items.name: Piece of Claw's Jigsaw
items.description: A rare item from the treasure trove of Dodge, one of the greatest Ecaflips Amakna ever knew.

items.name: Piece of Badoul's Treasure
items.description: A rare item from the treasure trove of Dodge, one of the greatest Ecaflips Amakna ever knew.

items.name: Baker's Yeast
items.description: Yeast is an essential ingredient for making bread rise.

items.name: Sesame Seed
items.description: Extremely rich in protein, this seed is a choice ingredient in the making of tasty bread, but the cultivation of sesame is rather delicate in the Amaknian climate. As a result, it is very rare and expensive.

items.name: Sunflower Seed
items.description: This protein-rich seed gives a peculiar taste and smell to loaves of bread.

items.name: Wheat
items.description: Since the beginning of time, Wheat has been the staple food of Amakna's inhabitants and Tofus.

items.name: Mushroom
items.description: With or without cream, Mushrooms are very tasty. The easiest way to get some is to kill a Fungi Master.

items.name: Boowonoké Hairs
items.description: This hair is different from other hair. It has magical properties which makes it extremely valuable to alchemists.

items.name: Boopig Testicles
items.description: These huge testicles are covered with soft, warm, downy fluff. The most dedicated of all crotch-sniffers, the Boopigs, will tear them apart if you get too close.

items.name: Poppy Seed
items.description: This seed imparts hallucinogenic properties to bread, ideal for a well-earned brain-holiday after a hard day's fighting.

items.name: Tofu Feather
items.description: Tofu Feathers are very magical things - just one kilo of them weighs as much as a kilopod of steel!

items.name: Gobdoroad's Drum
items.description:
"As far back as I can remember, I've never heard a pleasant melody come from this instrument. Not one. It is easy to conclude, therefore, that the Akademy does not offer musical instruction."

- Posthumous declaration by Jon Lemon

items.name: Ash Wood
items.description: Ash Wood is a low-quality wood but it is very common - it grows fast too.

items.name: Strubian Sickrat Leather
items.description: Tanners use this strong leather as their main resource when making boots, belts, masks, and even whips. The only drawback is that it smells like rutting Strubian Sickrat, which won't help you meet people.

items.name: Wabbit Teeth
items.description: They might be a bit worn from all that Cawwot-munching malarkey, but Wabbit Teeth are great for making potions thanks to their rejuvenating properties.

items.name: Evil Dandelion Flower
items.description: This flower loses its toxic properties when properly boiled and dried, and can be consumed in a herbal tea, but it is mainly used to entertain youths in search of romance. Indeed, who has never blown an Evil Dandelion Flower down the neck of a coveted lover? Such beautiful seeds, sweet as the touch of a shaft of sunlight on the dew-damp leaves of a charm tree. Perhaps Iops, who, instead of blowing, tend to suck the seeds and choke miserably in terrible convulsions.

items.name: Moskito Wings
items.description: These delicate wings have a very distinctive feature – anyone who dares to chew on them will gain spectacular powers of concentration. As a result, they're mainly used to make wisdom potions, and if you chew enough, you'll be able to spot a misplaced apostrophe on a Wanted notice in Astrub at fifty paces.

items.name: Limestone Dreggon Shell
items.description: This white shell is nearly unbreakable, but if the best jewellers polish it for generations, they can use its magic properties to make amulets with exceptional powers.

items.name: Demonic Rose Petal
items.description: These petals are a powerful aphrodisiac, which makes them the ideal present to win over your beloved. Just one thing... it's better not to brew them into tea, as drinking it would have the opposite effect.

items.name: Chafer Bone
items.description: This almost unbreakable bone becomes soft in contact with water, which makes things much easier for alchemists.

items.name: Drinking Water
items.description: Water is useful for many things. Make sure it's stagnant and cloudy for maximum taste when brewing beer.

items.name: Iron
items.description: Iron is essential to blacksmiths and anyone else who works with metal. Some logical creatures even use it for ironing.

items.name: Gold
items.description: Gold is a rare and precious metal. Thanks to its intrinsic qualities, it is essential to the making of powerful and beautiful weapons.

items.name: Diamond
items.description: Diamonds are a jeweller's best friend, but they require great skill to be worked properly. To find some, you often need to venture into dangerous mines. Good thing Diamonds are forever; you wouldn't want to be doing that twice a year!

items.name: Emerald
items.description: Glowing vivid green, this magnificent jewel can easily transform a frog into a prince, no kissing required.

items.name: Silver
items.description: Silver is bright, pure and much-coveted by discerning jewellers. Contrary to the myth spread round by the unscrupulous Miners' Association, it has no particular effect on vampires. Unless they're miserly vampires... Or artistic vampires... Do vampires make jewellery? It doesn't... say... here... Anyway, if it's a really nasty vampire who's only out for blood, who has a good job... damn. Do vampires work?... Look, just sell the "bloody" thing or something.

items.name: Tiwabbit Ears
items.description: Once boiled, these small, hairy, brown ears give off a smell of dead Boowolf. A true delight when stuffed with Royal Jelly.

items.name: Cawwot
items.description: It's the only food a Tiwabbit Wosungwee can eat, which is as good an excuse as any for its severe retardation.

items.name: Blue Larva Skin
items.description: This delightfully smooth skin is an excellent ingredient for magic potions.

items.name: Orange Larva Skin
items.description: This delightfully smooth skin is an excellent ingredient for magic potions.

items.name: Green Larva Skin
items.description: This delightfully smooth skin is an excellent ingredient for magic potions.

items.name: Arachnee Leg
items.description: In spite of its magical properties, this thin, hairy leg is in short supply - alchemists use it to pat their faces after shaving and never have enough left to sell... Like my mother always said... Don't get dry off your own supply.

items.name: Tofu Beak
items.description: Don't trust the ridiculously tiny appearance of this Tofu Beak; it's well-sharpened. The archers of Amakna have used them as arrowheads since the beginning of time.

items.name: Tofu Egg
items.description: This egg is a bit strange because it smells rotten even when it's not. Just imagine what it must smell like when it really is rotten. No one knows, however, which came first between the Tofu and the Tofu Egg.

items.name: Strawberry Jelly
items.description: Many greedy adventurers were dreadfully sick because of this delicious jelly. There's a saying that goes "everything is poison, nothing is poison, it's the dose that matters". In the case of Strawberry Jelly, avoid overdosing.

items.name: Mint Jelly
items.description: Many greedy adventurers were dreadfully sick because of this delicious Mint Jelly. Eaten in moderation, to ease your bad breath for example, it will have soothing properties on the morale of your troops.

items.name: Royal Blueberry Jelly
items.description: This delicious jelly is the result of the digestion and fermentation of honey by a Royal Jelly. Inedible in its raw state, it's nevertheless an ingredient of choice for sweets.

items.name: Moskito Eyebrows
items.description: The Moskito has long, thin eyebrows that set off its irresistible good looks just perfectly.

items.name: Black Tiwabbit Headband
items.description: This headband gives the appearance of a fierce warrior to the Black Tiwabbit who wears it. The Wabbit Wambo is apparently behind this custom of wearing a headband.

items.name: Araknoxious Intestine
items.description: This stem, as flexible and solid as a teachers cane, is THE choice material in the making of whips and other disciplinary implements, which are essential in the successful upbringing of children and to a healthy, open relationship between consenting adults.

items.name: Scarecro Tongue
items.description: This tongue is green due to its owner's excessive consumption of Mint Jelly... Can you imagine how much jelly you have to eat to turn that colour?

items.name: Mutant Tofu Tooth
items.description: The Mutant Tofu swapped its ridiculous little beak for ridiculous big teeth. It's hard to know which one is the more dangerous.

items.name: Evil Tofu Wing
items.description: This tiny, ridiculous wing is not very useful to the Evil Tofu... the only thing it does is blow hot air to knock Moskitos off balance.

items.name: Mush Mush Thorn
items.description: This venomous thorn protects the Mush Mush in close combat, but, tragically, also means the creature cannot give hugs without killing the hugee. For more important matters, the Mush Mush uses Sporm to reproduce, firing it at his partner from far away.

items.name: Mush Mush Sporm
items.description: This sporm is the "precious seed" that lets the mush mush scatter its angry mob wherever it wants, which is everywhere, basically. Be careful, however, as smelly feet and the smell of Bowisse's boots attract the sporm.

items.name: Crab Pincer
items.description: The Crab claw is like a deadly, unbreakable peacock feather... a great source of pride to its previous owner.

items.name: Wild Mint
items.description: This is the staple food of Green Jelly, so if you smell mint, don't get the teacups out right away...

items.name: Strawberry
items.description: Strawberries are the Strawberry Jelly's staple food. If you smell these delicious red berries somewhere, don't get too excited - it's likely that you've simply stumbled into a Strawberry Jelly's hunting ground.

items.name: Gob-Trotter Spyglass
items.description: Goblin scouts posted in the Amakna heights often get scared and run off, revealing their positions with thick clouds of dust – even when the enemy is still several kilokametres away. This is mainly because they have no idea which end of a spyglass to look through.

items.name: Gobbly Horn
items.description: Gobbly Horns are as shiny and soft as freshly tanned leather. For some unknown reason, Osamodas love them.

items.name: Gobball Wool
items.description: This thick wool smells like Bwork BO, but it's so thick and warm that you forgive it even that. It's also hypoallergenic, which is why Eniripsas everywhere use it to knit underwear out of.

items.name: Gobball Slobber
items.description: This infection-ridden slobber smells so bad because Gobballs never stop licking their filthy wool, which also gives Gobballs atrociously bad breath. A vicious circle.

items.name: Boar Tusk
items.description: This tusk allows the Boar to protect itself from enemies and, if required, to pick its snout... So don't forget to clean it with warm spring water before grinding it down into a fine powder.

items.name: Sick Arachnee Hairs
items.description: Boar Hair is naturally tapered and so ideal for making brushes and brooms. Some people develop serious allergies to Boar Hair, so always rub softly and infrequently.

items.name: Wild Sunflower Oil
items.description: This oil is highly recommended by dieticians because of its high proportion of essential, unsaturated and polyunsaturated fatty acids...

items.name: Walnut Oil
items.description: Because of its fruity flavour and its low proportion of saturated fatty acids, Walnut Oil is essential in pastry-making and for flavouring cakes. It can be kept in a closed bottle for a few days only.

items.name: Cashew Nut
items.description: When harvested, unripe Cashew Nuts can be used to make oil. Once dried, they're also used as toys by simple-minded Iop children.

items.name: Walnut
items.description: Walnuts can be used to make oil but it's better to consume them dried if you'd rather not suffer their laxative properties.

items.name: Acorn
items.description: Aggressive Arachnees all love Acorns, and everyone – or almost everyone – wonders why.

items.name: Hazelnut
items.description: When smothered in chocolate, this little Hazelnut is delicious. It's just a shame chocolate's so expensive in Amakna.

items.name: Five-Leaf Clover
items.description: This clover is a staple of the Tabi's diet. Nevertheless, breeders are wary of it because of the devastating flatulence it unleashes upon their livestock.

items.name: Palm Oil
items.description: Thanks to its delicate taste and aroma, this oil is suitable for any kind of culinary challenge, from frying food to making French dressing.

items.name: Oilbow Grease
items.description: This rare type of oil is what we call a mechanical elixir - it lubricates cogs and hinges so well that it only needs to be applied once. A guy by the name of Billy Wanka tried to make everlasting chewing gum with it once, but many, many children perished. Keep it for your hinges.

items.name: Sesame Oil
items.description: Sesame Oil is obtained from Sesame Seeds and can be distinguished from the others by its rich and delicate taste... toasted Hazelnuts I would say. The only problem is that it smells like grilled Gobball.

items.name: Barley
items.description: If you stare for too long at a Barley plant, you'll begin to see minute flaws in its leaves and stem. Enraged by these imperfections, you'll write a letter to King Allister demanding that something be done about them, and not even a Consolation Candy will calm your ire.

items.name: Hop
items.description: The flower of the female Hop plant contains all of the active ingredients used in brewing, such as bitter resins and essential oils. The flower of the male Hop plant isn't useful for anything, other than scattering pollen all over the place.

items.name: Malt
items.description: The name given to germinated Barley, the most important ingredient in quality beer. Be careful with Malt, it has an enormous capacity for absorbing beer in its germination phase... just like Tot after a hard day hunting Tofus.

items.name: Wo Wabbit Stomach
items.description: The main feature of this stomach is that it can easily distend. This greatly simplifies the Wo Wabbit's digestive problems caused by its excessive drinking of fermented Cawwot liquor.

items.name: Prespic Peak
items.description: When pressed into a game of hide and seek, nothing's more chic than a Prespic Peak.

items.name: Elite Chafer Dentures
items.description: Elite Chafers' teeth have been rotted by the horrible plonk served to Brakmarian troops. They must therefore wear dentures to keep all their bite. Like many drunks before them, they thought alcohol was a preservative.

items.name: Bwork Magus Beard Hair
items.description: For obscure reasons, this red hair smells very bad when it's raining. The Bwork Magi take advantage of its magic powers nevertheless, which could be of interest to some alchemists.

items.name: Bwork Magus Book
items.description: This book is a true collector's item. It's a source of inspiration and sturdiness for the Bwork Magus. Each page conceals numerous secrets about the anatomy of Amakna's creatures.

items.name: Ice Kwak Beak
items.description: Thanks to its extraordinarily strong beak, the Ice Kwak can peck holes in ice, just for the pleasure of pecking holes in ice. Ice Kwaks are strange creatures, that's for sure.

items.name: Fire Kwak Beak
items.description: Thanks to its extraordinarily strong beak, the Fire Kwak can put out embers, just for the pleasure of putting out embers. Fire Kwaks are strange creatures, that's for sure.

items.name: Wind Kwak Beak
items.description: Thanks to its extraordinarily strong beak, the Wind Kwak can fly into a window without being knocked out, just for the pleasure of flying into a window without being knocked out. Wind Kwaks are strange creatures, that's for sure.

items.name: Ice Kwak Feather
items.description: A distinctive feature of this feather is that it is resistant to frost. That's why you never see an Ice Kwak shiver.

items.name: Fire Kwak Feather
items.description: A distinctive feature of this feather is that it resists flames. That's why Fire Kwaks don't burn.

items.name: Wind Kwak Feather
items.description: A distinctive feature of this feather is that it is resistant to gusts. That's why you never see wind kwaks getting blown inside out like an umbrella.

items.name: Mushd Mud
items.description: The aggressive Mushd is composed of many pieces of mud put together. The only way to get the better of it is to dry it out, which is difficult considering just how moist it is.

items.name: Gwandpa Wabbit Beard Hair
items.description: Gwandpa Wabbits have foul-smelling false beards, just like Father Kwismas, but worse. As they are constantly dribbling in front of the Gwandma Wabbits, their beard hair is imbued with the underestimated powers of their dribble.

items.name: Gwandpa Wabbit Ear
items.description: These ears are pointed, rigid and covered with beautiful striped fur. It's unquestionably some exquisite fur, mainly because it's odourless.

items.name: Flax String
items.description: With this very sturdy Flax String, you can choose to either make nice, solid seams or to bind your friends' hands and feet to show them who the real guild leader is.

items.name: Nettles
items.description: On each of her birthdays, it's local custom to throw grandma into a field of this plant.

items.name: Flax Seed
items.description: This minute seed contains lots of goodness and plenty of flavour. Kwak hunters use these glistening seeds to lure the dozy creatures into traps.

items.name: Flax
items.description: There's nothing special about the Flax stem except that it is able to return to its original shape after bending up seven times. And so its fibre is equally flexible.

items.name: Crooked Fibre
items.description: Soft and sweet as an illicitly acquired purse, this fibre is also highly resistant and therefore holds up will under intense interrogations.

items.name: Hemp
items.description: The Hemp stem can be used for research into hallucinations but is also used in construction where it serves a very different purpose.

items.name: Hemp Fibre
items.description: This fibre is more resistant than beautiful and can be smoked in your quiet moments of introspection.

items.name: Hemp Seed
items.description: Hemp Seeds are used to calm down herds of Tabis during the rutting season. All you need to do is toss these seeds on their grazing ground and they'll instantly become less savage.

items.name: Sage
items.description: This flower is used to make potions with random effects! These effects range from general paralysis to invulnerability to Wabbit flatulence, an old personal favourite.

items.name: Elite Chafer's Mercy Kill
items.description: Most people assume that Chafers are completely incapable of pity. Well, don't be so sure. Take the Elite Chafer, for example: when he cuts an enemy down with a great slash of his scimitar, he takes the time to finish them off with the dagger hidden in his boot. A little glint of compassion that touches the heart even as it twists the knife.

items.name: Invisible Chafer Bone
items.description: If you close your eyes, scrunch up your face, bunch your fists, stamp your feet and scream until you're sick, you might be able to turn this bone's description invisible, just like the bone itself. Then all that would be left would be the pretty picture, and that's what you like best, because words make your head hurt.

items.name: Crackler Stone
items.description: This stone is almost alive, it draws life from the precious stones it contains. Nobody can break it except a Crackler. It'll make a great stone hammer.

items.name: Rib Chops
items.description: Grilled Rib Chops are absolutely delicious, but there's not much meat on them.

items.name: Chafer Archer Thighbone
items.description: This is a really strange bone... If you crumble it into dust, you can use it for curry powder. Seriously, just add water and hey presto... curry! I know a few unscrupulous chefs who'll be delighted to hear the news.

items.name: Treechnid Root
items.description: This piece of root has gained a lot of experience accompanying the Treechnid through the undergrowth. That still doesn't explain why it's magic.

items.name: Boowolf Tail
items.description: The Boowolf Tail is so similar to a big mossy log that you just can't tell them apart. That'll only add to your manic paranoia, I know, but you're better off knowing, believe me.

items.name: Boogranny Canine
items.description: This sharpened tooth is above all prized as a lucky charm. If this is true, Lady Luck must have a very poor sense of smell.

items.name: Boowoldlum Claw
items.description: This filthy claw is used to make fearsome weapons.

items.name: Copper
items.description: Copper is great for making cheap weapons... It could almost be a substitute for gold... Except it's soft, light, reacts with air and discolours quickly.

items.name: Bronze
items.description: This metal is often used in the making of decorative items. It's ideal for beautifying your weapons on the cheap.

items.name: Cobalt
items.description: The name "Cobalt" means "Devil's Copper" in ancient Sadida. It's suited to the forging of light and stylish - but lethal - weapons.

items.name: Tin
items.description: Tin is a soft and heavy metal, a bit like the Wo Wabbit but worse.

items.name: Manganese
items.description: Contrary to general opinion, this metal is not used to make gutters but terrifying weapons such as the "Manganesian Sharp"... This implement has bumped off more than a few Tofus at the Bulgur Festivals.

items.name: Bauxite
items.description: When properly tapered, this metal is much appreciated for its sharpness and unusual colour.

items.name: Coal
items.description: Coal has no particular magical properties, despite what you might think. However, it does attract lightning, stores it and, worst of all, always frees it at the worst possible time.

items.name: Flint
items.description: This sharp stone has cut the throat of more than one careless mole.

items.name: Ebony Wood
items.description: This wood owes its name to a misunderstanding... A family of lumberjacks living in this forest had a daughter named Bonnie. Bonnie was the only one who knew where to find a rather special type of tree and so this wood was named after her: "Bonnie Wood". Time and poor spelling finally produced the name "Ebony Wood".

items.name: Granite Stone
items.description: This heavy mineral doesn't wear or bend, which limits its usefulness to blacksmiths. It is only in working it for a long period that you will manage to extract some precious stones from it.

items.name: Oak Wood
items.description: This high-quality wood is particularly resistant. It's ideal for making things like bludgeons, houses or even boats. But its most vital use is for beer barrels.

items.name: Yew Wood
items.description: The wood of the Yew Tree is very strong and flexible. Consistently voted wood of the year by the bow makers of the region, it's also rather difficult to find - the peasants of Amakna destroy any shoots they see because they're poisonous to Gobballs.

items.name: Amber
items.description: This magnificent precious stone is made of fossilised tree resin. You can sometimes find a little Moskito inside, trapped for aeons in the sticky sap, which makes the stone even more valuable.

items.name: Treechnid Amber
items.description: This magnificent precious stone is made out of fossilised treechnid resin. Sometimes, it contains an arachnee that was trapped ages ago in its master's sap. Random chance or proof of unfailing loyalty? Naturalists wonder.

items.name: Crystal
items.description: Crystal is translucent and beautiful, but extremely brittle. Such is life, nothing is perfect even with precious stones.

items.name: Sapphire
items.description: This precious blue stone is well-adapted to the making of magical weapons, possibly because lazy script writers always use blue to represent mana.

items.name: Ruby
items.description: The shimmering glow of this precious stone makes it as bright as the Fire Kwak's feathers, but its surface is as cold to the touch as the Ice Kwak's snowballs.

items.name: Elm Wood
items.description: Once a common type of wood, Elm is now much sought-after. A long time ago, a terrible bewitchment called Grafioze was cast by a powerful Bwork Magus of the worst kind, decimating whole forests of it.

items.name: Maple Wood
items.description: Maple leaves are well-known for how good they taste on a flag and how good they look on pancakes. Or was it the other way around? Anyway... when it comes to the wood, we still don't know what to do with it.

items.name: Hornbeam Wood
items.description: This wood is affectionately known by lumberjacks as "Hornbeam Wood" because of the tree it comes from. Perhaps if they knew what Sadidas did underneath these trees in the dead of night, they wouldn't be so eager to search them out.

items.name: Chestnut Wood
items.description: The smell of Chestnut Wood sends flies packing. Well, not so much the flies who like Chestnuts... or flies who don't have much of a sense of smell... When you think about it, that probably covers most flies.

items.name: Cherry Wood
items.description: This type of wood is appreciated in the cabinet-making trade because of its dense texture and the brown-reddish colour it acquires with time.

items.name: Walnut Wood
items.description: Walnut Wood is often used in the making of furniture.

items.name: Ivory
items.description: Ivory is always in great demand because of its legendary whiteness. Smiths use the stuff when forging lethal weapons. Collectors value it just as highly. You'll have no problem selling this in Amakna.

items.name: Strange Ore
items.description: This ore has been extracted from a mysterious and unknown quarry. Unlike most strange items, it doesn't have an ounce of magic in it.

items.name: Chafer Lancer Leather Briefs
items.description: When winter comes, the Chafer Lancer never leaves home without his leather briefs... they keep his joints warm and distract his enemies if needs be.

items.name: Gargoyl Leather
items.description: This leather is particularly resistant, but smells like a male Gargoyl in rut. That explains why local farmers use it to trap female Gargoyls, who are too stupid to see past such a devious ruse.

items.name: Reworked Treechnid Sap
items.description: This syrupy sap has been tampered with by a renowned alchemist who wanted to liven up Treechnid Roots. I don't need to tell you that you'll have to be careful with this stuff.

items.name: Magical Cure
items.description: Some bakers tried to create this powder by mixing Flax Seed and bread, but the result was far from satisfying. The real Magic Cure is produced by wild flowers, and its nature remains a mystery.

items.name: Rye
items.description: This dark cereal can grow under the worst of conditions, it's one of the rare cereals capable of surviving long periods of drought.

items.name: Oats
items.description: This type of cereal is used to feed the young Tabis, whose teeth are not sufficiently developed for hard foods. The peasants nevertheless dished it out with a fearful moderation, being well aware of the eye-watering damage wrought by a fibre-fed intestinal tract.

items.name: Potatoes
items.description: Generally speaking, when you come across a spud, it means that you either are in the middle of a field or in the depths of a dungeon.

items.name: Peeled Potatoes
items.description: These potatoes are peeled, which makes them even more sumptuous.

items.name: Diamond Stone
items.description: When properly polished, this stone can make a magnificent Diamond.

items.name: Emerald Stone
items.description: When properly polished, this stone can make a magnificent Emerald.

items.name: Crystal Stone
items.description: When properly polished, this stone can make a magnificent Crystal.

items.name: Sapphire Stone
items.description: When properly polished, this stone can make a magnificent Sapphire.

items.name: Ruby Stone
items.description: When properly polished, this stone can make a magnificent Ruby.

items.name: Freyesque Orchid
items.description: This flower is as rare as it is beautiful. It's not surprising when you know that the rampant toads of the region use them to feed their offspring.

items.name: Edelweiss
items.description: This flower is beautiful but very rare. It's no surprise - its magic is so powerful that it can even bring people back to life.

items.name: Grawn
items.description: Grawns are appreciated for their delicate taste and bright pink colour. On the other hand, they are hated for their legendary bad temper and their gomina-style antennae.

items.name: Kralove
items.description: The Kralove may not look like much, but don't be fooled - behind its sad eyes, a fearsome predator crouches, ready to pounce on an intruding stranger.

items.name: Sickle-Hammerhead Shark
items.description: This blue shark is an activist with a strong herd instincts - there is no sense of the individual in their group even if their chief, Stakemoff, is idolised as a hero.

items.name: Kittenfish
items.description: The Kittenfish has two unusual characteristics - it has whiskers and it purrs underwater to frighten flying fish.

items.name: Muddy Trout
items.description: The Muddy Trout is somehow related to the aggressive Salmoon of Moon Island. This trout is delicious both raw and cooked...

items.name: Ancestral Cotton
items.description: This cotton is as soft as the belly fur of a young female Ecaflip, as white as a spring cloud and as delicate as a Tofu feather.

items.name: Silkworm Cocoon
items.description: This huge, off-white cocoon can be unwound to obtain a magnificent silk string. Legend has it that the adventurer Harry Hane used it to find his way out of Dark Vlad's maze.

items.name: Silk String
items.description: The delicacy and suppleness of this string is hard to beat. Silk is the fabric favoured by the Chafers for their fighting underwear.

items.name: Black Tiwabbit Hair
items.description: This black hair doesn't show the dirt. This is an advantage that will interest the kind of hero who thinks that a brisk walk through the rain is as good as a bath. The hair melts when it touches sweat, though.

items.name: Beaztinga Wings
items.description: This wing continues to vibrate frenetically, despite the fact that it's been violently detached from its former owner. It's funny at first, but it becomes a bit annoying when you've got lots of them in your sack.

items.name: Wo Wabbit Hair
items.description: This kind of hair is so greasy that you can use it to make waterproof clothes.

items.name: Beaztinga Fuzz
items.description: In adolescence, the Beaztinga's body gets covered by a soft fuzz, which is paradoxical given the overly aggressive behaviour it starts to display during that period.

items.name: Boowolf Fabric
items.description: This fabric, made of Boowolf Hair, is very rare. It's strong enough to resist all kinds of physical and magical attacks.

items.name: Boar Fabric
items.description: This Boar Hair fabric is rough and foul-smelling... but it offers excellent protection against physical attacks.

items.name: Squirrol Fabric
items.description: Under its spines, the Squirrol has a carpet of soft red fur, which gives off a rotten smell on rainy days. Fortunately, it never rains in Amakna... Just don't use this fabric to make your swimming trunks.

items.name: Wabbit Fabric
items.description: This fabric, made from Gwandpa Wabbit Beard Hairs, is very bushy, as well as irritating, a bit like a fat, urticant caterpillar.

items.name: Picfail Purée
items.description: Originally synonymous with culinary failure, this dish is given when it becomes apparent that an error has been made, regardless of its origin.

items.name: Gold Ingot
items.description: This ingot is made of solid Gold.

items.name: Ebonite
items.description: This rare alloy is used in the making of rare and often-lethal items. Perhaps the most insidious property of ebonite is that once it has rusted, it becomes a dangerous poison.

items.name: Aluminite
items.description: This alloy is incredibly light and is consequently a choice metal for small daggers or short swords.

items.name: Magnesite
items.description: This eccentric alloy is almost magical; it glitters and vibrates at night time, which is enough to frighten a slightly gullible Bwork.

items.name: Bakelelite
items.description: Bakelelite is not a solid alloy but correctly sharpened, it becomes as sharp as a Chafer's blade.

items.name: Kouartz
items.description: This strange alloy contains an impressive energy which makes it quite unstable under certain circumstances. The best smiths are mad about Kouartz and use it to create weapons with almost legendary powers.

items.name: Vampire Blood
items.description: This blood is magic and is an essential ingredient of magic black puddings. The side effects remain unknown.

items.name: Garglyph Leather Briefs
items.description: In order to avoid being hit in the spots where it hurts, the Garglyph sometimes puts on his leather briefs when he goes hunting. The briefs also provide good protection against sunburn.

items.name: Blueberry Jelly
items.description: This jelly is especially sticky, like an enraged Sadida Block. Strangely, it sticks Tofu Feathers together particularly well. You have to wonder what else it could be used for.

items.name: Mouse Hair
items.description: This Mouse Hair is very thin and soft - a much sought-after resource in the making of expensive coats for the mistresses of rich Amaknian bankers.

items.name: Mumussel Lining
items.description: This syrupy lining is useless, unless of course you want to wait for it to fossilise into mother of pearl. There's a rumour going around that a shrewd and especially attractive Enutrof has found a way to speed up the process.

items.name: Director Grunob's Manual
items.description: With this handbook in your possession, even you can realise just how stupid the Akademy's lessons are... Seriously, did you really expect to find a section titled "12 Ways to Skewer a Squirrol"?

items.name: Minotoror Hair
items.description: This hair smells very bad but is very resistant. Wearing a material made of Minotoror hair will make a fearsome combatant of you... much appreciated by flies, on top of that.

items.name: Clay Dreggon Shell
items.description: This golden shell is nearly unbreakable, but if the best jewellers polish it for generations, they can use its magic properties to make amulets with exceptional powers.

items.name: Coal Dreggon Shell
items.description: This black shell is nearly unbreakable, but if the best jewellers polish it for generations, they can use its magic properties to make amulets with exceptional powers.

items.name: Slate Dreggon Egg
items.description: A cute little Dreggon will come out of this strange egg if a female Slate Dreggon sits on it. Until then, don't try to keep it warm against you. You never know what could happen...

items.name: Clay Dreggon Egg
items.description: A cute little Dreggon will come out of this strange egg if a female Clay Dreggon sits on it. Until then, don't try to keep it warm against you. You never know what could happen...

items.name: Coal Dreggon Egg
items.description: A cute little Dreggon will come out of this strange egg if a female Coal Dreggon sits on it. Until then, don't try to keep it warm against you. You never know what could happen...

items.name: Limestone Dreggon Egg
items.description: A cute little Dreggon will come out of this strange egg if a female Limestone Dreggon sits on it. Until then, don't try to keep it warm against you. You never know what could happen...

items.name: Old Dreggon Bone
items.description: This old bone is magic. Correctly used, it should make very powerful items.

items.name: Royal Gobball Wool
items.description: This soft, light wool is fit for a king, but it does have a tendency to irritate sensitive skin. On the other hand, it is well weathered, given the venerable age of its rightful owner.

items.name: Strubian Raeman Wool
items.description: This wool is extremely soft because it comes from a Raeman's down. But be careful: it still smells strongly enough that mother Raemans will be tempted to groom you from head to toe.

items.name: Gobball War Chief Wool
items.description: This wool smells terrible, but it once belonged to a Gobball War Chief and so is of great sentimental value to warriors.

items.name: Prepubescent Boostache Leather
items.description: This smooth skin suits the making of leather underwear perfectly. The leather underpants of the Invisible Chafers are an early example.

items.name: Black Gobball Leather
items.description: This shining leather is often used by shoemakers and tailors to make small boots and hats.

items.name: Black Gobbly Wool
items.description: Even if tailors don't use it that much, this rough wool is very popular with the Enutrofs, who use it to hide their premature baldness.

items.name: Royal Gobball Leather
items.description: The incredible suppleness of this leather makes it fit for a king, and the web-like cracks are proof of the Royal Gobball longevity. It's the best leather in Amakna.

items.name: Ouassingue Hide
items.description: "This leather must have survived countless wars to be this strong today" were the dying words of the famous minstrel Jon Lemon right before he died, suffocated by the stench of a Ouassingue.

items.name: Piglet Leather
items.description: Just like mimolette, this leather becomes a dirty shade of orange with the passage of time... and the horrible smell... Uggh!

items.name: Ancestral Wood
items.description: This elm wood comes from the Olag-lacustre Island, which was struck by lightning one Fall morning. Rumours have it that a Bwork Magus is responsible for it because he didn't control his elementary spells properly.

items.name: Kristalite
items.description: This magic stone with a particular name is not suitable for general public as it can give great powers to weapons and jewels.

items.name: Peawly Mowning Key Fragment
items.description: An old Lenald key recycled by the Wabbits. This has passed through so many paws over the years, it'd be a shame to break it now!

items.name: High Noon Key Fragment
items.description: This key hasn't been nibbled to pieces yet. Use it well.

items.name: Wolling Evening Key Fragment
items.description: This key is already quite nibbled, but you've got the most important part of it. Here's hoping you don't get peckish too!

items.name: Dopple Stone
items.description: This stone comes from the Dopple World. It's highly-prized by some inhabitants of Amakna.

items.name: Kokokonut
items.description: Round as a cannonball, the Kokokonut also has 3 holes, which makes it very easy to throw away.

items.name: Pirate's Cute Shorts
items.description: Pirate's shorts are the proof that ridicule has actually killed someone. But apparently, they are also very lucky.

items.name: Kokokonut Palm Trunk
items.description: Kokokonut Palm Trunks are similar to other trunks: straight and strong, yet they are slightly thinner than the average.

items.name: Glu
items.description: This pot of pink jelly might smell good... But you must never taste it or you won't ever speak again. It's an excellent fixative.

items.name: Broken Helmet
items.description: This helmet took a bullet for you, pal.

items.name: Broken Wings
items.description: Looking at these broken wings makes you realise just how badly you wanted to stay in bed this morning.

items.name: Bottle of Rum
items.description: The label says '10 year old rum' but it is quite impossible to check if it tells the truth. Don't drink it excessively on the road for fear of seasickness.

items.name: Black Paint
items.description: You can paint anything with this can of paint: your house, your Tofu pet, your friends or even yourself...

items.name: Moon Island Ticket
items.description:
Destination: Heavenly Island
Cost: 1,000 kamas
Ticket: One-way

items.name: Slate Dreggon Shell
items.description: This sapphire shell is nearly unbreakable, but if the best jewellers polish it for generations, they can use its magic properties to make amulets with exceptional powers.

items.name: Earth Kwak Feather
items.description: A distinctive feature of this feather is that it resists falling rocks. That's why Earth Kwaks are never buried by landslides.

items.name: Earth Kwak Beak
items.description: Thanks to its extraordinarily strong beak, the Earth Kwak can peck holes in the ground, just for the pleasure of pecking holes in ground. Earth Kwaks are strange creatures, that's for sure.

items.name: Bow Meow Grass
items.description: This plant will make the mouth of an Ecaflip water.

items.name: Bloody Flint
items.description: This resistant and sharpened stone has apparently been used against something or someone. It is a raw and dangerous item which perfectly illustrates the characteristics of a Iop.

items.name: Carved Bone
items.description: It's a fearsome and gloomy item. Once worked it's as dangerous as a Sram.

items.name: Enigmatic Kama
items.description: A Tofu head with a strange Tofu hat on decorates this kama.

items.name: Flexible Wood
items.description: With its flexible and curvilinear shape, this big wooden branch makes you immediately think of Cras.

items.name: Old Four-Leaf Clover
items.description: Four-leaf clovers are rarer than five-leaf ones. So when you find one, you should rub it dry between two spell scrolls.

items.name: Spark Potion
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Spark, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Fire element. The enchantment sharply reduces base damage.
Health steal is not altered by this potion.

items.name: Sulphur Pouch
items.description: This little pouch of sulphur gives off an unbearable smell. The same smell as an Osamodas, come to think of it.

items.name: Drizzle Potion
items.description:
Thanks to the power of Spittle, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Water element. The enchantment sharply reduces base damage.
Health steal is not altered by this potion.

items.name: Urtica
items.description: Rapidly rubbing this plant on your skin will make you suffer torture but the stimulation produces beneficial effects... well, that's what Sacriers say at least.

items.name: Draught Potion
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Draught, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Air element. The enchantment sharply reduces base damage.
Health steal is not altered by this potion.

items.name: Tremor Potion
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Tremor, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Earth element. The enchantment sharply reduces base damage.
Health steal is not altered by this potion.

items.name: Bluebells
items.description: Bluebells are very small, delicate and attractive. On top of that, some say they have the power to calm down spirits and cure some illnesses. They were probably created by a divinity who wanted a plant in the image of the Eniripsas.

items.name: Landslide Potion
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Rockslide, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Earth element. The enchantment reduces base damage by a moderate amount.
Health steal is not altered by this potion.

items.name: Shower Potion
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Downpour, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Water element. The enchantment reduces base damage by a moderate amount.
Health steal is not altered by this potion.

items.name: Gust Potion
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Gust, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Air element. The enchantment reduces base damage by a moderate amount.
Health steal is not altered by this potion.

items.name: Blaze Potion
items.description:
Thanks to the power of Flame, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Fire element. The enchantment reduces base damage by a moderate amount.
Health steal is not altered by this potion.

items.name: Vervain
items.description: This special plant helps people go to sleep. It must be the emblem of Sadida.

items.name: Wildfire Potion
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Blaze, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Fire element. The enchantment slightly reduces base damage.
Health steal is not altered by this potion.

items.name: Tsunami Potion
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Tsunami, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Water element. The enchantment slightly reduces base damage.
Health steal is not altered by this potion.

items.name: Hurricane Potion
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Hurricane, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Air element. The enchantment slightly reduces base damage.
Health steal is not altered by this potion.

items.name: Earthquake Potion
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Quake, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Earth element. The enchantment slightly reduces base damage.
Health steal is not altered by this potion.

items.name: Everlasting Flower
items.description: This strange little plant grows in arid environments and gives off a smell of curry. It seems it can resist ageing. If only all this could be said for women.

items.name: Blue Scaraleaf Wings
items.description: These Scaraleaf wings have magic properties and are used in the making of elementary Water potions.

items.name: White Scaraleaf Wings
items.description: These Scaraleaf wings have magic properties and are used in the making of elementary Air potions.

items.name: Red Scaraleaf Wings
items.description: These Scaraleaf wings have magic properties and are used in the making of elementary Fire potions.

items.name: Green Scaraleaf Wings
items.description: These Scaraleaf wings have magic properties and are used in the making of elementary Earth potions.

items.name: Slender Tube
items.description: This tube has been specially designed to be uncorked with just one hand.

items.name: Big Phial
items.description: A thoughtfully-conceived phial which can be uncorked with no hands.

items.name: Scalding Poison
items.description: This Arachnee leg poison will send your head right into space. Both literally and figuratively, since after a short period of wide-eyed cosmic clarity, your skull explodes due to the massive increase in blood pressure.

items.name: Vampiric Liquid
items.description: This liquid, a blend of several bloods, has the nasty habit of catching in your throat.

items.name: Element Flask
items.description: This Flask is especially designed for capturing elementary essences.

items.name: Glass Bowl
items.description: This bowl is multipurpose! It can be used for making potions as well as for drowning fish.

items.name: Strange Symbol
items.description: It's really difficult to explain what this playing card represents. It's important, though.

items.name: 1,000 Kek Coupon
items.description:
Something is written on this piece of paper:
"Congratulations! You are now the proud owner of a KeK coupon, which proves that you are a great adventurer. Come see us, we are waiting for you!"
Map coordinates -1,-2

items.name: 2,000 Kek Coupon
items.description:
Something is written on this piece of paper:
"Congratulations! You are now the proud owner of a KeK coupon, which proves that you are a great adventurer. Come see us, we are waiting for you!"
Map coordinates -1,-2

items.name: 5,000 Kek Coupon
items.description:
Something is written on this piece of paper:
"Congratulations! You are now the proud owner of a KeK coupon, which proves that you are a great adventurer. Come see us, we are waiting for you!"
Map coordinates -1,-2

items.name: 10,000 Kek Coupon
items.description:
Something is written on this piece of paper:
"Congratulations! You are now the proud owner of a KeK coupon, which proves that you are a great adventurer. Come see us, we are waiting for you!"
Map coordinates -1,-2

items.name: Str Rune
items.description: This small rune can make the sharpest blades even sharper.

items.name: Wis Rune
items.description: This small rune can make the oldest blades even older.

items.name: Int Rune
items.description: This small rune can make the brightest weapons brighter.

items.name: Vit Rune
items.description: This small rune can make the most resistant weapon even more resistant.

items.name: Agi Rune
items.description: This small rune can make the lightest of weapons lighter.

items.name: Cha Rune
items.description: This small rune can make the most attractive of weapons more attractive.

items.name: Red Metaria
items.description: This strange-looking sphere seems to contain a tiny flame in its centre.

items.name: Blue Metaria
items.description: This strange-looking sphere seems to contain a tiny puddle in its centre.

items.name: Yellow Metaria
items.description: This strange-looking sphere seems to contain a clump of dirt in its centre.

items.name: Green Metaria
items.description: This strange-looking sphere seems to contain a tiny breeze in its centre.

items.name: Blue Triam Metaria
items.description: This strange-looking sphere seems to contain a tiny lake in its centre.

items.name: Green Triam Metaria
items.description: This strange-looking sphere seems to contain a tiny gust of wind in its centre.

items.name: Red Triam Metaria
items.description: This strange-looking sphere seems to contain a tiny inferno in its centre.

items.name: Yellow Triam Metaria
items.description: This strange-looking sphere seems to contain a tiny mound of earth in its centre.

items.name: Red Mage Metaria
items.description: This strange-looking sphere seems to contain a tiny explosion in its centre.

items.name: Blue Mage Metaria
items.description: This strange-looking sphere seems to contain a tiny ocean in its centre.

items.name: Green Mage Metaria
items.description: This strange-looking sphere seems to contain a tiny cyclone in its centre.

items.name: Yellow Mage Metaria
items.description: This strange-looking sphere seems to contain a tiny mountain in its centre.

items.name: Pa Str Rune
items.description: This powerful rune can make the sharpest of blades sharper.

items.name: Pa Wis Rune
items.description: This powerful rune can make the oldest of blades older.

items.name: Pa Int Rune
items.description: This powerful rune can make the brightest of weapons brighter.

items.name: Pa Vit Rune
items.description: This powerful rune can increase an item's Vitality bonus.

items.name: Pa Agi Rune
items.description: This powerful rune can make the lightest of weapons lighter.

items.name: Pa Cha Rune
items.description: This powerful rune can make the most attractive weapons even more attractive.

items.name: Ra Str Rune
items.description: This legendary rune can make anything at all sharper than the sharpest of blades.

items.name: Ra Wis Rune
items.description: This legendary rune can make anything at all older than the oldest blade.

items.name: Ra Int Rune
items.description: This legendary rune can make anything at all brighter than the brightest of blades.

items.name: Ra Vit Rune
items.description: This rune can make the most sturdy weapons even more resistant.

items.name: Ra Agi Rune
items.description: This legendary rune can make the lightest weapons even lighter.

items.name: Ra Cha Rune
items.description: This powerful rune can make the most attractive weapons even more attractive.

items.name: Ap Ga Rune
items.description: This rune is so powerful that it should be hurled off the World by the gods themselves. It makes a weapon so easy to use that you can slay ten warriors while... let's see... changing a nappy, sipping a cup of tea, erecting a dry stone wall in your front yard... just about anything.

items.name: Mp Ga Rune
items.description: This rune is so powerful that it should be hurled off the World by the Gods themselves. It makes weapons so much lighter and so much easier to put away that you can sit back and concentrate on the important things... although what's more important than watching your enemies getting sliced up?

items.name: Key to the Royal Gobball's Court
items.description: This key allows you to enter the Royal Gobball's Court. Caution: it will be destroyed after use.

items.name: Blacksmith Dungeon Key
items.description: This key will grant you access to the Blacksmith Dungeon. Be careful, it will self-destruct after use.

items.name: Skeleton Dungeon Key
items.description: This key will grant you access to the Skeleton Dungeon. Be careful though, as it will self-destruct after use.

items.name: Guildalogem
items.description: This rare stone will give you the influence you need to create a guild. Without it, guilds such as Miners With Attitude and the Men Who Stare at Gobs would never have come into being.

items.name: Lilbike Wheel
items.description: This wheel comes from the remains of a Lilbike's unicycle.

items.name: Pirolienne Bud
items.description: This bud comes from a Pirolienne's burnt stick.

items.name: Dark Treechnid Root
items.description: This root comes from the corpse of a Dark Treechnid.

items.name: Crocodyl Chief Scale
items.description: This fragment of shell will certainly be used to make beautiful boots.

items.name: Greaseball Bomb
items.description: Apprentice Greaseballs learn to juggle next to campfires. Survivors are automatically chosen to join the ranks of the clan.

items.name: Metaria Sphere
items.description: This sphere is a perfect imitation of a Metaria's insulating membrane.

items.name: Major Arachnee Leg
items.description: A very thin and very hairy Leg, formerly used in the making of exotic brooms and wigs.

items.name: Dark Treechnid Amber
items.description: This magnificent amber contains a nasty bug, which was caught in the dripping sap of its master. It's a kind of sarcophagus, really, and the Dark Treechnid uses it as a reminder of all its summons long after they are dead.

items.name: Crocodyl Scale
items.description: This Crocodyl Scale is like a little trophy for all beginner Crocodyl hunters. Don't hesitate to show it to the drunkards at the Inn. They'll be impressed and will offer you a drink to celebrate your success.

items.name: Crocodyl Teeth
items.description: When a crocodyl tries to cut its teeth on you, the best solution is to pull one out with determination and vigour, just like a strict dentist would.

items.name: Pointed Crowfox Feather
items.description: A Crowfox sometimes has a pointed feather different from the others. As a rule, it's magic, and even if it isn't, you can use it for dressing up as an Indian Chief.

items.name: Magic Oats
items.description: This wisp of magic oat straw once belonged to a simple peasant. The poor country fellow was bewitched by a Bwork Magus apprentice, who read his book upside down by mistake.

items.name: Darit Hair
items.description: This hair used to belong to Darit Popper, an especially pretentious young wizard. He was zapped by his own spell at the end of an epic battle with a nostalgic prespic.

items.name: Magic Arachnee Leg
items.description: This Arachnee Leg is different from the rest - it moves on its own and seems to be well and truly alive, even when amputated from its owner. It could be on the point of starting a family since apparently it is attracted to sewing tools.

items.name: Luigie Mushroom
items.description: This great hero was turned into a mushroom thanks to the bumbling magic of the mischievous Soft Oak. Being complete cretins, the spimushes venerate and protect him as one of their gods.

items.name: Chafer Foot Soldier's Surprising Bone
items.description: It's thanks to this magic bone that Chafer Foot Soldiers can achieve the most astonishing of feats. For instance, while in the middle of a fight, they can take off their briefs, put them on their heads without using their hands, and still avoid being hit by attackers. You will never get tired of this incredible performance.

items.name: Bewitched Wicker
items.description: This piece of Bewitched Wicker will enable you to make a beautiful basket for magic fruits, combining elegance and power... quite the opposite of a bad Liche.

items.name: Traumatised Rokokonut
items.description: This Rokokonut was traumatised as a child, and so, over the years, has accumulated an incredible amount of hatred. This hatred has rendered it a very powerful Rokokonut indeed.

items.name: Crystaloball Stone
items.description: It takes the patience of a saint but this stone can become round and bright like the pompom on a magic hat. Its shape makes it easy to fit almost anywhere.

items.name: Burnt Minotoror Horn
items.description: A very powerful incantation has scorched this Minotoror Horn, which makes it a much sought-after magical artefact. Unfortunately, like many things, they only work correctly in pairs.

items.name: Sickly Skin
items.description: Beneath this slimy exterior, a very precious artefact lies. It will bring you the luck of the devil himself, provided you wear it round your head... You'll have the temper of a devil too with this wet rag clinging to your skull.

items.name: Liroye Merline's Bark
items.description:
This fragment of bark comes from a tree in the enchanted clearing of Liroye Merline.
This fragment fell down when Brouce Boulgoure the lumberjack broke his Boulgourde against one of the enchanted trees.

items.name: Bright Sack of Potatoes
items.description: A Rogue carried incredible quantities of peeled potatoes in this sack and then sold them to prisoners. After he died, his bag passed down from Rogue to Rogue as a family ritual.

items.name: Dark Sack of Potatoes
items.description: The Dark Sack of Potatoes is identical to the Bright Sack of Potatoes apart from the fact that it has been dipped in some Dark Treechnid sap, thus conferring still more powers upon it.

items.name: Magic Redness Dye
items.description: This small magic potion gives hair a magnificent red colour. Oh, and it seems to have a few magical powers.

items.name: Magic Greenish Dye
items.description: This small magic potion gives hair a magnificent greenish effect. Oh, and it seems to have a few magical powers.

items.name: Magic Bluish Dye
items.description: This small magic potion gives hair a magnificent bluish effect. Oh, and it seems to have a few magical powers.

items.name: Magic Orange Dye
items.description: This small magic potion gives a magnificent auburn glow when applied to any kind of hair. Oh, and it seems to have a few magical powers as well.

items.name: Miliboowolf Hair
items.description: This fur is very similar to that of an Amaknan boowolf, just a little shorter, not as thick, and much softer. It's probably to make you feel more comfortable before you get eaten.

items.name: Cauldini's False Face
items.description: This mask will not turn you into a magician worthy of the name.

items.name: Magic Dark Dye
items.description: This small magic potion gives hair a magnificent dark colour. Oh, and it seems to have a few magical powers.

items.name: Furious Trool Wool
items.description: This piece of wool comes from the most dangerous Trool of Amakna who, apparently, has been transformed into a bedspread by an unscrupulous tailor, the same tailor who, if you believe what is publicly rumoured, has once exchanged his wife for a magic thimble. It's a mystery.

items.name: Cauldini Fabric
items.description: Many years ago, tailors created a simple system for determining the value of a material - the worse it smells, the better it is. This fabric smells worse than an Enutrof's foot bath commandeered by a Chafer to wash his pants in.

items.name: Bony Montana
items.description: "Who wants a little bone from his mummy-wummy?" Those were the last words of a proud Enutrof woman who mistook the Boowolf for her trusty poodle.

items.name: Salt Measure
items.description: This salt measure is the ideal quantity to season most family dishes. No meal can be cooked without it.

items.name: Dose of Tasty Juice
items.description: A dose of tasty juice, sometimes known as chef's special sauce, will make a fine, rustic, slightly salty broth.

items.name: Bowl
items.description: There's nothing more convenient than a bowl to eat your soup properly, even if the fact of eating properly doesn't alter the taste. Unless your fingers are really dirty.

items.name: Terrine
items.description:
Terrine is like meat... Oooo, that hits the spot. Three cheers for the terrine! Hurrah for the terrine!!!
Go terrine, it's your birthday.
Go terrine, it's your birthday.
(Extract from the butcher anthem, verse 4)

items.name: Cherry
items.description: Xelors often mistake this fruit for a space hopper. Remember them!

items.name: Lemon
items.description: This juice of this fruit is perfect for hiding the foul smell of rotting flesh. A must-have if you're serving leftovers to your guests.

items.name: Trool Fair Token
items.description: You bought this token from Leonzi Trool. His humble dream is to open the biggest public fair ever seen.

items.name: Breaded Fish
items.description: A cubic fish renowned for its particularly one dimensional thought processes. This piscatorial cretin is exceedingly easy to catch.

items.name: Igloo Fish
items.description: This rare species of breaded fish usually lives, as its name indicates, in the icy waters of the far North. Because of its polar diet, its flesh is rich in fibre.

items.name: Crab Surimi
items.description: This unusually-shaped crab is much appreciated for the great quantity of flesh it yields. It is also the only crab you can catch with a fishing rod because of its natural instinct to cut thread with its claws, which can't cut a thing!

items.name: Exotic Crab Surimi
items.description: Although a distant relative of the Crab Surimi, this crab has a few brain cells to throw around. This explains its rarity.

items.name: Tigerfish
items.description: This fish is much like a Kittenfish, but far, far more dangerous.

items.name: Piece of Coco Blop
items.description: This extract of Blop has a strong smell of coco. How can a monster residue smell like this?

items.name: Green Mouse
items.description: A Green Mouse running across the plains? Whatever you do, don't grab its tail.

items.name: Piece of Pippin Blop
items.description: A sizeable piece of Blop.

items.name: Piece of Morello Cherry Blop
items.description: A sizeable piece of Blop.

items.name: Piece of Indigo Blop
items.description: A sizeable piece of Blop.

items.name: Lard Bass
items.description: This fish is usually found in glacial lakes and rivers. Fishermen really love it for its size and fresh flesh.

items.name: Gudgeon
items.description: A small and fast-moving freshwater fish, the gudgeon is often caught by children and novice fishermen. Don't expect to feed your family with it.

items.name: Blue Ray
items.description: The Blue Ray rules the sea bed in which, for some mysterious reason, it digs tiny holes all day long. Every once in a while, it returns to the surface. Sometimes long enough for you to catch it.

items.name: Horror Grawn
items.description: Transformation of the Grawn. A distinguishing characteristic of this rare species is that it makes nauseating grunting noises when it moves around.

items.name: Farle's Ray
items.description: Farle Ingalsse personally discovered this particular species of ray during one of his great adventures. Apparently it has the ability to enchant fish with its deep, southern voice and rhythmic train-like beating of its tail.

items.name: Kiye Gudgeon
items.description: This rare species of gudgeon comes from Kiye Island, off Moon Island. Accustomed to warm currents, it migrates once a year to a hotter clime.

items.name: Siktrin Bass
items.description: A cousin of the Lard Bass, the Siktrin Bass is officially an endangered species. The population was hunted enthusiastically ever since some quack idiot doctor claimed that it improved the singing voice.

items.name: Ediem Carp
items.description: This creature is considered the wisest of all the freshwater fish. It's also surprisingly easy to catch... it's supreme knowledge of all things plunges many of its kind into an mind-numbing depression.

items.name: Small Sandy Carp
items.description: This small carp is sand-coloured, a distinctive feature which in theory should make it invisible to predators. What a pity there's not a single grain of sand in the lakes of Amakna.

items.name: Unique Kralove
items.description: This Kralove is monogamous. This is surprising when you know its habits.

items.name: Perch
items.description: This fish doesn't look like much but it is the slyest and quickest of its kind. It's worth a try though. Its matchless taste and unique flavour will be ample reward for your efforts.

items.name: Kittenperch
items.description: With the hideousness of its father and the savagery of its mother, this fish is the most difficult of all to catch. It's the rarest of its kind, too. Indeed, the mating of a Kittenfish with a Perch was once described by a famous statesman as "Grotesque, unbelievable, bizarre and unprecedented." The phrase GUBU has since been coined to describe such scandalous events.

items.name: Shiny Sardine
items.description: Some fish just don't know when to put it away... Cover up, get off the stage... Catching this bugger couldn't be easier.

items.name: Dark Sardine
items.description: Unlike the Shiny Sardine, the Dark Sardine is extremely difficult to catch.

items.name: Trout
items.description: Trout are easy to catch. Experienced fishermen haul them in by threes.

items.name: Ancestral Trout
items.description: This is one of the oldest trout in the World. If the simple passage of time makes you wiser, this trout must be the wisest of all. To be honest, though, that's not what I've heard.

items.name: Pike
items.description: This pike is a freshwater fish of average size. It's a barbecue's best friend.

items.name: Tupe-Halett Pike
items.description: This new species - resulting from the cross-breeding of several types of pike by the scientists Halett and Tupe - is supposed to have magical properties. Created only for experimentation, two specimens escaped during a violent argument between the two experts.

items.name: Open-Market Shark
items.description: A cousin of the Sickle-Hammerhead Shark, this animal is more ferocious and doesn't have a considerate fish-bone in its body. Catching an Open-Market Shark is the dream of every fisherman - or more precisely, catching one AND staying alive to tell the tale.

items.name: Crovus Feather
items.description: Sharpened into quill pens for years, Crobak Feathers are now used to adorn the rich and famous. No wonder Crovuses are nervous creatures – anyone who knows the value of these feathers will go a long way to get their hands on them.

items.name: Vetauran Hair
items.description: You had initially just wanted to chat with the jovial ruffian, but you were a hair too heavy-handed about it.

items.name: Plisskenskin
items.description: Have you ever dreamt of a magnificent Plissken leather bag? No? Good on you! It's not that resistant anyway!

items.name: Bliblitch Hairs
items.description: This type of hair is really disgusting. If you have a closer look at it, you'll discover a great microcosm of different parasites living on it... How lucky you are!

items.name: Frying Oil
items.description: What have Astrubian chips and Bontarian motorcycles got in common? This stuff.

items.name: Babbage
items.description: The favourite food of herbivores, it's also very good served as a side salad.

items.name: Onion
items.description: It's not just a good excuse for crying in public, this little bulb is also great for cooking.

items.name: Spices
items.description: Rosemary was always late delivering packages. This prompted the head of International Herbs & Spices to call her supervisor, demanding to speak to the parcel sage about Rosemary and time.

items.name: Pepper Measure
items.description: Ground pepper is an essential ingredient of mashed potatoes. Forget it at your peril.

items.name: Jelly Blubber
items.description: This blubber is similar to that extracted from a Jelly's heart. Used in cooking, it's an excellent preservative and gives a nice meaty tang to your meals.

items.name: Eternal Ashes
items.description: This is all that's left of an unfortunate soul who crossed your path. The creature made the mistake of thinking that being non-corporeal meant they could escape you. Their naiveté makes you smile.

items.name: Resin
items.description: This small portion of resin has many uses, mostly in the kitchen. But avoid eating it the way it is now, assuming you like having teeth.

items.name: Temporal Powder
items.description: This temporal powder, a flour residue discovered by Xelor millers, can slow down the molecular decomposition of materials and even living things. It is above all used as anti-wrinkle cream by female Enutrofs.

items.name: Scurvion Blood
items.description: Contrary to received ideas, this very syrupy blood doesn't contain poison. What's more, it can be used to make powerful preservatives and nice beauty masks.

items.name: Golden Wheat
items.description: This wheat contains a powerful magic.

items.name: Bright Hop
items.description: This type of hop has a bright and subdued aura revealing the magic Mother Nature has endowed it with.

items.name: Storm Flax
items.description: This Flax went through the most terrible storms and rose up again more than seven times. Pretty extraordinary for flax, you must admit. After getting wet every day for more than 148 years by the magic dew of the Great Pahti fields, its fibre might be useful for something.

items.name: Resistant Rye
items.description: This dark cereal can grow under the worst of conditions.

items.name: Sweet Barley
items.description: This rare type of barley absorbed sweet rainwater during its germination phase, which accounts for its incomparable magical powers.

items.name: Euphoric Hemp
items.description: This Hemp stem seems to have extremely powerful effects. Handled by a specialist, it could prove to be very useful.

items.name: Gold-Bearing Oats
items.description: When we look at this kind of oats we get the impression that the grains are covered with gold, the sign of the great magic power that is absorbed during sprouting.

items.name: Crovus Eye
items.description: A Crovus Eye is always useful... so long as you know how to avoid the evil eye.

items.name: Brandon's Heart
items.description: This human heart surely comes from the renowned Lhi, who had a passion for Crobaks.

items.name: Dead Crobak
items.description: You did good picking it up, it's intact. Dead but intact.

items.name: Crobak Foot
items.description: No need to break the foot of a Crobak. Especially as you know that, contrary to Wabbit Paws, Crobak Feet bring bad luck.

items.name: Scurvion Seed
items.description: These seeds have been prepared with Scurvion venom. The effects of this lethal poison are exponential, according to the dose you take.

items.name: Dragoturkey Teeth
items.description: This tooth seems to be very sharp. It could become a fearsome weapon in the wrong hands. Fortunately, the Dragoturkey only uses it to chew salad.

items.name: Contest Snapper
items.description: This fish can only be caught in the Sufokia Schwimming Pool. It is a cross breed of many diverse fish.

items.name: Royal Mint Jelly
items.description: This Royal Mint Jelly fleeced more than a few overly-confident adventurers, but it's finally been demolished. Eating it like you would an ordinary Jelly would be inadvisable.

items.name: Royal Strawberry Jelly
items.description: This concentrate of Royal Strawberry Jelly can turn a pacifist Tabi into a bloodthirsty killing-machine. An excellent reason to avoid giving it to your friends as a starter.

items.name: Royal Tofu Feather
items.description: You'd have to be a lop not to realise that this feather comes from the backside of a Royal Tofu. You'd have to be an Osamodas to want to touch it.

items.name: Garglyph Tooth
items.description: You can always hang this tooth from a strap around your neck and claim it used to belong to the terrible trash-vampire, Edward.

items.name: Trunknid Wood
items.description: This piece of wood sounds hollow. The green sap coming out of it proves that it is the nose of the Trunknid.

items.name: Megacrackler Megastone
items.description: Thou shalt not cast the first Megastone!

items.name: Crackler's Gold Tooth
items.description: You just shamelessly yanked this tooth out of the first unfortunate Crackler to cross your path. Too bad it was his only one! A full grill could have covered your zaap costs for a whole month.

items.name: Greedovore Flower
items.description: This flower facilitates digestion. Now you can stay as long as you want at the local free buffet.

items.name: Ambusher Leaf
items.description: Ambusher leaf has a very unusual taste, somewhere between hazelnut and limp Babbage. If you dare to try the meals you make, you will soon realise they taste a little like treachery.

items.name: Gobnoramus's Lance Head
items.description:
Young goblins are given spears for their first boar hunt. They will use these lances throughout their lives. They then learn how to clean, wield and sharpen them as they gain independence and legitimacy in the eyes of their camps.
The first goblin to own this must have thought it would be a good idea to attach it to the end of a stick and try to gut passers-by with it.

items.name: Goblin Eye Tooth
items.description: It's well known that goblins never brush their teeth. Because of this, they lose them regularly throughout their lives. This might explain that weird noise they make when you slug them in the mouth.

items.name: Piglet Milk
items.description: This Pig Milk comes from a Piglet. If you thought you'd found it on a Tofu, you didn't. Just sayin'...

items.name: Bwork Archer Scalp
items.description: Here is a scalp which could start a new fashion in the Enutrof world: the Toopish. A little bit of anti-lice potion and you'll be ready to participate in the "World's Classiest Enutrof" Contest.

items.name: Purple Mégabwork Leather
items.description: Bwork handicraft remains very mysterious. Some adventurers think the purplish colour comes from Goblins. But the origins of the leather are still unknown. Very strange.

items.name: Purple Fabric
items.description: The main characteristics of this strange Purple Fabric are that it is light and soft to the touch. The tag says "made in Tie One On".

items.name: Dark Miner's Candle
items.description: Take an Enutrof. When it's dark in the mines, no one can see him. The Dark Miner you took this candle off on the other hand... well, he can't be seen either since you now have his candle.

items.name: Lousy Pig Leather
items.description: Hunted by a wide range of enemies and predators, Lousy Pigs nearly disappeared from the food chain. Some say that people had to mate boars with piglets to bring the shrill sounds of their oinking and grunting back to the lower Cania Plains. But the real reason for the Lousy Pigs' return is probably something else entirely... Could the goddess Eboren be responsible? The fact is, it doesn't matter. Ever since they reappeared, the Lousy Pigs have had a grudge against everyone. You could even say they're in a permanently lousy mood.

items.name: Shroud
items.description: To gain credibility, Ghosts roll themselves up in a Shroud. That's one way of frightening lost adventurers.

items.name: Invisible Fabric
items.description: This fabric once belonged to Mill Burray, hunter of gophers. He spread it out to trap the burrowing creatures and prevent them from tunnelling all over his golf course. The charismatic Captain Chafer took hold of the fabric before disappearing in mysterious circumstances.

items.name: Vampire Canine
items.description: When you're a vampire, it's all well and good to terrorise your victims with a fearsome glare and graveyard breath, but you still need to take care of your primary weapon by brushing your teeth three times a day for at least three minutes. The vampire who lost this fang learned that the hard way. Deprived of his most effective tool, he's now forced to drink through a straw.

items.name: Vampire Straw
items.description: Never underestimate a vampire, especially when they're holding a straw; they could suck your blood until their thirst is quenched.

items.name: Greaseball Fabric
items.description: This fabric is actually recycled paper. Greaseballs often use it to give a particular look to their balls.

items.name: Tuft of White Hair
items.description: Finally, conclusive evidence that even monsters get stressed out.

items.name: Kwoan Eye
items.description: This Kwoan Eye has surprising hypnotic effects. You'll need to keep a close eye on yourself when handling it.

items.name: Dark Tissue
items.description: The peculiarity of this fabric is indisputable. That said, it's very irritating to the touch. You'll understand when I tell you that a Black Tofu used to use it as a handkerchief.

items.name: Bandages
items.description: These bandages are revolutionary: triple thickness, ultra-resistant and violet-scented. Shaped for confidence, shaped for comfort.

items.name: Cucumber
items.description: It is very hard to explain just what cucumbers are and what they're used for. Mainly because how they're used depends on the context.

items.name: Wabbit Paw
items.description: Many tourists come to the Wabbit Islands especially to find a Wabbit Paw which is supposed to be a lucky charm. Unfortunately it's not true, but keep it to yourself or tourism could suffer.

items.name: Scaraleaf Entrails
items.description: At first sight these entrails do not look particularly mouth-watering. However, if you chop them finely with some sun-dried herbs, some wild mint and then braise them in a rusty cauldron, they'll make a satisfying meal for discerning Chafers.

items.name: Reptilian Sword Fragment
items.description: With this fragment of sword hung above the fireplace, you have a good reason to show off. You have defeated the Crocodyl after all, just like the eccentric Mikool J., also known as Crocodyl Dandy, did before you. No one will know that you got it off a dead Arachnee.

items.name: Chafer Archer Arrow
items.description: This arrow can be used to craft a short, but sharp, weapon. It can also serve as a toothpick. It all depends where your priorities lie.

items.name: Hell Mina's Unruly Lock
items.description: Hell Mina's hair is said to be as untameable as its owner, so much so that she has to wear a headband to keep her vision free of obstructions during battle. This accessory doesn't actually seem to have the desired effect, of course, but no matter! That's just part of its charm.

items.name: Bone Fragment
