items.description: This fragment of bone has either come from the remains of a Chafer or from the leftovers of a Moowolf meal. There's also a large chance that it hasn't got anything to do with either one.

items.name: Kolerat Whiskers
items.description: Not very resistant, these whiskers will enable you to show off in front of your friends... by imitating Salv and Torh Bali, two great Brakmarian painters, for example.

items.name: Starfish Tongue
items.description: Several illustrious Amakna thinkers are still stumped as to what use a Starfish Trooper could possibly have for a tongue. They would probably be shocked if they knew.

items.name: Empty Crab Carapace
items.description: Once emptied, this crab carapace can hold a good many items. The problem is you'll never be able to get rid of the crabby smell. People have lost friends over much less.

items.name: Polished Stone Fragment
items.description: This fragment of polished stone comes from the left buttock of a Cracklerge. For squashing Arachnees, there's nothing finer, except for the Cracklerge itself, perhaps.

items.name: Pointed Stone Fragment
items.description: This fragment of pointed stone comes from the right shoulder blade of a Plain Crackler. Or maybe it's a part of the lower abdomen. Anyway, just be careful where you put it.

items.name: Crackler Heart
items.description: Jon Lemon used to do a cover of this stone's song: "You'll neeever break, neeeever break, neeeever break, neeever break... my heart of stone. (Oh no no!)"

items.name: Whitish Fang Fur
items.description: This resource is obsolete.

items.name: Dalbweel Knife
items.description: This knife has sent many an adventurer fleeing in terror. Don't underestimate it.

items.name: Dark Rose Leaf
items.description: This leaf has the characteristics of both nettles and brambles, which is why loving parents serve it as a salad to their darling little children.

items.name: Broken Macian Collar
items.description: Like any good Ouginak, their collar gives information. A message is inscribed on this collar: "If lost, please return me to my Brakmarian master on the Sidimote Moors, who will reward you with a punch in the face."

items.name: Macian Chops
items.description: Did it cross your mind that these chops could slobber for all eternity? Well, the scary part is they probably can – these animals are well-known for their everlasting gluttony.

items.name: Rat Fang
items.description: Don't be fooled, these small toothy-pegs are actually real sharp, stinky, used fangs. Sometimes unscrupulous Enutrof dentists replace teeth with them.

items.name: Spinal Cord
items.description: This is some good quality cord. Heavy though... You'd be amazed how many people put their backs out just picking it up!

items.name: Watermelon
items.description: Unlike the Lolwut Pear, the Lol Wutermelon is made of fail.

items.name: Banana
items.description: The famous minstrel Jon Lemon once composed an ode to this fruit: "Happiness is a warm Banana".

items.name: Orange
items.description: They say that oranges are not the only fruit.

items.name: Pear
items.description: This juicy Lolwut pear is made of win.

items.name: Explosive Capsule
items.description: This capsule contains extracts of magical citrus fruits. You are advised to shake it before opening, so the pulp doesn't stay stuck to the bottom.

items.name: Aubergine
items.description: This isn't the most nutritious of vegetables and it often requires strong seasoning to make it a bit more tasty. In spite of its bad reputation, however, it's really quite healthy. Well, healthy for everyone except Bworks. No one knows why, however.

items.name: Chafer Skull
items.description: This poor Chafer will never rattle again.

items.name: Oliviolet Wood
items.description: This wood seems to be completely heat-resistant. Don't try to use it to make a fire as you will die of exposure before the wood ever lights.

items.name: Bombu Wood
items.description: This wood is the softest you can find. It is solid, malleable and a joy to carve.

items.name: Hestia's Bramble Leaf
items.description: This ordinary-looking bramble leaf is an essential plant for some strange recipes.

items.name: Kaerlier Wood
items.description: This wood comes from the legendary Kaerlier. Its properties are quite surprising.

items.name: Kweats's Card
items.description: This card is linked to Master Kweats. That's all you'll ever know and all you need to know.

items.name: Lemon Jelly
items.description: This pot of Lemon Jelly looks quite strange. According to Elrik Ola, this jelly comes from his place. From the other side of the galaxy, to be more precise. It's a pity it tastes so good!

items.name: Royal Lemon Jelly
items.description: Some people say that Royal Lemon Jelly is much tastier than all the others, but that could be because the lemon flavour hides the taste of the jelly.

items.name: Cave Gobball Brain
items.description: There is no doubt that this brain comes from a Cave Gobball. Well-cooked, it's the favourite dish of young Iops who long to be strong and tall. They also believe it can make them more intelligent, but if that were true, they would stop this idiotic practise immediately.

items.name: Sewer Arachnee Leg
items.description: Eniripsas sometimes use this leg like a needle to sew up wounds. Eniripsas with a sadistic streak, that is.

items.name: Strubian Raeman Eye
items.description: In the past, eyes like this one were used to make delicious soup. So delicious, in fact, that the recipe had to be stricken from cookbooks because a goodly number of hunters would take only the eyes, leaving heaps of steaming carcasses everywhere.

items.name: Tofurby Stomach
items.description: This stomach has wonderful elastic properties. Don't worry if there's still a little Clover pulp inside it. In fact, the stuff is great for unblocking congested pipes. Er... That is, pipes under houses. Please don't stick it in your mouth.

items.name: Gobball Blood
items.description: This stuff doubles as bait and weapon. You attract the creatures of the wild with the smell of the stuff, then when it turns all scabby, you use it to knock them over the head.

items.name: Kwoan Tooth
items.description: Very few people are skilled enough to extract a tooth from a Kwoan. Note that this tooth goes up in value when it's damaged. Don't ask me why.

items.name: Prepubescent Boostache Tail
items.description: Remain hidden in a corner and watch patiently, without making any noise, and you just might see a Prepubescent Boostache wag its little tail. But they only do it during mating season.

items.name: Gargoyl Tongue
items.description: The Gargoyl's breath will make you wish you – or at least your nasal passages – were made of stone. You always have the impression that it ate an over-ripe Trool just before.

items.name: Strubian Milirat Slices
items.description: The expression "don't fart around" comes from binmen whose only food was Milirat meat, which is well known to cause intense and spectacular flatulence.

items.name: Ouassingue Stomach
items.description: Within this stomach hides a surprise. One Enutrof pinky finger, a bit of Osamodas nose... You could almost build a whole hero with all these pieces.

items.name: Robo Mace's Mace
items.description: Seeing the size of this mace, you have to wonder what the Imps really play at with their robots.

items.name: Lousy Pig Leather Briefs
items.description: "A Lousy Pig without briefs is a dead Lousy Pig." Such was the favourite expression of Lady Harre, a disciple of Feca and a dedicated peeping Tom. Her favourite pastime was sneaking up on her friends and putting Lousy Pig briefs over their heads.

items.name: Robo Mace's Chain
items.description: Don't underestimate the ruggedness of this chain. The slightest hit on your backside will keep you from sitting down for days.

items.name: Broken Hinge
items.description: The wear and tear caused by the constant opening and closing of the chest's lid have finally worn out the poor security hinge. It must have been very painful.

items.name: Useless Junk
items.description: The previous owner of this item tried his best to find a use for it. He tried using it to level a wobbly chair, but to no avail. He even tried to exhibit it as a contemporary artwork in his front room, in hopes that it might serve as a conversation piece, but in vain. Finally, he gave up and simply abandoned it in a forgotten corner of an equipped chest.

items.name: Broken Trident
items.description: Here's a little souvenir of your Lousy Pig friend. Hopefully he's not upset enough to track you across the plains... Given his piggish nature, it's definitely possible. Be careful.

items.name: Damaged Shell
items.description: This shell is the last remnant of Pushy Robot that pushed the limits a little too far.

items.name: Scurvion Entrails
items.description: At first sight, these entrails don't look very appetising. Fair enough. Scurvion entrails are actually revolting, even when cooked with loving care.

items.name: Arachmutated Eye
items.description: This disturbing but intriguing eye doesn't really reflect what you'd expect it to. For example, if you look into it, instead of your reflection you'll see your counterpart, your Dopple. Go figure.

items.name: Drinker Heart
items.description: This heart will remain faithful to you. As long as you don't sell or exchange it, it will stay in your bag. What a lovely thought!

items.name: Cracklope Eye
items.description: This Eye glows in the dark even once extracted from its owner's face. It's so bright you can read your favourite comic books all night long.

items.name: Hyoactive Rat Tail
items.description: Carefully cut, this tail tastes like a sausage. The weird thing is, when you cut out big slices, the sausage taste disappears. Another existential culinary enigma in this world.

items.name: Double Swell Warrior Ear
items.description: Hold it to your ear and you might hear the sea.

items.name: Dead Kolerat
items.description: You did good picking it up, it's intact. Dead but intact.

items.name: Whitish Fang Tail
items.description: This resource is obsolete.

items.name: Whitish Fang Paw
items.description: Whitish Fang Paws are highly prized by Amakna's gourmet chefs. They share their magical properties with whoever puts them on. If you put them on, however, you'll quickly find that luck is not as random as you.

items.name: Cracklope Tongue
items.description: This tongue certainly explored many dark places before you got your hands on it.

items.name: Ball
items.description: To attract a Whitish Fang into the bonds of domesticity, throw him a ball – they go crazy for them. He may not say it out loud, but you'll be friends for life.

items.name: Bell
items.description: The green mouse can be heard for kilokametres around thanks to its bell. And a good thing that is! The little critter makes it a habit to hide in thick vegetation and nibble away at anything it finds – including and most especially farmers' toes.

items.name: Plains Larva Skin
items.description: This skin smells like the countryside as well as being rather pretty. Some would even say it represents the authenticity of the Cania Fields soil.

items.name: Plissken Venom
items.description: This dreadful venom can wipe out a whole army of furious Gobballs. Just pour some of it onto a staff and start a-swipin'!

items.name: Plains Larva Tooth
items.description: There's no doubt this tooth used to belong to a Plains Larvae. It's plain to see from its dangerously sharp tip.

items.name: Bliblirect Stomach
items.description: This stomach is big enough to hold many things. A heaven-sent opportunity for a Iop to sort its Swords out.

items.name: Bliblido Leather
items.description: Despite its high quality, shoemakers refused to use this leather for many years. Customers thought it was fake because it has no smell! As they say, never judge a boot by its odour.

items.name: Plain Boar Tail
items.description: Many Brakmarian poachers collect this hairy trophy. The reasons why are still unknown to this day.

items.name: Bliblirect Fabric
items.description: Contrary to its leather, a Bliblirect's Fabric has a smell that should never be sniffed. It could rouse a Sadida from hibernation.

items.name: Bliblycerin Hoof
items.description: Bliblycerin Hooves are generally covered with mud or dirt but sometimes with colourful Biblops, which is not that unusual. The Bliblycerin hates Biblops as much as you do.

items.name: Plain Boar Snout
items.description: At first sight, this snout doesn't look very fresh. But don't be mistaken, it's the most tender and most refined snout that ever did sniff.

items.name: Bliblycerin Tusk
items.description: This Bliblycerin Tusk will you remind you how unpleasant this type of Bliblis is. Indeed, the tusk is as worn as a nibbling Wabbit Tooth, which probably means it's already skewered its fair share of adventurers.

items.name: Lord Crow's Scythe
items.description: This Scythe was originally designed to cut down Iops, but Lord Crow realised that harvesting grain was just as profitable as harvesting blood-thirsty warriors.

items.name: Clakoss
items.description: Lord Crow is just full of surprises! For example, he always carries a Clakoss - the famous royal cheese - in his pocket. He must really love it to have tamed such a beast!

items.name: Kaniger Nail
items.description: You need to be strong and quick to rip out a Kaniger nail. Strong to extract the nail, and quick to avoid the beating that follows.

items.name: Liquid Metal Potion
items.description: This potion gives a little reality back to an ethereal blade.

items.name: Liquid Heavy Metal Potion
items.description: This potion gives reality back to an ethereal blade.

items.name: Shrubstrate
items.description: These shrubs are very much appreciated when the need arises to do a somersault or relieve a pressing need.

items.name: Timber Substrate
items.description: Some Iops tried eating some, thinking it would make them more clever. What would make them think that, only a Iop knows.

items.name: Liquid Precious Metal Potion
items.description: This potion gives a great deal of reality back to an ethereal blade.

items.name: Fascine Substrate
items.description: Rather than filling in gaps in scientific Knowledge, this potion serves to fill in the gap between apprentice and disciple.

items.name: Vetauran Tin
items.description: This is irrefutable proof that Vetaurans are in good shape for their age.

items.name: Foxfyter Fabric
items.description: If you collect enough pieces of this fabric, you'll finally be able to make the giant cawwot costume of your dreams.

items.name: Foxfyter Ear
items.description: When you hang out with the wrong crowd, don't be surprised to get your ears pulled.

items.name: Kaniger Eye
items.description: Kaniger Eyes have become a fashion phenomenon – just look at the number of adventurers who wear them around their necks.

items.name: Big Cannonball
items.description: This, ladies and gentlemen is a reaaal Cannonball. Heavy as a whipped hippy, it tends to make holes in the skull of anyone who gets too close. Not the best idea then.

items.name: Lousy Pig Chops
items.description: Lousy Pig Chops have a special taste. Some people cook them with a spicy sauce, others eat them raw. As for the Lousy Pig, it prefers your chops. To each his own... recipe.

items.name: Leather Drive Belt
items.description: These belts, created for use in automatons, are frequently misused by Imps during their nocturnal meetings.

items.name: Dead Blop
items.description: You did good picking it up, it's intact. Dead but intact.

items.name: Troolaraj Mane
items.description: A mane of hair like this one is hard to find. Rich Enutrofs use it as hair replacement.

items.name: Trooligark Shoulder Pad
items.description: This is the best way to admire this shoulder pad. The worst would be still attached to the Trool's shoulder. Now you can go on parade!

items.name: Trool Bracelet of Strength
items.description: As if a Trool needed a Strength Bracelet! This incredible bone-grinding machine wears one bracelet on each wrist.

items.name: Troolaraj Briefs
items.description: Judging by the state of these briefs, the Trool wasn't careful about where it sat. You can also estimate the age of its owner. By smell, of course...

items.name: Yellow Larva Skin
items.description: This delightfully smooth skin is an excellent ingredient for magic potions.

items.name: Trunknid Eyebrows
items.description: Ever wondered how Trunknids manage to frighten away chance visitors so easily? The answer's right in front of you: who wouldn't crumble under a glare from eyebrows like these?

items.name: Wooden Disk
items.description: This disk can be used to replace the broken wheel on a wooden toy, or plug the nose of a dense child.

items.name: Magic Slice of Burnabwork
items.description: This slice is dripping with noxious substances that prolong combustion.

items.name: Tofukaz Foot
items.description: How can a Tofukaz be so agile with only two toes, you must surely ask yourself? It's a mystery.

items.name: Tofukaz Stomach
items.description: "If you keep eating the same thing, you end up looking like what you eat," was the wise advice of Bontarian chef Boolya Wild. And that's why Tofukaz' stomachs are as green as the grass they eat.

items.name: Strubian Sickrat Mane
items.description: You'll find it easy to get into "Vee-Eye-Pee" parties with this mane on your head. Unless you bring an Osamodas friend, of course, in which case you'll just be mistaken for their Summons.

items.name: Boowonoké Scalp
items.description: When you and the Boowonoké met, the same thought ran through your warped minds... To leave with a scalp. Well, now you've got a scalp and it needs a hat.

items.name: Miliboowolf Scalp
items.description: When you and the Miliboowolf met, the same thought ran through your warped minds... To leave with a scalp. Well, now you've got a scalp and he needs a hat.

items.name: Moowolf Scalp
items.description: When you and the Moowolf met, the same thought ran through your warped minds... To leave with a scalp. Well, now you've got a scalp and he needs a hat.

items.name: Boopig Eye
items.description: Even removed, the gaze of the Boopig remains fixed on you. Its gaze follows you wherever you go... It's quite impressive.

items.name: Black Tofu Eye
items.description: Even removed, the gaze of the Black Tofu Eye remains fixed on you. And if you look closely, it's still blinking. What vitality the Black Tofu has!

items.name: Boowolf Teeth
items.description: There's nothing sharper.

items.name: Raul Mops Eye
items.description: Only tourists would be dumb enough to believe that this eye belonged to a Raul Mops.

items.name: Mushd Hand
items.description: This Mushd Hand, found inside an Arachnee carcass, is covered in mud, or at least that's what people think. But imagine if there was nothing under that mud, not even a Mushd Hand.

items.name: Muddy Mushd Heart
items.description: With their muddy hearts, it's hard to decide where Mushds lie in the food chain. Actually, thinking about it, they're surely right at the very end of the food chain.

items.name: Wild Ginger Dragoturkey Wing
items.description: This wing smells like sulphur. Any Dragoturkey breeder will tell you it's the most tender part for a barbecue. Just don't forget to season it because the wing is also the most tasteless part.

items.name: Dragoturkey Wing
items.description: The domestic Dragoturkey tastes much better than its wild cousin. It has no sulphurous aftertaste, and the meat is delightfully moreish. That's why it's every child's favourite meal.

items.name: Wild Dragoturkey Tail
items.description: This tail can come in quite handy: put it on a round rock and give it a good spin. When it stops, follow the direction indicated by its tip. That was the cornerstone of Sadida navigation for centuries.

items.name: Dragoturkey Peak
items.description: Located on the back of the Dragoturkey, this peak can be used to scratch your crotch, provided you can mount a Dragoturkey.

items.name: Domoizelle Feather
items.description: This pale pink feather will help you craft some of the most delicate and sought after items in all of Amakna.

items.name: Dostrogo Feather
items.description: The deep blue of this rare feather will let you hide in the puddles of Moon Island, or in the sky, if you use its cannon.

items.name: Dead Glukoko
items.description: You did good picking it up, it's intact. Dead but intact.

items.name: Green Carapace
items.description: But where's the owner hiding? Maybe he went out to buy some pizza.

items.name: Red Carapace
items.description: But where's the owner hiding? Maybe he moved out a short while ago.

items.name: Yellow Carapace
items.description: But where's the owner hiding? Maybe he's having a nap inside.

items.name: Blue Carapace
items.description: But where's the owner hiding? Maybe he's in the shower.

items.name: Kokonut Slice
items.description: Finally something that reminds you of your holiday. That travel agency has got it coming!

items.name: Kokostraw
items.description: To sip a fresh drink, you need a coloured straw. Now, you'll have to find a hole in the Kokonut.

items.name: Turtle Milk
items.description: What a good idea! Turtle Milk in a bottle! You can drink it whenever and wherever you want.

items.name: Quality Rum
items.description: This old rum must come from a highly prized cellar. Unless it comes from a flask forgotten for many generations in someone's pocket.

items.name: LeChouque's Beard
items.description: You have just torn off LeChouque's beard from his chin. Weirdly enough, his teeth came along with the beard... That might be because he's been dead for a long time.

items.name: Cannon Dorf Ball
items.description: No one knows if it's because of his experience handling big balls, or because he is one himself, but Cannon Dorf is the best cannoneer on LeChouque's crew.

items.name: Scrawny Bwak
items.description: Breeders have always believed the Bwaks flew away at the end of their lives... this Bwak must be an exception.

items.name: Tikokoko Leaf
items.description: The hardiest hunters always want to recover a Tikokoko Leaf as a souvenir, whatever the cost, and then never come back to this cursed island. Why would they?

items.name: Thierry Voodoo Doll
items.description: Strength emanates from this doll... you have the strange feeling that it is calling somebody.

items.name: Jav Voodoo Doll
items.description: Strength emanates from this doll... you have the strange feeling that it is looking for somebody.

items.name: Sarbak Voodoo Doll
items.description: Strength emanates from this doll... you have the strange feeling that it is listening to somebody.

items.name: Archer Voodoo Doll
items.description: Strength emanates from this doll... you have the strange feeling that it is waiting for somebody.

items.name: Greedo Rum
items.description: This bottle was accidentally left inside a Greedovore, used as a mobile cellar for several years.

items.name: Rib Jaw
items.description: The Rib is a skinny wee rake... If it loses its jaw on top of that, it'll be about as offensive as an army of hibernating ticks.

items.name: Dragon Pig Snout
items.description: The Dragon Pig didn't smell that one coming. Hahaha.

items.name: Piglet Leather Briefs
items.description: These very large briefs suit Piglets down to the ground... The seams are stretchy and reinforced for comfort during close attacks. As tradition demands, these briefs must never be washed because they will lose their mystic qualities, which are as yet unknown but feared nonetheless.

items.name: Mabwork Ear
items.description: Mabworks need first-class material to make their implants. At first glance, this ear seems to have been ripped off a piglet's head without its permission.

items.name: Kwak Claws
items.description: The Kwak is no scavenger. The rotting flesh under his claw-nails is, in fact... well, I'll spare you the details.

items.name: Earthworm
items.description: This earthworm is the favourite dish of wild Kwaks. The odd thing is that it remains alive once extracted from the Kwak's stomach.

items.name: Waterworm
items.description: This waterworm is the favourite dish of wild Kwaks. The odd thing is that it remains alive once extracted from the Kwak's stomach.

items.name: Fireworm
items.description: This fireworm is the favourite dish of wild Kwaks. The odd thing is that it remains alive once extracted from the Kwak's stomach.

items.name: Airworm
items.description: This airworm is the favourite dish of wild Kwaks. The odd thing is that it remains alive once extracted from the Kwak's stomach.

items.name: Dead Major Arachnee
items.description: You did good picking it up, it's intact. Dead but intact.

items.name: Kwapa Water
items.description: Kwapa water isn't very different from the water you drink every day, but crafters continue to believe that it's needed to make many different items.

items.name: Gobelishous's Chewed Bone
items.description: Gobelishouses are compulsive gluttons that devour everything within reach. The one that owned this bone chomped down on it so hard that you can clearly see the teeth marks.

items.name: Wild Sunflower Petal
items.description: This petal moves according to the sun. If you put it in your right pocket in the morning, you'll find it in your left pocket in the evening.

items.name: Wild Sunflower Leaf
items.description: Somewhat bizarrely, the fleshy, spiny leaves of the Wild Sunflower are also its feet - so don't be surprised if this one smells a little cheesy.

items.name: Demonic Rose Saliva
items.description: This furious rose has habit of slobbering rabidly on whoever approaches it... They say it's a sign of affection!

items.name: Fertiliser
items.description: Any beautiful plant needs Fertiliser. That's why ageing Enutrofettes don't need it.

items.name: Crocodyl Bone
items.description: This strange, greenish bone came from a Crocodyl's leg. The tears the poor animal wept when he saw one of his extremities was missing were certainly not tears of the crocodile sort.

items.name: Wild Grass
items.description: This type of vegetation is used for bedding in Gobball pens. It certainly is a wild species - it often flees of its own accord. Polite too, though. It always closes the gate after it. Quite spectacular, just great.

items.name: Bat
items.description: When the going gets tough, the tough turn into bats. Well, it depends how you define tough, I guess. If you're talking about a vampire that snickers before flying off – you know the sound, it's a bit like "gnak gnook gnak gnak" – then "tough" is probably the wrong adjective. Such laughter could put to rout an army. An army of ticks, that is.

items.name: Rotten Egg
items.description: It's positively shameful. Laying a Tofu Egg that's already decomposing?! You really have to be deranged to have such ideas.

items.name: Goballista Cap
items.description: Goballistas are among the biggest cowards in the goblin ranks. They prefer staying back and hiding under their caps, think that that'll make them more difficult to flush out. In addition to being lousy strategy, this habit also explains why they so rarely hit their targets...

items.name: Evil Tofu Feather
items.description: The Evil Tofu hasn't got many Feathers left. Therefore, he's risking a stinking cold. Don't be surprised if you hear him sneeze at night.

items.name: Dead Neye
items.description: You did good picking it up, it's intact. Dead but intact.

items.name: Boowoldlum Magic Testicles
items.description: Nobody knows exactly when or how it happened, but one day, these testicles were given magic powers... The extent of their true powers remains shrouded in mystery.

items.name: Moowolf Magic Testicles
items.description: As strange as it may seem, these testicles have magic powers. We don't really know to what extent that helped the Moowolf, and to be honest, it's probably better not to ask.

items.name: Minos Skin
items.description: This skin is as tough as Brakmar's fortifications. Its unsung natural properties make it easy to work into the finest items.

items.name: Bwork Helmet
items.description: In the Bwork clan, the Bwork Magus are in charge of the forge. They are equipped with a helmet from birth to avoid any accidents, such as falls and hammer blows.

items.name: Bwork Shoulder Pad
items.description: This shoulder pad is an essential component in the education of young Bworks – although "education" isn't exactly the right word for what they do. "Training" would be a closer fit.

items.name: Tattered Bwork Boot
items.description: A boot like this is almost useless. Once it has been correctly patched up by a skilled shoemaker it'll do something, but for now its smell can help you repel the advances of your eager fans.

items.name: Bwork Archer Briefs
items.description: The Bwork Archer had the bad habit of putting his arrows away into his leather briefs. This might explain why the Bwork Archer's arrows are said to be poisoned.

items.name: Bizarbwork Scalp
items.description: Early on, young Enutrofs try and get hold of a Bizarbwork Scalp to hide their growing bald spot. Wearing that thing on their heads, they look even more ridiculous than normal!

items.name: Kriptonite
items.description: This remarkable Alloy was pulled out of the ground far from here. Use it to decorate the fireplace or, if you wish, to hit a Iop over the head.

items.name: Kobalite
items.description: Kobalite is the most impressive alloy ever discovered. The ancient miners thought it was the perfect mixture until they realised it crumbled into dust when it came into contact with Gobball Slobber.

items.name: Broken Chafer Helmet
items.description: You can't use this helmet in such a state. It would hurt your head. Get a good tailor to put some padding in, and pad his pockets at the same time.

items.name: Robionicle Claw
items.description: This primitive-looking claw is primarily used to rip the heads off enemy Robionicles during the illegal robot fights the Imps organise.

items.name: Mutilated Makroute
items.description: This magic Makroute is in poor condition. It didn't stand up to the violence of your attacks and its coat is now dark. A new life could be opening up for it if only you were able to heal it.

items.name: Mutilated Bear
items.description: This small Bear Head is in poor condition. Some string, a bit of fresh tissue and plenty of imagination will transform this horrible thing into a magnificent headgear.

items.name: Dark Wicker
items.description: This Piece of Wicker is as dark as the darkest ghost, as magic as the most magic ghost, as resistant as the most resistant ghost. Just remember ghosts don't exist.

items.name: Soft Oak Root
items.description: Some people make beer with this kind of root. Given that the Soft Oak had no tolerance for the grog, it's very inadvisable.

items.name: Soft Oak Wood
items.description: This wood has had a few close shaves with Brouce Boulgoure's Axe. It has also experienced many other mysterious and dangerous things that even the book of the Bwork Magus does not reveal. You have every reason to expect the worst.

items.name: Soft Oak Amber
items.description: This amber contains one of the Soft Oak's leaves, trapped for aeons in the sticky sap. This precious treasure is truly a collector's item, just like LeChouque's yellow and red polkadot socks.

items.name: Fairywork Powder
items.description: When your guests get bored, crack open a box of Fairyworks! You can build them yourself using this powder and other ingredients. Guaranteed to create an explosive atmosphere at your next party.

items.name: Stuffed Gobball
items.description:
This stuffed toy is the spitting image of a Gobball; and its creators were vicious enough to make it smell like Gobball too. So don't be surprised if you smell bad when you wake up in the morning.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Royal Gobball
items.description:
This stuffed toy is royally good; from the seams to the stuffing, nothing's been left to chance. It's an excellent gift for spoilt children or rich brats.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Sadida Dopple
items.description:
This stuffed toy has a big alarm clock in its stuffing, very useful for Sadidas who find it hard to wake up. It's best left behind when you fall under a charm, though, since time has a way of getting away from you!
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Ecaflip Dopple
items.description:
This stuffed toy amuses Ecaflips of all ages.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Iop Dopple
items.description:
This stuffed toy looks just like a real Iop in a way: too stupid for words and not even a smidgen of stuffing in its head.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Sram Dopple
items.description:
This stuffed toy was stolen from a young Sram who stole it from one of his friends...
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Eniripsa Dopple
items.description:
This stuffed toy could almost fly on its own if its wings weren't worn down. Indeed, this toy is far from new. But no matter: it's still a nice gift.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Enutrof Dopple
items.description:
This stuffed toy is rumoured to be stuffed with bauxite and golden nuggets – at least that's what they say on the black market... In reality, it's just ordinary gravel.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Feca Dopple
items.description:
This stuffed toy is almost indestructible, so it's perfect for young, unruly, careless Fecas.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Osamodas Dopple
items.description:
They say that this toy can summon other small stuffed toys if it's kept in proper condition... but that's just an old wives' tale to keep young Osamodas from eating it.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Cra Dopple
items.description:
This proud-looking stuffed toy is made to be hurled onto your playmates, as a kind of boomerang that doesn't come back.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Xelor Dopple
items.description:
This stuffed toy makes a strange noise. It seems to have a clock in its stuffed head, a kind of lullaby to lull young Xelors off to sleep.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Boar
items.description:
Real boar bristles were used to make this toy. Surely that's a sign of quality.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Tofu
items.description:
Who has never dreamt of cuddling a Tofu close? You maybe? In this case, you really do buy just anything, or your friends have no taste when it comes to gifts.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Mush Mush
items.description:
This Mush Mush has neither painful thorns nor paralysing poison. But it's fearsome enough to frighten the most naive of Iops.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Prespic
items.description:
This stuffed Prespic has no thorns and can't turn itself invisible, but it's a good stuffed toy and will make all your friends terribly jealous.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Wabbit
items.description:
The stuffed Wabbit is a must-have, perhaps because it will never go out of fashion. Unlike you.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Dark Vlad's Rattle
items.description: This ordinary Rattle once belonged to Dark Vlad, which is enough to make it priceless.

items.name: Stuffed Dragon Pig
items.description:
This stuffed toy is unique. But be careful, it's only suitable for an... experienced... audience.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Lord Crow's Cup-and-Ball
items.description: This magnificent toy once belonged to Lord Crow. Too stupid to understand how it worked, he used it to crush his little crows. Everyone has a right to a pastime.

items.name: Captain Chafer's Skipping Rope
items.description: Captain Chafer used that skipping rope to keep his finger joints in shape. Since he disappeared from Amakna, it's been passing from hand to hand.

items.name: Red Balloon
items.description: This balloon is a souvenir from the Trool Fair.

items.name: Blue Balloon
items.description: This balloon is a souvenir from the Trool Fair.

items.name: Green Balloon
items.description: This balloon is a souvenir from the Trool Fair.

items.name: Yellow Balloon
items.description: This balloon is a souvenir from the Trool Fair.

items.name: Trool Fair Snow Globe
items.description: This nice snow globe will be right at home on a mantelpiece.

items.name: Stuffed Boowolf
items.description:
This magnificent stuffed toy with real Boowolf hairs will keep you warm at night and fill your bedroom with the pleasant smell of dead Boowolf sweat.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Fake Quaquack
items.description: Don't trust it, it's a fake Quaquack. Give it to Skroo Gee - he's near the Duck Stall. You will be rewarded.

items.name: Bean
items.description: Planting this bean won't let you get to the land of the giants. However, eating it with your back to a fire might create a big enough explosion to get you there.

items.name: Ambusher Bud
items.description: This little Ambusher bud contains a sticky, syrupy sap. If you have the misfortune to walk on an old Ambusher hidden in the long grass, you may remain caught until it devours your boots entirely. On the other hand, if you manage to make off with an intact Ambusher bud, you will be able to hush the most moany of Fecas by offering it to them and pretending it is chewing gum.

items.name: Crocodyl Chief Skull
items.description: This huge skull is testimony to the appalling dental hygiene of the Crocodyl Chief. The funny thing is it still seems to contain some magic power since it is still inhabited by the Crocodyl Chief's soul. Sometimes it even sheds Crocodyl tears if you're very nasty to it.

items.name: Dalbweel Skin
items.description: Actually getting a complete piece of Dalbweel Skin is almost a miracle. Most of the time, Poachers only collect a few scales. Ideal to make bags, this old skin will also be appreciated by tailors who make fighting-underwear.

items.name: Lilbike Skin
items.description: This skin is made up of a multitude of scales and is in all ways superior to the classic dalbweel skin. Indeed, the lilbike skin's outside is more resistant and is covered with sharp, cutting scales, while the inside is particularly soft. There's a legend that some old tailors would confuse the two sides when making underwear. The legend doesn't say, however, whether that brought them less business, or more...

items.name: Spadere Eye
items.description: Stuck to an Al Howin's Day costume, this eye looks remarkably like a cancerous tumour.

items.name: Dark Rose Petal
items.description: This petal is used to make expensive perfumes. It gives off a scent of fresh corpse decomposing in lavender, which makes it very popular with Bontarian high society.

items.name: Sherpere Glove
items.description: The Hameres use these padded gloves to avoid getting cut whilst handling stones with sharp edges.

items.name: Twelve Fingeres Ear
items.description: All your requests to the Twelve Fingeres fell on deaf ears, so you took one of theirs.

items.name: Hamere Helmet
items.description: Since a Hamere is never safe from falling rocks, they always leave the house with protective equipment.

items.name: Bworker's Cave Key
items.description: This keys allows you to enter the Bworker's Cave Caution: it will be destroyed after use.

items.name: Bworker Token
items.description: Great for playing heads or tails so you can kill your enemy while the coin spins, this pure gold token will make you happy, but maybe unlucky as well.

items.name: Blue Piwi Feather
items.description: This Piwi feather was taken from the butt of a hapless Piwi.

items.name: Purple Piwi Feather
items.description: This Piwi feather was taken from the butt of a hapless Piwi.

items.name: Green Piwi Feather
items.description: This Piwi feather was taken from the butt of a hapless Piwi.

items.name: Red Piwi Feather
items.description: This Piwi feather was taken from the butt of a hapless Piwi.

items.name: Yellow Piwi Feather
items.description: This Piwi feather was taken from the butt of a hapless Piwi.

items.name: Pink Piwi Feather
items.description: This Piwi feather was taken from the butt of a hapless Piwi.

items.name: Used Bwork Protection
items.description: Love can sometimes be more destructive than war, but that's not what Bworker told you.

items.name: Bamboo Wood
items.description: Unlike reed, bamboo can break when bent. Most of the time, it's the teeth of a careless adventurer that will break first. These bloody dentists even have nature on their side... I tell you.

items.name: Holy Bamboo Wood
items.description: Normally, only the most deserving Pandawas can get their hands on a piece but sometimes, lumberjack tourists take a little souvenir of their trip to Pandala Island. Bloody tourists.

items.name: Bamboo Shoots
items.description: Being completely tasteless, these bamboo shoots are not a popular foodstuff. You should cut them down with a well-rusted scythe and marinate them for a couple years in Greedovore juice before you serve them up to your friends. Another tip from unscrupulous restaurateurs willing to feed you anything at all.

items.name: Dark Bamboo Wood
items.description: Walloh, a young Pandawa, once asked his father, "What's the difference between Bamboo and Dark Bamboo, Daddy?" His dad slapped him for asking such a stupid question. Everyone knows that the difference between Bamboo and Dark Bamboo is the size of their seeds.

items.name: Bamboo Blowgun
items.description: This item is a sort of hollow tube that shoots small projectiles when you blow into it. Kind of like a blowgun, only made out of bamboo.

items.name: Rice
items.description: Either sticky or slimy, rice is a long-time favourite with young, starving Pandawas.

items.name: Lotus Flower
items.description: Some say it's the oldest known flower. It symbolises fertility as well as detachment since it can submerge itself in water without getting wet. Some Pandawa Chiefs use this symbol to make their followers understand they have to live their life in the World without falling under its influence.

items.name: Aquamarine Stone
items.description: Sorcerers claim that this stone has special powers. Everyone believes those powers exist, but no one has ever seen them yet. A bit like intelligent Iops, come to think of it.

items.name: Topaz Stone
items.description: Batches of this weird-looking stone were once used to feed the young Crackrocks of Pandala breeders. Believe it or not, the stones are now endangered, so this practise has been discontinued.

items.name: Agathe Stone
items.description: This stone has been named after a Pandala river in which great quantities of it used to be found. But times have changed and the intensive exploitation of the past now means it is difficult to find.

items.name: Aquamarine
items.description: This transparent and sometimes slightly bluish precious stone is so shiny that, worn around your neck, it'll hid even the deepest wrinkles. Hawkers aren't shy about touting its virtues to tourists: "This stone will make your beloved happy and make it easier for you to accept the tragic traces of passing time on the faces of those you love." A good way to kill two birds with one stone.

items.name: Topaz
items.description: For some dubious reasons, Topaz is still the most popular jewel among jewellers. It attracts quite a lot of Crobaks in the Cania Plains.

items.name: Agathe
items.description: This stone has been named after a very famous female Pandawa: Agathe Pahtes. She could be found in places of debauchery such as the Sufokia Pirates' Pub, where she spent her last years dancing, chained up to a big mast in the middle of the pub.

items.name: Burnabwork Skin
items.description: This flesh has been scorched by numerous exposures to open flame.

items.name: Silicate
items.description: This ore clearly comes from the rocky soils of Terrdala. They say that Gardan Framine fell head over heels in love with a female Pandawa ghost whilst mining in the area. Love really doesn't know any boundaries!

items.name: Dolomite
items.description: Irko, the Dark Miner, had great respect for dolomite – "the hard and unbreakable rock" as he used to call it.

items.name: Pyrute
items.description: This alloy was used to forge blades which wouldn't rust when in contact with the blood and drool of its victims.

items.name: Brassic
items.description: A shiny alloy, Brassic is tolerated by bankrupt jewellers who can't afford precious stones. They usually make very competitively priced alloys. Comes in handy when you want to marry for money.

items.name: Pandkin Seed
items.description: This humongous seed is filled with a heavy but magical oil. Its shell is said to be unbreakable and many craftsmen use it to enchant their weapons. Others stick wiggly eyes on it and put it on the dashboard of their cart.

items.name: Lottery Ticket
items.description: Between your fat little fingers you're greedily clutching a superb Lottery Ticket. Hold on to it. You might be the lucky winner at the great draw!

items.name: Water Pandawushu Artefact
items.description: This magic artefact is used by the Pandawushu disciples to enchant their equipment.

items.name: Wind Pandawushu Artefact
items.description: This magic artefact is used by the Pandawushu disciples to bewitch their equipment.

items.name: Rock Pandawushu Artefact
items.description: This magic artefact is used by the Pandawushu disciples to enchant their equipment.

items.name: Fire Pandawushu Artefact
items.description: This magic artefact is used by the Pandawushu disciples to enchant their equipment.

items.name: Tatatojiki's Broken Pottery
items.description: You destroyed this piece of pottery but unfortunately it didn't contain any rubies.

items.name: Bulbiflor Pollen
items.description: When it is pollen season, no one is immune... Burning eyes, sneezing, itchy throat – nothing really dangerous, but adventurers all agree that it's a nightmare all the same.

items.name: Nenufrog Tongue
items.description: A surprising mix of animal and plant, the Nenufrog can stay perfectly still for hours at a time. Its prey has no idea of the danger it's in. By the time its tongue lashes out, fast as a whip, it's already too late.

items.name: Bulbush Thorn
items.description: When a plant doesn't seem to have thorns, that's when it pricks you. That's the Bulbush's hidden talent.

items.name: Flowistil Pistil
items.description: It's said that, because of their inflatable pistils, flowistils would be able to fly if they breathed in helium.

items.name: Kwamurai Katana
items.description: Katana is a very big word to describe such a tiny wisp of a thing that can barely cut anything. At the same time, the Kwamurai are very pale imitations of samurai. They seem more like children waving twigs than real swordsmen. Good riddance!

items.name: Shinobuubusu Mask
items.description: This mask enchanted by Earth magic lets Shinobuubusus turn into terrifying golems.

items.name: Titinuki Wand
items.description: It's difficult to say which – this wand or your face – most offended the massive Titinuki from whom you managed to steal it.

items.name: Parashutackle Glasses
items.description: These glasses are too small for your face, but if you want to amuse those around you, they'll fit your family jewels nicely.

items.name: Ishibig Pak Rocky Fist
items.description: One can reasonably wonder how stone gloves can be articulated. They aren't really, but become articulated in the hands of Ishibig Paks and their stupefying Rock magic.

items.name: Bambooto Stalk
items.description: This hollow stalk has many uses. Indeed, when bamboo runs short, some Kwapa use it as a blowgun.

items.name: Nectar of the Orient
items.description: This invigorating nectar has astonishing natural power that may surprise you... all the energy of Plantala.

items.name: Boombardier Hairs
items.description: These hairs come from a Boombardier, a terrible creature that looks quite puny but in reality has terrible magical powers.

items.name: Fouxnamballist Hairs
items.description: This hair was ripped off the back of a horrible red creature.

items.name: Bangartifoux Hairs
items.description: This thick, stinky hair was ripped off the back of a horrible, red creature.

items.name: Gingerocket Skin
items.description: This smooth, fine skin offers excellent protection from the various magical attacks that the Gingerocket encounters when spells backfire.

items.name: Spitfoux Skin
items.description: In times gone by, people used this to make underwear for children with sensitive skin. Spitfoux skin underwear has been approved by Captain Chafer's descendants.

items.name: Fangshu Spearhead
items.description: Experienced Fangshu use the tips of their spears like harpoons to jump on their enemies.

items.name: Kurookin Fabric
items.description: This scrap of fabric is waterproof and extremely durable. It's your best friend when the rain-and-wind apocalypse arrives. But everyone knows that such an apocalypse will never happen...

items.name: Firefoux Fabric
items.description: This red fabric has a magic power. I would be glad to say the same about you, but...

items.name: Magic Tanuki Hairs
items.description: Tanukis reputedly bring good luck and fortune. These hairs, which you ever so gently borrowed, will make an excellent good luck charm.

items.name: Aerodynamic Pelt
items.description: The Kozaru can cut through the air effortlessly with this pelt.

items.name: Kwapa Coveralls
items.description: These coveralls are a very functional piece of clothing. Oddly, however, these don't come in XXL and so they rarely cover all.

items.name: Wind Dojo Key
items.description: This key lets you enter the Wind Dojo. Be careful, though: it will be destroyed after use.

items.name: Valley of the Lady of the Water Key
items.description: This key lets you adventure into the Valley of the Lady of the Water, a mysterious valley at the edge of Akwadala. Please note: bathing is strongly discouraged in this beautiful place.

items.name: Tanukouï San's Workshop Key
items.description: This key lets you enter Tanukouï San's Workshop. Be careful, though: it will be destroyed after use.

items.name: Fouxwork Factory Key
items.description: When stuffed up the nose, this key will protect you from foot odour and stinky breath after a night of excessive imbibing at the inn.

items.name: Ino-Naru Bracelet
items.description: Certain unscrupulous people sell these bracelets by claiming that they bestow "insert random property" on anyone who wears them.

items.name: Onabu-Geisha Flower
items.description: The Onabu-Geisha are the most stylish warriors in the Shogun's army but don't be fooled by their appearance. They are fearless fighters who will cut you to pieces if given the chance.

items.name: Kaokurimono
items.description: One day, a Pandawa farmer just barely scraping by with his harvests found a pile of gold in front of his door. Gobsmacked, he quickly shoved it into his bag without trying to identify the source of this bounty. Overjoyed to have had what he could have earned after a hard year's labour just drop into his lap, he headed to the village determined to put the money to good use at the inn. After spreading his good news liberally around the village, he went home to bed, his spirits high and slightly befuddled. The next morning, all that was left of the farmer was his hat next to a small pile of gold.

items.name: Rockai
items.description: Every Twelvian has an inner hero. Every Yokai has a tiny inner rock.

items.name: Samurai Ghost Fabric
items.description: Unfortunately, this piece of fabric won't magically weave you into the warp and weft of samurai life.

items.name: Blue Embers
items.description: These embers burn in the spirit world as well as in our own. Every summer, there's a sharp increase in the number of ghosts accidentally getting burned by Twelvians roasting marshmallows.

items.name: Tanukouï San Testicles
items.description: These enormous testicles are covered with a very soft down which works wonders in resisting magic attacks as well as the damage the Tanukouï San causes himself when summoning a Tanuki Chan. In any case, what you're holding in your hands is something really very special!

items.name: Shogun Tofugawa's Moustache
items.description: The Shogun Tofugawa loves two things: devising ingenious military strategies, and pensively stroking his moustache whilst devising said strategies.

items.name: Madura Eye
items.description: Some claim that drawing a pupil on a Madura's empty eyeball while concentrating on a wish will make it come true. Oddly enough, they're the ones with huge "PM me offers, no noobs" signs in front of their shops.

items.name: Jiangshi-Nobi Bone
items.description: The Jiangshi-Nobi are a unique warrior caste within the Ghost Samurais. Indeed, the mummies they carry on their backs are in fact their former bodies, and the bodies you can see are projections of their souls. Keeping their remains in this way lets them keep part of their identity and power of old.

items.name: Drumurai Breastplate
items.description: Drumurai units play a crucial role in maintaining cohesion within the Shogun's army, which is why they are often the first to be targeted during clashes. Their armour is therefore specially designed to hold up against arrows and thrown weapons.

items.name: Kabushido Shoulder Pad
items.description: Kabushido armour is both highly effective combat equipment and a symbol of a soldier's high status. Indeed, their perfect mastery of sabre fighting and combat in general, combined with their flawless code of honour, is what allows these warriors to attain the rank of Kabushido and become the Shogun's most powerful fighters.

items.name: Tsukinochi Crescent
items.description: Tsukinochi fighters use this metallic crescent, forged under moonlight, to absorb some of the moon's energy and infuse their attacks with it.

items.name: Kapokaza
items.description: The concept of umbrellas wearing hats is very hard to wrap your mind around when you're not a living umbrella yourself.

items.name: Worn Lantern
items.description: This spectral lantern is very heavy for its size... most likely weighed down by the weight of the damned.

items.name: Broken Mask
items.description: When you turn this mask to face the northeast, you can feel a terrifying rage pouring out of its empty eye sockets.

items.name: Cri Rune
items.description: This rune will make your attacks even more surprising.

items.name: Hea Rune
items.description: This rune will improve your ability to heal others.

items.name: Dam Rune
items.description: This rune will increase damage to your enemies.

items.name: Pow Rune
items.description: This rune will increase damage dealt to your enemies.

items.name: Dam Ref Rune
items.description: This rune will enable you to reflect damage more easily.

items.name: Range Rune
items.description: This rune will increase the range of your attacks.

items.name: Sum Rune
items.description: This rune will make it easier for shamans to summon.

items.name: Pod Rune
items.description: This rune will make equipment lighter.

items.name: Pa Pod Rune
items.description: This rune will make equipment lighter.

items.name: Ra Pod Rune
items.description: This rune will make equipment lighter.

items.name: Trp Dam Rune
items.description: This rune will increase the power of your traps.

items.name: Trp Per Rune
items.description: This rune will increase the power of your traps.

items.name: Ini Rune
items.description: This rune puts you one step ahead of your enemies and lets you anticipate their reactions.

items.name: Pa Ini Rune
items.description: This rune puts you one step ahead of your enemies and lets you anticipate their reactions.

items.name: Ra Ini Rune
items.description: This rune puts you one step ahead of your enemies and lets you anticipate their reactions.

items.name: Pp Rune
items.description: This rune will increase your luck in finding rare items.

items.name: Fire Res Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Fire damage.

items.name: Air Res Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Air damage.

items.name: Water Res Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Water damage.

items.name: Earth Res Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Earth damage.

items.name: Neutral Res Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Neutral damage.

items.name: Fire Res Per Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Fire damage.

items.name: Air Res Per Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Air damage.

items.name: Earth Res Per Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Earth damage.

items.name: Neutral Res Per Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Neutral damage.

items.name: Signature Rune
items.description:
This rune allows the best craftsmen to put their signature on their creations.
(To be used along with the ingredients when crafting items.)

items.name: First Part of the Dragon Pig's Maze Key
items.description: If this snout doesn't appeal to you, don't try to make something out of it. You'll get slapped all the way home.

items.name: Second Part of the Dragon Pig's Maze Key
items.description: This might be part of the key which opens the treasure chest you've always dreamt of. It may also be the key to your grave.

items.name: Dragon Pig's Maze Key
items.description: If you think this key will attract your dirty pig-friends, you really haven't got it... The only thing it will do is open up the Dragon Pig's Maze. Be careful, though as it will be destroyed after use.

items.name: Ancestral Domain Key
items.description: This key made of Treechnid Bark could take root in any warm and humid microsystem... like a Bwork's crotch, for example.

items.name: Water Res Per Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Water damage.

items.name: Memory Potion
items.description: This potion allows you to steal part of a being's essence and retain an everlasting memory of your victim's soul. Quite handy for marking your territory or your goods, this potion is often used to create signature runes.

items.name: Kaliptus Flower
items.description: When you burn it, this flower gives off a thick hallucinogenic smoke. When you chew it, it tends to make you impotent. And if you use it to make an infusion, it will have great laxative effects. The best thing to do would be not to touch it at all.

items.name: Gobkool Wool
items.description: This wool looks like Gobball wool but isn't. This wool doesn't smell.

items.name: Gobkool Horn
items.description: According to an old legend, when you grind this horn down, the powder is said to have aphrodisiac powers. The same legend specifies that it can also have surprising side effects. Another reason to try it out!

items.name: Koolich Cavern Key
items.description: This key of bone will enable you to enter the Koolich Cavern even if you haven't been invited.

items.name: Tofu House Key
items.description: This key, made of Tofu feathers, can tickle the inside of many locks into hysterics of opening. It will grant you access to Farle Ingalsse's Tofu House.

items.name: Game Master Token
items.description: You can probably exchange this beautiful token for precious gifts at the Trool Fair.

items.name: Stuffed Sacrier Dopple
items.description:
This stuffed toy is just perfect for young Sacriers. It's great for mopping up blood and can even be washed at high temperatures.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Stuffed Pandawa Dopple
items.description:
This stuffed toy smells like alcohol and wet Pandawa hair... just like mummy.
(This stuffed toy is only good as a collector's item.)

items.name: Labyrinth of the Minotoror Key
items.description: This wonderful key will allow you to get into the Inner Labyrinth of the Minotoror. It won't help you get out again, though.

items.name: Kaliptus Wood
items.description: This scented wood can be used to build nice-smelling houses even if their owners stink. It's a pity it isn't supple enough to make underwear.

items.name: Lord Crow's Library Key
items.description: Use this key to meet Lord Crow himself. If you're lucky, he might invite you to share a piece of cheese in his company.

items.name: Cracklers Rocky Peaks Key
items.description: This key is almost unbreakable but it is a little worn from opening so many doors. It looks like it's been created from the intimate parts of a Crackler.

items.name: Koalak Warrior Bandage
items.description: This bandage is normally wrapped around the Koalak Warrior's arms. This way, he can blow his nose without using any handkerchiefs. When this bandage is old and worn out, you hang it on the ceiling of your house to catch passing Moskitos.

items.name: Dok Alako Fabric
items.description: This fabric seems to be imbued with an ancestral magic that is quite unpredictable and uncontrollable. Yet another thing it has in common with that special person in your life.

items.name: Immature Koalak Skin
items.description: The little immature Koalak who's skin you tore off didn't want you to treat him that way... but hey, you're stronger and crueller than he is.

items.name: Koalak Master Skin
items.description: This old and worn skin used to protect the Koalak Master's behind. It still has some nice reddish traces, ample proof of a crazy, restless life.

items.name: Koalak Rider Skin
items.description: This torn skin was worn out against that of the Koalak Rider's Mount. Obviously, this is a proof of its good quality.

items.name: Drakoalak Skin
items.description: This skin's smell will remind you of the Amakna Castle stables.

items.name: Mama Koalak Bone
items.description: The Mama Koalak has particularly solid bones that don't break under her weight. The same cannot be said for the famous minstrel Jon Lemon who lost the use of both his arms when he got squashed by a Mama Koalak's humongous thighs.

items.name: Wild Koalak Femur
items.description: Once carved and shaped like a dagger, this bone makes a great a boil-piercer.

items.name: Koalak Gravedigger Shinbone
items.description: This bone can be used as a shovel to unearth corpses and strip them off, if you like spending your holidays next to cemeteries. Incidentally, it's also the Koalak Gravedigger's shinbone.

items.name: Koalak Mummy Ulna
items.description: Thanks to the Koalak Mummy's numerous wrappings, which give good protection against the most powerful magic attacks, this bone has kept all of its splendour.

items.name: Morello Cherry Koalak Hair
items.description: This hair is covered with Blop pollen, which gives it a delectable taste, but a foul smell.

items.name: Coco Koalak Hair
items.description: This hair is covered with Blop pollen, which gives it a delectable taste, but a foul smell.

items.name: Pippin Koalak Hair
items.description: This hair is covered with Blop pollen, which gives it a delectable taste, but a foul smell.

items.name: Indigo Koalak Hair
items.description: This hair is covered with Blop pollen, which gives it a delectable taste, but a foul smell.

items.name: Bloody Koalak Tail
items.description: This resource is obsolete.

items.name: Bloody Koalak Boomerang
items.description: This weirdly shaped piece of wood travelled for a long time through the air between enemy ranks before breaking. Rumour has it that it will always fly back to its owner, but rarely into their hands.

items.name: Dragoturkey Beard Hairs
items.description: This hair is urticant enough to change simple Dragoturkey kisses into weapons of mass destruction. Very urticant indeed.

items.name: Purple Warko Beard Hair
items.description: This hair is urticant, making this beard a war weapon much more destructive than a Bwork's bad breath, if we were to compare them. Shocking!

items.name: Skeunk's Hideout Key
items.description: Rigroulak gave you this key in exchange for the Koolich set... Unless it's just a cheap replica crafted by a common-as-muck handyman. Either way, it should enable you to enter Skeunk's Hideout.

items.name: Dok Alako Boomerang
items.description: This weirdly shaped piece of wood travelled for a long time through the air between enemy ranks before breaking. Rumour has it that it will always fly back to its owner, but rarely into their hands.

items.name: Koalak Master Boomerang
items.description: This weirdly shaped piece of wood travelled for a long time through the air between enemy ranks before breaking. Rumour has it that it will always fly back to its owner, but rarely into their hands.

items.name: Brown Warko Boomerang
items.description: This weirdly shaped piece of wood travelled for a long time through the air between enemy ranks before breaking. Rumour has it that it will always fly back to its owner, but rarely into their hands.

items.name: Reapalak Fabric
items.description: This fabric smells like death, whereas you smell as if you were dead. The difference is worth noting.

items.name: Fisheralak Bone
items.description: This bone is quite spongy and enables the Fisheralak to float if it falls in while pulling up a big catch.

items.name: Piralak Skin
items.description: This scar-covered skin is more resistant than a rock but remains extremely supple. It's perfect for making whips and tasteless sandals.

items.name: Koalak Forester Hair
items.description: This hair is covered in Kaliptus sap, giving it a shiny glint. Unfortunately, it cannot be used for haute couture as it smells like rotting Dragoturkey.

items.name: Shredded Drakoalak Headgear
items.description: This weird-looking headgear used to hide the premature baldness of the Drakoalak. With a little practise, it might soon be able to hide yours.

items.name: Legendary Crackler Rock
items.description: It is said that this rock might be the heart of the Legendary Crackler. What we do know is that the Legendary Crackler never had a heavy heart. Therefore, this rock is incredibly light, making it possible to create suitable items for characters who favour mobility, agility and protection. Just perfect!

items.name: Bwork Dungeon Key
items.description: This interesting key will allow you to drag open the door of the Bwork Dungeon... It can't promise you'll get out of there alive though.

items.name: Golden Scarabugly Entrails
items.description: These entrails are responsible for the difficult digestions of the Golden Scarabugly. You are entitled to fry them without feeling remorse.

items.name: Scaraleaf Dungeon Key
items.description: This wonderful golden key will grant you access to the Scaraleaf Dungeon. And you thought you'd seen it all.

items.name: Black Scaraleaf Wings
items.description: Unlike what some adventurers may think, Black Scaraleaf Wings are not black, but white. Another mystery Mother Nature gave us to discuss at the Inn.

items.name: Secret Royal Tofu House Key
items.description: This key will grant you access to the Royal Tofu House. You'll get the thrashing of your life there too.

items.name: Field Dungeon Key
items.description: This key will let you into the Famished Sunflower's Barn. It won't let you out again, though.

items.name: Moowolf Lair Key
items.description: This key will grant you access to the terrible Moowolf Lair. Once inside, you'll most likely be gutted in a relaxing, low-key atmosphere.

items.name: Magic Famished Sunflower Petal
items.description: Just like any magical item, this one is impressive. The petal emits an aura that is as powerful as the incredulity of any onlookers.

items.name: Greasy Tofurby Feather
items.description: The Tofurby regularly smears himself with grease to stop his feathers falling off his plumage. A technique as old as the hills, which enables some Enutrofs to keep some of their hair beyond puberty.

items.name: Golden Scarabugly Wings
items.description: If you've always dreamt of flying like a fat Piwi, stick these wings to your belt and jump from the Tower of Orders in Brakmar. As well as giving the locals a laugh, you'll make a great meal for Crobaks.

items.name: Drinker Feather
items.description: This alcohol-soaked feather is extremely inflammable. It's very useful for roasting Drinkers.

items.name: Crowfox Hair
items.description: The Crowfox loves to dress up as a Crobak. No one really knows why, but most people have something to say on the subject.

items.name: Tamed Crobak Feather
items.description: This greasy feather belonged to a Tamed Crobak who spent most of his life locked up and force-fed until he became fat enough to completely fill the space of his cage.

items.name: Minotot Room Key
items.description: Crafted from diverse materials, this key will grant you an audience with the terrifying Minotot. If you go the distance, it'll make a great story for the taverns and picnic tables of the land. You'll also have a sore ass, or perhaps the remnants of a sore ass, if you do live to tell the tale... Good luck!

items.name: Scaratos Carapace
items.description: This small shiny shell is very useful for creating nice jewellery at a low cost... You'll be able to sell it to an Astrubian for a fortune once you convince them it can make you fly.

items.name: Quetsnakiatl Feather
items.description: The ancients say this feather used to be covered with magic stone dust which made one unit of Quetsnakiatl feather be heavier than three units of Tofu feathers. It seems that these days, however, the Quetsnakiatl have rid themselves of the excess weight.

items.name: Jellidice Jelly
items.description: This jelly pot contains some repulsive-smelling substance with an appalling taste, and yet you secretly dream to spread it all over your body, don't you. Your perversion is even greater than your gluttony.

items.name: Minokid Hair
items.description: This hair seems to be covered with short-haired-Tuftie-musk based brylcreem and cave Kirball grease. It almost looks appetising.

items.name: Minoskito Skin
items.description: Worn out by the sand and the sea salt, this skin is as thin as an old sock worn out by... sand and sea salt. Does that mean a healthy Minoskito looks like a fresh sock? Yes it does.

items.name: Khamelerost Skin
items.description: This roasted skin protects sensitive skins from rays of sunshine. It's a particularly close-fitting skin.

items.name: Manderisha Skin
items.description: This spotted skin is said to be covered with a poison capable of changing anyone into a dried Karaball.

items.name: Dragon Pig's Den Key
items.description: After getting lost in the Dragon Pig's Maze, you realised that you had forgotten the key to the Dragon Pig's Den. What a shame...

items.name: Capsaaloock Hair
items.description: It's useless insisting! This hair is not edible.

items.name: Troolewd Hair
items.description: Under its clothes, the Troolewd hides a very soft down that would make the most coquettish of princesses jealous.

items.name: Deminoball Leather
items.description: This rough, cracked leather will remind you of your beloved's cheeks.

items.name: Capsaaloock Leather
items.description: The Capsaaloock always had sensitive skin – that's why he has to cover himself up with bandages. Spiteful gossips say that it's to hide other shocking things.

items.name: Mumminotor Bandage
items.description: Wrapped up around the horns but especially around the private parts of the Mumminotor, this bandage became imbued with the Mumminotor's magic with the passing years. Smelly and terrifying, this bandage is much sought after by the fetiologists of the World.

items.name: Deminoball Horn
items.description: At first sight, this impressive horn does not seem to be very useful. And even when you take a closer look at it, it doesn't seem very useful – a bit like an army of ticks.

items.name: Mumminotor Horn
items.description: Wrapped up in a magic bandage, this horn must be extremely expensive, very precious, awfully smelly and cursed. A bit like a mummy would be.

items.name: Sakai Mine Key
items.description: Who would want the key to a disused mine on a frozen island, lost and guarded by strange goblins desperately seeking a lost nugget?

items.name: Key to Crocabulia's Lair
items.description: This key will let you enter the lair of the Dreggons' protector. Take care not to end up char-broiled, as being reborn from your ashes is not something just anyone can do.

items.name: Key to Draegnerys's Trial
items.description: This key will open the doors to your first baptism by fire. No, that's not a metaphor; it's literally what might happen to you.

items.name: Akakwa Akapants
items.description: These pants are red, of course. Not blue. What am I saying? They're not vulgar underpants, they're a true work of art! You might even call them... a masterpants! Get it? Masterpiece, masterpants... Don't worry... That joke will get funnier every time you (don't) hear it.

items.name: Shape-Shifting Dragoss Horn
items.description: Not quite as pointy as a Xelor's Synchro, but a lot more solid, the Sapphire Dragoss uses this horn to turn an arse-kicking session into an arse-piercing one.

items.name: Limestone Dragoss Horn
items.description: Not quite as pointy as a Xelor's Synchro, but a lot more solid, the White Dragoss uses this horn to turn an arse-kicking session into an arse-piercing one.

items.name: Lichangoro Broken Blade
items.description: Just like thorns and brambles can give you a nice prick after you've cut them down, this broken blade still cuts deep. Take care, there's plenty of fight left in it.

items.name: Coal Dragoss Shell
items.description: You could use this Black Dragoss Shell to protect your most precious parts.

items.name: Slate Dragoss Shell
items.description: You could use this Sapphire Dragoss Shell to protect your most precious parts.

items.name: Shape-Shifting Dragoss Shell
items.description: You could use this White Dragoss Shell to protect your most precious parts.

items.name: Clay Dragoss Shell
items.description: You could use this Golden Dragoss Shell to protect your most precious parts.

items.name: Coal Dragoss Scale
items.description: You could use this Black Dragoss Scale to make a very nice pair of boots or some underwear for fighting in.

items.name: Slate Dragoss Scale
items.description: You could use this Sapphire Dragoss Scale to make a very nice pair of boots or some underwear for fighting in.

items.name: Limestone Dragoss Scale
items.description: You could use this White Dragoss Scale to make a very nice pair of boots or some underwear for fighting in.

items.name: Clay Dragoss Scale
items.description: You could use this Golden Dragoss Scale to make a very nice pair of boots or some underwear for fighting in.

items.name: Dragostess Skin
items.description: Smooth and perfumed with young adventurers' blood, this skin makes Dragostesses irresistible. Used to make boots or belts, this skin can be washed in a washing machine at any temperature.

items.name: Bliblido Horn
items.description: Underneath its thick fur, the Bliblido has two lovely horns. To find a reason for their existence, wise men tried to study the habits of the female Bliblido, but without success.

items.name: Protective Dreggon Tooth
items.description: Protective Dreggons' teeth are extremely sharp, so sharp the slightest touch can leave a gaping wound.

items.name: Dragandrop Wing
items.description: Even when his wing is damaged, torn and burnt, the Flying Dreggon can still fly freely above the void like a young, carefree Moskito.

items.name: Dragandrop Hide
items.description: This dark hide is covered with a multitude of small scales that supposedly improve the Dragandrop's aerodynamics. In reality, however, they're just for show.

items.name: Dragnnoyed Horn
items.description: The Dragnnoyed uses this horn as an aiming device to help him hit his targets when he drinks and flies.

items.name: Dragnarok Hide
items.description: Tough enough to resist its own blade, Dragnarok hide is also renowned for being edible... provided you boil it for several years first.

items.name: Dragmatic Horn
items.description: When the Dragmatic has a touch of lava reflux, its horn lights up. If you see that happen, get out of there immediately.

items.name: Bliblitch Leather Strap
items.description: This leather strap can replace your suspenders.

items.name: Crocabulia's Broken Horn
items.description: Crocabulia broke her horn in a terrible fight while protecting the egg from which Crocoburio hatched some 15 years later.

items.name: Crocabulia Skin
items.description: You could use this red skin to make a Little Red Waddling Cape, but your tailor would be very confused. "This recipe has produced nothing!" they would cry, somewhat awkwardly.

items.name: Magical Founoroshi Tail
items.description: This tail is so magic that it's still wagging, even after having been cut, dried and stuffed! If you're smart enough, you'll find another use for it that doesn't involve hanging it above your fireplace.

items.name: Moon Skin
items.description: Deprived of his soft skin, poor Moon was taken by surprise and could only run away in the jungle screaming with pain. This is a nice bedtime story you'll enjoy telling your kids to make them go to sleep.

items.name: Magic Moon Fabric
items.description: Judging by the tiny stars twinkling around it, this fabric seems to be magic. Hard to believe? Maybe. But one day, you'll have to face the truth... You're just too stupid to tell if something's magic or not. Do not follow your Astrubian killer instinct... trust all these descriptions.

items.name: Shin Larva Skin
items.description: This Shin Larva skin is slimier and stickier than you could have imagined. It reminds you of that accident you had with a jar of less-than-fresh strawberry jam...

items.name: Shin Larva Tooth
items.description: No one would have ever believed that a Shin Larva would actually have a mouth full of teeth. It's probably because Shin Larvae only have one tooth.

items.name: Vibrating Royal Tofu Feather
items.description: More royal than the Royal Tofu feather, more vibrating than the Vibrating Kirball of the Kruup mines, this feather will tickle whoever you want, wherever you want. The instructions say that it should be easy to look after.

items.name: Bworkette Skin
items.description: The Bworkette let you take some of her skin in exchange for your clemency. But she forgot to tell you that she told her big brother Bworker... he might want some of yours in exchange!

items.name: Bworkette Hair
items.description: The Bworkette has very soft skin everywhere but under her arms. Well, the little cookies she makes have to be flavoured somehow, don't they?

items.name: Farle's Pig Skin
items.description: Farle was the greatest breeder of all, at least according to breeders who are jealous of Shika. Anyway, what's certain is that Farle is the one who created Farle's Pigs. They were named after him because he created them in his image.

items.name: Dorgan Ation Skin
