items.description: Dorgan Ation has once more been extremely generous with you in spite of his bad temper. He gave you his skin before leaving and moaning like a Lousy Pig. What a nerve!

items.name: Blodz Uker Skin
items.description: You used a cheese grater to scrape this skin off a poor Blodz Uker. No doubt he will remember that terrible event for life. Don't count on him to tell you the way next time you get lost in his maze.

items.name: Dragon Pig Hair
items.description: No matter how hard you look, you still can't find the Dragon Pig's body part this hair came from. If you look hard enough, the Dragon Pig's anatomy seems to be full of surprises.

items.name: Mega Legendary Crackler Rock
items.description: This humongous rock looks like a rock from the Legendary Crackler, but it is not. It's a lot more special than that!

items.name: Boogranny Mojo
items.description: This small flask contains the virile power of the Boogranny in liquid form. Be careful though, it's not edible.

items.name: Wa Wabbit Hair
items.description: The Wa Wabbit is usually quite miserly and balks at sharing his hair. Exceptionally, to reward your courage (or buy your clemency), he has decided to give you one of his body parts. How touching!

items.name: Wa Wabbit Fabric
items.description: No one really knows where the Wa Wabbit got this fabric and no one seems interested in knowing either. Disturbing and disquieting, the origin of the fabric remains one of the greatest mysteries of all Amakna.

items.name: Nagate's Rubber Quaquack
items.description:
The Lady of the Water is a huge fan of the rubber quaquack method. Have your plans to capture small children all come up empty? Telling your quaquack all your troubles could help you figure out where you've been going wrong!

That said, holding this duck in your hands isn't a sure sign that the method will work.

items.name: Shihan Hair Stick
items.description: Certain pedants wonder if the Kozaru have hair or just long fur on their heads. This begs the question of whether these items should be called hair sticks or fur sticks.

items.name: Hanshi Scarf
items.description: This scarf floats in the air constantly even when there's no wind. This significantly increases your charisma, except when it flaps into your eye or it catches on a branch.

items.name: Koolich Stone
items.description: Though the Koolich is quite a generous thing, he wasn't exactly happy about giving you his big stone. And it's understandable, given what you're going to do with it.

items.name: Koolich Braid
items.description: This huge braid was made by the Koolich himself. Over the years, it's become almost as stiff as a block of stone. It still holds a foul, slimy liquid that attracts moskitos. The most surprising thing about it, though, is that this braid was very flattering on its owner. Slob that you are, whatever made you think it'd be a good idea to steal it?

items.name: Skeunk Skin
items.description: This bit of skin probably comes from Skeunk's heels, which would explain its nice yellowish colour. While you won't be able to create modern fashionable clothes with this old skin, you'll still be able to create clothing from another era and get in on the "retro" trend that's raging among the younger set.

items.name: Skeunk Hair
items.description: Skeunk thinks nothing of a full body-shave. Here's the proof.

items.name: Minotot Hoof
items.description: An enormous number of adventurers have been trampled by this hoof, but then so have many huge turds scattered around the Labyrinth of the Minotoror. You must understand that it's not easy for a charging Minotot to distinguish between the two at first glance.

items.name: Soft Oak Clearing Key
items.description: This key will grant you to access to the most intimate parts of the Soft Oak's anatomy... I bet you won't even know it when you get to the special place. As disturbing and exciting as the much loved Amaknian sport of naked Judo, this trip will not leave you empty handed, that's for sure.

items.name: Sandy Castle Key
items.description: This key, made of marine waste and sea shells, will grant you access to the beach with the whitest sand of all the Asse Sea Coast.

items.name: Black Rat's Moumousetrap Key
items.description: This key will let you into the Black Rat's Moumousetrap located in the Brakmar sewers. No need for a disguise. Your wildly invasive hair will help you go unnoticed, even if you're not a Brakmarian.

items.name: White Rat's Pantry Key
items.description: This key will let you into the White Rat's Pantry located in the Bonta sewers. No need for a disguise: you'll go unnoticed, even if you're not a Bontarian.

items.name: First Sphincter Dungeon Key
items.description: You picked up this key in the Bonta Rat Dungeon. You'll need it, and its counterpart, to enter Sphincter's Dungeon.

items.name: Second Sphincter Dungeon Key
items.description: You picked up this key in the Brakmar Rat Dungeon. You'll need it, and its counterpart, to enter Sphincter's Dungeon.

items.name: Grossewer Rat Hair
items.description: This hair is dirty and stinky. It roamed the most disgusting sewers of the area. And yet, it's still shiny.

items.name: Rat Skin
items.description: The scars all over this skin are actual proof of the Rat's difficult childhood. You could at least feel sorry for him!

items.name: Grossewer Raeman Skin
items.description: Once washed, this skin can be used as a carpet or a doormat.

items.name: Tofoone Fluff
items.description: It was once used to make fake moustaches, but it can also be used as fake armpit hair.

items.name: Black Rat Mane
items.description: Adventurers' may find this mane handy when dealing with future (or current) baldness.

items.name: White Rat Mane
items.description: Adventurers' may find this mane handy when dealing with future (or current) baldness.

items.name: Sphincter Cell Fabric
items.description: This fabric seems to be covered in a strange chemical... It definitely has side effects, but I really don't know what they are.

items.name: Sphincter Cell Femur
items.description: Sphincter was not kind to bones and would break them in two, three, four and sometimes even five pieces when he had to buck up his sleepy students.

items.name: Ancestral Treechnid Bud
items.description: This shrivelled up bud was completely drained of its sap by a hungry creature. If you plunge it into water, you'll see it resume its original form, swell, and then if you wait a long time, rot.

items.name: Ancestral Treechnid Root
items.description: Even if you snatch it from its owner, this root can whip you or twist your ankles. Mean thing!

items.name: Trool Bone
items.description: If we consider the weight and solidity of a Trool bone, it's easy to understand why it hurts so bad when they smack you during Trool-playing games.

items.name: Bworcelhain's Heart
items.description: This heartless Bworkette, who got rid of her son Krazybwork and threw him in a pit, was cursed by Bworknroll when she refused his love. Locked up in a cellar, she feeds herself with her own heart. Every night, it grows back and starts beating again.

items.name: Mumussel
items.description: This beautiful and fresh Mumussel is a great companion to Bworks when they go plundering away from their wives.

items.name: Industrial Fattrool
items.description: You can use this thick and nutritious grease to cook most types of food in old pots without ruining the dish. Some Osamodas also use it to slip Tofus into places that the Iop moral code condemns.

items.name: Kardorim's Crypt Key
items.description: This key allows you access to Kardorim's Crypt. Kardorim is one of the toughest Chafers in Incarnam.

items.name: Snoowolf Skin
items.description: Slightly curly, this skin will make a wonderful bedside rug. I'm sure someone around Incarnam will want it. You just have to find out who it is...

items.name: Batofu Feather
items.description: This feather was plucked from the Batofu's armpit, and it smells like a marinated ancestral Doobitchoo.

items.name: Bontarian Rat Hair
items.description: This hair used to belong to the Bonta sewer rats. Indeed, they were the only ones to have hair tufts which matched the colour of their city wall.

items.name: Brakmarian Rat Hair
items.description: This hair used to belong to the Brakmar sewer rats. Indeed, they were the only ones to have hair tufts which matched the colour of their city wall.

items.name: Great Coralator Relic
items.description: This impressive relic might make you forget all of your worries.

items.name: Gourlo the Terrible Relic
items.description: This impressive relic might make you forget all of your worries.

items.name: Greater Bherb Relic
items.description: This impressive relic might make you forget all of your worries.

items.name: Tynril Relic
items.description: This impressive relic might make you forget all of your worries.

items.name: Kimbo Relic
items.description: This impressive relic might make you forget all of your worries.

items.name: Slimy Scale
items.description: This slimy, slippery scale allowed its owner to escape capture by strange adventurers who fished with their teeth. Unfortunately, it was no use against the well-placed swipe of a rusty sword.

items.name: Raul Mops Skin
items.description: Raul Mops has a real weakness. He loves to smear himself with water, wine and vinegar. What he loves most of all is rolling peanuts along the road with his nose. Dry roasted, by the way, just in case you ever feel like doing him a favour.

items.name: Sponge Mob Skin
items.description: Either side of this skin can be used for your DIY projects. The soft side is for cleaning delicate surfaces, and the rough side for scouring all your previously inaccessible body parts.

items.name: Piece of Goldemort
items.description: Congratulations! You managed to steal a piece of Goldemort's corpse. You'd make a vulture proud!

items.name: Worn Coral
items.description: Coral only loosens itself from the Coralator when the weather is dry. Coral is a beautiful substance and is often used to make jewellery. Other brutes actually eat it... but only because they mistake it for crab sticks.

items.name: Coralator Coccyx
items.description: This strategically-located bone enables the Coralator to sit down with dignity. Now that he's dead, you can use it to establish your own authority upon his fellow creatures.

items.name: Great Coral
items.description: The only difference between the Worn Coral and the Great Coral is their size and what you can do with them. However, a whole lot of worn Corals will never replace a Great Coral.

items.name: Kurasso Coral
items.description: This coral's remarkable blue colour is a result of the Kurasso Craboral's unhealthy diet. It doesn't even manage to eat a single piece of fruit or veg a day, let alone 5!

items.name: Mahlibuh Coral
items.description: This coral's remarkable green colour is a result of the Mahlibuh Craboral's unhealthy diet. It doesn't even manage to eat a single piece of fruit or veg a day, let alone 5!

items.name: Passaoh Coral
items.description: This coral's remarkable red colour is a result of the Passaoh Craboral's unhealthy diet. It doesn't even manage to eat a single piece of fruit or veg a day, let alone 5!

items.name: Mojeeto Coral
items.description: This coral's remarkable yellow colour is a result of the Mojeeto Craboral's unhealthy diet. It doesn't even manage to eat a single piece of fruit or veg a day, let alone 5!

items.name: Polished Stone Heart
items.description: The only thing that can differentiate a Crackler's heart from that of a polished Crackler is the delicacy with which the item can break between your toes when you least expect it.

items.name: Polished Ball
items.description: From what part of the Crackrock's anatomy does this ball come? And why do they always come in pairs?

items.name: Great Sacrum
items.description: The Great Coralator offered you a bone from its backside. It doesn't have much use for it anyway.

items.name: Sparo's Humerus
items.description: Even though this bone's called a humerus, it's hard to tell if it actually comes from Sparo's arm. When he died, his skeleton was put in a barrel and smashed up. It sounds painful, even for a bone.

items.name: Flib's Stump
items.description: If I were you I wouldn't pick this thing up - the mouth it came from is about as clean as the devil's crotch. But well, you're the adventurer, you know your business!

items.name: Kido Beak
items.description: This beak is so fragile that Otomai's disciples used it to make training arrows with blunt ends.

items.name: Craboral Pincer
items.description: Just avoid shaking a Craboral on the pincer! You might lose your hand to politeness.

items.name: Kurasso Petal
items.description: The colour of this petal reveals its doubtful origin. Alcohol abuse can even be seen in the creations of Otomai's disciples.

items.name: Mahlibuh Petal
items.description: The colour of this petal reveals its doubtful origin. Alcohol abuse can even be seen in the creations of Otomai's disciples.

items.name: Passaoh Petal
items.description: The colour of this petal reveals its doubtful origin. Alcohol abuse can even be seen in the creations of Otomai's disciples.

items.name: Mojeeto Petal
items.description: The colour of this petal reveals its doubtful origin. Alcohol abuse can even be seen in the creations of Otomai's disciples.

items.name: Kurasso Bulb
items.description: Palmflowers don't grow from seeds but a bulb soaked in alcohol. Why? Just because!

items.name: Mahlibuh Bulb
items.description: Palmflowers don't grow from seeds but a bulb soaked in alcohol. Why? Just because!

items.name: Passaoh Bulb
items.description: Palmflowers don't grow from seeds but a bulb soaked in alcohol. Why? Just because!

items.name: Mojeeto Bulb
items.description: Palmflowers don't grow from seeds but a bulb soaked in alcohol. Why? Just because!

items.name: Mane in Bloom
items.description: This mane is an improbable hybrid of hairs and flower petals, which means it's doubly allergenic. So keep away if you're sensitive... a single sneeze could send your brain flying out your nose.

items.name: Barbrossa's Ridiculous Beard
items.description: This tiny hair tuft will remind you of your holidays thanks to its smell of sand, sunscreen and alcohol. What a pity it stinks so much of gunpowder too!

items.name: Flib's Red Tuft
items.description: No one knows whether the colour of this tuft is natural or due to some untimely bush fire.

items.name: Kilibriss Down
items.description: Kilibriss down is light and much sought after for the making of mattresses.

items.name: Barbrossa's Shirt
items.description: Do you need an insect repellent? Just put Barbrossa's Shirt on! One side effect is that people will vomit automatically if they come within five feet of you.

items.name: Gourlo's Wrecked Shorts
items.description: No one ever found an intact pair of Gourlo's shorts - he was a pyromaniac, and frequently burnt his clothes right off his body.

items.name: Flib's Cursed Little Box
items.description: This small chest is shaped like Flib... unless it's the opposite! In any case, it's still a cursed item.

items.name: Sparo's Scarf
items.description: This scarf is an essential accessory for both the summer and winter seasons. It will give you an original look, though a bit kitsch. Its flashy colour will certainly excite male Gobballs, but is that really what you want?

items.name: Explosive Powder
items.description: To make up for not having a cannon for an arm, a pirate never goes anywhere without a weapon. They can't shoot very quickly, though, because they have to wait for the powder to dry each time – clearly, it's of very poor quality.

items.name: Polished Brain Fragment
items.description: Thanks to this fragment, you'll learn the Cracklers' good manners: hand crushing to say hi.

items.name: Mufafah Moustache
items.description: Marylork the painter prefers his brushes to be made from thick, luxuriant Mufafah Moustache, rather than the slightly wispy Kittenfish Moustache, which is liable to blow away in the slightest of breezes.

items.name: Kilibriss Staff
items.description: Thanks to its length, this staff will enable you to reach the most difficult places to access and to scratch yourself all over.

items.name: Kido Rear Feather
items.description: One of Otomai's greatest riddles was inspired by this resource: what's the heaviest? One hundred pods of Kido feathers or one hundred pods of Pyrute?

items.name: Plain Pikoko Wing
items.description: The Pikoko never was famous for its grace in flight. Once you've seen its wings, well, you'll understand why.

items.name: Plain Pikoko Nut
items.description: There's no milk inside this Pikoko Nut, just brain juice. If you're lucky, you might find a few neurons floating on the surface.

items.name: Floramor Bark
items.description: This bark is curiously curved. It looks like it's been through a rasp.

items.name: Rotaflor Bark
items.description: This bark is curiously curved. It looks like it's been through a rasp.

items.name: Gwass Bark
items.description: This bark is curiously curved. It looks like it's been through a rasp.

items.name: Barkritter Bark
items.description: This bark is curiously curved. It looks like it's been through a rasp.

items.name: Warguerite Bark
items.description: This bark is curiously curved. It looks like it's been through a rasp.

items.name: Dark Pikoko Nut
items.description: There's no milk inside this Pikoko Nut, just brain juice. If you're lucky, you might find a few neurons floating on the surface.

items.name: Tynril Pistil
items.description: Should a Sacrier be lucky enough to remove several of these sexual organs from the four Tynrils after a long, arduous fight, the rest of his teammates would be well within their rights to refer to them as "The Sac's Pistils". Whether they should or not is another matter altogether.

items.name: Floramor Stamen
items.description: The stamen is the male organ of a plant. Yep! Despite appearances, it seems that Floramor is a male...

items.name: Rotaflor Carpel
items.description: A little biology lesson: the flowers are the plants' sexual organs and the pistil is part of the flower while the carpel is part of the pistil... I'll let you decide what does what.

items.name: Gwass Sepal
items.description: This part of the Gwass' body is always green, no matter what. Is it due to some excess of chlorophyll or to something else?

items.name: Barkritter Calyx
items.description: Don't bother trying to use the Barkritter Calyx to drink anything. It might resemble a cup, but it's about as solid as a sieve.

items.name: Warguerite Bract
items.description: The Warguerite bract refers to an area that decency prevents me from uttering.

items.name: Dark Pikoko Tonsils
items.description: The Dark Pikoko is not as nuts once he's got his tonsils removed. Well, this is no surprise since the surgery usually kills him.

items.name: Dark Treeckler's Achilles' Heel
items.description: You won't defeat the Dark Treeckler by shooting an arrow in his Achilles' heel. But you can always try...

items.name: Dark Treeckler Seed
items.description: With a lot of patience, time, water and fertiliser, you might manage to grow a Treeckler in your garden so that you can practise fighting against him. It would be easier to just catch a boat to Otomai Island...

items.name: Cheeken Plait
items.description: This thick and harsh hair can be used as a mop if not to hide your baldness. But you'll have to wash it many, many times before that.

items.name: Cheeken Cloaca
items.description: No, it's not disgusting! It's nature!

items.name: Air Pikoko Rump
items.description: This rump will enable you to create items that will cover up your own backside.

items.name: Kimbo Sock
items.description: Despite appearances, Kimbo does wear socks, but he just doesn't wear them on his feet. He prefers rolling them and then placing them in strategic places.

items.name: Moopet Stuffing
items.description: Nature having been only modestly generous to the Moopet, the creature has to resort to artifice to pass for a living thing. At times, he uses it to make his bed pass for a bed too.

items.name: Moopet Fabric
items.description: This fabric has a strange texture but it can be used to quickly dress any modest monster.

items.name: Air Pikoko Nut
items.description: There's no milk in this Pikoko Nut but you'll find some brain juice with a few floating neurons.

items.name: Snailmet Shell
items.description: Round and shiny, this shell has been polished with slobber for several centuries.

items.name: Light Treeckler Knot
items.description: Captain Chafer heard the name of this object, and for ever more, the Treeckler was known as "Knob Head".

items.name: Light Treeckler Stump
items.description: Don't you know why this stump is unlike any other stump? It's obvious!

items.name: Greater Bherb Feathered Tail
items.description: One by one, year after year, the number of feathers on the Bherb's appendages increases. You can tell its age by the bushiness of its brush.

items.name: Zoth Fabric
items.description: Made of a soft and resistant material, this fabric is perfectly adapted to the Zoths' figure and hides what needs to be hidden.

items.name: Ouassingue Fabric
items.description: This fabric has more holes than Swiss cheese, but it is still capable of absorbing a maximum amount of waste to regurgitate at the least opportune moment.

items.name: Zoth Warrior Shinbone
items.description: Just like all the other bones of the Zoth Warrior, this shinbone has been broken many times. It healed perfectly and became even stronger. If it could talk it would say: "What doesn't kill you, makes you stronger."

items.name: Zoth Disciple's Kneecap
items.description: Since the Zoth Disciple always attacks with his knees, the kneecaps became extremely large and tough. I know tortoises who'd trade their shells for one of these things.

items.name: Zoth Master's Fly
items.description: The Zoth Master's fly is outstanding. It's been specially designed not to cut you. Any adventurers who have ever been traumatised by their flies will understand.

items.name: Zoth Girl's Handkerchief
items.description: The Zoth girl does not use this handkerchief to wipe away her tears but to clean off her enemies' blood.

items.name: Zoth Sergeant's Insignia
items.description: This embroidered insignia is more of a childhood memory than a military insignia.

items.name: Ouassingue Juice
items.description: Unless you're flaming drunk, there's no way you'll confuse Ouassingue juice with any drinkable liquid you can name. The nauseating stench will dissuade the blind from knocking back a mouthful.

items.name: Mopy King Fabric
items.description: This fabric has more holes than Swiss cheese, but it is still capable of absorbing a maximum amount of waste to regurgitate at the least opportune moment. BANG! And the dirt is back.

items.name: Mopy King Inside Out Shorts
items.description: Taking after their ancestor, Mopy King Dagobert, all Mopy Kings wear their shorts inside out. What's confusing is that it doesn't turn their stomachs inside out as well.

items.name: Dried Mopeat Peat
items.description: Made from rotting vegetables, this peat has incredible powers of absorption. Mama Bworks save them for Auntie Floe's monthly visits.

items.name: Miremop Double Chin
items.description: The Miremop spends a lot of his time taking mud baths in the hopes of slimming down. He has never lost an ounce, but at least his double chin evens out his figure.

items.name: Giant Kralove Ink
items.description: Slimy and dense, the Kralove ink can be used either to write romantic letters or to paint your room a depressing black depending on how your love life's going.

items.name: Giant Kralove Sucker
items.description: Given the size of this sucker, there's no doubt about its grip. And when you remove it, the slurping noise is deafening.

items.name: Snailmet Slobber
items.description: This Snailmet Slobber won't break a Pikoko's bones, but it'll certainly keep one glued to the ground.

items.name: Tynril Amber
items.description: This amber is different from any other. If you close your eyes, shake it and dance the manic tango of Captain Chafer, you might feel it vibrate and glow as if a mysterious spirit inhabited it. To be honest though, you'll look like an idiot. A shiny, vibrating idiot.

items.name: Grotto Hesque Key
items.description: This strange key will enable you to enter the Grotto Hesque in one piece.

items.name: Otomai's Ark Key
items.description: This strange key will enable you to enter Otomai's Ark in one piece.

items.name: Bherb's Gully Key
items.description: This strange key will enable you to enter Bherb's Gully in one piece.

items.name: Tynril Lab Key
items.description: This strange key will enable you to enter the Tynril Lab in one piece.

items.name: Kimbo's Canopy Key
items.description: This strange key will enable you to enter the Kimbo Canopy in one piece.

items.name: Gourlo the Terrible Fabric
items.description: Used in the past as a blister bandage by Gourlo the Terrible, this fabric is still imbued with a dizzying stench. The funny thing is, one sniff and you'll be overcome with an irresistible hunger.

items.name: Feca Skull
items.description: This Feca skull will make a perfect bookend, if you can stop the moans escaping from it.

items.name: Osamodas Skull
items.description: A Tofu here, a Bwork Magus there... This Osamodas disciple just lost his head!

items.name: Enutrof Skull
items.description: This trophy was already old before it became a trophy.

items.name: Sram Skull
items.description: This trophy was already morbid before it became a trophy.

items.name: Xelor Skull
items.description: This skull is often mistaken for that of the famous mummy Toothan Khumin. But don't be fooled, those bandages aren't made from molten kamas, but from paper mache.

items.name: Ecaflip Skull
items.description: That's enough of heads or tails. How about a game of knucklebones instead!

items.name: Eniripsa Skull
items.description: Don't be cruel, this isn't a sparrow's skull!

items.name: Iop Skull
items.description: This trophy is as empty now as it was when it was alive.

items.name: Cra Skull
items.description: This cute Cra skull appears to have been fetched out of a recent archaeological dig.

items.name: Sadida Skull
items.description: What? There's actually a skull underneath that huge thatch of hair?

items.name: Sacrier Skull
items.description: This bragging Sacrier, with his 6000HP, isn't so smug now, is he?

items.name: Pandawa Skull
items.description: You'd have thought that after being hung-over for such a long period of time, this Pandawa would have appreciated being placed in a coffin!

items.name: Temple of the Great Ougaa Key
items.description: This key grants you access to the terrifying Temple of the Great Ougaa and his Funguses.

items.name: Blop Field Key
items.description: This key grants you access to Blop Fields.

items.name: Morello Cherry Key Fragment
items.description: If you find the other pieces of this key, you'll have to go and fight the Rainbow Blop. If you don't want to look for the other pieces anymore after hearing that, I understand.

items.name: Pippin Key Fragment
items.description: If you find the other pieces of this key, you'll have to go and fight the Rainbow Blop. If you don't want to look for the other pieces anymore after hearing that, I understand.

items.name: Coco Key Fragment
items.description: If you find the other pieces of this key, you'll have to go and fight the Rainbow Blop. If you don't want to look for the other pieces anymore after hearing that, I understand.

items.name: Indigo Key Fragment
items.description: If you find the other pieces of this key, you'll have to go and fight the Rainbow Blop. If you don't want to look for the other pieces anymore after hearing that, I understand.

items.name: Royal Rainbow Blop Lair Key
items.description: This key grants you access to the Rainbow Blop Dungeon.

items.name: Mushnid Bark
items.description: A parasite never feels so at home as when he's lodged in the bark of a Mushnid. From time to time the creature will scratch itself, tearing off a part of its diseased skin which can turn into a mushroom itself if it falls in the right place. This mushroom will then find the nearest Mushnid to parasite... as vicious circles go, this one is pretty gruesome.

items.name: Trumperelle Trunk
items.description: This Trumperelle trunk still has the toxic breath of its former owner. Now it's usually used as a phony musical instrument to kill whole audiences at 'assassination concerts.'

items.name: Mushmunch Tongue
items.description: The mushmunch has an incredibly long, soft tongue for licking spores off its companions. Safe to say that this is the only enviable trait they have.

items.name: Mush Mish Eye
items.description: The Mush Mish has the annoying habit of wanting to scratch its itchy eyes with its pointy staff. Sometimes it loses an eye, and sometimes when it scratches its neck, it loses its head.

items.name: Mush Tup's Blade
items.description: The Mush Tup has two arms, two legs and two heads. All this means is that it's two times dumber than you'd expect.

items.name: Mush Rhume Slobber
items.description: This spit is delicious, if a little slimy. It's often used to grease weapons. Or warriors if they enjoy fighting with no clothes on.

items.name: Ougaa Spine
items.description: This beast only has four spines on its head, but what spines... sharp as gads they are!

items.name: Ougaat Fragment
items.description: Ougaa has stunning headgear, and you're holding a piece of his special hat in your hands.

items.name: Greedoblop Flower
items.description: Gluttonous Greedoblops get so hungry that they'll even consider eating their own flowers. Fortunately, their snappy jaws always seem to stumble upon a wandering adventurer just in time.

items.name: Blopshroom Flower
items.description: This flower has been plucked from the head of a Blopshroom. Don't worry about it, the Blopshroom never liked it anyway.

items.name: Trunkiblop Root
items.description: The Trunkiblop has great big roots which draw up anything adventurers throw on the ground.

items.name: Royal Morello Cherry Blop Flower
items.description: If this flower wasn't royal, I bet you would have thrown it out by now.

items.name: Royal Coco Blop Flower
items.description: If this flower wasn't royal, I bet you would have thrown it out by now.

items.name: Royal Indigo Blop Flower
items.description: If this flower wasn't royal, I bet you would have thrown it out by now.

items.name: Royal Pippin Blop Flower
items.description: If this flower wasn't royal, I bet you would have thrown it out by now.

items.name: Royal Blop Leaf
items.description: When dried, rolled and smoked, this leaf can evoke hallucinations in the weakest adventurers, as well as an implacable urge for... relief. An overdose can lead to speedy death.

items.name: Royal Rainbow Blop Leaf
items.description: This leaf feeds on the grey matter of the Royal Rainbow Blop. It's a good thing it's not too greedy!

items.name: Royal Rainbow Blop Flower
items.description: This flower was hidden in the cranial box of the Royal Rainbow Blop. It plugged up all the holes in the creature's memory.

items.name: Bworker Hide
items.description: This skin has been through the wars and yet it has emerged unscathed. It should be just as useful now it's been removed from its former owner.

items.name: Cherry Jam Tart
items.description: This cake with red fruit and cherry jam is enough to make a grown man drool. Other than that, it's of no use whatsoever.

items.name: Tempus Bloomus
items.description: This plant's existence is as mysterious and improbable as its name. Both here and there, but not right now, it's lucky it's not somewhere else, otherwise we'd really be lost. To exchange it for compensokens, go to Pauly Gees, next to the Amakna Castle zaap at [3,-5].

items.name: Climbing Rope
items.description: This is some good rope, and has long been the number one seller for climbers on their way up. And the number two seller for climbers on their way down. In a very old Amaknian tradition, it is also tied in a slip knot and given as gift to village leaders as a sign that their decisions are not appreciated by all.

items.name: Raw Mother of Pearl
items.description: This mother of pearl will be beautiful when polished.

items.name: Mother of Pearl
items.description: This material is made from aragonite crystals and shellite. It was unknown up until Otomai Island was discovered and shellite was found on the Craborals there. This element is very precious to alchemists, although the recipes in which it's used are always jealously guarded.

items.name: Tra Khben Paste
items.description: This paste was invented by the famous Tra Khben, a geologist who specialised in ecosystems and harvests, and who suffered from arthritis of the back from a young age. This paste is remarkable for its ability to make any organic substance it touched rock hard. Tra Khben used this property to help himself stand up straight. When the geologist died, it became very popular with Enutrofs, for an entirely different reason. Its only downside is its smell which explains the ferociously bad breath of many Enutrof miners.

items.name: Impure Blue Corruptah Stone
items.description: This stone will attain its full potential when polished.

items.name: Impure Yellow Corruptah Stone
items.description: This stone will attain its full potential when polished.

items.name: Impure Green Corruptah Stone
items.description: This stone will attain its full potential when polished.

items.name: Poisoned Fishy Salad
items.description: Wake up and smell the coffee, or so the saying goes. Well, this salad does not smell of coffee. It smells of fish. Fish and sweaty feet. This is quite useful, really, because it masks the smell of poison, which, once gulped down, induces projectile vomiting. Great for livening up a boring wedding or playing a trick on your favourite guild leader.

items.name: Back-Scratcher Tip
items.description: This Back-Scratcher Tip has several joints to make it easier to use. It has several prongs, and can double up nicely as an Osamodas'... hey, who writes this stuff?!

items.name: Back-Scratcher Handle
items.description: On its own, this handle is of no use to you whatsoever. You could attach a scratcher to its tip, but that wouldn't be much use to you either. You'd be correct in assuming that only someone pretty twisted would know what to do with it.

items.name: Incomplete Back-Scratcher
items.description: This back-scratcher is almost perfect. Almost, but not quite. Only a highly-skilled smith could complete it, and unfortunately, you don't know one.

items.name: Longevity Potion
items.description: Nileza the alchemist created this potion hoping it would grant him immortality. Unfortunately, he died before he could use it, mistaking some Unikron Blood (which was in the bottle next to it on the shelf) for it.

items.name: Funky Flour
items.description: Xavier the Baker used this flour to make the bread served at each of the funerals of the famous singer Jon Lemon.

items.name: Copy of the Bandit Hideout Key
items.description: This copy of the key to the Ecaflip bandits' hideout is about to shatter. If you try to use it like it is, it will probably break. All this, plus the fact that there's no safety certificate, leads you to believe that the key is a forgery. You'd be right!

items.name: Nowaine Jelly
items.description: Liroye Merline alone knows the recipe to this artificial jelly. When it's mixed with wet turf the jelly hardens and takes on the form of anything that's slid into it. This product is very useful for creating moulds.

items.name: Blueprint for a Clothes Peg
items.description: This blueprint is so simple that even a young Iop could understand it. Well... let's not exaggerate. In the hands of a handyman, it can be used to make objects. If the handyman is a Iop, however, get ready for trouble. You'll need this blueprint, 5 Etching Boards and 3 Kobalite.

items.name: Bucket of Clothes Pegs
items.description: This bucket contains enough clothes pegs to hang up the underwear of the entire Amakna garrison. You could also use them to dry the skins of freshly-slain monsters, or the skin of your mother-in-law.

items.name: Magic Patch
items.description: This synthetic fabric, invented by the tailor Sosh, allows magic clothing to be patched up without affecting their powers. That might explain why experienced tailors value it so highly.

items.name: Magic Blood Orange Dye
items.description: This magic dye, invented by Uba Tesse, is particularly aggressive. It seems to be possessed of a willpower of its own, driving it to do harm. You have to wonder why it's just so aggressive, though.

items.name: Hunting Rune
items.description:
In the words of Lezan the Wise - "Well, bad hunters just see something, right, and then they shoot it like. And then though, good hunter, like, see something and shoot it. Good hunters." 
You can check if all this is true with this rune.

items.name: Morrow Bone
items.description: This bone closely resembles that of a chafer, but it isn't. It belonged to the famous adventurer Morrow, whose exploits nobody remembers and whose flavour the Moowolf doesn't remember either.

items.name: Magic Shadowy Dye
items.description: This extremely rare magical dye is primarily used in exorcism rituals and black magic. The smell it gives off is worse than that produced by the gastric evaporation of a group of Trools who have swallowed some sulphur or an Osamodas.

items.name: Key to Sotsiah Peh's Workshop
items.description: This key grants access to the workshop of the great Smithmagus Sotsiah Peh, in the Brakmar Tunnels. To avoid being disturbed too often, he has enchanted it so that it disappears after use.

items.name: Bombu Barrel
items.description: This barrel, made of Bombu Wood, is surrounded by ebonite. As this alloy is transformed into poison over time, Bombu Barrels are mainly used for the fermentation and storage of alcohol, giving it a special flavour and side effects that are just as special.

items.name: Little Pebble
items.description: This little pebble's purpose is to activate the magic tiles and awaken the water spirit. It's easy to use, simply place the pebble on a tile and the magic will do the rest. Simple and effective. Even a Iop could do it, as long as there's no enemy around for them to throw the pebble at.

items.name: Sesanabolic Potion
items.description: This potion is incomplete because Merlinmagus Ambrosius didn't reveal how much Ougaa'g to add.

items.name: Transmuted Water
items.description: This water, transmuted by Dragonsly, is a mix of Sacred Water and Moon Water. The result is simply... surprising.

items.name: Sag Mask
items.description: Sag was a ingenuous Enutrof who wasn't afraid of anything. This mask allowed him to survive in the foul air of Brakmar's deepest mines. He had forgotten, however, that even though the seal is tight, this mask does not protect from volcanic eruptions.

items.name: Ticket to the Isle O'Anstitch
items.description: This ticket entitles you to a round trip to the Isle O'Anstitch. It is only valid with Nikos Monot, in Cania Bay.

items.name: Tanuki Entrails
items.description: At first glance, these entrails are definitely not very appetising. At second glance, even less so.

items.name: Kido Blood
items.description: As red as its plumage, Kido blood is the number one ingredient in next generation cooking. However, its lack of magical properties makes it a very poor substitute for vampire blood in the recipe for magic black pudding.

items.name: Pa Trp Dam Rune
items.description: This rune increases your traps' power.

items.name: Pa Trp Per Rune
items.description: This rune increases your traps' power.

items.name: Ra Trp Per Rune
items.description: This rune increases your traps' power.

items.name: Pa Pow Rune
items.description: This rune will increase damage dealt to your enemies.

items.name: Ra Pow Rune
items.description: This rune will increase damage dealt to your enemies.

items.name: Pa Pp Rune
items.description: This rune will increase your luck in finding rare items.

items.name: Citronana
items.description: Flambéed or sliced, topped with melted chocolate or just on its own, this fruit is a delicious dessert.

items.name: Hazing Stone
items.description: Trampled, chewed, crushed, washed, ironed, dried, you've had everything done to you. Not only is your body bruised, but your ego too.

items.name: Tofu Pheromone
items.description: This dehydrated, powdered pheromone can attract a Tofu from several kilokametres away, as long as your own pheromones don't asphyxiate it first.

items.name: Dragoturkey Sweat
items.description: Holy Bwork! How did you manage to get that? And, more to the point, why? You're really weird.

items.name: Snowdrop
items.description: Hardened to Frigost's harsh climate, this flower is much more resistant than its delicate appearance would suggest. That said, to preserve the alchemic properties of such a rare plant, it must be handled carefully when harvested.

items.name: Icefish
items.description: Spines as sharp as Bworker's blades, scales as thick as Soft Oak Bark, and eyes as black as Crobak Feathers. This fish may be formidable, but served up on a plate it is quite simply delicious.

items.name: Aspen Wood
items.description: This tree appears to tremble when you touch it. After all the axe blows you've dealt it, it's not surprising it's scared of you.

items.name: Frosteez
items.description: What's surprising about this cereal is that, in addition to its resistance to Frigost's extreme climate, it gives any milk it comes into contact with a delicate chocolatey flavour.

items.name: Obsidian
items.description: Hard enough to scratch glass and dark enough to sap your morale, this rock has lost all of the heat of the lava from which it came. It would be perfect as a tombstone, as long as it's not your own.

items.name: Mastogob Wool
items.description: Mastogobs need to be shorn once a year, just like the armpits of Pikokos.

items.name: Mastogob Clavicle
items.description: There isn't the tiniest piece of edible meat left on this bone, so there's no point you gnawing on it.

items.name: Mastogobbly Ear
items.description: Frigostians normally eat these ears with vinaigrette because they taste awful, and Frigostians love vinaigrette.

items.name: Mastogobbly Leather
items.description: They say that boiling this leather 8 times in water renders it edible. That's a Frigostian's idea of a funny joke, by the way.

items.name: Mastogob Warrior Eye
items.description: This eye must have seen the rumps of a fair few female Mastogobs in its time. Now all the poor thing can see is the fluff in your pocket.

items.name: Mastogob Warrior Horn
items.description: The most reckless Frigostians have fun with sleeping Mastogob Warriors by attempting to throw three metallic rings around each of their horns without waking them up. Unsurprisingly, no one has ever made it to the end of the game alive.

items.name: Venerable Mastogob Tail
items.description: This hairy little tail was well hidden under the Venerable Mastogob's thick wool. That didn't stop you from finding it and pulling it off, though, did it?

items.name: Venerable Mastogob Wool
items.description: It's dirty, but venerable. Kinda reminds you of someone.

items.name: Royal Mastogob's Greenhouse Key
items.description: Use this key to enter the greenhouse where the Royal Mastogob hides.

items.name: Pingwin Key
items.description: This key contains high levels of asbestos and as a result floats very well on water and on salad dressing. You can also use it to enter the Royal Pingwin's excavation.

items.name: Wreck of the Hesperus Key
items.description: Battered by the waves, this key smells of iodine and rotten seaweed, like a chain-smoking Enutrof who has let himself go. It is, however, the only way of entering the Wreck of the Hesperus.

items.name: Obsidemon's Hypogeum Key
items.description: This worn key was once used to access the Frigost mines. Nowadays, it can be used to enter the Obsidemon's Hypogeum, where the bodies of adventures foolish enough to have crossed its path are kept nice and warm.

items.name: Snowfoux Den Key
items.description: It smells a bit like frozen, damp Bow Wow, but it'll get you into the Snowfoux Den.

items.name: Korriander's Lair Key
items.description: This strangely shaped key shines at night. So if you happen to get lost in the Petrified Forest, instead of helping you find your way, it'll help the monsters find you instead.

items.name: Kolosso's Caverns Key
items.description: Nope, it doesn't matter how hard you stare at it, you won't get an answer. This isn't the key to the gates of paradise.

items.name: Bearbarian Antichamber Key
items.description: Any self-respecting Frigostian can blab on for weeks about the many virtues of honey. Rather than listen to the gassy old windbags, why don't you have a look inside the hive yourself? You might even get the chance to see the inside of a Bearbarian's stomach while you're at it.

items.name: Frosteez Seed
items.description: This seed, cold to the touch, releases a powerful chocolate aroma.

items.name: Royal Mastogob Tail
items.description: The Royal Mastogob uses his tail to shoo away Moskitos during the summer months. It's completely useless for the rest of the year though, and sometimes he even forgets it's there.

items.name: Royal Mastogob Wool
items.description: No one can say exactly when Mastogobs first arrived on Frigost. What is certain is that they've been there a long time, because certain Frigostian households still pass down Royal Mastogob Wool underwear from generation to generation, and there are several examples that date back centuries.

items.name: Pingwinkle Beak
items.description: When it's not planted firmly in the jaw of the Pingwinkle, this beak can be found planted firmly in your backside.

items.name: Pingwinkle Feather
items.description: In olden times, Pingwinkles only used to visit Frigost's shores for a few days during the winter, but now the island has frozen over completely, they've decided to stay - which is as good an excuse as any to steal their feathers all year round.

items.name: Pingwobble Wing
items.description: Frigostians have often wondered what purpose these ridiculous wings could serve, as they're not even strong enough for the Pingwobble to stir up a light breeze.

items.name: Pingwobble Skin
items.description: It's very oily, isn't washed very often, and it shines. Nope, I'm not talking about your wig, but this Pingwobble Skin.

items.name: Mama Pingwin Oil
items.description: This oil was extracted from a Mama Pingwin. It will take you a very long time to wipe the memory of how exactly you extracted it from your scarred mind.

items.name: Mama Pingwin Down
items.description: Everyone on Frigost loves to stuff their underwear with Mama Pingwin down. Some people say they do it to keep warm, but only a Iop would believe that.

items.name: Shaman Pingwin Giant Fishbone
items.description: There are plenty of questions about Frigost that don't have answers, and, more worryingly, plenty of answers that don't have questions. You will never know where the Shaman Pingwin found this giant fishbone.

items.name: Shaman Pingwin Beard Hair
items.description: The Shaman Pingwin's Beard smells of fish and goat musk. This potent mix is used by the bravest inhabitants of Frigost as a Mastogob repellent.

items.name: Kung-Fu Pingwin Tail
items.description: Don't be fooled by its modest size - it knows exactly where it's going.

items.name: Kung-Fu Pingwin Ear
items.description: Usually hidden by a decaying fish, the ears of the Kung-Fu Pingwin hear one thing, the calls of available partners during mating season. So you're free to make fun of Kung-Fu Pingwins in perfect safety as long as you don't look like a potential partner.

items.name: Royal Pingwin Feather
items.description: The Royal Pingwin is well respected by the inhabitants of Frigost, who, blinded by his noble title, think he's probably more important than he actually is, and don't hesitate to kill him as a result.

items.name: Royal Pingwin Egg
items.description: Don't pretend you don't know exactly which hole this enormous egg came out of.

items.name: Cromagmunk Tail
items.description: Cromagmunks use their tails to balance when they're rolling their acorns along the floor. Cromagmunks seem impervious to ridicule.

items.name: Cromagmunk Acorn
items.description: Cromagmunks spend the first few years of their lives looking for the best acorn possible. They spend the rest of their lives trying to remember where they've hidden it.

items.name: Sabredon Tooth
items.description: A very serious, progressive scientific study has shown that the teeth of the Sabredon were the very first cause of perforated buttock amongst the Frigostian population.

items.name: Sabredon Hair
items.description: Sabredon Hair was once used to stuff quilts - which certain Frigostians of dubious personal hygiene could then use as an excuse to mask their polecat stench.

items.name: Woolly Piggoth Tusk
items.description: This tusk smells like someone's underpants. Not yours, though.

items.name: Woolly Piggoth Leather
items.description: A Woolly Piggoth's skin pads its angular bones quite nicely, meaning it stays festively plump all year round.

items.name: Frighog Baleful Eye
items.description: You killed a Frighog, and just before shuffling off this mortal coil and joining the sanctuary of other Frighogs killed in action, it gave you one last look of such ferocity that your blood ran cold. As if it wasn't cold enough already on Frigost.

items.name: Frighog Pierced Ear
items.description: A Frighog's ears are pierced all over. Is this because they like piercings, or is it because Jon Lemon's songs can even be heard on Frigost too?

items.name: Kanigloo Ear
items.description: This ear reminds you of one of the favourite songs of young Frigostians: "Kanigloo gloo gloo, Greedoblop blop blop tadada tzum tzum". There aren't many lyrics, sure, but that way a Iop can just about memorise it.

items.name: Kanigloo Fabric
items.description: This fabric reminds you of the second verse of one of the favourite songs of young Frigostians: "Frighog hog hog...". Unfortunately, you don't remember the rest of the words.

items.name: Woolly Bow Meow Hair
items.description: While they were still alive, the Mayor of Frigost's political opponents would tell anyone who would listen that she wore Woolly Bow Meow Hair lingerie.

items.name: Woolly Bow Meow Sternum
items.description: No one knows for certain what exactly this sternum is used for. Stuffing Woolly Bow Meows, perhaps?

items.name: Stunted Rat Paw
items.description: Young Frigostian schoolchildren have a game called "BowMeouch" which involves cutting a paw off a Stunted Rat and using it to simulate footprints in the snow. They attract Snow Bow Meows in search of prey to ambush. Once the Snow Bow Meow is caught, they shave its fur off and turn it into a muffle. Aren't children wonderful?

items.name: Stunted Rat Fabric
items.description: Before Frigost froze over, Stunted Rats were hunted for their fur, which was then sold on the Amaknian continent under the name "Exotic Kitsou Skin".

items.name: Crabeye Pincer
items.description: Crabeyes are hunted by the fishermen of Frigost for two reasons: their permanent bad temper and their tendency to play jokes on the fishermen by snipping their nets with their pincers. The fishermen get their revenge, and play jokes on the crabs by snipping their pincers off.

items.name: Crabeye Eye
items.description: The eye contains a vitreous fluid that is used in traditional Frigostian recipes to replace vinegar – but only if you let the eye ferment for long enough.

items.name: Gullipop Beak
items.description: Gullipops are rather stupid, badly behaved creatures whose guano lies scattered in stinking piles around Permafrost Port. They like to steal fish from fishermen, but if properly trained, they can also "liberate" the personal effects of distracted tourists and hide them in their beaks.

items.name: Gullipop Feather
items.description: Frigostian schoolchildren use these feathers to write with, which is why mother Gullipops always stress to their chicks the need to accelerate when passing a school.

items.name: Ice Saw
items.description: This saw is used to cut blocks of ice. It will also cut frozen limbs particularly well.

items.name: Steel Plate
items.description: Steel plates are very popular among Frigostians, who use them to manufacture machinery and steel pipes.

items.name: Protective Mask
items.description: This mask is used by workers to protect their faces in hazardous working conditions. It also protects very well from slaps and thrown dishes if you have forgotten your wife's birthday.

items.name: Protective Gloves
items.description: These gloves protect objects from your grubby little mitts. Certain Srams use them to protect their identity by hiding their fingerprints.

items.name: Talklyka Pirate Claw
items.description: Very handy for pinching the buttocks of its enemies or grabbing pickles stuck to the bottom of the jar, this claw is a Talklyka Pirate's pride and joy.

items.name: Talklyka Pirate Rope
items.description: It's difficult to say what purpose this rope could serve for a Talklyka Pirate, because everyone knows they haven't got a clue how to tie knots.

items.name: Karrybean Pirate Buoy
items.description: Some pirates can't swim and so they need a buoy. They may eventually beach on the black sand beaches of Alma's Cradle after floating around for several years. Once they're back on terra firma, they're generally thirsty for revenge. But since they can't take revenge on the sea, they take revenge on the weak, tourists, and especially weak tourists.

items.name: Karrybean Pirate Tail
items.description: It's difficult to call this a tail... It's more of a Karrybean Pirate extremity.

items.name: Yuara Pirate Oil
items.description: Yuara Pirates always keep a little oil with them to ensure that their wheel rotates correctly, but end up drinking it in a misguided attempt to stop their heads rotating instead.

items.name: Yuara Pirate Shell
items.description: This shell protected the Yuara Pirate from sea spray and guano while it was sailing. Once back on dry land, the shell protects its delicate pupils from the black sandstorms of Alma's Cradle.

items.name: Retspan Pirate Mast
items.description: Ignorant people might think this is a Spinnaker pole or a bowsprit, while any Frigostian tell you that this is a vertical spar and therefore a mast.

items.name: Retspan Pirate Tooth
items.description: Even the best Frigostian research scientists have failed to explain the usefulness of teeth for a ghost, especially a ghost tied to a mast. Perhaps it uses them to gnaw at the ropes?

items.name: Harpy Pirate Shell
items.description: The Harpy Pirate stole this shell from a powerless mollusc. It hasn't made him any more powerful so far.

items.name: Harpy Pirate Scale
items.description: This scale belongs to what appears to be a former Frigostian-turned-pirate who was transformed into a ghost when he swallowed too much water while swimming. That's what happens when you have too much salt in your diet!

items.name: Vigi Pirate Fabric
items.description: If you turn this fabric over, you'll find some invaluable advice: "If you see an enemy, rob him of his treasure, hide it on a desert island and put a cross on a map so you can remember its location. Remember not to hide the map with the treasure".

items.name: Vigi Pirate Eye
items.description: Vigi Pirates are selected for their excellent visual capacity. They are able to discern a school of tuna during a storm at night with an octopus covering their eyes, guano on their eyelids and the songs of Jon Lemon playing in the background.

items.name: Buck Anear Hair
items.description: Also known as "Buck Lightyear", "Buck Aroo", "Buck Adoaboutnothing" or "Buck Off", this pirate has sailed every sea known to man and beast. The tides have decided that he should end his days on the black sand beaches of Alma's Cradle.

items.name: Buck Anear Scapula
items.description: Broken twice by cannon balls, three times from rolling in the sea spray, and four times having slipped on dried guano, this bone made a wealthy man of the ship's doctor, until he was eventually thrown to the sharks for dark tales of gambling, women, alcohol, insubordination, provocations to a duel, treasure theft, scuttling and mutiny. A succession of small things which eventually led to his downfall. You don't mess with Buck Anear.

items.name: Atomystique Stone
items.description: This stone was levitating around an Atomystique until you tried to avoid it, or levitate yourself - you don't know exactly what happened, but now you've got a headache and you're covered in steaming mud.

items.name: Atomystique Tephra
items.description: This lava fragment was ejected at high speed from an Atomystique orifice that you never knew existed! Desperately trying to finish it off with blows from a rusty rake probably wasn't the best idea... Luckily, you weren't in its way when it came crashing down, lodging itself between the fleshy bum cheeks of a local builder.

items.name: Solfatara Residue
items.description: How can a vaporous creature give rise to solid waste? This question was first asked 74 years ago during the famous Frigostian contest for the Promotion of Young Graduate Geologists. No participant was admitted that year and the issue still remains one of Frigost Island's most terrifying mysteries.

items.name: Solfatara Ulna
items.description: This steaming bone changes shape according to the mood of the Solfatara - a beast renowned for its terribly foul moods.

items.name: Steam Crackler Heart
items.description: This stone heart fills with steam when the Steam Crackler meets a partner. This unique feature lets you determine quickly if you've killed a single Steam Crackler... You just need to see if its heart floats.

items.name: Steam Crackler Egg
items.description: Steam Cracklers are comparable to Cracklers made from steam that have decided to do battle with anything that does not resemble them in any way, or that they can just about make out through the steam. Unsurprisingly, they lay eggs filled with steam. Did I mention the steam?

items.name: Fumaroller Stone
items.description: The Fumaroller was waving this huge stone at the end of what appeared to be his tail. He had hoped to intimidate you, until you found his weak point. Unfortunately you failed to memorise it, as your head is full of cotton wool.

items.name: Fumaroller Artefact
items.description: This vaporous artefact smells like rotten eggs mixed with guanocamole. The mere mention of this mixture makes you hungry.

items.name: Mofette Stone
items.description: The Mofette takes its name directly from a geological feature that is quite common in the Tears of Ouronigride. This stone resembles one of its organs, a kidney perhaps.

items.name: Mofette Tuff
items.description: Behind this strange name hides a rock with a vascular structure. But you can just content yourself with likening it to a piece of the giant mofette you just savagely split in two.

items.name: Obsidemon Slag
items.description: Even the Obsidemon itself thinks this is junk. Just don't put it in your pockets, especially those that aren't fireproof.

items.name: Obsidemon Vertebra
items.description: This vertebra contains bone marrow that has already been cooked and is ready to be consumed. What you are holding in your hands is the precursor to an entire line of microwave ready meals.

items.name: Soryo Snowfoux Paw
items.description: Having taken several blows to the face from this paw, you finally have the right to place it in your bag as a good luck charm.

items.name: Soryo Snowfoux Ear
items.description: We don't know how the Snowfoux arrived on Frigost, but we do know that their distant cousins come from Pandala. Now you understand a little better where that frozen McSheth residue that you slept in last night came from.

items.name: Maho Snowfoux Leather
items.description: This leather is thick enough to allow the Maho Snowfoux to withstand low, low temperatures and go sledging on his arse without hurting himself, which makes you particularly jealous.

items.name: Maho Snowfoux Wool
items.description: Long used for stuffing the underwear of complex-ridden Frigostians, this wool is now known to give spots to anyone who strokes it. You have just found an excellent excuse to justify your pestilent pimples.

items.name: Yokai Snowfoux Wool
items.description: It's difficult to find anything more stupid than the offspring of a Yokai Snowfoux, yet some parents seem to have succeeded. You're trying to work out what that's got to do with this Snowfoux Wool, but you can't see anything, even squinting and shaking your fists.

items.name: Yokai Snowfoux Skull
items.description: The skull of the Yokai Snowfoux has just about enough room to hold a snowflake that has been crushed in a vice and then evaporated. But as stupidity is frightening, all Frigostians are terrorised by this creature, even though it is barely able to put one paw in front of the other.

items.name: Tengu Snowfoux Wool
items.description: Ripped straight from the body of Tengu Snowfoux, this wool is particularly warm, and will strengthen your virility if your chest wig is a little sparse.

items.name: Tengu Snowfoux Leather
items.description: The completely waterproof leather was used by Frigostians to craft supple, smooth, soft containers to put things in. Some of them even claimed they didn't need to use the containers, as they were happily married.

items.name: Still Water
items.description: This water, kept in an unstable state of supercooling, is mainly used to instantly freeze any type of food. Some unscrupulous Frigostians say it also works very well with mothers-in-law.

items.name: Frosteez Oil
items.description: This oil is good for preserving food and ideal for massages, lending a slight scent of chocolate to all your meals.

items.name: Puffed Frosteez
items.description: Lighter and sweeter than conventional Frosteez, this cereal will make you roar with pleasure if you eat it with mimilk.

items.name: Frozen Icefish
items.description: Unlike traditional Icefish, Frozen Icefish is already frozen (the clue is in the name I guess), which means it can be kept for longer.

items.name: Snow Star
items.description: This rare flower is named in remembrance of a boy named Savo who swore his love to a shepherdess, with the stars as his witnesses. He gave her a bouquet of these flowers before leaving for Frigost Village, where he became a chimney sweep and perished in a fire.

items.name: Temporal Shard
items.description: A shard of glass that looks pretty ordinary at first glance, but if you look closely, you can see scrolling images on its roughened surface. Memories? They look like events that took place nearly a century ago. This shard was part of a much larger piece, that's for certain.

items.name: Buzta Ear
items.description: Less hairy than the ears of a Stabba, this one at least has the advantage of being clean.

items.name: Asploda Eye
items.description: This eye seems stuck to the goggle lens. Such a shame. If it weren't for that, you might have been able to swallow it.

items.name: Sakai Nugget Fragment
items.description: Count Harebourg was quite clear: "It's there for sure, under your nose! Just a few pickaxe blows away. Keep looking." So the Goblins tirelessly continued to seek the true nugget of Sakai, deemed to be bigger than the fist of a Trool and heavier than a bowl of Kerbabben Salad. How could such a stone go unnoticed on such a small island?

items.name: Stabba Fibula
items.description: This bone appears to have suffered several fractures, most probably from the pickaxe blows of other Goblins whose vocabulary is often limited to "Grüüüp" and "Oukk", and whose sentences are punctuated by pickaxe blows.

items.name: Grabba Skin
items.description: There's a Goblin shopping list written on this skin in adventurer blood: "Beer, Meat, Beer" - everything needed for a successful party. You should keep it.

items.name: Drilla Stone
items.description: It was inevitable that the Drilla would eventually find this stone as all he does is drill rock all day long. He is convinced that its odd appearance means it is worth more than a vulgar piece of coal, so he keeps it, and will almost certainly exchange it for a beer or perhaps a female goblin, although the beer would be a much better choice and far less hassle in the long term.

items.name: Gobshell Egg
items.description: Gobshells are mechanical creatures, so it is illusory to think that they hatch from eggs. According to Goblin logic, their eggs must therefore also be mechanical. You suddenly understand why Goblins are at the bottom of the ladder in the animal kingdom, right next to Larvae.

items.name: First Fire Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain a Firestone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Fire Fragments.

items.name: Second Fire Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain a Firestone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Fire Fragments.

items.name: Third Fire Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain a Firestone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Fire Fragments.

items.name: Fourth Fire Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain a Firestone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Fire Fragments.

items.name: First Earth Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain an Earthstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Earth Fragments.

items.name: Second Earth Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain an Earthstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Earth Fragments.

items.name: Third Earth Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain an Earthstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Earth Fragments.

items.name: Fourth Earth Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain an Earthstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Earth Fragments.

items.name: First Water Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain a Waterstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Water Fragments.

items.name: Second Water Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain a Waterstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Water Fragments.

items.name: Third Water Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain a Waterstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Water Fragments.

items.name: Fourth Water Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain a Waterstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Water Fragments.

items.name: First Air Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain an Airstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Air Fragments.

items.name: Second Air Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain an Airstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Air Fragments.

items.name: Third Air Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain an Airstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Air Fragments.

items.name: Fourth Air Fragment
items.description: You'll obtain an Airstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Air Fragments.

items.name: Firestone
items.description: This stone is elemental energy, solidified and concentrated.

items.name: Earthstone
items.description: This stone is elemental energy, solidified and concentrated.

items.name: Waterstone
items.description: This stone is elemental energy, solidified and concentrated.

items.name: Airstone
items.description: This stone is elemental energy, solidified and concentrated.

items.name: Buck Anear's Bunch of Keys
items.description: While his men waited to share the loot contained in the Hesperus's chests, Buck Anear spent hours working out which key on this bunch went with which particular chest. His men, fed up of waiting, went off to do something else, which meant Buck Anear could keep everything for himself.

items.name: Dod Rune
items.description: You're finding it difficult to keep hold of this slippery rune. When used correctly, it'll help you get out of difficult situations.

items.name: Pa Dod Rune
items.description: You're finding it difficult to keep hold of this very slippery rune. When used correctly, it'll help you get out of difficult situations.

items.name: Loc Rune
items.description: You're finding it difficult to throw this sticky rune away. It's magical properties will allow you to keep in contact with your enemies.

items.name: Pa Loc Rune
items.description: You're finding it difficult to throw this very sticky rune away. It's magical properties will allow you to keep in contact with your enemies.

items.name: Ap Res Rune
items.description: You feel more energetic with this rune in your hand. Use it to avoid any kind of lethargy.

items.name: Pa Ap Res Rune
items.description: You feel much more energetic with this rune in your hand. Use it to avoid any kind of lethargy.

items.name: Mp Res Rune
items.description: This rune's magic gives you the urge to run. Great for some good times during your morning jog.

items.name: Pa Mp Res Rune
items.description: This rune's powerful magic gives you the urge to run. Great for some good times during your morning jog.

items.name: Ap Red Rune
items.description: This rune provokes a kind of lethargy. Powdered, it can be used to send your enemies to sleep.

items.name: Pa Ap Red Rune
items.description: This rune provokes a kind of deep lethargy. Powdered, it can be used to send your enemies to sleep.

items.name: Mp Red Rune
items.description: Normally used to treat heavy legs, this rune's effect has been reversed. Basically, don't expect to run like a Tofu when you use it.

items.name: Pa Mp Red Rune
items.description: Normally used to treat heavy legs, this rune's effect has been reversed. Basically, don't expect to run like a Dragoturkey when you use it.

items.name: Psh Dam Rune
items.description: This rune coats the soles of your shoes with a fine layer of ice. To be used for winter sports or jokes in poor taste.

items.name: Pa Psh Dam Rune
items.description: This rune coats the soles of your shoes with a layer of ice. To be used for winter sports or jokes in poor taste.

items.name: Psh Res Rune
items.description: Crampons have appeared on the soles of your shoes, which is very useful if you want to avoid hurting yourself should you slip over. Ridiculous at a ball, however. It's up to you when you use this rune.

items.name: Pa Psh Res Rune
items.description: Large crampons have appeared on the soles of your shoes, which is very useful if you want to avoid hurting yourself should you slip over. Ridiculous at a ball, however. It's up to you when you use this rune.

items.name: Cri Dam Rune
items.description: Your senses have been heightened since you came into possession of this rune. It will allow you to accomplish even more extraordinary feats.

items.name: Pa Cri Dam Rune
items.description: Your senses have been strongly heightened since you came into possession of this rune. It will allow you to accomplish even more extraordinary feats.

items.name: Cri Res Rune
items.description: Inexplicably, you think this rune is a good luck charm. Perhaps it will help you avoid a spell's ill-effects.

items.name: Pa Cri Res Rune
items.description: Inexplicably, you think this rune is an effective good luck charm. Perhaps it will help you avoid a spell's ill-effects.

items.name: Earth Dam Rune
items.description: Associated with Earth, this rune will definitely strengthen your mastery of this element.

items.name: Pa Earth Dam Rune
items.description: Strongly associated with Earth, this rune will definitely strengthen your mastery of this element.

items.name: Fire Dam Rune
items.description: Associated with Fire, this rune will definitely strengthen your mastery of this element.

items.name: Pa Fire Dam Rune
items.description: Strongly associated with Fire, this rune will definitely strengthen your mastery of this element.

items.name: Water Dam Rune
items.description: Associated with Water, this rune will definitely strengthen your mastery of this element.

items.name: Pa Water Dam Rune
items.description: Strongly associated with Water, this rune will definitely strengthen your mastery of this element.

items.name: Air Dam Rune
items.description: Associated with Air, this rune will definitely strengthen your mastery of this element.

items.name: Pa Air Dam Rune
items.description: Strongly associated with Air, this rune will definitely strengthen your mastery of this element.

items.name: Neutral Dam Rune
items.description: Not associated with any particular element, this rune will nevertheless strengthen the resolve of the indecisive when making a decision, which is paradoxical.

items.name: Pa Neutral Dam Rune
items.description: Not associated with any particular element at all, this rune will nevertheless strengthen the resolve of the indecisive when making a decision, which is paradoxical.

items.name: Carniflora
items.description: This beautiful flower reflects the sensitivity of its former owner. Who'd have thought that even the most ferocious of Kanniballs had a soft side!

items.name: Kanniball Andchain's Hood
items.description: Not many people know that Kanniball Andchain wears a hood under his mask. Now that you have it in your hands, you'll be able to prove it. The question is, will people believe you?

items.name: Freshly-Squeezed Cromagmunk Juice
items.description: Only the most skilled alchemists can craft this potion, the difficulty of which lies in keeping the Cromagmunk alive and conscious during the pressing, which lasts 10 minutes. Pressing too hard or too fast produces a slurry that isn't even good enough to feed a Lousy Pig.

items.name: Living Cromagmunk
items.description: This Cromagmunk is alive. It moves, picks its nose and bites the backsides of the unwary. It almost sounds like your little sister, if you ignore its large, furry tail.

items.name: Synthetic Root
items.description: This root was created by a Frigostian biologist to repair the damage caused by his past mistakes.

items.name: Kanniball Village Key
items.description: An ancient custom offered a certain lose-lose proposition to everyone who wanted to visit the Kanniball village: death or tounga. Sadly, the extremely painful tradition wasted far too many kokokonuts, so it was replaced by a simple key. Things were a lot funnier before.

items.name: Haunted House Key
items.description: You can use this key to take a trip around the Haunted House at the Trool Fair. You disclaim any liability for personal injury and damages caused by its misuse.

items.name: Boostache Moustache
items.description: Boostache always had a bit of a complex about not being able to grow hairs on his chin, and in fact, about not having a chin at all, sadly. To compensate, he grew this superb moustache.

items.name: Boostoplasm
items.description: No one knows how Boostache secretes this strange substance, or from where it comes. All that's known about it is that it's white, it's sticky, and it glows in the dark.

items.name: Yomi Snowfoux Malleolus
items.description: The ankle bone is the one most prone to suffering terrible fractures among Yomi Snowfoux. That's what you get for mucking about in the snow... The clumsy creatures seem to have lost the renowned survival instinct that defines King Tengu's subjects.

items.name: Yomi Snowfoux Tail
items.description: The tail of the Yomi Snowfoux is always covered in bandages because the bone within it tends to break very easily, which is a very painful experience for its hapless owner.

items.name: Fuji Snowfoux Condyle
items.description: This Snowfoux condyle is perfectly designed to dig into any concave, bony cavity that presents itself. Your skull, for example.

items.name: Fuji Snowfoux Leather
items.description: This leather is very soft but has a rigidity that is hard to beat. Unfortunately, the pheromones it gives off are likely to attract a lot of unwanted attention.

items.name: Dramanita Gill
items.description: Frigostians cook these gills in parcels of fabric made from Kanigloo hair before washing them three times in the snow. Their hallucinogenic properties have never been demonstrated, and those who have consumed them have strangely escaped from Frigost Island by swimming, without ever managing to return.

items.name: Dramanita Eye
items.description: Even torn from its mycological socket this eye continues to emit a slight glow, but sadly not enough to help you find your way through the Petrified Forest at night.

items.name: Fistulina Ear
items.description: Able to hear the sound of Kanigloo fleas at a distance of more than seventy-two Cromagmunk feet, these ears have had the nosiest, deafest Frigostians fantasising for generations.

items.name: Fistulina Volva
items.description: It is very important that you distinguish between a Fistulina's Volva, and another thing it has which, despite sharing a similar spelling, is actually something completely different altogether. Yep, that's right, a Volvo.

items.name: Fungore Peduncle
items.description: Booris Loggin was a famous Frigostian sculptor known for his work depicting stalks in wooden logs. One of his most famous works is "Loggin's Fungore".

items.name: Fungore Gill
items.description: The Fungore was once reputed to be an ugly creature who loved to play tricks on Frigostians. He was suspected of burning down houses and eating children. Fortunately, all this was a myth. In reality the Fungore is a gentle creature who burns children and eats houses.

items.name: Treecherous Bark
items.description: Frigostians once used this bark to cover benches and chairs. They would then all rush to rub up against them, with their bare bottoms hanging out of their pants, because having such smooth buttocks would allow them to reach much faster speeds when sledging on their backsides.

items.name: Treecherous Root
items.description: While shambling through the Petrified Forest one day, the Treecherous got its foot caught up in a root. Poor Treechy struggled so much that its foot snapped off, so now it uses the offending root as a replacement. Don't you love a happy ending?

items.name: Serpula Flake
items.description: The Serpula is known to Frigostians for inflicting considerable damage to buildings by devouring, among other things, their timber frames. It is said that cutting off its volva is enough to render it completely harmless. But as you've killed it, you'll never know.

items.name: Serpula Peduncle
items.description: Looking at this Serpula Peduncle, you'd think this evil creature had deserved his sad fate. Korriander will think the same when he sees yours.

items.name: Korriander Foot
items.description: Thin, hairy, ugly and smelly, this foot is the perfect image of its former owner.

items.name: Korriander Eye
items.description: This glassy eye is perfect to accompany a salad dressed with Rattedaugue vinaigrette. Recommended for the toughest of palates only, or for those without taste buds.

items.name: Pyrotechnic Brockhard Eye
items.description: Such big, moist eyes and so cute, too. How could you do such a thing to this poor creature?

items.name: Pyrotechnic Brockhard Ear
items.description:
Pyrotechnic Brockhards are somewhat timid creatures, and their ears point backwards so much that it becomes almost impossible to find them.
You, however, appear to have succeeded.

items.name: Gluttonous Brockhard Tail
