items.description: The hunters of Frigost used to sell Gluttonous Brockhard Tails to Dame Antium.

items.name: Gluttonous Brockhard Manubrium
items.description: This bone is extremely solid and resistant, and is capable of supporting the weight of the Gluttonous Brockhard's claws and thoracic cage.

items.name: Bestial Brockhard Claw
items.description: The Bestial Brockhard is able to scratch his back very easily using his claws, but has to make sure he doesn't scratch any lower.

items.name: Bestial Brockhard Hair
items.description: The hair of a Bestial Brockhard is so abundant that certain Frigostians have used it to stuff mattresses, and as a result, their own pockets. However, they're not here any more to tell us about it.

items.name: Nightcrawling Brockhard Fabric
items.description: This fabric is very insubstantial. Be careful it doesn't disappear into thin air.

items.name: Nightcrawling Brockhard Ear
items.description: This ear, thinner and more contoured than those of the other creatures in the Fangs of Glass, is aerodynamic perfection incarnate, which comes in very handy when you're crossing the different dimensions.

items.name: Icy Brockhard Molar
items.description: One of the great things about being a Icy Brockhard is that you can eat what you want and your breath stays as fresh as a snowdrop.

items.name: Icy Brockhard Ear
items.description: It's probably not a good idea to play Chinese Whispers with an Icy Brockhard; you could end up with chapped lips.

items.name: Venomous Brockhard Tail
items.description: This tail's only use is to keep the Venomous Brockhard balanced. In other words, it's neither useful nor ornamental. Ah, there you go! Something you have in common.

items.name: Venomous Brockhard Scapula
items.description: You were sitting on this bone and you didn't even realise. Fancy that!

items.name: Kolosso Claw
items.description: Elderly Frigostians say that in order to shatter this claw, it must be heated to white-hot and then quickly plunged into the snow.

items.name: Kolosso Fabric
items.description: Formerly known as Piautre, Kolosso was renown for having hair as strong as steel. Unfortunately no one has ever found any trace of lead in his brain.

items.name: Apewicubic Bearbarian Vomer
items.description: This bone has been broken several times due to the Apewicubic Bearbarian being punched repeatedly on the nose, but still stays firmly in its skull. Once ground up into powder, it has several curative properties.

items.name: Apewicubic Bearbarian Ear
items.description: By virtue of having ice cubes placed between them, the ears of an Apewicubic Bearbarian have ended up growing an extra layer of fur over the years, which is why the Frigostians still continue to make many ear muffs out of Apewicubic Bearbarian ears.

items.name: Torpid Bearbarian Iris
items.description: You laid into this poor creature with such ferocity that all that remains is this iris, without even its vitreous body for company. You're such a brute!

items.name: Torpid Bearbarian Hair
items.description: This hair could make you a fortune if sold in Torpidbearbarianville. Unfortunately for you, there's no such place. At least that's what they say... The very mention of a place full of euphoric bearbarians makes you smile. We don't want to know why.

items.name: Rampant Bearbarian Wool
items.description: The Rampant Bearbarian is not known for having fresh feet. Now he'll be known for not having fresh sheets too.

items.name: Rampant Bearbarian Leather
items.description: Every time you look at this piece of leather, you can't help but hum that famous song by the Amaknian duo Lark and Mard: "Oh what a glorious thing to be, a healthy, grown-up, busy buzzy bee, whiling away the passing hours, pinching all the pollen from the corned-beef flowers".

items.name: Esurient Bearbarian Incisor
items.description: Still covered in honey, this incisor must be rotten to the pulp.

items.name: Esurient Bearbarian Fabric
items.description: Some people have the fabric of heroes. You have the fabric of an Esurient Bearbarian.

items.name: Vespal Bearbarian Wings
items.description: The death rate amongst young Vespal Bearbarians is very high, since their honey-covered wings tend to get stuck together when they're in flight. Their inability to fly well makes them excellent Kamikazes.

items.name: Vespal Bearbarian Antenna
items.description: The Vespal Bearbarians don't use this big antenna to communicate, but it does give them the opportunity to tie their enemies up easily.

items.name: Celestial Bearbarian Tail
items.description: If the Celestial Bearbarian's Tail doesn't stay a pristine white and if it touches the ground, or some honey, Frigost Island will be engulfed in ice five times over. Well, that's the Celestial Bearbarian's excuse for being carried around by a slave, anyway.

items.name: Celestial Bearbarian Hamate
items.description: The Celestial Bearbarian has broken this bone several times playing Growlf. Growlf is a game invented by the Bearbarians which consists of hitting small enemies into a hole using a sceptre. The prize for the Bearbarian who manages to do this in the least number of shots is a honey bath.

items.name: Mellifluous Bearbarian Tail
items.description: The Mellifluous Bearbarian's tail puffs up when it is upset. No Frigostian has ever had the chance to see it unpuff, sadly.

items.name: Mellifluous Bearbarian Calcaneus
items.description: As a result of tap-dance lessons, the Mellifluous Bearbarians' Calcanei have become incredibly resistant.

items.name: Kami Snowfoux Cornea
items.description: You can finally look the Kami Snowfoux in the eye without your bony knees knocking together.

items.name: Kami Snowfoux Incisor
items.description: This tooth smells just like your underwear and you've got a terrible pain in your buttocks. There must be a reason behind all this.

items.name: Snowfoux Tear
items.description: Having heard about the death of his mother, the Snowfoux shed this unique tear just before he himself shuffled off this mortal coil.

items.name: Kwakwa Beak
items.description: The Kwakwa is proud and majestic, but everyone knows that its beak stinks. Everyone apart from you, it seems. Maybe you should have thought a little harder before picking it up.

items.name: Kwakwa Feather
items.description: There's an old Osa nursery rhyme that tells of a Kwakwa with a khaki feather stuck to its kwokkwok. Unfortunately, the words don't mention what a kwokkwok is, nor where you can find such a thing.

items.name: Kwakwa's Nest Key
items.description: This key will allow you to study the Kwaks in their natural habitat, and who knows, you might even reach the summit.

items.name: Brumen Tinctorias's LaboRATory Key
items.description: This key, made from the remains of moorland creatures, goes perfectly with your clothes when you wear it around your neck.

items.name: Flask of Nelween Smoke
items.description: This smoke, collected from the corpse of Nelween, is highly volatile. Try not to breathe it in when you use it in a workshop as it can cause madness and hallucinations. No. No. Don't even think about it!

items.name: Nelween Down
items.description: You might not have recovered his precious smoke, but at least you managed to pull some of Nelween's hair off. It has no more power than the fabric of a Whitish Fang, but it's ever so shiny, and you know how distracted young adventurers get. I'm sure they'll pay a fair whack for it.

items.name: Kwismas Dungeon Key
items.description: This key was made by local craftsmen. Some of Kwismas Island's weaker monsters also have copies of it.

items.name: Kwismas Cavern Key
items.description: This key was made by local craftsmen. Some fairly tough monsters on Kwismas Island also have copies of it.

items.name: Father Kwismas's House Key
items.description: This key was made by local craftsmen. Some of Kwismas Island's strongest monsters also have copies of it.

items.name: Rogue Skull
items.description: You won't be blown away by this Rogue Skull. There's nothing astonishing about it either.

items.name: Masqueraider Skull
items.description: Since you can't use his mask, which refuses to come off, this Masqueraider skull can be worn as a hat. Unfortunately though, it also comes with a very bad smell which you can't get rid of.

items.name: Sphincter Cell's Lair Key
items.description: This key smells like dead rat and rotten snapper – just what you need to slip into Sphincter's lair unnoticed.

items.name: Gorgoyle Handle
items.description: This handle can be used to knock on a door to announce your presence. It also works very well on monsters or on boyfriends who are a little too forward.

items.name: Gorgoyle Fragment
items.description: Lousy Pigs suck on this fragment when they're near a willing female in order to test the specimen's durability. So what's it doing in your mouth?

items.name: Juvenile Mud
items.description: It seems that, since their business closed down, the confectioners Fer and Ro have had the ingenious idea of drying this mud, leaving pieces of Sauroshell in it, and offering it to the gods of the World of Twelve, claiming that they were the only ones worthy of eating this new 'chocolate'. The story doesn't say what the gods thought of this, but the goddess Eniripsa has been looking a little plumper since then.

items.name: Novice Mud
items.description: This thermospasmic mud is a cleaner's nightmare - if it gets on your clothes, the stains are so tough even a Piks machine can't get them out.

items.name: Mature Mud
items.description: Adventurers who want to hold off resorting to cosmetic surgery often cover themselves in this mud to prevent wrinkles. They forget, however, that this hardly makes them any more beautiful.

items.name: Venerable Mud
items.description: Ever since you've been carrying this mud around in your bag, a strange smell has been following you around, as if you've stepped in something. If I were you, I'd stay away from Eltneg Wood, in case a Trool falls in love with your delicate perfume.

items.name: Juvenile Powder
items.description: Young Enutrofs with too much imagination have tried to sell this powder by claiming it's Gourlo's explosive powder. Their scam might have worked too, if they hadn't fallen upon a hungry lion.

items.name: Novice Powder
items.description: This powder is the perfect addition to any apprentice alchemist's briefcase.

items.name: Mature Powder
items.description: Ecaflip women of a certain age use this powder to cover their greying fur. Unfortunately, their ruse is quickly uncovered when their potential one night stand rubs them up the wrong way.

items.name: Venerable Powder
items.description: This powder is used to make the famous Mont Noir pencils. Its rarity doesn't really explain their exorbitant prices though, or the ridiculous profits their manufacturers make.

items.name: Juvenile Ashes
items.description: If you were hoping to see a Sauroshell be reborn from these ashes, you're going to be waiting a long time.

items.name: Novice Ashes
items.description: These Ashes smell as bad as a pubescent Osamodas taking part in Captain Chafer's Panty Party.

items.name: Mature Ashes
items.description:
What's small, black, covered in soot and smells of sulphur?
The Mature Ashes of the Incandescent Sauroshell! Although, the answer 'Zeurg' would also be accepted.

items.name: Venerable Ashes
items.description: You won't have to look far to find the source of that barbecued Lousy Pig smell. These still hot and smoking ashes are burning your fur.

items.name: Juvenile Puddle
items.description: Here's an excellent weapon to use in a water bomb fight.

items.name: Novice Puddle
items.description: Thanks to its rich vitamin and salt mineral content, this water can make you a small fortune when sold in large enough quantities.

items.name: Mature Puddle
items.description: Cras really love water. When it trickles down, they say it tickles.

items.name: Venerable Puddle
items.description: Although small, this puddle can be a deadly trap for any Xelors who step in it. In fact, if they're not rescued quickly, they might drown in their own nostalgia. Blame the passing of time.

items.name: Juvenile Smoke
items.description: If you collect enough of this smoke, you'll be able to use it to make a screen.

items.name: Novice Smoke
items.description: Here's the proof you CAN have smoke without fire.

items.name: Mature Smoke
items.description: Smoking kills, and this Sauroshell's paying the price.

items.name: Venerable Smoke
items.description: This Sauroshell was just about to lay a magnificent Madreggon, but thanks to you, these dreams have gone up in smoke.

items.name: Sauroshell Egg Yolk
items.description: If you were in the Sauroshell's place right now, it would be no yolk, believe me.

items.name: Sauroshell Eye
items.description: Even dead, this eye continues to stare at you, reminding you of the very first time you met the in-laws. It's enough to make even the bravest adventurers shiver.

items.name: Sauroshell Shell
items.description: The content of this shell could have given you a very cheap Madreggon, but you chose to give it a horrible and painful death instead. What goes around, comes around, you know...

items.name: Sauroshell Fang
items.description: This long and pointy fang will be the envy of all your vampire friends. It is, after all, the size that counts.

items.name: Grozilla Dorsal Spine
items.description: Legend has it that Grozilla's front legs are so small because he's never been able to reached back to scratch his back without slicing a chunk off on his deadly dorsal spines. Really, though, they're just withered because he insists on killing his enemies by reducing them to ashes or swallowing them raw. All the same, this spine is mighty sharp.

items.name: Grozilla Ardent Bezoar
items.description: This magic bezoar, lodged in Grozilla's throat and burning eternally, is what enables him to spit fire. Lodged in your throat, you'll just cough your lungs out whilst running in circles and shrieking like a little sissy. Remember, wanting to be Grozilla won't make you Grozilla.

items.name: Black Stone of Vulkania
items.description: This stone is as black as a Trool's underpants. Luckily for your entourage, it doesn't give off the same smell. So you can't use it as an excuse to explain that nauseating stench that lingers around you.

items.name: Plastic Heart
items.description: This fake Sauroshell Heart has two uses. Children can fill in with Lousy Pig blood and use it as a water pistol by pointing the false artery at the target and squeezing it. As for the parents, this heart can be a welcome reminder of the heat on Vulkania Island when they're trembling from cold on Kwismas Island.

items.name: Billabone Cemetery Relic
items.description: Imbued with a powerful magic, each extremity of this relic shows the opposite direction to the other. So, it can tell you where the north and south are, or the east and west, simply by pointing the relic in the right direction. Now you think about, that salesman ripped you off, didn't he? What do you expect from a souvenir shop, though?

items.name: Holiday-maker Jam
items.description: This jam contains the vitamin-filled, spiced food that is associated with Vulkania Island. The package carries a somewhat unsettling warning though: May contain clothing.

items.name: Lyfflongen-Pross Pebble
items.description:
This crystal is very popular amongst adventurers and, in particular, Enutrofs because of the blessing it has been bestowed with. Some people claim it was made by the protector of Junssidor, Sumens, himself, which would explain its powerful magic.
Nevertheless, some less gullible academics claim it's a rip-off, also known as a tourist-trap.

items.name: Sauroshell Figurine
items.description: This figure is an excellent way of attracting dust to your desk. If you're as short on conscience as you are on cash, you can always sell it on to a tribe of Sauroshell simpletons.

items.name: Ardonite
items.description: This rare alloy gives off an energy powerful enough to fuel even the most demanding magical items, such as asymmetric bottle-openers or barycentre-less percolators, to cite just a couple of the better known examples.

items.name: Forest Substrate
items.description: This concentrate is obtained after cooking various boards that have been marinated in dubious brine. Any resemblance to your grandmother's recipes is pure coincidence.

items.name: Alteration Potion
items.description: The doctors advise you not to drink it, but your future heritors are all for it. Who to believe?

items.name: Damadrya's Bamboo Grove Key
items.description: This key would make a lousy toothpick but an excellent nose pick. It can therefore keep your hands (and nose) busy as you travel through the Damadrya's Bamboo Grove.

items.name: Crimson Pebble
items.description: You can skim this pebble beautifully across the surface of lakes or off the foreheads of people who are weaker than you.

items.name: Gleaming Pebble
items.description: This pebble will enable you to forge powerful items whilst preventing you from forging an opinion on the quantative theory of kamas.

items.name: Sparkling Pebble
items.description: This pebble looks like your own bald pate decorated with mashed firefly. That's all you have in common with it, though, because the pebble is magic.

items.name: Mineral Potion
items.description: Heavier than heavy water, this potion is perfect for keeping the fishes' heads above water so they don't drown.

items.name: Thicket Substrate
items.description: Chafer Axit was sprinkled with this liquid four times when he was still small and puny. I can't imagine a better start in life, can you?

items.name: Farmland Substrate
items.description: The association of retired but still very brave former firemen who now volunteer at Allister's castle would not recommend you use this liquid to put out fires. Unless you like adding fuel to the fire.

items.name: Redolph Pattern
items.description: This pattern can be used by craftsmen to make part of the Redolph Set.

items.name: Goblimp Pattern
items.description: This pattern can be used by craftsmen to make part of the Goblimp Set.

items.name: Kwismas Nightmare Pattern
items.description: This pattern can be used by craftsmen to make part of the Kwismas Nightmare Set.

items.name: Kwismas Dungeon Key Mould
items.description: Just like the mould you find on bread, this is not meant to be eaten.

items.name: Kwismas Cavern Key Mould
items.description: Like most moulds, this can be used by men and women alike. The difference is in the way it's used... which is the same for all users.

items.name: Father Kwismas's House Key Mould
items.description: Using this mould, you might just be able to make it into Father Kwismas's House. That doesn't mean you're going to make it out alive though.

items.name: Snowflake
items.description: This magical snowflake is a vital resource for crafting Kwismas items. Unfortunately, if you try to use it to cool down your suitors' enthusiasm it'll have no effect at all.

items.name: Blimpristed's Gusset
items.description: This underpant gusset is squeaky clean and smells like lavender, unlike your own.

items.name: Redolph's Red Nose
items.description: This blocked up nose is leaking a sticky substance that stinks of alcohol. Only the most reckless Pandawas would put it in their mouths.

items.name: Roachelf's Antennae
items.description: These antennae are highly sought-after by fishermen, perhaps because they start vibrating whenever there's phishing to be done. It's probably not a good idea to wear them at the Astrub, Amakna Village and Frigost Village Zaaps.

items.name: Oogie Betty's Braces
items.description: Sick of your reflection being ruined by your rotten teeth? Here's your chance to change your life! Pearly white smile and stray pieces of food getting stuck guaranteed.

items.name: Goblimp Joke
items.description: If you're a fan of fine dining and bad jokes, be prepared to let out a little whine.

items.name: Scarlet Kwismas Wrapping Paper
items.description: With this wrapping paper, you can create a gift package to give to anyone you like!

items.name: Wedding Wrapping Paper
items.description: This wrapping paper will allow you to create a beautiful gift package. You just need to decide who to give it to!

items.name: Birthday Wrapping Paper
items.description: This wrapping paper will allow you to create a beautiful gift package. You just need to decide who to give it to!

items.name: Apology Wrapping Paper
items.description: This wrapping paper will allow you to create a beautiful gift package. You just need to decide who to give it to!

items.name: Congratulations Wrapping Paper
items.description: This wrapping paper will allow you to create a beautiful gift package. You just need to decide who to give it to!

items.name: Love Wrapping Paper
items.description: This wrapping paper will allow you to create a beautiful gift package. You just need to decide who to give it to!

items.name: Friendship Wrapping Paper
items.description: This wrapping paper will allow you to create a beautiful gift package. You just need to decide who to give it to!

items.name: Fellowship Wrapping Paper
items.description: This wrapping paper will allow you to create a beautiful gift package. You just need to decide who to give it to!

items.name: Affection Wrapping Paper
items.description: This wrapping paper will allow you to create a beautiful gift package. You just need to decide who to give it to!

items.name: Corruption Wrapping Paper
items.description: This wrapping paper will allow you to create a beautiful gift package. You just need to decide who to give it to!

items.name: Tenderness Wrapping Paper
items.description: This wrapping paper will allow you to create a beautiful gift package. You just need to decide who to give it to!

items.name: Ribbum Wrapping Paper
items.description: This wrapping paper will allow you to create a beautiful gift package. You just need to decide who to give it to!

items.name: Surprise Wrapping Paper
items.description: This wrapping paper will allow you to create a beautiful gift package. You just need to decide who to give it to!

items.name: Snowy Kwismas Wrapping Paper
items.description: With this wrapping paper, you can create a gift package to give to anyone you like!

items.name: Starry Kwismas Wrapping Paper
items.description: With this wrapping paper, you can create a gift package to give to anyone you like!

items.name: Kwismas Minotoball Gift Package
items.description: This package was given to the Kwismas Minotoball because he was a good boy all year long. Incidentally, that's also the reason he gets to take several weeks' holiday every year in Descendre, to unwind by brawling merrily with any adventurers who cross his path.

items.name: Gift Label
items.description: This label has the name of the lucky recipient of the gift written on it. It can be attached at a Wrapping Station.

items.name: Ronin Chafer Thighbone
items.description: It is said that the weapons made from these black Ronin Chafer bones are so sharp that they can cut through butter. This time, it's not just a legend...

items.name: Draugur Chafer Jaw
items.description: The Draugur Chafer is known for the powerful noises he makes. Despite his lack of vocal cords, he produces the strangest of cries that sound somewhere between a gargle and an incredibly husky voice. You picked up his jaw as a souvenir of the joyous moments he brought you.

items.name: Primitive Chafer Helmet
items.description: This helmet is made of wood, even though metal and gemstones are much more fashionable; the horn is upside-down; it offers very little real protection... Yes siree, this headgear is just as primitive as its wearer - which is why it looks so good on you.

items.name: Smiths' Chest Lock
items.description: When you smashed the Smiths' Chest to smithereens to get the loot hidden inside, you didn't even notice that the lock attached to it was never actually locked. Obviously, your motto that day was: act first, think second. Iop would be proud of you.

items.name: Ice Powder
items.description: Sprinkle this powder into the underwear of your fellow adventurers who are just a bit too smooth-talking for their own good.

items.name: Bworker Nail
items.description: Too big to use as a lucky charm, too dirty to take pride of place on your mantelpiece... This is yet another item for you to stuff under your bed, amongst your dirty washing, to be lost for eternity.

items.name: Kimbo Sphenoid
items.description: You'll never manage to place this bone correctly on Kimbo's skeleton, even after profound anatomical studies. Maybe it's because Kimbo has never actually had a sphenoid...

items.name: Lord Crow Down
items.description: This eiderdown duvet allows the Master to keep warm, even if it is as cold as ice in his library.

items.name: Greater Bherb Feather
items.description: Worn on your arm, this feather is sure to tickle someone's fancy.

items.name: Minotot Ethmoid
items.description: This tiny bone from the Minotot's skull isn't the strongest, but it has never been broken thanks to the featherweight brain that it's used to supporting.

items.name: Chewed-Up Helmet
items.description: When the Key Master explained, with a wide grin, that this completely and utterly useless helmet was the finest gift he could possibly offer you, you thought he was joking. First Kin's relic, and now this - don't you deserve a better reward for all your efforts?! Still, might as well try to work out all the chinks, just in case.

items.name: Flask of Draconic Gas
items.description: This flask is filled with gas from a dragon's wounded colon. Only the most skilful craftsmen will be able to use it without putting themselves at risk.

items.name: Synthetic Leather
items.description: As well as being smoother than a Dragoturkey's bum cheeks and more resistant than an Enutrof's hairpiece, this leather is also an excellent insulator. That's probably why Frigostians use it to gag their wives, children and mothers-in-law.

items.name: Foggernaut Skull
items.description: This unlucky Fogger took one gulp too many. All the more reason to use his empty skull as a cup!

items.name: Al Howin's Vegetable Patch Key
items.description: This key will allow you to get into Al Howin's Vegetable Patch, but only during Pumpkwin season (one month starting from the day that Al Howin touches back down in Amakna).

items.name: Al Howin's False Teeth
items.description: This is what will happen to your teeth if you eat too many treats on Al Howin's Day, kiddywinkles!

items.name: Al Howin's Bristly Sideburns
items.description: Sideburns were banned on the Amaknian continent at the same time as Al Howin. They're now considered even more of an atrocity than Al's famous curse.

items.name: Cursed Pumpkwin Seeds
items.description: If you plant these seeds and wait a few months, you'll soon see a horde of Cursed Pumpkwins come at you, snapping for your head. Why aren't they very popular again...?

items.name: Zoth Smoke Machine
items.description: This smoke machine is supposed to be the cause of the mist that constantly surrounds the Zoth Village and the Canopy. Some people say that Zoth Disciples' heads are all full of mist too, but nobody dares say that to their faces.

items.name: Counterfeit Royal Seal
items.description: This fake but very real-looking seal might just help out those that aren't too bothered about having the real deal. Getting caught with this seal will result in a century of imprisonment.

items.name: Rat Shio Pustule
items.description: At first glance, it looks like a tasty roll fresh from the oven perched on your head. Feel free to taste it, but remember that appearances can be deceiving! Caution, may burst and splatter unexpectedly.

items.name: Sewer Keeper Leg
items.description: This hairy, greasy leg is just downright dirty. Were you hoping to pick your nose with it? You might make matters worse...

items.name: Bad Boy Tattoo
items.description: This tattoo comes from some unfortunate beefcake. It seems to have been bitten off... It's no doubt a souvenir taken by a sentimental murderer.

items.name: Sailor Knot
items.description: This knot is very popular with sailors and will win the hearts of young girls who dream of adventure.

items.name: Seasonal Pebble
items.description: This little pebble is warm in spring, hot in summer, cool in autumn and icy cold in winter. Some people refuse flat out to believe that this is possible, whilst others spend as long marvelling at it as they do choosing their first set.

items.name: Lunar Pebble
items.description: This pebble is named for the curious light that it gives off, which makes it look like the moon. It doesn't glow in the dark, so there's no point taking it with you for your midnight encounters.

items.name: Solar Pebble
items.description: Please make sure nobody ever throws this pebble at your head. Not only will it leave a nasty bump; it could also give you sunburn.

items.name: Beach Towel
items.description: This towel can be used for beach tanning, rubbing down sandy-skinned Sadidas or soaking up Ecaflip gambling debts. It's so absorbant it would also make a great mop.

items.name: Golden Dragoturkey Wing
items.description: This atrophied wing won't give you the power to fly, nor can you use it to knock out your enemies. It is, however, the perfect prosthetic for Eniripsa who have torn their own wings.

items.name: Dopple Mirror
items.description: The reflection that you see in this mirror is deformed by your darkest thoughts. Another reason to believe that beauty isn't on the inside.

items.name: Ouassingue Slobber
items.description: The legend says that the aroma produced by this slobber is a blend of all the smells in the World. A real pot pourri of fragrances that will make you want to carve your nostrils out.

items.name: Family Relic
items.description: Several stories explain how this relic was passed down from generation to generation. Is it a cursed pasta necklace made by a schoolchild for Mother's Day, knicker elastic stolen from a grave by a tomb profaner, or a fossilised bogey rosary? Only an expert will be able to tell you that.

items.name: Capoei Rat Shorts
items.description: Adventurer, with these shorts, you're finally ready to practice capoeira.

items.name: Ratter Tail
items.description: Chinese whispers around the sewers are saying that a Ratter's caudal appendage is able to triple in size when rubbed up the right way. Given the way that the owner of this example was treated, it's hard to tell.

items.name: Prize Fin
items.description: Some years ago, swimmers participating in the Krozolympiks decided to fix snapper fins onto their swimming costumes to improve their performance. Following a rather painful accident where one of the athletes put his trunks on inside-out, this technique has been strictly forbidden. Anyone caught violating this rule will be sent straight back to the locker room.

items.name: Adventurer Skull
items.description: According to the Reapalaks, Adventurer Skulls are better than Kaliptus Wood in two ways: they can be harvested all year long without causing deforestation and they are just as hard. Whether you use it as a decorative ornament or as building material for sinister edifices, you can't deny that this is a fantastic item.

items.name: Hazwonarm Headband
items.description: This accessory, appreciated amongst pirates, can be used as an eye-patch, a nose-patch or a privates-patch, depending on the size and occasion.

items.name: Uchiwang Ribbon
items.description: If you see an Uchiwang tie a ribbon around her hair, you can bet she's just invented a new technique for tearing you apart.

items.name: Miremop Tooth
items.description: The Miremop is the owner of a fine (if dangerous) set of gnashers that it uses to nibble on the fingers and toes of curious adventurers who get lost in the peat bogs. Who knew something so soft could bite so hard?

items.name: Zoth Girl's Toy
items.description: What kind of Iop brain would let a child play with a toy like this?

items.name: Emerald Larva Tooth
items.description: This tooth would make the perfect lucky charm for your emerald wedding anniversary; it wards off evil spirits and halitosis.

items.name: Glacial Fluid
items.description: Glacial Fluid, which is much loved by practical jokers, is also useful for cooling down the rampant ardour of randy Wabbits and Dragostesses with a little too much fire in their bellies.

items.name: Zoth Pipe
items.description: There's no better way to steady your nerves than by taking a puff or two from a peace pipe such as this one. An old legend says that the clouds that float in the sky were actually created by the accumulation of smoke from the Zoth Village.

items.name: Minokid Horn
items.description: Seen in the personals section of the Daily Maze: "LOST: one horn after a dishonest fight with a belligerent adventurer. Whoever finds it will be rewarded with a free go with my sceptre and a guided tour of the labyrinth."

items.name: Suspicious Pouch
items.description: To your great disappointment, there aren't any kamas in this pouch. It contains a few scraps of lead, a handful of peculiarly shaped dice and an old pencil with the rubber half chewed off. Probably the elements required for some kind of suspicious, demonic ritual.

items.name: Caramel Rabmajoke #1
items.description:
"What cheese do you use to encourage a Celestial Bearbarian?
Camembert!"

items.name: Short-Tempered Dark Treechnid Bud
items.description: These buds will nip you in the bud!

items.name: Healing Branch Leaf
items.description: This leaf is as soft as an Eniripsa's hands. It's unfortunate that its odour is more like that of a retired Foggernaut's diving suit.

items.name: Caramel Rabmajoke #4
items.description:
"What do you call cheese that isn't yours?
Nacho cheese."

items.name: Caramel Rabmajoke #8
items.description:
"What does cheese say to itself in the mirror?
Halloumi."

items.name: Caramel Rabmajoke #2
items.description:
"Why are Prancing Chimeras so happy?
Because they eat what bugs them!"

items.name: Caramel Rabmajoke #3
items.description:
"What's the nicest thing a Kanniball can say to a girl?
You look good enough to eat!"

items.name: Caramel Rabmajoke #5
items.description:
"Why do Masqueraiders have such a hard time making friends?
Because they're always two-faced."

items.name: Caramel Rabmajoke #6
items.description:
"How do you get out of the Asse Sea?
Wet!"

items.name: Caramel Rabmajoke #7
items.description:
"What does Alit Elfminate say when a customer gets too demanding?
Suit yourself!"

items.name: Strawberry Rabmajoke #1
items.description:
Why did the vampire's lunch give him heartburn?
It was a stake sandwich.

items.name: Strawberry Rabmajoke #2
items.description:
"What do you give a sick Piwi?
Tweetment."

items.name: Strawberry Rabmajoke #3
items.description:
"How does a Pingwin build its house?
Igloos it together!"

items.name: Strawberry Rabmajoke #4
items.description:
"What's the most musical part of a Cheeken?
The drumstick."

items.name: Strawberry Rabmajoke #5
items.description:
"If you had 8 Apis in one hand, and 5 Apis in the other, what would you have?
Really big hands!"

items.name: Strawberry Rabmajoke #6
items.description:
"What's orange and sounds a bit like a parrot?
A Cawwot!"

items.name: Strawberry Rabmajoke #7
items.description:
"Why did Kelog Hornflex stop making doughnuts?
He was bored with the hole business!"

items.name: Strawberry Rabmajoke #8
items.description:
"What is the librarian Hippolyte Thermia's favourite vegetable?
Quiet peas!"

items.name: Lemon Rabmajoke #1
items.description:
"What do Ghasts eat on Al Howin's Day?
Ghoulash!"

items.name: Lemon Rabmajoke #2
items.description:
"Why can't you starve on Otomai Island?
Because of the sand which is there."

items.name: Lemon Rabmajoke #3
items.description:
"What do you give a sick Boar?
Oink-ment."

items.name: Lemon Rabmajoke #4
items.description:
"What do you call a legless Bow Wow?
You don't. You have to go and get it yourself!"

items.name: Lemon Rabmajoke #5
items.description:
"What did the Flax Flower say to the Edelweiss?
What's up, bud?"

items.name: Lemon Rabmajoke #6
items.description: "A hungry Sufokian goes to a restaurant in Madrestam and asks: 'Do you serve crabs here?' The owner replies, 'We serve everyone, sir.'"

items.name: Lemon Rabmajoke #7
items.description:
"What do you get if you divide the circumference of a Pumpkwin by its diameter?
Pumpkwin Pi!"

items.name: Lemon Rabmajoke #8
items.description:
"What do you call a girl with a Prancing Chimera on her head?
Lily!"

items.name: Orange Rabmajoke #1
items.description:
"How do Treechnids get on the Internet?
They log in!"

items.name: Orange Rabmajoke #2
items.description:
"How do you know if the YeCh'Ti is under your bed?
Your nose touches the ceiling!"

items.name: Orange Rabmajoke #3
items.description:
"What has one hundred heads and one hundred tails?
One hundred kamas."

items.name: Orange Rabmajoke #4
items.description:
"What always comes at the end of Fanks Givingue?
The letter 'e'!"

items.name: Orange Rabmajoke #5
items.description:
"What's the best method of transport at Fleaster time?
Itch-hiking!"

items.name: Orange Rabmajoke #6
items.description:
"Why is Jon Lemon always so cool?
Because he has so many fans!"

items.name: Orange Rabmajoke #7
items.description:
"What's the most musical part of a Kittenfish?
The scales!"

items.name: Orange Rabmajoke #8
items.description:
"How many months have 28 days?
All of them."

items.name: Kola Rabmajoke #1
items.description:
"Why did the Iopette sit on the clock?
To be on time!"

items.name: Kola Rabmajoke #2
items.description:
"What smells the best at a Skank Hivin dinner?
Your nose!"

items.name: Kola Rabmajoke #3
items.description:
"Why are Vampires tough to get along with?
Because they can be a pain in the neck!"

items.name: Kola Rabmajoke #4
items.description:
"How do you fix a Worm-O'-Lantern?
With a Pumpkwin patch!"

items.name: Kola Rabmajoke #5
items.description:
"What do Frigostians eat for lunch?
Ice berg-gers!"

items.name: Kola Rabmajoke #6
items.description:
"How does a Pingwin make pancakes?
With its flippers!"

items.name: Kola Rabmajoke #7
items.description:
"What is a Prancing Chimera's favourite cold drink?
Croak-a-cola!"

items.name: Kola Rabmajoke #8
items.description:
"Why did Kerub run from the tree?
Because he was afraid of the bark!"

items.name: Nougat Rabmajoke #1
items.description:
"Two antennas met on a roof, fell in love and got married. The ceremony wasn't much...
But the reception was excellent."

items.name: Nougat Rabmajoke #2
items.description:
"What do Bow Wows eat at the cinema?
Pupcorn."

items.name: Nougat Rabmajoke #3
items.description:
"How do Foggernauts like their vegetables?
Steamed!"

items.name: Nougat Rabmajoke #4
items.description: "There are two Catbreads baking in the oven. One says to the other, 'By Ecaflip, it's hot in here!' The second replies, 'Holy Crab! A talking Catbread!'"

items.name: Nougat Rabmajoke #5
items.description:
"What's an Osamodas's favourite food?
Whipped cream!"

items.name: Nougat Rabmajoke #6
items.description:
"What kind of book does a Wabbit like to read?
One with a hoppy ending!"

items.name: Nougat Rabmajoke #7
items.description:
"What's stupider than a Iop?
Several Iops!"

items.name: Nougat Rabmajoke #8
items.description:
"What's the difference between a Babbage leaf and a bogey?
You'd never convince a Goblin to eat a Babbage leaf!"

items.name: Magic Snapper
items.description: This curious Snapper lives in the depths, but sometimes comes to the surface when attracted by rays of sunlight. Fishermen say it is endowed with various powers, including that of making skin oily and shiny.

items.name: Sapphire Larva Skin
items.description: This skin is doted with a particular magic: it glows in the dark when lit up.

items.name: Emerald Larva Skin
items.description: This larva skin between keeps friendship green.

items.name: Ruby Larva Skin
items.description: This skin was the principal material used whilst renovating the Xelor Temple's clock mechanism.

items.name: Golden Larva Skin
items.description: Wild Enutrofs love to wear coats made of Golden Larva Skin because it makes them feel rich.

items.name: Kerub Hair
items.description: No, this isn't Bow Meow hair, but Ecaflip hair. And not just any Ecaflip... It grew on the illustrious Kerub Crepin himself. It's highly unlikely that he'll be asking for it back so it's completely up to you to decide what you want to do with it.

items.name: Koalak Warrior Hair
items.description: Koalaks don't go to school, so the Koalak Warrior didn't have the opportunity to become the playground bully. It has, therefore, decided to take revenge on random adventurers and become the Agony V'Helley bully.

items.name: Bloody Koalak Tuft
items.description: The Bloody Koalak only has hairs this long on two parts of its body. These look like they sprouted from his head... Or at least that's what you'll continue telling yourself...!

items.name: Wild Koalak Scarf
items.description: The Wild Koalak doesn't wear this scarf to look like a bandit, but rather to mask its horrific, Bwork-killing breath!

items.name: Purple Warko Used Nappy
items.description: You can tell how wise a Purple Warko is by the number of nappies it goes through each day. The more often it changes them, the wiser it is. Studying habits really is an interesting little thing!

items.name: Emeralda's Skeunk Autograph
items.description: If you give this powerful artefact to a female Sadida, something rather strange will happen: she'll swallow a name change potion and start calling herself Emeralda. If you give it to a male Sadida, its effects are stranger still, because he'll swallow a sex change potion instead.

items.name: Sapphira's Hairpin
items.description: This hairpin is the only hair accessory that supports the weight of Sapphira's barnet. You find it has a better use as a tool for pinning down the most ferocious opponents.

items.name: Tuft of Ruby's Hair
items.description: We're not entirely sure which part of Ruby's body these tufts come from, nor how they were detached. What we do know, however, is that they smell of sea salt, despite the sea being far, far away from Koalak Mountain!

items.name: Diamondine's Damaged Boomerang
items.description: This boomerang is in as pathetic a state as Brakmar's expansionist policy, which is exactly why Diamondine got rid of it.

items.name: Emeralda's Diary
items.description: This diary reveals the unsuspected secrets of Emeralda's life that would make even Mitomiel, the Meridia of Shamelessness, pale with jealousy.

items.name: Sapphira's Kaliptus Shampoo
items.description: This shampoo gives a particular shine to Sapphira's hair, and even a particular odour.

items.name: Ruby's Reminder
items.description: Ruby uses this reminder to jog her memory. She often forgets her name and is forced to repeat "Ruby, Ruby, Ruby, Rubyyyy".

items.name: Diamondine's Concert Ticket
items.description: This ticket for Skeunk's first ever concert has expired. Now you finally have the ideal excuse to drown your sorrows in a barrel of Bamboo Milk.

items.name: Sapphire Larva Tooth
items.description: Dipped in Mimilk, this tooth would make the perfect breakfast for your sapphire wedding anniversary.

items.name: Ruby Larva Tooth
items.description: A necklace of these teeth would make the perfect accessory for your ruby wedding anniversary.

items.name: Golden Larva Tooth
items.description: Set in your loved one's dentures, this tooth would make the perfect gift for your golden wedding anniversary.

items.name: Ugly Tofu Beak
items.description: The only advantage of putting this beak in your mouth would be to shut you up and give your team mates some peace and quiet.

items.name: Ugly Tofu Tuft
items.description: Once upon a time, there was a shy little Tofu quite unlike the others: for one thing, he was the only one in the village with fur. Teased mercilessly by his peers, he ran away, hoping that adulthood would set him free. But it never did.

items.name: Blastofu Ashes
items.description: The Blastofu is apparently capable of being reborn from its ashes. Since they've changed hands, these ones might not work any more.

items.name: Tofuzmo Feather Duster
items.description: The Tofuzmo used this feathery ruff to look cool and rebellious. Sadly, it just makes you look like another teenager who hasn't quite got to grips with puberty.

items.name: Blastofu Ember
items.description: This ember, which is as hot as an Astrubian transvestite in Incarnam, is far from ready to let itself go out. Tsss! Can't touch this!

items.name: Tofuzmo Rump
items.description: This rump got spanked more than I ever have, you can't help thinking as you look down at it in your inventory.

items.name: Tofubine Feather
items.description: The Tofubine was so busy cavorting with the Royal Tofu that she dropped a few feathers, which you were quick to pick up.

items.name: Tofubine Egg
items.description: This egg might contain a future Royal Tofu! Then again, it might contain an Ugly Tofu. This particular Tofie's choice isn't that difficult at all.

items.name: Podgy Tofu Leg
items.description: Apparently Jon Lemon wrote his seminal song "More Eating Good (This Podgy Tofu Has Flown)" whilst gnawing on one of these legs.

items.name: Atrophied Podgy Tofu Wing
items.description: This wing is more atrophied than a Iop's brain and an Enutrof's sense of generosity put together.

items.name: Marine Conch
items.description: If you lift this conch to your ear and listen, you'll hear the roar of the ocean. If you lift this conch to your mouth and blow, you'll hear the roar of the militiamen who have come to arrest you for bursting everyone's eardrums.

items.name: Suntan Lotion
items.description: Some people claim that a suntan is a sign of good health. Others disagree with this plainly preposterous notion, but the god Ju has taken steps to shut them up. Halcyon days if you've got leathery, burnt skin!

items.name: Starfish Eyelid
items.description: Some starfish have stars in their eyes, while others turn their eyes to the stars. As for the starfish on the Asse Coast, well, they only have eyes for the muscle-bound adventurers who strut along the beaches in the summer.

items.name: Carbon Paper
items.description: Dopples use dark paper like this to create copies of anything they can lay their grubby hands on. Ancient engravings, love letters or graffiti in public toilets: anything will do. What does it mean? Is it a sign of the Dopples' over-developed instinct to reproduce? Or maybe it just shows that they're incorrigible copycats.

items.name: Seed of Contention
items.description: Sown by troublemakers and the god Mikart, these seeds germinate rapidly and grow into large plants surprisingly quickly. Dark Bakers use slices of the plants' fruits to garnish their pies, and then delight in throwing them at your face.

items.name: Medicinal Stone
items.description: According to the legend, the Dok Alakos were so intent on finding the very best Medicinal Stones the world had to offer that they dug and dug and dug, until their mountain was criss-crossed with ravines. Only Enutrofs and baby Koalaks actually believe that tosh, of course.

items.name: Old Kralove Sucker
items.description: Mopeats will pick anything up, probably because they've lived with the Giant Kralove for so long. If you believe the rumours, this old sucker has magic powers, and is worshipped by a tribe of particularly cretinous Wabbits. On a more practical note, it comes in very handy for unblocking toilets.

items.name: Zoth Abacus
items.description: If you're the kind of pernickety Feca who hates having to pay an equal share of the bar tab when you've only had a glass of water and a packet of crisps, but your Iop friends have had a full five-course meal and drunk the bar dry, then this abacus will be right up your street.

items.name: Sewer Keeper Eye
items.description: What gloomy horrors has this eye witnessed? You'll probably never know, and it's probably just as well.

items.name: Mama Bwork Boil
items.description: When you compress the sides of this boil between your fingers, you'll cause a yellowish liquid with unknowable properties to ooze out. In public, you claim that you'd never do something so gross, but statistics show that 77% of people take a perverse pleasure in doing it in private.

items.name: Mama Bwork Leather Thong
items.description: The Mama Bwork saves her leather thong for special occasions such as stag nights. She graciously passed it on to you so that you can carry on her trade when she's gone.

items.name: Holey Fire Bandana
items.description: The merchant who sold you this bandana swore blind that the bullet hole was real.

items.name: Red Boxers
items.description: The Bwork who used to own these boxers was something of a hygienic dunce. Please don't look to him for a role model.

items.name: Holey Earth Bandana
items.description: The hole in this bandana is big enough for you to fit three or four of your fingers through. Which means it should be big enough for... But no. You mustn't.

items.name: Brown Boxers
items.description: The Bwork who used to own these boxers caught a case of the McSheth. Please don't wear them on your head.

items.name: Holey Water Bandana
items.description: Unfortunately, wearing this bandana won't stop your good ideas from flying away.

items.name: Blue Boxers
items.description: The Bwork who used to own these boxers used to keep blue spimush in them. Yeah. That's where that nasty rash came from.

items.name: Holey Air Bandana
items.description: It's no good wearing this bandana if you want to avoid getting a head cold.

items.name: White Boxers
items.description: The Bwork who used to own these boxers had impeccable personal hygiene. You should follow his example.

items.name: Cybwork Bolt
items.description: It's no good shutting the stable door after the horse has bolted, but really, if the Cybwork had been more careful with his hardware, he wouldn't be so screwed over now.

items.name: Cybwork Briefs
items.description: The Cybwork is like a walking testosterone factory: these briefs smell like the gym at home time.

items.name: Frigostian Jeweller Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Butcher Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Baker Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Handyman Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Shoemaker Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Sword Smith Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Shield Smith Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Dagger Smith Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Axe Smith Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Hammer Smith Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Shovel Smith Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Fishmonger Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Bow Carver Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Wand Carver Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Staff Carver Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Frigostian Tailor Bag
items.description: This bag is full of resources prized by Frigostian craftsmen.

items.name: Harrogant Eye
items.description: Get this horror grafted onto your forehead, and your arrogance will reach the heights of Mount Scauldron.

items.name: Harrogant Pants
items.description: Even the briefest glance at this shoddy fabric will tell you that it ought to have been thrown out years ago. But who'd say no to such a soft, stretchy pair of leather pants?

items.name: Dumple Leather
items.description: You should have gone easy on the poor soul that gave up this leather. Dumples aren't known for their intelligence. In fact, they have very little going for them at all.

items.name: Dumple Fabric
items.description: Even the stupidest creatures in the World of Twelve have the right to cover up with a bit of fabric. So keep your chin up!

items.name: Putchup Brain
items.description: There's not much to this brain, but it brings back vivid memories of the sight of your Iop uncle's brain from that day you all went to the Kanniballs' trepanning festival on Moon Island. Good times.

items.name: Putchup Leather
items.description: This leather was chosen for its wonderful resistance, and not because it was the only scrap left on the factory floor.

items.name: Asteraw Leather
items.description: This leather smells like straw, and the Asteraw's straw smells like leather. the old Tofu and egg paradox again!

items.name: Asteraw Heart
items.description: As you move your hand and its murderous contents into a shaft of daylight, you realise with a jolt that this creature had a heart. Perhaps it was not so different from you. Perhaps it had hopes, ambitions, regrets. Stricken with sudden repulsion, you sink to your knees and wail.

items.name: Leatherball Leather
items.description: If the Leatherball were a little smaller, it would fit into a mouth. You're so used to the World of Twelve that this image doesn't even shock you.

items.name: Leatherball Tooth
items.description: This tooth is the perfect illustration of why you should never put your hand into an unknown mouth, even if it is to impress a girl.

items.name: Klime's Moustache
items.description: On his days off, Klime wears a tight-fitting t-shirt that reads "5% leather, 95% moustache". How depleted must he be feeling right now?

items.name: Klime's Scalp
items.description: Placed carefully over your nascent bald spot, this little treasure will take three weeks off you, easy!

items.name: Potbellion Blood
items.description: This brute's blood can't even be used to make black pudding. Outrageous!

items.name: Potbellion Molar
items.description: An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth - or in your case, a tooth for an uncomfortably large chunk of your right buttock.

items.name: Stalak Incisor
items.description: Stalaks are eager, messy eaters, and in a confused blur of teeth and flesh, they often bite their own tongues. You did the owner of this ridiculously sharp incisor a favour by pulling it out. They would say thank you, but you killed them.

items.name: Stalak Ethmoid
items.description: This bone was broken on more than one occasion when the young Stalak still played Gobbowl. You know what they say about Gobbowl, though: "Them's the breaks!"

items.name: Karkanik Blood
items.description: Not even a vampire would drink this stuff.

items.name: Karkanik Malleus
items.description: Karkaniks boast that they can fire their arrows faster than their opponents' shadows can move - but not this one, it would seem.

items.name: Skateman Incus
items.description: The incus, or anvil, is the anvil-shaped ossicle in the Skateman's middle ear. Your mum told me an anvil fell on your cot when you were a baby. I'm guessing it wasn't this one.

items.name: Skateman Brain
items.description: Skateman Brain is inedible - who would have thought? Well, not the Skateman any more, that's for sure.

items.name: Revish Stapes
items.description: The stapes is the smallest bone in the Revish's body. This particular example was shattered into tiny pieces during a recent Jon Lemon concert.

items.name: Revish Moustache
items.description: Ridiculous moustaches were all the rage before you were born, so have some respect for those of us who are still brave enough to wear one!

items.name: Missiz Freezz's Armpit Hair
items.description: And to think, she didn't even say thank you for the free hair removal you gave her!

items.name: Missiz Freezz's Underpants
items.description: Missiz Freezz likes to keep a spare pair of underpants in her pocket in case she gets knocked down by a Skaterman and has to be carted off to the nearest medical centre. Spare or worn, you're just happy to add them to your burgeoning collection.

items.name: Nessil Slobber
items.description: A thorough analysis of this slobber shows that Nessil should really think about flossing a lot more regularly.

items.name: Nessil Molar
items.description: The last dentist who attempted to treat this tooth was found at the bottom of a lake, wearing a skirt and reeking of whisky.

items.name: Krackal Canine
items.description: You're almost certain that this tooth is false, because it reminds you of the 'diamond' ring you gave to your sweetheart in the Astrub Inn. There was definitely a whiff of lavender about that marriage.

items.name: Krackal Mane
items.description: The Krackal's mane is so glossy, because it's worth it.

items.name: Dodox Feather
items.description: "But why would a bird that can't fly need feathers?" Those were the last words of an adventurer who tore out his own heart because he hated everyone.

items.name: Dodox Beak
items.description: It's not unusual for a Dodox to become particularly attached to passing adventurers, especially by its beak.

items.name: Thermite Leg
items.description: A Thermite has six legs, so it's not like it's going to miss one, is it?

items.name: Thermite Carapace
items.description: Judging by the marks on this carapace, it looks like some adventurers may have mistaken it for an ashtray.

items.name: Snowdew Bract
items.description: Do carnivorous plants taste of meat?

items.name: Snowdew Sepal
items.description: Snowdews love the taste of fresh meat, so you've got nothing to be worried about.

items.name: Nileza's Embroidery
items.description: You knew that Nileza wore embroidered pants even before the fight started, and luckily for you, the secret of how you came by that piece of information will now never be revealed.

items.name: Nileza's Buttonhole
items.description: This strange invention is very handy if you know how to use it, but potentially very painful if you don't.

items.name: Kan-O-Mat Canine
items.description: If you'd have known just how eager Kan-O-Mats are to bite dentists, you might not have killed so many of them.

items.name: Kan-O-Mat Claw
items.description: When a Kan-O-Mat feels sad, it scratches its claws on Count Harebourg's tapestries. When a Kan-O-Mat feels happy, it scratches its claws on Count Harebourg's tapestries as well. Any resemblance to real persons in your guild, living or dead, is purely coincidental.

items.name: Tinkerbear Maxilla
items.description: Tinkerbears will happily use a fallen comrade's maxilla as a vice when something needs repairing. Not everything can be fixed that way, especially not that tattoo you've got on your left bumcheek. Yes, the one you had done as a declaration of love for your sweetheart who left you broken-hearted a couple of days later.

items.name: Tinkerbear Tail
items.description: By pulling regularly on its tail, a Tinkerbear can increase its output dramatically for several days. I know what you're thinking, but trust me, it won't work.

items.name: Pingwinch Beak
items.description: I know you were keen for that Pingwinch to stop sticking its beak in, but was cutting it off really necessary?

items.name: Pingwinch Sternum
items.description: The ribs that were attached to this sternum were delicious, but they would have tasted even better if you'd defeated its owner yourself. Watching your fights on Frigost, it's difficult to know whether you're the hunter or the hunted.

items.name: Mecanofoux Astragalus
items.description: This bone was specially designed to adapt to the changing size of Mecanofoux ankles. The poor creatures suffer from a terrible inferiority complex, and are very sensitive about the size of their bones. You can readily sympathise with that sentiment, so I'm sure you'll put this to good use.

items.name: Mecanofoux Ear
items.description: This small, mechanical ear is incredibly realistic and will filter out any unwanted noises, selectively hearing only what it wants to hear. Its inventor was directly inspired by the ears of her husband.

items.name: Serpulax Volva
items.description: This membrane concealed the Surpulax's most intimate mechanisms, but you were deeply disappointed by what you saw when you tugged it away. Instead of attempting to seduce you, this mechanical handyman should have stuck to the day job.

items.name: Serpulax Peduncle
items.description: You can eat this peduncle shredded, boiled, smoked or even stewed, but the results will be the same – you'll be leaving Count Harebourg's castle on a stretcher. Mind you, that's no different than any other adventurer who's attempted to defeat him.

items.name: Frozen Heart
items.description: This heart doesn't need to be preserved in the fridge; it's already as cold as a Rattedaugue's insincere salutations. Since the disappearance of the Ice Cracklers, hearts like this one have been in great demand by Frigostian organ smugglers.

items.name: Oni Leather
items.description: In days gone by, the Onis haunted the Mystified Forest, where they would torment adventurers by telling them the opposite of what they actually meant. After the big freeze, they all but disappeared, which is why this leather has become so rare.

items.name: Tunder Alloy
items.description: This Frigostian alloy was frozen solid in a barrel of beer when the curse struck. That explains why not even the best miners can craft it and only master jewellers can use it without cracking it.

items.name: Sylargh's Wool
items.description: This wool kept Sylargh warm while he worked outside until the fateful day he developed a terrible phobia of snowflakes.

items.name: Sylargh's Incisor
items.description: This hollow tooth is almost as rusty as your social skills.

items.name: Bubotron Feather
items.description: The Frigostian bourgeoisie love to pluck these feathers from Bubotrons and use them to adorn their hats. Count Harebourg loves to pluck these feathers from the Frigostian bourgeoisie and uses them to adorn his Bubotrons.

items.name: Bubotron Beak
items.description: One decent hammer blow is all it takes to open this beak. Two blows and you'll break it, three and you're likely to lose a finger, statistically speaking.

items.name: Treadfast Claw
items.description: This razor-sharp claw cuts flesh with disconcerting ease, which is why Treadfasts don't shake hands with the people they meet. Well, that and the fact that they can't stand on one leg.

items.name: Treadfast Beak
items.description: Treadfasts won't hesitate to peck the backsides of anyone who attempts to enter Count Harebourg's castle uninvited, so if you've got flawless buttocks it can only mean one thing - you're either a lamentable adventurer, or you're one of the Count's followers. So which one are you?

items.name: Cycloid Eye
items.description: Cycloids can spot mechanical defects with an unerring accuracy, so it's no surprise that this eye is staring directly at you.

items.name: Cycloid Feather
items.description: Cycloid feathers make excellent feather dusters, and the owner of this particular example will be only too pleased to attack you, once it's finished the housework.

items.name: Sinistrofu Wing
items.description: You wanted to find out if Sinistrofus can fly with only one wing, so you pulled this off a passing owl and threw the poor bird from the walls of Count Harebourg's castle. The landing looked particularly painful. Now you can rip the other one off and see if it can fly with no wings at all.

items.name: Sinistrofu Tail
items.description: All the birds in the courtyard laugh at this tiny tail, your mother-in-law included.

items.name: Nocturnowl Wing
items.description: When it comes to poultry, there are usually two camps: breast or thigh. You appear to have chosen wing.

items.name: Nocturnowl Spike
items.description: This spike acts as a lightning conductor when the Nocturnowl is struck by a bolt from the blue.

items.name: Count Harebourg's Scapula
items.description: This shard of scapula burst through the Count's bandages like ideas pop into your head - painfully.

items.name: Count Harebourg's Bandages
items.description: Icy yet warm, clean yet sullied by insults. You're still not convinced the Count deserved his fate.

items.name: Missiz Freezz's Frostforge Key
items.description: This key won't unlock Missiz Freezz's chastity belt, but it will unlock the door to her dungeon.

items.name: Sylargh's Carrier Key
items.description: You had to wrench this key from that Handyman's hands, the cheeky little monkey.

items.name: Klime's Private Suite Key
items.description: This key will show you what you can do with some leather, a little imagination, and a great deal of perversion.

items.name: Nileza's Laboratory Key
items.description: There might be some powerful potions in Nileza's laboratory, although they probably taste foul. You'll just have to try them all to find out.

items.name: Count Harebourg's Dungeon Key
items.description: You won't be able to wind up any clocks with this key, but it'll certainly let you wind up the Count.

items.name: Crystalline Root
items.description: This root, full to the brim with alchemical nutrients, is difficult to harvest as it crystallises in the ground.

items.name: New Bolt
items.description: Like your brain, this bolt has never been used, but unlike your brain, it will serve some purpose during its short existence.

items.name: Zipper
items.description: This little beauty is Klime's genius incarnate. You can use it to zip up a pocket, your leather coat, or that flap in the seat of your pants.

items.name: Frozen Spores
items.description: If you look more closely at the fungal spores trapped in this chunk of ice, you can see some tiny pubic lice larvae in there as well. The fact that they were recovered from Missiz Freezz's private rooms is surely just an unfortunate coincidence.

items.name: Glass Eye
items.description: This is an exact replica of the eye Missiz Freezz's first, last and only butler lost when he peeped through her bedroom keyhole. Curiosity kills more than cats.

items.name: Grozilla Scale
items.description: The newspapers are filled with Grozilla and Grasmera's doings, and handbags made with their scales are must-have accessories in high-flying circles. Some say these bags make their owner sprout a third arm; others claim they grant superpowers, or at least glow-in-the-dark powers. It's as if the good old class spells weren't enough for people!

items.name: Grozilla False Tooth
items.description: Grozilla had some false teeth cast to make himself look dreadfully frightening. On your small frame, the effect is even more terrifying.

items.name: Grasmera Scale
items.description: With a couple of these taped onto your back, you might just manage to pass your humpback off as some kind of exotic costume. Sadly, nothing can be done for your nightmare-inducing face.

items.name: Grasmera's Pouch of Coal
items.description: What was an organic pouch filled with coal doing in Grasmera's oozing guts? Before you ponder this question any further, please wash your hands.

items.name: Grasmera's Bony Joint
items.description: One of the first rituals Zeurg established at the Osamodas Temple was that of slowly sitting down on this joint until it disappeared completely. The screams of the disciples have long been a source of terrible legends.

items.name: Grasmera's Pouch of Magma
items.description: This organic pouch will withstand even the highest temperatures, which means that you can safely bury your head in it when your ears are burning with shame.

items.name: Broken Chains
items.description: Be like the Dark Smiths – break the chains that bind you to a life without freedom, reject your masters, and sow chaos wherever you go! Rise up! And if by some misfortune you happen to die along the way, these chains are perfect for haunting those you most despised when you were alive.

items.name: Precious Zoth Stone
items.description: This stone is responsible for sharpening the Zoth Warriors' wits and axes.

items.name: Golden Dragoturkey Peak
items.description: There are tons of reasons for wanting a great big peak: protection against predators, aerodynamic jogging, an excuse not to go into small rooms... And as well as all the important things, there are also old favourites such as picking your nose and drawing in the sand.

items.name: Kanniballs
items.description: They probably won't miss 'em...

items.name: Spectral Flame
items.description: Raval was the one who lit the burning flame you can see in the eyes of the ghosts of those who fell during the Crimson Dawn. Nobody knows when this flame will go out. Don't count on it to keep you warm on those long, cold, lonely nights, because though it may feed on bodies, hearts and souls, it's as cold as a YeCh'Ti burp.

items.name: Alliagem
items.description: This rare stone will give you the influence you need to create an alliance. To destroy one, all you need to do is attempt to share a valuable piece of loot between several members.

items.name: Black Wabbit Paw
items.description: Can you pick a paw paw? Ow a pwickly peaw?

items.name: Black Wabbit Bobtail
items.description: Black Wabbits will shake their tails whenever and wherever they can. Surely you know a few people who behave the same.

items.name: Tiwabbit Whiskers
items.description: These whiskers feel divine against the soft, pure skin of your cheek. If only your grandma's whiskers felt the same.

items.name: Tiwabbit Wosungwee Branch
items.description: Tie a Dofus to the end of this branch and perch on the shoulders of a slow-witted Astrubian and he'll carry you wherever you need to go without question!

items.name: Tiwabbit Wosungwee Tongue
items.description: This tongue is completely dried out from having slobbered too long over an inaccessible Cawwot. You know, the same thing will happen to your whole body if you spend too long running after Dofus.

items.name: Skeleton Wabbit Bone
items.description: Just 223 more bones and you can build a Skeleton Wabbit model of your own! Just look at the result! Tall, strong, bony, attractive: 223 more bones and this Skeleton Wabbit could be yours! Want this handsome Skeleton Wabbit in your living room? Only 223 bones to go! Call now!

items.name: Skeleton Wabbit Skull
items.description: You've hit the jackpot! This skull is the most important of the 224 Skeleton Wabbit bones you need to reconstruct a REAL Skeleton Wabbit in the comfort of your own home! Look at its definition, its nobility. Want to see the rest of this tip-top, Cawwot-nibbling hunk? Only 223 bones to go! Call now!

items.name: Wa Wabbit's Castle Key
items.description: Ever since you got this blasted key, you've been dying to make it into goulash. Lovely hot goulash in a thermos might save you if you get lost out in the wilderness, and it would taste so good! But no. You should save it and pay a visit to the Wa Wabbit in his castle instead.

items.name: Wa Wabbit's Warren Key
items.description: Some adventurers claim that this key grants access to the Wa Wabbit's harem - hundreds upon hundreds of lonely female Wabbits. Why don't you go and find out for yourself?

items.name: Skeleton Black Wabbit Headband
items.description: This headband is soaked with as much Wabbit blood as the blade of your sword. Armed with a gift like this, you'll finally win the heart of that Sacrier you've had your eye on!

items.name: Skeleton Black Wabbit Ossicle
items.description: Make sure this ossicle doesn't get lost amongst your collection of Skeleton Wabbit bones. Any more than the regulation 224 bones and your limited edition life-size Skeleton Wabbit model will have knobbly bits all over the place. You heard: only 224 bones! Start collecting now!

items.name: Wa Wobot Beard
items.description: This beard is just what you needed to finish off your Kwismas outfit! This year, the kids are in for a scare!

items.name: Black Wo Wabbit Stomach
items.description: You might find it hard to believe, but this stomach is filled with Cawwots and Cawwots alone. Looks like even people who gorge themselves on veggies can become fatty bum-bums.

items.name: Wobot Wosungwee Fur
items.description: Wobot Wosungwees have much softer fur than their Tiwabbit Wosungwee counterparts. This is because of their excellent diet consisting mainly of cawwot juice. That said, Tiwabbit Wosungwees are decidedly the more athletic of the two.

items.name: Wobot Helmet
items.description: This helmet was designed to cover up the whole of a Wabbit's head whilst allowing the ears to poke out. Stick it on a Iop's head and he'll do a pretty good Wabbit impression, provided he's not too big-headed.

items.name: Whitepaw Wabbit Staff
items.description: To your great disappointment, this staff isn't magic. Whitepaw Wabbits merely use it to walk without a limp. It also lets them look just a little more serious when gesturing to cast a spell.

items.name: Wabbit Bolt
items.description: The soldiers in the Wa Wabbit's personal guard carry bolts like this for good luck. It helps them keep their feet on the ground.

items.name: Wewe-Wabbit Blood
items.description: This blood changes colour according to the cycles of the moon. In other words, it's a nightmare for scatter-brained alchemists.

items.name: Cawwotman Leaves
items.description: You may well ask yourself how a living Cawwot manages to survive in a land filled with Wabbits. Perhaps the Wabbits from the Abandoned Labowatowies don't like Cawwots. Perhaps Cawwotmen aren't edible. Nibbling on these leaves might bring you all the answers... but you don't feel brave enough. Where's that dim-witted friend of yours?

items.name: Glo Wabbit Ears
items.description: These soft little ears glow in the dark. If only they hadn't been brutally ripped off the head of a live animal, they could have replaced your favourite cuddly toy.

items.name: Vampiwe Wabbit Teeth
items.description: These teeth are pointier than the other Wabbits'. And that means... Yes! Their owner must feed on something other than cawwots. You genius, you.

items.name: Janus Wabbit Eye
items.description: Only one of the Janus Wabbit's heads is sane. By extension, only one of its eyes is edible. Just putting that out there in case you ever find yourself lost on the Sidimote Moors with nothing to eat.

items.name: Twansgenic Cawwot
items.description: Biting into this Cawwot will bring about some surprising effects. If you're scared by the very thought of it, just remember that all your childhood heroes were born in puddles of radioactive waste and genetic laboratories.

items.name: Tiwobot Goggles
items.description: The Tiwobot can't see much through these goggles, which is why it's so fearless. If you could see the faces you pull in battle, you'd prefer to fight blind too.

items.name: Ecaflip's Ball
items.description: If the legends are true, then this relic used to belong to the god Ecaflip. Apparently he threw it away after losing a Bow Meow's cradle tournament. You've got to admit: if you lose at a game you invented yourself, you may as well not have any balls to play with at all.

items.name: Morongrel Ear
items.description: Your inner rebel couldn't resist the urge to cut off one of this Morongrel's ears despite that fact that it's strictly forbidden within the kingdom of Amakna. Rules are made to be broken, right? And so are ears.

items.name: Morongrel Leg
items.description: It's illegal to chop off Morongrels' ears, and severing their tails is enough to earn you a stern stare from any park warden. You don't want to get in trouble with the long arm of the law, so you just kept this leg as a keepsake of that memorable day.

items.name: Gobvious's Elastic Band
items.description: World-famous jack of all trades Mac Gayver would find a thousand things to do with this elastic band. You're not a genius like him, so you'll probably stick to the tried and tested recipes in your books.

items.name: Gobvious's Duster
items.description: The feathers on this sad specimen are long gone, but you can always use it as a riding crop at one of the masked parties you're always pretending you don't go to.

items.name: Spanner Stilt
items.description: This stilt can be used as a swatter for turbulent children, a poker for noisy animals, a cage bar for bawdy daughters and a cane for civilised walks on the green.

items.name: Spanner Tooth
items.description: As decayed as this tooth is, it's still as solid as a rock. If you slaughter several million Spanners, you'll gather enough of them to build yourself a castle!

items.name: Rhinoblasty Horn
items.description: It's only when you realise that the Rhinoblasty's horn was ripped clean off that you fully appreciate the violence of the battle in which you partook. You don't worry about it too much, though: you're too focussed on collecting more so you can dress up as Dark Moll for the Al Howin's celebrations!

items.name: Rhinoblasty Ear
items.description: As well as being as blind as a bat, the Rhinoblasty is as deaf as a post and as stupid as a Iop. You should be happy you never had to see what it had hidden under its helmet.

items.name: Dramak's Holey Pants
items.description: All Dramak ever wanted was to be considered an A-list villain. He set about sorting this out, starting by hiring a cheap session musician to write his theme tune. When he burst onto the scene in 643, the whole of Astrub was singing it: "I gotta hole in my pants, a hole in my pants, sometimes I get gassy and I give in to my body..." There was a dance routine and everything.

items.name: Dramak's Holey Sock
items.description: Bundled up in his supervillain costume, Dramak barely ever gets a chance to change his underclothes. As a result, you're now the lucky owner of a sock harbouring a perfect sample of all the bacteria in the World of Twelve's sewers.

items.name: Dramak's Theatre Key
items.description: This key is a VIP pass for latecomers like you who forgot to reserve a seat AGAIN.

items.name: Nugget
items.description: It glitters like your sweetheart's eyes, and crackles as a sausage upon a grill.

items.name: Famished Sunflower Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Sponge Mob Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.
