items.name: Kanniball Andchain Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Foggernaut Battery
items.description: The only way to tell if this battery is charged is to touch the contacts with your tongue. If you lose your tongue, it was charged.

items.name: Steamcrab Claw
items.description: If a Steamcrab offers to shake your hand... IT'S A TRAP!!

items.name: Steamcrab Carapace
items.description: Inside the steamcrab, a two-stroke engine hummed away nicely. That was before you destroyed the cylinder head in just three quick moves.

items.name: Barbakle Barb
items.description: Certain knavish Foggernauts have used these barbs to pop the balloons of kids who wouldn't behave, or the poke the backsides of those who were a bit too lazy.

items.name: Barbakle Oil
items.description: The colour of this oil seems to suggest that the Barbakle didn't have its annual oil change. The Foggernauts usually do it at the same time as their annual bath.

items.name: Harpo Eye
items.description: This giant eye looks a bit like the bottom of a bottle that's been shined up a bit, but not cleaned.

items.name: Harpo Blood
items.description: The blood test revealed a large quantity of iron and no small amount of rust. A clean bill of health, then, when one works for a surveyor who squeaks at every move.

items.name: Bartyclank Leather
items.description: This leather came directly from Bartyclank's tunic. The artisan who tanned and sold it had a convincing slogan: "No animals were harmed in the making of this tunic, just the buyer."

items.name: Bartyclank Embroidery
items.description: This little piece of embroidery is all that remains of Bartyclank's femininity.

items.name: Psychlo Beard
items.description: Solid enough to scrape the rust off just about any metallic object, the hairs of this beard can be used to scrape the crud out of the saucepans when you let the dishes build up for a month, like we both know you always do.

items.name: Psychlo Sock
items.description: This lead sock lets Psychlo always keep his feet solidly on the ground.

items.name: Merkator's Beard
items.description: This beard has become discoloured after repeatedly being exposed to – and abused by – salt water and hundreds of fearsome storms that only a brave explorer could face. Or maybe Merkator dyed it to match his armour. Only his barber knows for sure.

items.name: Merkator's Heart
items.description: This rusty heart, which once beat so strongly, has long since surrendered.

items.name: Old Hammer Head
items.description: This ancient relic was made by an equally ancient Foggernaut. Until you figure out what it's actually for, you could always use it to pound in some nails, or to smash your enemies' feet.

items.name: Merkator's Aquadome Key
items.description: This key will allow you to access Merkator's Aquadome and seize your chance to prove that you're not a spineless landlubber!

items.name: Mysterious Fabric
items.description: This fabric is uncommonly slinky and elastic. The most foolish rumours say it has supernatural powers, like making you temporarily forget your in-laws or picking up the kids at school for an entire week. Which explains why it's used to make "powerful" equipment.

items.name: Void Mask
items.description: Shadow has a fascination with the void and nonexistence. Whether you see the glass as half full or half empty, Shadow's not happy until it's completely empty. In the end, maybe you're more like him than you imagine.

items.name: Vengeance Mask
items.description: Revenge is a dish best served cold, something that Shadow understands quite well: hidden in his underground lair, he's been preparing his plan to reduce the World of Twelve to nothingness. The Panterror is part of that plan. It's capable of finding the smallest corner of shadow where it can rest, forgotten, until it delivers the fatal blow.

items.name: Violence Mask
items.description: The Dominous has no concept of subtlety and his mask fits him perfectly. His role: crush his enemies as quickly as possible. You might say Shadow was inspired by Iops when he created this monster.

items.name: Vivacity Mask
items.description: The Nightfoul is a very peculiar type of shadow: quick and agile, no sooner can you spot it than it's disappeared.

items.name: Vice Mask
items.description: The Brocktis aren't the first bad guys to wear masks. They love using their allies to scare their enemies.

items.name: Obscurati Symbol
items.description: Vengeance, Viciousness, Vivacity, Violence, Void... This symbol revives visions of the visages of the Obscurati. This of course brings memories of your interview with them back into view.

items.name: Shadow Horn
items.description: If someone tells you to take Shadow by the horns, you perhaps shouldn't take them literally. This horn doesn't contain much shadowy power anymore, but all the same, it's evil – handle with care.

items.name: Shadow's Pyramid Key
items.description: With this key in your possession, you now have access to a place steeped in mystery. When you go there maybe you can cast some light in the shadows.

items.name: Vigilante Insignia
items.description: Brandished with certainty and conviction against a supervillain, this insignia will force the villain to tell you every detail of his evil plan before he tries to kill you. Note: tries. If he succeeds, you didn't deserve the insignia.

items.name: Ghost's Cold Sweat
items.description: As brave as it may be, the ghost was terrified when it saw your face close up. After such a fright, the only thing that remained of it was a few drops of cold sweat.

items.name: Old Partition Sheet Music
items.description: This sheet gives off the same odour of dust and use as your father-in-law. It doesn't tell bad jokes like him though.

items.name: Pignolia Leather
items.description: How do you tell the difference between a Pignolia Leather and a common Piglet Leather? Just read the label – that's what it's there for, dummy.

items.name: Khamelerost Tongue
items.description: It may not look it, but this tongue's actually many large 'ring' muscles. The Khamelerost flicks it out by contracting them. Being mostly incompressible water, their volume can't change, so the rings shrink in diameter, but get thicker, making the tongue much longer almost instantly.

items.name: Scaratos Horn
items.description: This horn used to be the pride and joy of a particular Scaratos. Then one day, his wife was introduced to the handsome postman. Now the horn is in your pocket. That says it all, doesn't it?

items.name: Quetsnakiatl Stone
items.description: Not big fans of feathers, Crackler dancers prefer sporting Quetsnakiatl Stones.

items.name: Obscure Shard
items.description:
This Shard comes from the inky black body of a creature from the Lost Dimension.
It doesn't seem terribly useful, except to players who've finished the quest "The Army of Shadows", who can use it to persuade a Globilum to follow them everywhere.

items.name: Shadow Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Mooring Ball
items.description: The original and biggest Mooring Ball was the subject of one of Frigost's longest-standing traditions: it was said that cupping the ball gently in your hand would bring luck for the coming year. Queues of citizens lined up at the port every winter to give it a stroke. Even after the ball was carried away by the storm that ripped off a chunk of Frigost Island, replicas have been made and fondled ever since - at least, that's what the P.A.N.T.S. prophets who gave you this imitation told you.

items.name: Scale of Courage Fragment
items.description: If you manage to procure several of these, it may be possible to assemble them into a complete dragon scale with magic properties, which will be indispensable in helping you find the Emerald Dofus.

items.name: Scale of Ferocity Fragment
items.description: If you manage to procure several of these, it may be possible to assemble them into a complete dragon scale with magic properties, which will be indispensable in helping you find the Emerald Dofus.

items.name: Scale of Endurance Fragment
items.description: If you manage to procure several of these, it may be possible to assemble them into a complete dragon scale with magic properties, which will be indispensable in helping you find the Emerald Dofus.

items.name: Father Whupper Pattern
items.description: This pattern can be used by craftsmen to make part of the Father Whupper Set.

items.name: Kanigrula Fur
items.description: Sniff this silky fur and the warm, bestial musk it gives off will send your testosterone levels through the roof. Naturally, specimens regularly fetch small fortunes on the black market, but unfortunately for the Enutrof collectors who see it as their latest get-rich-quick scheme, most of the hunters who try plucking it straight from the source end up as adventurer stew.

items.name: Kanigrula Tail
items.description: This tail is covered with silky fur and is bendy, solid and machine-washable all at once. You can think of a thousand things to do with it, but none better than using it as a replacement bathrobe belt.

items.name: Kannihilator Mane
items.description: Believe it or not, Kannihilators are born with snow-white manes. They take on their terracotta hue over several years, as the Kannihilators get used to burrowing for food in the entrails of Iop hunters who brandish their swords a little too close to the Alyeenas.

items.name: Kannihilator Skin
items.description: If you spent all day digging up the earth and crushing gravel with your bare hands, your skin would be just as tough and rocky as a Kannihilator's!

items.name: Alyeena Hair
items.description: This hair is the subject of many a Iop's jealous rage. In fact, they were so incensed by the idea that their hairstyle was not unique that they spent centuries trying to massacre the Alyeenas. Unfortunately, they continually confused one another with the monsters and ended up fighting with their own kin. Rish Claymore had to intervene in person to put an end to this madness.

items.name: Alyeena Face
items.description: This adorable face will tremble if there are evil spirits around, which means that the Cania hunters have no trouble at all selling it as a natural vibro-massager on the Brakmarian market.

items.name: Felygiene Claw
items.description: This claw is so sharp and pointy that it can be used by surgeons as both a scalpel and a needle for stitching patients back up. Thrifty!

items.name: Felygiene Canine
items.description: With two of these canines inserted into your dentures, people will sincerely hope that you are not coming back to bite them in the bum.

items.name: Bigheera Chain
items.description: Slipped around your neck, wrists and ankles just before your deep-sea diving test, this heavy chain might just make your mother-in-law the happiest woman in the world.

items.name: Bigheera Ball
items.description: Why do Bigheeras drag such heavy balls along behind them? Could they be trying to compensate for something?

items.name: Kanazure Ear
items.description: When blocked up, this ear won't hear a thing. Same goes for when it's been ripped off its owner's head.

items.name: Kanazure Fabric
items.description: This fabric is rarer than Kaniger fabric for the simple reason that it's much harder for an Astrubian to slay a Kanazure than a Kaniger.

items.name: Orfan Mane
items.description: Rumour has it that Nevark shaved the manes off all the Orfans in a single day, after leaving them each with just one eye to cry with. The hunter himself is unable to confirm if every single Orfan was really there, because he was only two years old and didn't know how to count yet.

items.name: Orfan Buckle
items.description: Orfans are well-known for having no imagination. They copied their buckle design from the Thunder-Meows that fell from the sky during the Great Rains of 595.

items.name: Pair of Cross Strich Balls
items.description: The Cross Strich probably has the biggest pair of balls in the world. Frustrated at being so clearly outdone, some adventurers don't think twice about snipping them off and slipping them into their own trousers. Really! It's insane what some people will do just to make themselves look important.

items.name: Cross Strich Egg
items.description: Unfertilised Strich eggs are full of noxious gases, which is probably why no innkeeper in their right mind would ever include Strich egg omelette on a menu.

items.name: Stretch Leg
items.description: Sadidas use these legs in black magic rituals to curse their enemies. Alas, those old ladies who insist on walking slowly along the pavement in rows of three seem to be naturally immune.

items.name: Stretch Wing
items.description: If you get a pair of these wings grafted to your back, you won't be able to fly, but you will be invited to every party in town just for your chicken dance.

items.name: Watchamatrich Rump
items.description: The Watchamatrich is loved by physics and chemistry teachers alike for its incredible ability to pass waste in all three states (solid, liquid and gas) simultaneously.

items.name: Watchamatrich Tongue
items.description: This tongue is paradise for bacteria, which multiply in its valleys and ridges faster than Cras and Sadidas do in the Astrub Forest.

items.name: Trubout Feather
items.description: This feather had already been steeped in the blood of dozens of victims when it was yanked out of its Trubout's Rump. Served it right!

items.name: Trubout Mite
items.description: This little parasite has shown no sign of life since it was plucked off a Trubout's corpse. Be careful, though, as once it finds itself in a warm, smelly, humid place, it's bound to wake up and invite its extended family to live with it too.

items.name: Patrich Eye
items.description: The natural zoom on this eye is a thousand times more powerful than a Cra's, which would explain how Patriches can spot Srams from several kilokametres away.

items.name: Patrich Glands
items.description: Holistic doctors use these glands to make invigorating ointments whose immediate effects include toning the skin, firming up the muscles and triggering testosterone overproduction. The perfect gift for your father-in-law – maybe that way your mother-in-law will finally fall for him.

items.name: Stricheetru Fluff
items.description: This fluff is softer than your grandmother's stubble and is completely hypoallergenic, so it won't irritate your skin when you rub your cheeks against it.

items.name: Stricheetru Beak
items.description: Stricheetrus are fond of earthworms and opera singing. Using their pointy beaks, they can pierce the flesh of their still-conscious prey in order to dig around in their entrails. And the baby ones are so cute!

items.name: Kanigrula's Cave Key
items.description: This key holds the promise of a future filled with hours and hours of wild, torrid excitement. You like claws and whips, right?

items.name: Kanigrula Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Cross Strich's Aviary Key
items.description: This key will grant you access to the most incredible view you've ever seen, served on a plateau. Then again, that's what the estate agent who tried to sell you Meriana's house in the swamps told you.

items.name: Brutatax Embroidery
items.description: This embroidery is a mark of Brutatax's sovereignty. Its golden pattern will have greedy collectors from all over the world queuing up at your door.

items.name: Persaport Cord
items.description: If anyone tries to grab your purse strings from your capable grasp, you can use this cord to bind their hands safely behind their backs.

items.name: Mimicasket Tongue
items.description: Mimicaskets always have trouble keeping a civil tongue in their heads, and sometimes the easiest solution is simply to rip it out, especially if you can't stand being insulted.

items.name: Antrezure Antenna
items.description: You never quite know what you're going to find on the end of an Antrezure's antennae, but given that their favourite pastime is attacking sensitive body parts, you're probably most likely to find scraps of underwear.

items.name: Hurtful Locker Horn
items.description: The Hurtful Locker's two horns are actually connected to one another. It took mammoth strength to detach this one from its twin.

items.name: Precious Moustache
items.description: Here is the finishing touch for your next Too Faux Karnaval disguise. You'll look absolutely precious, dahling!

items.name: Drhossil Tusk
items.description: The Drhossil's tusks are worth a small fortune on the Astrubian market. Some wise men say that they grant their owner a blessing from Enutrof himself.

items.name: Drheamer Claw
items.description: In your experience, this claw is hellishly sharp despite being small, and the Drheamers are far more belligerent than their name would suggest.

items.name: Digshot Skin
items.description: Since drhellers don't have ears, they need to be highly receptive to vibrations from all directions. Digshots' skin has evolved specifically for this purpose: as well as withstanding pressure during long underground journeys, it also allows digshots to distinguish certain sounds made by their kind.

items.name: Powa Drhell Horn
items.description: The Powa Drhell prefers to use its horns in combat than its tusks, which it saves for digging underground passageways. Don't bother taking a red flag with you when you fight it, as it really doesn't need any provocation at all to charge.

items.name: Perfidhius Eye
items.description: Perfidhius are basically evolved Digshots: their love for fighting has left them somewhat tattered and torn, but their reflexes are sharpened to perfection. This eye has borne witness to many a bloody battle.

items.name: Drhellvina Tail
items.description: The Drhellvina's tail is almost as dangerous as its horns: when you're least expecting it, the Drhellvina will remind you that it fights just as well backwards as forwards.

items.name: Jewel from King Nidas's Crown
items.description: This gem will have heads turning wherever you go. What are you going to do with it? Give it away? Bury it? Sell it? Eat it? Maybe you should donate it to a charity such as "Enutrofs Without Frontiers", which fights tirelessly to return coveted items to Enutrofs the world over.

items.name: Kamasterisk Horn
items.description: Only an Enutrof would think up the idea of fighting with gold-plated horns. But you have to hand it to him: the result is almost terrifying as the Bearendizer during a honey shortage.

items.name: Staruman Eyebrow
items.description: Starumen are modest, the kind of guys who have tons of talents but never really talk about them. The one who used to own this eyebrow, for instance, was a master at fanning his friends by shaking his facial hair about.

items.name: Levitrof Tooth
items.description: Its ex-owner may be a long-forgotten threat now, but this tooth seems to contain some kind of mystical power. People in its vicinity get the impression they're being followed everywhere by a Levitrof. Way to awaken old phobias!

items.name: Pazpartu Key Fragment
items.description: Despite repeated cries of "THE KEY! THE KEY!!!" and "QUICK! QUICK!!!" from your teammates, you only managed to grab a fragment of the Pazpartu's key. Hopefully you'll do better in the crystal dome.

items.name: Hairsh Golden Ball
items.description: These balls come in all different colours and glow in the dark. The Hairshes use them to feign magical attacks, which, paired with an icy glare, is enough to send some adventurers running. When not fighting sissies, this bluff technique just makes the Hairshes look even more ridiculous.

items.name: Kamatrix
items.description: This piece of money comes from another dimension entirely and is only valuable to Enutoughs. They say the Kamatrix has the mysterious power of making projectiles deviate from their initial trajectories.

items.name: Dimensional Fabric
items.description: Here's a piece of fabric you definitely shouldn't use to make underwear with. Let one rip and you might destroy the universe!

items.name: Enutough Beard Hair
items.description: Certain naughty painters steal Enutoughs' beard hairs to make their paintbrushes with. All the better for selling overpriced, poor quality knock-offs with, my dear!

items.name: Drheller Tooth
items.description: If you chewed on stones all day long, your teeth would be in bad condition too. The tooth fairy doesn't even stop by Enurado any more.

items.name: Strongboxer Part
items.description: This Strongboxer, or what remains of it, doesn't look like much now, but it doesn't matter. It was beautiful on the inside.

items.name: Rose of the Sands
items.description: It's not red, but at least it won't wilt.

items.name: Tourmaline
items.description: Tons of Enutrofs have sold their parents for their weight in Tourmaline.

items.name: King Nidas Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Brutatax Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Drhossil Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Brutatax's Factory Key
items.description: Brutatax's Factory is the place where kamas are made... You know, kamas? The things adventurers lie, cheat and swindle one another for every day? It's only natural you need a key to get into that place. Once you get inside, no messing around!

items.name: Drhossil's Caves Key
items.description: Drills at the ready - the Drhossil is not going to be happy about sharing his gold mine!

items.name: King Nidas's Palace Key
items.description: Countless adventurers have dreamt of sneaking into King Nidas's Palace to nab an ingot or two of gold for their retirement funds... What they don't take into consideration is the cutting-edge surveillance system that trips them up at the first hurdle. You have been warned!

items.name: Cross Strich Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Stellia's Map
items.description: This map will allow you to find Stellia Blutzell's legendary treasure.

items.name: Fragment of Stellia's Map 1/3
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Stellia's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Stellia's Map 2/3
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Stellia's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Stellia's Map 3/3
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Stellia's map back together.

items.name: Gein's Map
items.description: This map will allow you to find Gein's legendary treasure.

items.name: Fragment of Gein's Map 1/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Gein's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Gein's Map 2/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Gein's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Gein's Map 3/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Gein's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Gein's Map 4/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Gein's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Gein's Map 5/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Gein's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Gein's Map 6/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Gein's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Gein's Map 7/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Gein's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Gein's Map 8/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Gein's map back together.

items.name: Totankama's Tablet
items.description: This tablet will allow you to find Totankama's legendary treasure. (The quest "Totankama's Treasure" must be in progress to be able to study the tablet.)

items.name: Totankama's Tablet Fragment 1/5
items.description: This fragment will let you reassemble Totankama's Tablet. (The quest "Totankama's Treasure" must be in progress to be able to study the tablet.)

items.name: Totankama's Tablet Fragment 2/5
items.description: This fragment will let you reassemble Totankama's Tablet. (The quest "Totankama's Treasure" must be in progress to be able to study the tablet.)

items.name: Totankama's Tablet Fragment 3/5
items.description: This fragment will let you reassemble Totankama's Tablet. (The quest "Totankama's Treasure" must be in progress to be able to study the tablet.)

items.name: Totankama's Tablet Fragment 4/5
items.description: This fragment will let you reassemble Totankama's Tablet. (The quest "Totankama's Treasure" must be in progress to be able to study the tablet.)

items.name: Totankama's Tablet Fragment 5/5
items.description: This fragment will let you reassemble Totankama's Tablet. (The quest "Totankama's Treasure" must be in progress to be able to study the tablet.)

items.name: Dark Court Fabric
items.description: Srambad's nobility has some luxurious tastes and this fabric reflects them perfectly: soft and silky, this fabric is obviously not made from just any old material. It just goes to show, even the worst criminals can have delicate skin.

items.name: Necrotick Chitin
items.description: The Necroticks are essential to Srambad's normal operation: all the refuse has to go somewhere!

items.name: Malitiamen Insignia
items.description: Srambad inhabitants had developed the ability to recognize Malitiamen by their characteristic odour, but since all the adventurers came, it's become much harder to smell the difference. So an insignia was created to ease the confusion a bit.

items.name: Skull and Crossbones
items.description: A symbol of Srambad, this type of relic is generally taken as a souvenir. So you can definitely hook it up to your bunch of keys.

items.name: The Queen of Thieves' Embroidery
items.description: To be able to take this from the Queen of Thieves, you have to be incredibly foolhardy. Everyone knows she doesn't let too many people get near, and she lets even fewer people rip off parts of her clothes.

items.name: Mastaklyr's Disarmed Trap
items.description: This trap is no longer all that dangerous – at best it could be reused as a hammer.

items.name: Terristocrat Bomb Fuse
items.description: If you leave it sticking out of the ground, this fuse could scare some people by making them think there's a buried bomb. Of course, it goes without saying that a real bomb would probably be more effective.

items.name: Double's Scrunchie
items.description: It seems that the Double's scrunchie is slightly different from her double's, but no one has ever really been able to tell the difference.

items.name: Tortryck Shoulder Pad
items.description: Tortrycks don't really joke around – if they demand you give them your papers, you better do it before they do you in.

items.name: Magic Skemage Skull
items.description: Skemages use this skull to channel their magic. But, truth be told, it's mostly just a decorative element.

items.name: Toxoliath Blood
items.description: This blood fascinates alchemists: it's the only part of the Toxoliath that is completely noxious. In fact, it seems to have healing properties.

items.name: Scoliopode Leg
items.description: Given the way they're hunched over, and how heavy they look, Scoliopodes often make people wonder how they manage to stay up on two feet. And this leg doesn't look like it's going to get you any closer to an explanation.

items.name: Amorphid Wing
items.description: These wings seem more decorative than useful, given Amorphids' mass.

items.name: Sculucanus Pincer
items.description: Being incredibly sharp, these pincers can be used as an offensive weapon or as a tool – it all depends on what you're using them against.

items.name: Trechepeira Venom
items.description: This venom inflates any organ it's injected into to incredible levels. They say that Sram's Herald once accidentally suffered its effects.

items.name: Dethornit Stinger
items.description: The Dethornits only rarely come out of the Toxoliath's cave, and they have a tendency to implant their stingers into the first person they see. That's not very good for their development.

items.name: Captain Scarlight's Heart
items.description: There are those who doubt that Captain Scarlight has a heart, and even this doesn't necessarily prove them wrong. Even his heart is mocking you.

items.name: Millimaster Scarf
items.description: The Millimasters are actually the spiritual offspring of the Fungi Masters. Who knows what they're hiding behind their scarves.

items.name: Kartridge Bag
items.description: The Kartridges keep their ammunition in this bag. And they keep such large ammunition, and in such great amounts, that they can use their bag as a deadly bludgeon.

items.name: Sramurai Bone
items.description: Some hide their knives in their sleeves, some in their boots. As for Sramurais, they've found a unique solution for hiding their blades: their bones.

items.name: Blundergus Bandage
items.description: Blunderguses are covered in bandages, but they're not Xelors. The best proof is their size.

items.name: Elsumo Pants
items.description: It wouldn't be too pleasant to have your face pressed into these pants – they could knock anyone out.

items.name: Key to the Throne Room of the Dark Court
items.description: The path to the throne is sometimes long and fraught with danger. Other times, you just need to know which door to open. Of course, the two aren't necessarily mutually exclusive...

items.name: Key to Toxoliath's Cave
items.description: A veritable herbal paradise for alchemists, Toxoliath's cave is nonetheless pretty noxious.

items.name: Key to Captain Scarlight's Ring
items.description: If you feel like a Rassler at heart, Captain Scarlight is waiting for you in his ring. Be careful though, he's not faking it, and you shouldn't either.

items.name: Stellia's Panties
items.description: Why would Stellia hide panties in her chest and not the other way around?

items.name: Dremoan's Map
items.description: This map will allow you to find Dremoan's legendary treasure.

items.name: Fragment of Dremoan's Map 1/5
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Dremoan's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Dremoan's Map 2/5
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Dremoan's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Dremoan's Map 3/5
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Dremoan's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Dremoan's Map 4/5
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Dremoan's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Dremoan's Map 5/5
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Dremoan's map back together.

items.name: Dremoan Sporm
items.description: You hold in your hands Dremoan's descendants.

items.name: Rusty Hook
items.description: Although you could use it as it is, this hook is far more useful for making Lockpicks.

items.name: Lockpick
items.description: This simple Lockpick is a formidable tool in the hands of a capable burglar.

items.name: Mastigator's Map
items.description: This map will allow you to find Mastigator's legendary treasure.

items.name: Fragment of Mastigator's Map 1/5
items.description: This fragment will let you reassemble Mastigator's Map.

items.name: Fragment of Mastigator's Map 2/5
items.description: This fragment will let you reassemble Mastigator's Map.

items.name: Fragment of Mastigator's Map 3/5
items.description: This fragment will let you reassemble Mastigator's Map.

items.name: Fragment of Mastigator's Map 4/5
items.description: This fragment will let you reassemble Mastigator's Map.

items.name: Fragment of Mastigator's Map 5/5
items.description: This fragment will let you reassemble Mastigator's Map.

items.name: Mastigator's Egg
items.description: You have in your hands Mastigator's offspring, as well as a pretty good meal.

items.name: Gein's Bottle
items.description: There's enough liquid here to drown your sorrows, but not enough alcohol to get you drunk.

items.name: Reader Coupon 1/3
items.description: If you have all 3 coupons, you can exchange them at the Krozette [5,3] for a new gift.

items.name: Reader Coupon 2/3
items.description: If you have all 3 coupons, you can exchange them at the Krozette [5,3] for a new gift.

items.name: Reader Coupon 3/3
items.description: If you have all 3 coupons, you can exchange them at the Krozette [5,3] for a new gift.

items.name: Sacred Snowfoux Bones
items.description: Jangakkuq gave you these bones to make him a pair of Sacred Knives.

items.name: Verminoculate Eye
items.description: Krobe eyes can turn 360 degrees, which lets them look through certain parts of their bodies. Isn't evolution marvellous?

items.name: Bashillus Leg
items.description: It's hard to believe these little feet work to get the Bashillus from place to place, and in reality, there's a reason: they actually move a lot quicker by rolling around.

items.name: Bacterrible Antenna
items.description: We're not really sure why many Bacterribles have antennae like this. Some theories say they're purely cosmetic, others hold that they serve some sort of olfactory purpose.

items.name: Viring Shell
items.description: Given its shape, the Viring needed to have resistant skin: adventurers always have an irrepressible urge to bang on it. And that's why there's the shell.

items.name: Pathogerm Skin
items.description: Pathogerm Skin is highly sought after for its elastic properties, but its colour makes it unusable for most other things.

items.name: Protoz'orror Nucleus
items.description: The Protoz'orror can completely regenerate itself from even a small bit, which makes it nearly immortal. Its nucleus is therefore just another disposable part of its anatomy, which it can rebuild at will, given the time.

items.name: Key to the Belly of the Whale
items.description: This key will let you go inside the enormous marine mammal known as Kideebom. However, no guides are available – you'll have to find your way around by yourself.

items.name: Whale Salt
items.description: Krobes absorb the salt dissolved in the seawater – and that's the only good thing that happens when they show up.

items.name: Captain Scarlight Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Toxoliath Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Queen of Thieves Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Protoz'orror Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Vortex Wing
items.description: These wings are actually strong enough to hold Vortex up, and he flies around in the privacy of his own bedroom all the time. He looks so ridiculous doing so, however, that he never uses them in public.

items.name: Ickyrus Talon
items.description: Ickyruses have talons where their hands used to be. Although stylish, they are marginally less dextrous and practical than hands. Just one of the many prices you have to pay when you want to be able to fly.

items.name: Hystairkal Horn
items.description: Not all Fugitives have horns, you know. You really shouldn't jump to conclusions about why some have them and some don't.

items.name: Krossflire Eye
items.description: Krossflires are deadly hunters. Apparently they can see their prey before it's even appeared.

items.name: Crushmore Claw
items.description: Crushmores love using their fists, but their claws are not a pretty sight close up.

items.name: Wastrel Feather
items.description: Wastrels sometimes use these surprisingly sharp feathers as projectiles, but their most common use is as torture instruments. Bare feet of the world, beware.

items.name: XLII Horn
items.description: XLII's horns didn't start out that colour. How on earth did they get like this?

items.name: Thriten Tooth
items.description: People say that Thritens are the unluckiest Altdemons ever. Their teeth are sometimes used to make the bad luck potions so popular with Trool Fair vendors.

items.name: Twentoo Skin
items.description: Twentoo Skin is an extremely rare resource that is sometimes used to bribe influential figures with luxurious tastes.

items.name: Thirtree Loincloth
items.description: What does the Thirtree hide under its loincloth? Some questions ought never to be answered.

items.name: Sethen Beard
items.description: Superstitious types swear by Sethen Beards. Apparently they're deeply magical, which makes them highly sought-after.

items.name: Tuft of Siks-T Hair
items.description: This tuft of hair is absolutely priceless. Maybe you'll find out how Siks-Ts manage to keep them in such good condition, no matter what hardships they may face.

items.name: Fraktal Pixel
items.description: Fraktal is still watching you through this pixel.

items.name: Bigbit Pixel
items.description: Never tell Bigbit he's fat. Try "cuddly" or "bubbly" to cushion the blow.

items.name: Elfacet Pixel
items.description: Don't let their childlike appearance fool you: Elfacets are the most mischievous of all the Xelomorphs.

items.name: Brikablak Pixel
items.description: Brikablaks can get hold of just about anything for you... Well, so long as it's rectangular and black all over.

items.name: Smashlete Pixel
items.description: Smashletes aren't the friendliest of the Xelomorphs, but they do have some undeniable talents, such as beating absolutely anyone in a footrace (...despite not having feet).

items.name: Segmantid Pixel
items.description: This pixel only appears when you've wrestled a Segmantid to the ground, and is proof that it is no longer in a fit state to fight.

items.name: Miniature Sandglass
items.description: This sandglass is a symbol of passing time. You can't help but wonder if there isn't more than meets the eye with this thing...

items.name: Vortex Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: XLII Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Fraktal Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Akornaddikt Acorn
items.description: Akornaddikt got this at his first Acorn Addicts Anonymous meeting.

items.name: Fraktal's Megalith Key
items.description: Getting out of Fraktal's Megalith in one piece is quite an accomplishment. Make sure you prepare properly before going in... Some strong glue to hold your limbs in place should be fine.

items.name: XLII's Metronomicon Key
items.description: Will you finally find the answer to the meaning of the universe?

items.name: Vortex's Eye Key
items.description: There are many places where you have so much fun that time simply flies by. Unfortunately, the Eye of Vortex is not one of them.

items.name: Xelomorph Symbol
items.description: Looking at this symbol really makes your mouth water. Waiter! The menu, please!

items.name: Altdemon Hair
items.description: These hairs are as irritating as your mother-in-law, which is really saying something.

items.name: Fugitive Loop
items.description: The symbol on this belt buckle looks a lot like the Dimensional Voyagers' one. There must be a reason for that... If you don't know it yet, you still have a lot to learn. You heard! Get outta here and do some quests.

items.name: Fragment of Akornaddikt's Map 1/2
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Akornaddikt's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Akornaddikt's Map 2/2
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Akornaddikt's map back together.

items.name: Akornaddikt's Map
items.description: This map will allow you to find Akornaddikt's legendary treasure.

items.name: Kickroach's Lair Key
items.description: This distinctively shaped key can be used to replace the missing rung from the ladder that leads to Kickroach's Lair.

items.name: Kamyum
items.description: Unless you're a Vilinsekt, this kamyum, sticky with honey, probably won't be worth much to you... Unless, of course, you're an adventurer who has just completed the "Miniature Adventure" quest, in which case you can use it to persuade Verminus to follow you around wherever you go.

items.name: Vilinsekt Antennae
items.description: What better way to prove your strength than by pulling the antennae off poor, defenceless insects? What's more, they grow back, so knock yourself out!

items.name: Kickroach Leg
items.description: This leg is a vital ingredient for a great many dishes prepared by Amakna's chefs. Shame they're all inedible.

items.name: Scampihorse's Rechargeable Battery
items.description: No need to pedal to recharge this battery: simply soak it in water for a few minutes, then hop on the spot 36 times while shouting "GAHOO-WAHOO" at the top of your lungs. And there you have it, a brand new battery! Isn't technology marvellous?

items.name: Brumen's Elixir
items.description: The source of all Brumen Tinctorias's might can be found in these elixirs, which give his power and intelligence a megaboost. Take good care of them; they could come in handy sooner than you expect...

items.name: Panthyrozy's Perfume
items.description: Panthyrozy the thief leaves no trace but this perfume at the scenes of her crimes: a scent every bit as bewitching and deadly as its owner.

items.name: Fragment of Brumen's Map 1/3
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Brumen Tinctorias's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Brumen's Map 2/3
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Brumen Tinctorias's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Brumen's Map 3/3
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Brumen Tinctorias's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Panthyrozy's Map 5/5
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Panthyrozy's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Panthyrozy's Map 4/5
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Panthyrozy's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Panthyrozy's Map 3/5
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Panthyrozy's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Panthyrozy's Map 2/5
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Panthyrozy's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Panthyrozy's Map 1/5
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Panthyrozy's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 8/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Scampihorse's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 7/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Scampihorse's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 6/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Scampihorse's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 5/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Scampihorse's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 4/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Scampihorse's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 3/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Scampihorse's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 2/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Scampihorse's map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 1/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Scampihorse's map back together.

items.name: Brumen's Map
items.description: This map will allow you to find Brumen's legendary treasure.

items.name: Panthyrozy's Map
items.description: This map will allow you to find Panthyrozy's legendary treasure.

items.name: Scampihorse's Map
items.description: This map will allow you to find Scampihorse's legendary treasure.

items.name: Eliotrope Skull
items.description: This Eliotrope's last teleportation teleported him right into the cemetery.

items.name: Treechnee Hair
items.description: This hair has a natural resin coating. This means you won't need any glue to stick it to your bald pate or to the palms of your hands.

items.name: Treechnee Eye
items.description: This eye, as hard as stone, can double up as a spare billiards ball, if you're into that kind of thing, and you lose one...

items.name: Venerable Treechnid Root
items.description: This root helps to keep the Venerable Treechnid sturdy and strong in the worst of storms. But if you can't find a use for it, you can always drop it and if anyone asks, just tell them you're putting down roots.

items.name: Venerable Treechnid Bark
items.description: This thick bark protects the Venerable Treechnid from vicious swings of the axe. But if you can't find a use for it, you can simply return it, just make sure you don't put the bark up the wrong tree.

items.name: Arachnotron Broken Mask
items.description: This Arachnotron wore a mask to conceal his identity from other Arachnees. It wasn't just him you crushed, but also his dreams of one day becoming a famous superhero.

items.name: Squashed Arachnee
items.description: This Arachnee got in a pickle and was spat out in this mangled state. Be careful what you eat.

items.name: Dark Treechnee Bark
items.description: This fire-proof bark would make useful construction material for adventurers who like to play with fire.

items.name: Dark Treechnee Web
items.description: If you're going to throw your weight around, you might as well throw it onto this strong, silent type of web.

items.name: Short-Tempered Dark Treechnid Amber
items.description: This precious stone will not fit on your finger nor make you invisible. But you can call it 'my precious' if you want.

items.name: Short-Tempered Arachnotron Broken Mask
items.description: Instead of giving him a break, you broke his mask, which will do nothing for his mood, to say the least.

items.name: Squashed Short-Tempered Arachnee
items.description: This is what happens when you have a quick temper but you're not quick enough. If only it had been crabby, it might have stood a chance with a shell.

items.name: Short-Tempered Treechnee Leg
items.description: This Dark Treechnee was so grumpy you didn't mind leaving him without a leg to stand on.

items.name: Short-Tempered Treechnee Mandible
items.description: If coated in Snailmet slime, this mandible can be an effective weapon against Moskitos.

items.name: Summoning Branch Finger
items.description: This gnarled wooden finger looks like the middle one that the Summoning Branch raised in your general direction right before meeting its maker.

items.name: Summoning Branch Eye
items.description: This eye is capable of looking deep into your very soul and reading you like an open book. Both literally and figuratively.

items.name: Healing Branch Eye
items.description: This eye can make an excellent lure for Neyes if held out at arm's length in the Evil Forest.

items.name: Blue Spimush Gill
items.description: Mixed with boiled Gobball Slobber, left to infuse then served to an old Gobball, it restores his old virility for a few hours. Brouce Boulgoure drinks a cup of this fine brew after every meal.

items.name: Brown Spimush Gill
items.description: Mycologists agree that the Brown Spimush was originally orange and that this colour variation has something to do with the fecal odour it emits. This theory is strongly refuted by chefs who serve Spimush omelettes in their restaurants.

items.name: Red Spimush Gill
items.description: In the past, Shamans used to stuff their orifices with these gills to communicate with the gods. They would fall into deep trances and have vivid visions, but recent scientific studies have shown that this was basically due to a lack of oxygen from blocked respiratory tracts.

items.name: Green Spimush Gill
items.description: Whatever the colour, Spimush gills always give off an odour akin to a Prespic with bowel troubles.

items.name: Key to the Lair of the Rac Queen
items.description: Fancy browsing a web? Use this key to see how well you click with the Rac Queen. But be careful, you may accidentally walk inter-her-net and have a venomenal time. The web site is in the Arak-hai Forest.

items.name: Slimy Silk
items.description: Perfect for slime balls.

items.name: Rac Globule
items.description: This glistening yellow blob that protrudes from the Rac Queen's abdomen is probably a sensory organ, or it might be just to distinguish the queen from the other Arak-hai... But more importantly, what will it fetch at the markets?

items.name: Sylvan Seal
items.description: The Foresters in the King of Amakna's service recognise each other by their inimitable odour, a subtle combination of humus, musk and sweat. So don't expect this seal to help you pass as one of them - your spicy adventurer's scent will give you away.

items.name: Fertile Ruby Fragment
items.description: This precious stone has been blessed by Silvosse, Master of Cuttings. Plant this in your garden and watch your lawn turn into a veritable jungle. If your dream is to have a large family, you can also keep it in your pocket.

items.name: Damadrya's Exploding Bud
items.description: This bud bodes well for new beginnings but also seems a wee bit unstable... As a precaution, keep it in a stable, shake-free environment.

items.name: Undergrowth Substrate
items.description: The side effects of this substrate include making really lame jokes about its name.

items.name: Packrat Eye
items.description: After gazing longingly at the sinewy muscles of Strodents, this Packrat's eye detached from its socket. The same could happen to you if you're not careful.

items.name: Ratter Pill
items.description: To stay in shape, the Ratter swallows vast quantities of these blue pills made by the disciples of Eltux.

items.name: Arak-hai Gland
items.description: This somewhat repugnant organ may be useful for those into toxic substances. So why do you have it in your bag?

items.name: Daddy Longlex Mouthparts
items.description: Daddy Longlex is rumoured to have razor-sharp wit. These appendages would tend to support the theory.

items.name: Venomica Wool
items.description: So you thought nothing could be more uncomfortable than a Gobball Wool cape? Well try sleeping under a Venomica wool blanket.

items.name: Gargantula Teeth
items.description: This fang was extracted by force from a Gargantula's mouth. Anaesthetic was unnecessary: the monster had so many teeth, it didn't even notice one missing.

items.name: Nephilady Silk
items.description: Tailors fight over this raw material and for good reason: clothes made from Nephilady silk have a slimming effect, which is hugely popular. It also causes a rash, but such is the cost of looking good.

items.name: Jumparak Eye
items.description: It's impossible to confuse the eye-catching colour of this eye with another creature's. If you compare any two side-by-side, the difference really jumps out.

items.name: Kickroach Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Rac Queen Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Nettle Hyroid
items.description: You just have to rub these leaves on your enemies face to hear them sing louder than a eunuch.

items.name: Divine Sage
items.description: The soothsayers who abuse this distilled plant claim to have foreseen their death: choking on their own vomit, in a gutter.

items.name: Field Clover
items.description: In a fight, this clover is reputed to give a sudden and decisive advantage to its team.

items.name: Praying Mint
items.description: It's said that this board is very pious, even though it's often used by young Srams to strangle their husbands after the honeymoon.

items.name: Pythag Orchid
items.description: The alchemist-butcher Pythagore is the first to have turned to this planty infusion for inspiration, which he was sorely lacking.

items.name: Margedelweiss
items.description: It's said that this flour grows in dragon vapour, but no one has been able to prove it.

items.name: Tri Pandkin
items.description: This plant is used to reduce taste and lighten the odour of Lousy Pig tripe.

items.name: Ginseng
items.description: The root of this plant is used as a panacea by the Kanniballs on Moon Island.

items.name: Ginsengoku
items.description: This plant is particularly appreciated by Moon, who prefers it to the Citronana diet.

items.name: Belladonna
items.description: Once popular with Otomai's disciples, but they gave up farming this plant after several fatal accidents having to do with its ingestion. Since, it's common to see alchemists in Sram's service on the island.

items.name: Belladonzel
items.description: It used to be common for Otomai's disciples to offer this plant to young women who caught their eyes. Since Iops joined their ranks, the practise has been abandoned.

items.name: Mandrake
items.description: It used to be that this plant only grew underneath the traps on the gallows. Since then, it's branched out a bit, and can be found all over cemeteries.

items.name: Mandrakueso
items.description: As strange as it may seem, alchemists have succeeded in making cheese out of this plant.

items.name: Ancestor Potion
items.description: This drink has as much character as a good beer, and your grandfather.

items.name: Loafing Potion
items.description: After abusive consumption, this sale of this potion is forbidden at Zaaps.

items.name: Ferrite
items.description: This strange alloy is created by novice miners as practise.

items.name: Riz Cola
items.description: This grain is often used in the creation of cough drops.

items.name: Husse Malt
items.description: The beer brewed from this malt helps its drinker see good from bad: drinking it in moderation is good - drinking too much makes for a bad time the next morning.

items.name: Corn
items.description: Otomai's disciples love grilling this dried grain in a pan, with salt or sugar, before watching a spectacle.

items.name: Kornub
items.description: The sailors making the journey between Otomai Island and the continent of Amakna always keep this grain nearby, which they sell for a tidy profit in Madrestam.

items.name: Millet
items.description: This crop was named after Bernard, the minstrel best known for his song about the Multimen.

items.name: Millet Nial
items.description: Wine experts are ready to buy this grain at a price that would give any self-respecting Enutrof a heart attack.

items.name: Primary Forest Substrate
items.description: This reminds you of vacations at the beach, being chased by the natives who wanted to roast you on a spit for some strange ancestral ritual.

items.name: Virgin Forest Substrate
items.description: Alchemists use this substrate to develop new contagious, fatal diseases.

items.name: Sylvan Substrate
items.description: Eating this won't make you invisible, or indestructible, any more than it will help you burn up the dance floor or improve your *ahem* anatomical characteristics.

items.name: Eel
items.description: Much like a Sram, the eel slips without difficulty through the oddest places.

items.name: Rock Eel
items.description: Fishing with explosives has allowed Rogues to corner the market on this fish.

items.name: Grey Sea Bream
items.description: No one really cares what a bream is, or how it can be royal.

items.name: Royal Sea Bream
items.description: No one really knows what a bream is, or how it can be royal.

items.name: Monkfish
items.description: This dead fish has the same empty look as your grandfather.

items.name: Humonkfish
items.description: Due to its name, some Iops believe that this fish is a part human hybrid.

items.name: Cod
items.description: The number of cod has been greatly reduced by massive consumption in the big cities.

items.name: Bearded Cod
items.description: This could be resold for a tidy sum at the Trool Fair.

items.name: Tench
items.description: Tench sounds a lot like stench. This is not a coincidence.

items.name: Haunted Tench
items.description: It seems that this magic fish brings bad luck. At least that's what the fishermen say.

items.name: Swordfish
items.description: This fish is an incomparable duellist, which is to be expected when you consider how much time it must spend practicing.

items.name: Quixote Swordfish
items.description: During mating season, this fish swims upstream to attack waterfalls in order to impress its sweetheart. This lets fishermen catch it without having to go out on the ocean.

items.name: Worm-Ridden Wood
items.description: There's fewer traces of worms in this wood than in your mount's posterior.

items.name: Hazel Wood
items.description: It seems that Akornaddikt built himself a decadent palace with these boards... Can you believe it? It also seems that you'll believe anything.

items.name: Particle Board
items.description: This board is used to create cheap furniture, which is why it's prized by Enutrofs working in funeral parlours.

items.name: Plywood Board
items.description: Worms are stuck to this board like Astrubians around an adventurer throwing their inventory on the ground.

items.name: Greal Board
items.description: This board is the same board used for Brakmar's giant barbecues and pyres.

items.name: Surf Board
items.description: Many copies of this Vulkanian board were created in Amakna.

items.name: Ironing Board
items.description: Don't worry: it's not just for women.

items.name: Awkwood Board
items.description: Many a Twelvian schoolboy lives in mortal fear of walking around with this board.

items.name: Pastry Board
items.description: Since many "gourmands" have developed the strange habit of licking this board and getting splinters in their tongues, a law was created that expressly forbids seeking compensation for any injury caused by this board.

items.name: Etching Board
items.description: Don't confuse this with a retching board, which doesn't exist.

items.name: Bread Board
items.description: Executioners like to use these boards to keep from damaging their work surfaces while executing smaller creatures.

items.name: Drawing Board
items.description: Carrying this board with you everywhere lets you come up with new plans faster when your old ones fail.

items.name: Rescue Board
items.description: This board has saved innumerable lives, especially at sea.

items.name: Celestial Wool
items.description: This Celestial Wool will certainly keep you covered, but its transparent nature can be somewhat troublesome, especially if you have something to hide.

items.name: Chimeric Feather
items.description: Trying to get a feather from the Chimeric Tofu by running after it will build up your legs real quick!

items.name: Translucent Petal
items.description: If you're thinking of making a hat with these petals to protect you from the sun, well... good luck.

items.name: Spiritabby Tail
items.description: Worn as a scarf or used as a whip, this tail has quite a few uses in expert hands.

items.name: Internal Fire
items.description: After years of meditation, you might be able to reveal your inner fire. If you don't want to wait, you can also bump off a few Spirit Fires.

items.name: Gloot Skin
items.description: Much like a water balloon, this skin contains all the water Gloots need to survive. If you want to be rid of it, you'll only need a needle.

items.name: Aminita Volva
items.description: If you're asking what a volva is, you must be a man.

items.name: Incarnam Relic
items.description: If the legend is to be believed, these relics have the power to bring the dead back to life. However, seeing the Incarnam Chafers, some doubts are normal.

items.name: Kardorim's Skull
items.description: This magnificent skull will look wonderful on your coffee table - a souvenir of a battle from your days as a young adventurer. However, be careful that it doesn't devour your meal when you turn your back on it.

items.name: Jade Hammer Head
items.description: If you're moderately talented, you can probably craft a replica of Hargnok the Smasher's hammer with this piece of green stone. Then you could have the pleasure of smashing your adversaries' heads in with a legendary weapon.

items.name: Intangible Meat
items.description: Taken from moribund animals or bodiless spirits, this meat is rather strange. It's said it's the result of an experiment by Tajonoo... The god of insipidity would particularly appreciate its bland taste.

items.name: Ash Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Chestnut Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Walnut Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Oak Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Bombu Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Maple Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Oliviolet Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Yew Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Bamboo Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Cherry Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Hazel Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Ebony Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Kaliptus Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Hornbeam Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Dark Bamboo Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Elm Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Holy Bamboo Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Aspen Sap
items.description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

items.name: Slab
items.description: This slab was torn from the ground in Bonta during the student protests of Maysial in 598. Six centuries later, and they're still paying for it..

items.name: Basalt
items.description: Laid down end to end, this basalt could be used to build a giant path from Brakmar to Vulkania to see who has the biggest. Stones, that is.

items.name: Kardorim Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Untainted Meat Juice
items.description: This juice attracts Moskitos, just like you.

items.name: Untainted Baker's Yeast
items.description: With this yeast, you can at least pretend to be a decent baker.

items.name: Untainted Fish Juice
items.description: This juice was untainted when it was bottled. But is it still? You'll find out soon...

items.name: Potion of Old Age
items.description: This potion can speed up certain chemical processes, such as the the formation of precipitates. It's a bit like a super-powerful yeast, but it doesn't taste as bad.

items.name: Tam Voodoo Doll
items.description: This Doll has a mysterious power, and you have a sneaking suspicion that there's someone trapped inside it.

items.name: Rusty Blade
items.description: Tettinus was a fearsome pirate whose very name inspired dread and awe in all who heard it. Armed with his Rusty Blade, he was the living embodiment of death, more cruel than death itself could ever be. No one knows what happened to him, but many have reported seeing pirates using a Rusty Blade to scare their enemies...

items.name: Moon's Tree Key
items.description: No one is allowed to climb Moon's Tree without first giving the sacred key to his humble servant... And forget about trying to bribe her with Citronanas, peanuts, or Adventurer Meat, she's completely incorruptible.

items.name: LeChouque's Boat Key
items.description: They say whoever shows this key to pirate Jack Martel will win the right to visit the Dark Hurl, LeChouque's boat. Once you're on board, it's hard to say what might happen... Few have returned alive to tell the tale.

items.name: Zatoishwan's Hairs
items.description: These hairs have a rather delicate odour, a subtle blend of Bamboo Milk liqueur and broiled fur.

items.name: Anatak's Scalp
items.description: ‘X marks the spot.' You remembered this sentence as you were scalping Anatak, but unfortunately you did not find anything of value under his skin.

items.name: KOs' Massive Shoulder Pad
items.description: This shoulder pad is so massive that only a phenomenally strong creature can wear one without getting crushed under its weight.

items.name: Voldelor's Foot
items.description: According to Enurado tradition, thieves have their feet cut off, are locked up with the gold they tried to steal and are forced to count it over and over until their eventual demise.

items.name: King Kongoku's Hide
items.description: You took out its heart, but the powerful monster was still dangerous even in death and could have made your skull explode in a sudden shock.

items.name: Ground Meat
items.description: Only an artist, a real expert with a knife, a veteran cutter could cut this meat in this way. Pray you never fall into the hands of one such artist – if you do, you'll end up on a plate, on a table, in front of an Enutrof who's overjoyed at the idea of chomping down on a beautiful steak tender enough for his (or her) old teeth.

items.name: Rotten Meat
items.description: This meat is as full of protein as it is full of maggots.

items.name: Rotten Carrion
items.description: It's not the size of this meat that matters, but the delightful smell of decaying flesh.

items.name: Contaminated Meat
items.description: The stench of this meat repels even the most reckless of Moskitos.

items.name: Contaminated Carrion
items.description: If you walk around carrying this meat, people will think you just came out of a dump.

items.name: Mineral Meat
items.description: Way back when, Mineral Meat was simply used to fuel fires, as it was deemed inappropriate for consumption - it wasn't even something you'd feed to animals. These days, it's become fashionable to mix it with other products to sell it in the form of patties, raviolis, pâtés...

items.name: Mineral Carrion
items.description: You'll have no trouble selling this meat if you pass it off as a latest gen biological weapon.

items.name: Tender Meat
items.description: The secret of tenderising this meat is the same as that of a successful education - hit subject with The Fellow Pages.

items.name: Tender Carrion
items.description: The fact that you're constantly rubbing this meat against your cheek reveals a deep emotional void.

items.name: Maggoty Meat
items.description: This still-living meat doesn't mill about as much as one might expect. In fact, the larvae are waiting to be eaten to start developing.

items.name: Maggoty Carrion
items.description: If you slapped a hunk of this raw meat on a plate, it'd crawl to the nearest mouth.

items.name: Rancid Meat
items.description: This meat will definitely no longer be spoiled if you just change the use-by date. Ignore the flies buzzing round it.

items.name: Rancid Carrion
items.description: Even though it's totally unfit for consumption, there's numerous ways of recycling this meat to make it commercially viable.

items.name: Blood-Soaked Meat
items.description: If you've got no more paint, you could always use this meat to colour your walls.

items.name: Blood-Soaked Carrion
items.description: If you squeeze this meat, you'll get enough blood out of it for several transfusions.

items.name: Stale Meat
items.description: You needed to check meat, but then you find it's a stale meat. Can't win them all.

items.name: Stale Carrion
items.description: If you can find a buyer for this meat, then you now know what you to do with the bodies of your Sidekicks...

items.name: Oozing Meat
items.description: Can be used in place of hair dye - assuming red is what you're going for.

items.name: Dripping Meat
items.description: Well, the vast quantities of toxins in this meat had to go somewhere, didn't they.

items.name: Dried Meat
items.description: You simply do not understand why your grandparents give off a musty smell while this meat has no odour whatsoever.

items.name: Dried Carrion
items.description: This meat has undergone a conservation process similar to that of the oldest Enutrofs, which guarantees exceptional durability.

items.name: Bloody Meat
items.description: You could almost believe this to be the remains of a Sacrier, but a closer examination will remove any further doubts. It is the remains of a Sacrier.

items.name: Bloody Carrion
items.description: Vampires go crazy for this meat, so it's time you stopped wearing it as a fetching necklace.

items.name: Marbled Meat
items.description: You know the phrase about somebody losing their marbles? Well, you'll find them all again in this dodgy sirloin. As well as the person who lost them.

items.name: Marbled Carrion
items.description: More veins than an old Enutrof's leg, and tastes almost as bad.

items.name: Macerated Meat
items.description: You don't know where and how many times this meat has been macerated, and it's better that way. Trust us.

items.name: Macerated Carrion
items.description: This meat is fresh from the butcher between the sewers and the waste water pond.

items.name: Biltong Meat
items.description: Only traditional hunters know how to procure and pronounce this choice cut of meat.

items.name: Biltong Carrion
items.description: The kind of meat that is favoured by jerks.

items.name: Fresh Meat
items.description: Oto Mustam's personal butcher, who has been recently promoted to work in the fiery lower levels of Brakmar, has become an expert in preparing this kind of meat.

items.name: Fresh Carrion
items.description: Somebody had to find a use for the cannon fodder that mounts up every time a peace treaty goes south.

items.name: Lean Meat
items.description: All the fat from this meat has been carefully extracted in order to make the confectionary that is given to kids on school outings.

items.name: Lean Carrion
items.description: The way the fat has been reduced in this meat is something that can easily be copied by aspiring slimmers - cut off any fat that sticks out. Immediate results guaranteed.

items.name: Spoiled Meat
items.description: Your parents taught you early on that even though you're spoiled, it's no reason to throw you out with the rubbish, even if in this meat's opinion, you deserve it.

items.name: Spoiled Carrion
items.description: There's always a way to falsify documents or grease the palm of a health inspector in order to certify the perfect quality of this meat.

items.name: Midnight Meat
items.description: Only the best father pheasant plucker that ever plucked a father pheasant could pluck this meat.

items.name: Midnight Carrion
items.description: If it were blue, it would be called something else. Well, no, it wouldn't be called Something Else literally.

items.name: Tasty Meat
items.description: One day, you left with your parents-in-law. The next, you came back alone, your bag full of ground meat they gave you. No one's seen them since.

items.name: Tasty Carrion
items.description: One day, you left with your old mount. In the evening, you came back with a new mount and some meat to cook for supper.

items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Kongoku's map back together.
