items.name: LeChouque Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Ethereal Carrion
items.description: This meat can barely be touched, which makes it tricky to cook for a beginner hunter.

items.name: Huppermage Skull
items.description: This hupperskull is full of calcium, and once reduced to powder will make a great dietary supplement for your Bow Meow or Bow Wow.

items.name: Knout Tips
items.description: These sharpened tips have no problem going through the thickest of skins and the hardest of nipples.

items.name: Knout Handle
items.description: Zeurg could find a use for this handle, maybe even several, and the images that come to mind arouse a mix of excitement and disgust.

items.name: Knout Straps
items.description: These solid, rugged straps were designed to be used for several decades.

items.name: Colousses's Meowsoleum Key
items.description: Are you itching to get into the Meowsoleum just crawling with Ecaflees? Use this key to scratch that itch.

items.name: Ush's Plateau Key
items.description: This key is like a token which allows you to make a foolish bet: to survive a battle against Ush Galesh. Many would hesitate before risking their life, but not you. The emptiness of your existence is such that you have nothing to lose.

items.name: Catseye Challenge Key
items.description: Do you like playing dice? You'll love the Catseye Challenge. Don't worry: if you fail, you'll go straight to the cemetery without suffering the tortures of the Ecaflip toilet. Not everyone's been so lucky...

items.name: Chance Biscuit
items.description: This little cake, drier than your mother-in-law's heart, contains a bit of paper with the following message written on it: "All is not yet lost." You feel reassured.

items.name: Petrified Ecaflee Larva
items.description: This larva could have become a Fleeflee or a Geriatick if it hadn't gobbled up so many mineral substances. And now, here it is, hard as a rock, condemned to a life as material used for making keys. What an unhappy ending.

items.name: Weremoggy Claw
items.description: Each Weremoggy has its own way of slashing at its victims' back or intimate parts: its claw marks form its signature. The one you tore this trophy from may not be able to make any dedications for quite some time.

items.name: Great Game Card
items.description: There's a rumour that the picture cards of the Great Game filed a complaint with the Divine Tribunal of Ingloriom for cuts and folds. Since the arrival of adventurers in the Ecaflipus Dimension, the cards have been getting beaten regularly.

items.name: Fleeflee Paw
items.description: Stickier than your mother-in-law during a family dinner, the Fleeflee paw will never separate from the person it's attached to. Handle with care if you don't want to end up with a new limb.

items.name: Melouse Eye
items.description: This eye shows the Melouse to be a nasty little beast: it prefers to have to leave an eye behind rather than to have to miss a good scrap.

items.name: Bytbul Palp
items.description: The Bytbul was feeling around so much that he got a smack. Well, he was warned.

items.name: Geriatick Skin
items.description: Just like a vampire, this old skin absorbs the blood of anyone who comes into contact with its hairs.

items.name: Itsh Spine
items.description: How valuable could it be? After all, look how many the Itsh had laying around.

items.name: Colousses Gland
items.description: The seed contained in this gland is the cause of the Ecaflee infestation of the Elevation Stones. Be very careful then not to leave it just laying around, unless you want to see the little pests polluting your home.

items.name: Catsquatch Tail
items.description: This tiger-striped tail works perfectly as a scarf. But be very sure it's not still attached to its owner before you put it around your neck.

items.name: Pouncer Fur
items.description:
"The Pouncer's soft and silky fur is as blue as the reflection of the skies in your eyes."
– Khan to Bakara
Taken from the tale "The Adventurer of Ecaflipus"

items.name: Catichan's Collar
items.description: Even though it's as fast as air, you'll always hear a Catichan coming thanks to this collar decorated with a little tinkling bell.

items.name: Calleyat Ear
items.description: When it's cold out, the Calleyat can always use its giant ears as impromptu blankets.

items.name: Sucatrose Tooth
items.description: Each time you cross a Sucatrose, you feel an irresistible urge to munch on its fur, as if it were a snack. Don't be surprised, then, if it doesn't act very sweetly towards you.

items.name: Ush's Moustache
items.description: Each of Ecaflips' sons cherishes their fur - when they have some - like a divine gift. So it's normal that you hunt them down and rip out their fur like it was an invaluable treasure.

items.name: Soldier's Pike
items.description: Used like a spear, this pike always finds its target's heart.

items.name: Knight's Feather
items.description: This instrument of torture has already made the greatest feet in the World of Twelve waver.

items.name: Jack's Vest
items.description: This vest supposedly brings luck. Its former owner should have held on to it better.

items.name: Queen's Belt
items.description: A belt made out of fur, fit for a queen.

items.name: King Playa's Seal
items.description: When in ownership of this seal, it is possible to sign any document in the guise of King Playa. If he had the slightest bit of authority, you could go wild!

items.name: Catseye's Die
items.description: In order to make a decision when several choices present themselves, it is important to always have a die handy. Don't hesitate to throw it a second time if the first throw's result wasn't what you were hoping for.

items.name: Atcham's Hair
items.description: You could have cut out his tongue, but in an excess of kindness, you pulled out nothing more than the hair that was sticking out of it.

items.name: Atcham's Map
items.description: This map will allow you to find Atcham's legendary treasure.

items.name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 1/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Atcham's Map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 2/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Atcham's Map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 3/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Atcham's Map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 4/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Atcham's Map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 5/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Atcham's Map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 6/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Atcham's Map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 7/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Atcham's Map back together.

items.name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 8/8
items.description: This fragment will allow you to put Atcham's Map back together.

items.name: Great Game Catzino Token
items.description: Do you feel lucky? Well do you?

items.name: Weremoggy Catzino Token
items.description: Do you feel lucky? Well do you?

items.name: Ecaflee Catzino Token
items.description: Do you feel lucky? Well do you?

items.name: Catseye Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Ush Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Colousses Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: King Leorictus's Crypt Key
items.description: This key was made to open the Crypt housing the dead King Leorictus's ashes.

items.name: Prince Djamal Brecht's Crypt Key
items.description: This key was made to open the Crypt housing the dead Prince Djamal Brecht's ashes.

items.name: Korriander Flower
items.description: Korriander Flowers smell of caged wild beasts in order to repel herbivores. It also works at repelling mothers-in-law or clingy girls.

items.name: Phosphorescent Solvent
items.description: Restless like a torch in the night, it will attract any insects, as well as their predators. It's a simple way to hunt without exhausting yourself.

items.name: Cursed Temple Key
items.description: This key is used to enter the Cursed Araknas Temple. This sentence should be taken literally.

items.name: Abominable Fish Juice
items.description: Sadly, the smell isn't misleading: this juice tastes dreadful.

items.name: Asphyxiating Fish Juice
items.description: Do you want to see someone dead? Then this is the gift they require.

items.name: Pestilential Fish Juice
items.description: This flask contains an elixir which tastes every bit as good as a concentrate of all the dirty socks in Amakna.

items.name: Noxious Fish Juice
items.description: Did someone really think that mixing three unbearably stinky juices would give you an unforgettable fragrance?

items.name: Araknas Map
items.description: This map will allow you to find the Araknas Sacred Stones User Guide.

items.name: Ambergris
items.description: This rare and odiferous material is worth its weight in Pearls of the Depths. Common people claim that it's "whale vomit", but they have narrow-minded view of the world; you don't share it in any way... do you?

items.name: Deep Sea Token
items.description: The mark of great men is to have their name written down in history. The Deep Sea Token simply allows you to create a Seal of the Founders. It takes all sorts to make a world.

items.name: Steamopump
items.description: This pump is used to make a Hydraulic Wheel. Don't use it for anything else: it would be dangerous and unsuitable.

items.name: Brass Propeller
items.description: This propeller won't allow you to fly away, but will however let you go down to explore the ocean depths. Don't look disappointed; you'll find another chance to take off.

items.name: Diving Weights
items.description: When someone tells you you'll need these weights to explore the Tritun Depths, you're relieved: after all, it shows that you don't weigh that much.

items.name: Jitter Filter
items.description: As its names shows, this filter is supposed to catch all of your fears, from the most intimate to the most elementary. You have trouble conceiving that such a thing can be possible, but then again, you have trouble conceiving many things.

items.name: Shell Pedestal
items.description: You'll need to remember to clean the inside of the shell before using it as a pedestal. Otherwise, when you place the statuette on it, it'll stink of old rotting molluscs.

items.name: Seal of the Founders
items.description: For safety reasons, the site of Ancient Sufokia is not open to the public. A seal is therefore necessary to use the facilities that will let you reach its depth.

items.name: Hydraulic Wheel
items.description: A very long time ago, the Submerged City was explored by the first Foggernauts. If you want to visit it, you'll need to use a Hydraulic Wheel to open the gates and activate the lifts built by the founders.

items.name: Propulsion Accelerator
items.description: To cross the rough seas that swirl at the edge of the Tritun Rift, there's nothing quite like a Propulsion Accelerator.

items.name: Anti-Whirlpool Ballast
items.description: The Foggernauts don't carry much weight against the whirlpools blocking access to the Tritun Depths. This problem is solved by adding some ballast.

items.name: Fear-Catcher
items.description: This strange object allows explorers to go down to Rygurgal Pit without being overcome by an unspeakable terror.

items.name: Snedon Statuette
items.description: The owners of this statuette – representing a dark divinity – can dive to Rygurgal Abyss with a slim chance of coming back up again one day.

items.name: Mol Usk Slobber
items.description:
Mol Usk Slobber has curative properties, which help certain wounds heal. The only side effect is that it changes the colour of the skin where it's applied.
Some people use it as Al Howin makeup.

items.name: Yoloinist Crab Claw
items.description: When the Yoloinist Crab finds a partner it thinks is worthy, it tests it by grabbing its shell and squeezing with all its might. If the shell remains unbroken, the two crabs become a couple. Thank goodness normal dating doesn't work the same way.

items.name: Gambasmak Scale
items.description: Gambasmaks are extremely rapid and agile. Their scales help them be more stable underwater, as well as giving them a unique style.

items.name: Mantaze Tail
items.description: Constantly electrified, the Mantaze's tail generates a dangerous sphere around it – so long as it is underwater. In the darkness, certain underwater animals get fooled: attracted by the light, they don't miss out on suffering a few discharges.

items.name: Aquatic Parasite
items.description: In an environment dominated by blues and greens, this little parasite absorbs these two colours, causing its host to turn a decidedly more red tint. Unfortunately, this drastically reduces their lifespan, as it renders their hosts much more visible, and therefore much more vulnerable.

items.name: Crabtun Lantern
items.description: It was thought that this lantern helped the Crabtun attract its prey in order to eat them more easily. But it actually lets it attract its prey in order to more easily headbutt them. It's a subtle difference.

items.name: Meno's Hair
items.description: Where exactly did you pluck this hair from?

items.name: Octodoll Ink
items.description: Octodoll Ink is normally black. This sample must have been taken during a particular period.

items.name: Tryde Trident
items.description: Trydes can make themselves invisible with their tridents: these weapons capture the light as firmly as they skewer all those who venture under the seas.

items.name: Silyrus Moustache
items.description: Silyruses love to live dangerously: if two of their moustaches touch one another, it can paralyse them. And yet these are the only underwater inhabitants to give each other a kiss on the cheek when they meet.

items.name: Merdiodon Spine
items.description: Before grabbing a globe-fish, Merdiodons aren't immune to their poison. It's after continuously being stung while handling them that they build up a tolerance.

items.name: Tritun Skin
items.description: Tritun skin, combined with their natural ability to swim, lets them make it through certain underwater passages that they alone can make it through.

items.name: Dantinea's Dentures
items.description: Without saying a word, these dentures help you send a very clear message: I'm in no mood to talk. They might mistakenly say you're very hungry, although the two messages are not mutually exclusive.

items.name: Diepwon Tentacle
items.description: This tentacle is a vestige of what the Diepwon was before fully possessing its host.

items.name: N'yalgy Tentacle
items.description: Often confused with a sea snake, this tentacle lets the N'yalgy frighten away animals that come too close while it's attempting magic rituals.

items.name: Skt-Zo Leg
items.description: Skt-Zos absorb souls. Their tentacles absorb souls, their mouth absorbs souls, their eyes absorb souls... naturally, their legs absorb souls too. It's a way of life.

items.name: Spookkoth's Eye
items.description: Synonymous with conspiracy, Spookkoth's Eye is its main tool for sewing discord.

items.name: Flauticultist's Flute
items.description: This flute can emit melodious and recognisable sounds underwater. Flauticultists are one of the rare species able to play audible music underwater. But that doesn't stop them from using their instrument for other means, usually morbid ones.

items.name: Angular Stone
items.description: An important piece for the Servants of the Unspeakable, this stone seems linked to another dimension.

items.name: Koutoulou Larva Wing
items.description: It's hard to believe that such a small wing could support the immense weight of a Koutoulou Larva. Thankfully, magic can explain anything.

items.name: Litlamprey Tooth
items.description: Litlampreys are always hungry and can eat anything. However, their teeth are impeccable, maintained by Mol Usk Slobber.

items.name: Mahaquany Wood
items.description: Marine carpenters avoid using this wood which looks like coral to make ships; this prohibition probably has something to do with the fact that Mahaquany grows in the abysses. Boats were made to float; it's best not to tempt fate.

items.name: Salikronia
items.description: This plant is also known as the sea gherkin, but alchemists prefer to use the term Salikronia. That obviously sounds more classy and mysterious to uncultured people.

items.name: Quisnoa
items.description: This pseudo-cereal is consumed by divers in great quantities; there's nothing better than some good Quisnoa gruel to weigh you down and make you reach the bottom faster.

items.name: Limpet
items.description: Sufokian Limpet has abandoned the rocky foreshores to seek refuge in the depths of the bay. To live happily, it lives in hiding... but not well-hidden enough to escape from you.

items.name: Sepiolite
items.description: This soft, white mineral is as light as foam, which is where it gets its name from. The mineral, that is, not foam... After being dried out, it becomes as hard as your mother-in-law's heart. Its heat resistance and porous nature make for a material of choice to create pipes.

items.name: Captain Meno's Ship Key
items.description: The legendary Mobilus is finally opening its doors to you, but don't expect to receive a very warm welcome.

items.name: Dantinea's Palace Key
items.description: This key grants you the right to be Dantinea's next meal. Don't forget to season yourself before entering her palace!

items.name: Koutoulou's Temple Key
items.description: Entering Koutoulou's Temple... what a strange and terrifying idea! Are you sure your mind's not warped?

items.name: First Receipt
items.description: This receipt can be exchanged for Alitons in the Breeder Village.

items.name: Second Receipt
items.description: This receipt can be exchanged for Alitons in the Breeder Village.

items.name: Third Receipt
items.description: This receipt can be exchanged for Alitons in the Breeder Village.

items.name: Fourth Receipt
items.description: This receipt can be exchanged for Alitons in the Breeder Village.

items.name: Fifth Receipt
items.description: This receipt can be exchanged for Alitons in the Breeder Village.

items.name: Wild Receipt
items.description: Regardless of the Dragoturkeys' fate, this receipt will make sure you cover your costs.

items.name: Insignificant Receipt
items.description: Regardless of the Dragoturkeys' fate, this receipt will make sure you cover your costs.

items.name: Piddling Receipt
items.description: Regardless of the Dragoturkeys' fate, this receipt will make sure you cover your costs.

items.name: Minimal Receipt
items.description: Regardless of the Dragoturkeys' fate, this receipt will make sure you cover your costs.

items.name: Modest Receipt
items.description: Regardless of the Dragoturkeys' fate, this receipt will make sure you cover your costs.

items.name: Minor Receipt
items.description: Regardless of the Dragoturkeys' fate, this receipt will make sure you cover your costs.

items.name: Average Receipt
items.description: Regardless of the Dragoturkeys' fate, this receipt will make sure you cover your costs.

items.name: Substantial Receipt
items.description: Regardless of the Dragoturkeys' fate, this receipt will make sure you cover your costs.

items.name: Weighty Receipt
items.description: Regardless of the Dragoturkeys' fate, this receipt will make sure you cover your costs.

items.name: Considerable Receipt
items.description: Regardless of the Dragoturkeys' fate, this receipt will make sure you cover your costs.

items.name: Major Receipt
items.description: Regardless of the Dragoturkeys' fate, this receipt will make sure you cover your costs.

items.name: Great Receipt
items.description: Regardless of the Dragoturkeys' fate, this receipt will make sure you cover your costs.

items.name: Troofle
items.description: This is the original recipe for Troofle; the Bworks' industrial version is nothing but a poor copy, with its comparatively  bland flavour and insipid smell. In plain English, it stinks for kilokametres around, and a single drop could fertilise the Cania Fields for a month.

items.name: Fattrool
items.description: You can use this thick and nutritious grease to cook most types of food in old pots without ruining the dish. Some Osamodas also use it to slip Tofus into places that the Iop moral code condemns.

items.name: Shimmering Silk
items.description: This very special cloth would is used to craft the legendary Dofusteuse.

items.name: Mastodon Bone
items.description: This ridiculous bone comes from the carcass of a Mastodon.

items.name: Mastodon Flute
items.description: This flute, carved from a Mastodon Bone, has been reinforced for prolonged, violent use.

items.name: Castuc Juice
items.description: By squeezing enough Castucs, a juice comes out of them which is particularly sweet and refreshing.

items.name: Levito Maraca
items.description: Lighter than air, the Levito Maracas fly away whenever they get the chance. If you manage to get your hands on a pair, don't let them out of your hands – if you do, you'll never see them again.

items.name: Cactana Scroll
items.description: The contents of the Cactana scrolls have been the subject of much speculation. Now that you have one in your hands, the mystery has been solved: it contains a spice-based recipe... the kind of dish that'll make you die of thirst.

items.name: Castupod Flower
items.description: Don't sniff this flower too closely, or you'll find yourself with a lovely floral nose piercing.

items.name: Saguaro Whiskers
items.description: You've taken a Saguaro's whiskers. Did you think they'd make a good moustache for you? Whatever were you thinking!?

items.name: Pampastuc G-String
items.description: This beautiful g-string would suit you perfectly. Be sure not to put it on backwards, or you'll have to say goodbye to your tackle.

items.name: El Piko Golden Star
items.description: This star would be perfect at the top of a Kwismas tree.

items.name: Fine Sand
items.description: Although people walk on it all day long, this sand can be used for many things. Building castles, for example.

items.name: Spykbal Ball
items.description: These balls are mainly used in the famous game of the Spykbowls. The rules are simple: you have some balls covered with spikes, and must throw them at your opponents.

items.name: Ourobubble Scales
items.description: These scales are perfect for crafting armour that is both light and resistant. As a result, they can also be used to make combat swimsuits, so you can fight while topping up your tan.

items.name: Scordion Tail
items.description: The residents of Ohwymi have got into the habit of putting Scordion Tails in their liquor bottles, to scare tourists. Fortunately, after a few hours spent with said liquor, the venom contained within this tail is eliminated completely.

items.name: Fennex Tail
items.description: The hairs of this tail are often used to craft the best paintbrushes. To the point of transforming any child's scribblings into a masterpiece... at least in their parents' eyes.

items.name: Mantiscore Carapace
items.description: Once used to craft armour, it now serves as a projectile in sand yacht races.

items.name: El Spiko
items.description: Sporting a thin, elegant moustache, this tip is much classier than you.

items.name: Mantiscore Heart
items.description: This heart is imbued with spice, which makes it a particularly spicy and refined dish. It is sought after by the greatest chefs in the world who use it to justify the astronomical price of their dishes.

items.name: Leopena Eye
items.description: Even once it's removed from its owner, this eye seems to follow you around as if it could bite you. Don't let it hang around in your pockets; you never know...

items.name: Mastodon Cemetery Key
items.description: This key has more of a symbolic value showing your burning desire enter the Mastodon Cemetery, rather than any real use.

items.name: El Piko's Cave Key
items.description: This key is a sign of respect among Castucs. It proves the value of the Castuc who owns it, and eventually allows it to be able to have an audience with El Piko when he hides away in his cave.

items.name: Castuc Cocktail
items.description: This cocktail made from Nonexistent Water and Castuc pulp is essential for crafting a quality Dorado Hat: it allows the tailor to quench their thirst while working.

items.name: Jackalnubis Fragment
items.description: No need to rub it frantically; no genie will come out of this fragment.

items.name: Bandijd Tooth
items.description: Contrary to what one might believe, this mummified tooth is in much better condition than your decaying toothypegs.

items.name: Mumystic Garnet
items.description: These garnets keep levitating with the magic permeating them; it remains to be seen what purpose they serve.

items.name: Sneerena Golden Eyelid
items.description: This is an accessory which will soon be all the rage at Klime's masquerades.

items.name: Scratchotep Ear
items.description: The shape and texture of this ear make it a clean and therefore reusable cotton bud. You won't need to buy them in packets of one hundred any more.

items.name: Tal Kasha Hair
items.description: You're going to need more than a tuft of his hair to compete with the Tal Kasha's mane.

items.name: Chrysonefantine Scarab
items.description: Hit a Iop's skull, and it'll make this item start to resonate. The sound produced varies depending on the size of the skull and its emptiness.

items.name: Chamber of Tal Kasha Key
items.description: To your disappointment, this key doesn't let you get into the Tal Kasha's bedroom, but her burial chamber. So unless you're a Sram, you may draw your colleagues' suspicion and disgust.

items.name: Wurmlord's Passage Key
items.description: The Wurmlord takes great pleasure in feeling adventurers penetrate his passage, then go back up all the way to his glottis. Therefore, feel free to jump into his hole feet first.

items.name: Cyclouse Tooth
items.description: Let's just hope that any toothless Mimice are willing to pay you for it!

items.name: Sharcut Tongue
items.description: This is what happens when you bite your tongue with a mouth full of several rows of sharp teeth.

items.name: Mastifang Paw
items.description: Ridiculously small, this paw is a painful reminder of the mockery you suffered in the school locker room.

items.name: Tremrus Skin
items.description: This skin is ideal for camouflaging yourself in a rocky environment... so long as you're a Crackler.

items.name: Stapleworm Spike
items.description: A Stapleworm without spikes is like a Sadida without a doll, or an Enutrof without a beard: it loses everything that characterizes it and gives it its charm.

items.name: Sandworm Shell
items.description: This piece of shell is robust enough to serve as a sled on the dunes.

items.name: Wurmlord Eye
items.description: The Wurmlord's eye is his most developed sensory organ. So it makes sense it being valued by alchemists trying to reproduce this effectiveness.

items.name: Ouginak Skull
items.description: An Ouginak proverb says that it is better to die a quick and decisive death than to let time slowly eat you away.

items.name: Mel Dam Per Rune
items.description: This rune will increase melee damage.

items.name: Dis Dam Per Rune
items.description: This rune will increase ranged damage.

items.name: Wep Dam Per Rune
items.description: This rune will increase weapon damage.

items.name: Spe Dam Per Rune
items.description: This rune will increase spell damage.

items.name: Mel Res Per Rune
items.description: This rune will reduce melee damage.

items.name: Dis Res Per Rune
items.description: This rune will reduce ranged damage.

items.name: Hunderp Blood
items.description: It's hard to say if this blood is the Hunderp's or one of its victims.

items.name: Buckshot Tail
items.description: It's not the first time that you've held such a hairy tail in your hands, and it feels just as good as it ever did.

items.name: Draftwit Slobber
items.description: If you distill just one drop of this slobber, you could keep the Amakna Tavern stocked up on beer for an entire month.

items.name: Nemroz Bone
items.description: This bone belongs to a hunter who won't live long enough to become anything but skin and bones.

items.name: Crambo Arrow
items.description: If you ask Count Razof why Cra would create such a creature, he'll inform you it wasn't the goddess but him who created Crambo.

items.name: Count Razof Hair
items.description: It's quite normal that Count Razof has practically no hair left on his noggin, because you've got it all in your hands.

items.name: Bottle of Nottlebeck
items.description: This artisanal beer, whose production secrets are known only to the initiated, has the power to reunite hunters, both good and bad.

items.name: Count Razof's Camp Key
items.description: A tin of food or a bottle of red wine would have done just as nicely.

items.name: Hunter's Trap Blueprint
items.description: To create a Hunter's Trap, a Handyman must follow this blueprint with 7 Holy Bamboo Woods and 7 Amakna Beers.

items.name: Muscle-Bound Beverage Formula
items.description: To create a Muscle-Bound Beverage, an Alchemist must follow this formula with 8 Mandrakes, 10 Drinking Waters, and 1 Cawwot.

items.name: Rustic Implants Diagram
items.description: To create a Rustic Implant, a Blacksmith must follow this diagram with 1 Pyrute and 1 Midnight Meat.

items.name: Hunter's Trap Chest
items.description: This chest contains several Hunter's Traps.

items.name: Muscle-Bound Beverage
items.description: This beverage is intended for an animal, and its effects on a Twelvian might be drastically different. Therefore, please don't drink it before you go strutting about the beach this summer.

items.name: Rustic Implants
items.description: These implants give Ben Wodent claws and fangs. What better way to make your partner jealous?

items.name: Magik Riktus Big Top Key
items.description: This key will allow you to see a Magik Riktus performance.

items.name: Forfut Manor Key
items.description:
If you agree to give your blood, it is possible to enter Forfut Manor without a key. 
But it's a one-way journey.

items.name: Anerice's Spike
items.description: The spikes on Anerice's dress make anyone who comes to close bleed, not to offend them.

items.name: Ghoulutton Nail
items.description: Ghoulutton Nails are soaked in Anerice's power, and can turn you into a ghoul. Luckily for you, they never use their hands to fight.

items.name: Kerighoul Wing
items.description: You may be wondering how these wings manage to cope with the weight of a Kerighoul. It's another question to add to your collection of futile questions to which you'll never find an answer. How will you sleep at night?

items.name: Ghouligan Eye
items.description: Just like Chafers, ghouls can switch their eyes without injury. Therefore, they sometimes use them to barter for certain favours. More and more ghouls only have one eye left, which is of real delight to the eye patch sellers of Forfut.

items.name: Ghoultimate Hair
items.description: Their hair is the reason that Ghoultimates are also called fabulous ghouls.

items.name: Pipistracker Nose
items.description: In the past, some Pipistrackers used their sense of smell to get their bearings and track their prey. Now, the smell of ghouls completely masks any trail, so they do the same thing as borbats and get their bearings using echolocation.

items.name: Red Ghoulobule
items.description: A dash of idiocy, a drop of frivolity, a few grains of nonchalance: it's actually rather difficult to tell ghoul blood apart from Iop blood.

items.name: Ilyzaelle's Lookout Key
items.description: Ilyzaelle's Lookout is a place that sends shivers down your spine. Luckily for you, the Soul-Blazes are very cuddly, and are always there to give you a bit of warmth.

items.name: Phiretom Eye
items.description: This eye still moves occasionally, as if it's surveilling the area and waiting for a moment of weakness.

items.name: Skoul Claw
items.description: This type of claw is highly sought after at funfairs. They're generally used in games where you have to grab items with them. This is made all the more difficult by their ghostly nature.

items.name: Encapsulated Soul-Blaze
items.description: Ghost hunters go crazy for this item, which they like to keep on their mantelpiece.

items.name: Hothing Ashes
items.description: These ashes are too hot to handle.

items.name: Ectorch Fragment
items.description: This Ectorch Fragment is always on fire, as if its soul continues to be burn even after being defeated.

items.name: Spirigneous Remains
items.description: This Spirigneous did not meet a happy end.

items.name: Ilyzaelle Feather
items.description: These feathers make Ilyzaelle's armour more aerodynamic.

items.name: Pa Hea Rune
items.description: This rune will improve your ability to heal others.

items.name: Pa Air Res Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Air damage.

items.name: Pa Water Res Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Water damage.

items.name: Pa Fire Res Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Fire damage.

items.name: Pa Neutral Res Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Neutral damage.

items.name: Pa Earth Res Rune
items.description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Earth damage.

items.name: Dead Key Tooth
items.description: Having listened too closely to his dentist's advice, Dead Key ended up losing his teeth.

items.name: Reallinotseen Vertebra
items.description: The bones of the Reallinotseen are as resistant as its shield. They can be used to replace bolts or rings lost on a wedding day.

items.name: Relentliss Tongue
items.description: Some like them slobbery, others like them gravelly. The Relentliss's tongue is neither one or the other, but sets everything it touches ablaze.

items.name: Dedbomb Grenade
items.description: Charred One dentists recommend that their patients place one of these grenades in their mouths to eliminate oral health problems.

items.name: Hintense Eye
items.description: You have to be darn raving mad to remove a dead opponent's eye. What are you going to do with it now?

items.name: Solar's Brain
items.description: Against all expectations, Solar had a brain that was several times larger then a green pea. With the little use he made of it, he shouldn't miss it too much.

items.name: Charred Ones' Blood
items.description: Unlike lava, Charred Ones' blood never cools down, and remains molten. This property hasn't escaped Brakmarian chefs' attention, and they now use it to spice up dishes that need to be kept hot.

items.name: Zombrute Flesh
items.description: This looks like ligaments connecting pieces of putrid mud together, and it's rubbery. With any luck, it'll make for a chewing gum that doesn't lose its taste after ten minutes.

items.name: Drowhirl Lance Tip
items.description: You can impersonate a Unikron by sticking it to your forehead, or you can always impersonate a Unikron by sticking it to your forehead.

items.name: Funerbroadsword Protection
items.description: This removable protection can be used as an elbow pad, knee brace or muzzle, to name but a few.

items.name: Sucgunner Aquarachnee
items.description: This harmless-looking little creature will cling to you and will suck your blood down to the last drop. In this sense, it's a nice metaphor for married life.

items.name: Piece of Micrab Armour
items.description: The Micrab claims to wear this armour for purely defensive purposes, but has never managed to explain what adding thorny growths to it was supposed to do in this regard.

items.name: Bethel Akarna's Tail
items.description: A tail is to an Osamodas what a sword is to a Iop: the bigger it is, the more trusty it is. Bethel Akarna's is especially impressive.

items.name: Submerged Ones' Shell
items.description: Technically speaking, this shell doesn't belong to a Submerged One, but to one of the many creatures living off it.

items.name: Key to Solar's Tower
items.description: Thieves misuse this key as a skeleton key, since it tends to melt all locks into which it is inserted.

items.name: Key to Bethel's Tower
items.description: Ideal for picking your nose, cleaning your ears out, and scrubbing under your toenails.

items.name: Enchanted Ore
items.description: Anything can be enchanted: a carousel, a flute, a ball, dice... In this care, it's ore.

items.name: Metal Shield Base
items.description: Not to be confused with a metal shield case that doesn't work the same way and might result in you getting seriously hurt.

items.name: Enchanted Thread
items.description: This thread isn't long enough for you to leave a trail behind in the Labyrinth of the Minotoror, so you'd best use it for stitching.

items.name: Wood Cream
items.description: You must remember that wood is a living thing and you need to take care of it.

items.name: Target Dummy Body
items.description: A robust base on which to build a Target Dummy or scarecrow.

items.name: Vermifuge Mixture
items.description: In the past, if suspects tried to worm their way out of an interrogation, Iop investigators wouldn't think trice about using a vermifuge. It never worked as planned, so the method was abandoned.

items.name: Stinging Wool
items.description: Untangling brambles and nettles barehanded isn't as dangerous as handling this wool.

items.name: Mantiscore Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Bethel Akarna Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Solar Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Meno Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Ilyzaelle Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Dantinea Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Koutoulou Larva Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Anerice the Shushess Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Count Razof Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Dazahk Freezammer Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: El Piko Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Tal Kasha Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Cauldini Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Wurmlord Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Bitter Orange
items.description: Bitter orange... Is it a fashion statement? Is it a fruit? Is it a drink? Is it what makes bitter bitter? Is it a presidential hairpiece?

items.name: King Dazahk's Brewery Key
items.description: King Dazahk's Brewery is probably Pandawas' favourite place, because they can give themselves over to their two favourite pastimes: drinking and fighting – at the same time!

items.name: Beer Tankard
items.description: In the Stubbyob kingdom, if there is one thing even rarer than a Stubbyob without a beard, it's very likely an empty beer tankard. Which just goes to show: the rarest things aren't always the most expensive.

items.name: Dazahk Freezammer's Shoulder Pad
items.description: When one's head is a bit oversized, it's easier to keep it attached with solid shoulder pads such as this one.

items.name: Tankanvil Armour
items.description: It occasionally happens that certain daring Stubbyobs remove their armour before a fight. It's not known whether they're trying to prove that they are the strongest, or the most hard-headed.

items.name: Gobyob Sling
items.description: Just like the slingshot you made for yourself as a child, this sling is an excellent way to break the ice.

items.name: Beardrammer Beard Hair
items.description: You'd almost think that if Stubbyobs are so obsessed with their beards, it's because they'd look like children without them.

items.name: Rokrusher Leggings
items.description: No one has yet seen a Stubbyob kneel before anything. Some biologists even theorise that they do not have knees and so are physically unable to kneel.

items.name: Warmonbeer Tooth
items.description: Given their unfortunate habit of biting their opponents, Stubbyobs need to have irreproachable dental hygiene: altering the taste of their beer by leaving residue from previous victims in their mouths is out of the question.

items.name: Rhineetle Horn
items.description: The Department for the Control and Regulation of Counterfeit Creatures guarantees that Rhineetle horns will grow back quickly. According to them, this is proven by the fact that nobody's ever seen a hornless Rhineetle.

items.name: Super Croquette
items.description: Your pets will absolutely love this extra-nutritious kibble.

items.name: Enriched Croquette
items.description: Your pets will absolutely love this extra-nutritious kibble.

items.name: Ebony Dofus Replica
items.description: Rotceres have flooded the market with thousands of these replicas, so don't expect this one to fetch a good price.

items.name: Emerald Dofus Replica
items.description: Rotceres have flooded the market with thousands of these replicas, so don't expect this one to fetch a good price.

items.name: Ivory Dofus Replica
items.description: Rotceres have flooded the market with thousands of these replicas, so don't expect this one to fetch a good price.

items.name: Ochre Dofus Replica
items.description: Rotceres have flooded the market with thousands of these replicas, so don't expect this one to fetch a good price.

items.name: Crimson Dofus Replica
items.description: Rotceres have flooded the market with thousands of these replicas, so don't expect this one to fetch a good price.

items.name: Turquoise Dofus Replica
items.description: Rotceres have flooded the market with thousands of these replicas, so don't expect this one to fetch a good price.

items.name: Malician Badge
items.description: Malice trades for these badges during the Al Howin season.

items.name: Abyssal Metal
items.description: This temporally weathered metal does not come from the depths of time, but from the depths of the ocean. The Merkaptans use it both for their diving suits and cooking pots.

items.name: Ekar Habib's Map
items.description: This map will take you to Ekar Habib's treasure.

items.name: Captain Ebrous's Map
items.description: This map will take you to Captain Ebrous's treasure.

items.name: Mary Reankle's Map
items.description: This map will take you to Mary Reankle's treasure.

items.name: Mayhav the Bloodthirsty's Map
items.description: This map will take you to Mayhav the Bloodthirsty's treasure.

items.name: Raspberry
items.description: A sweet red fruit that children and the goddess of seagulls love.

items.name: Forgotten Reflection
items.description:
Far beneath the veiled surface of this astral fragment, you can spot the brightness of a dreamlike memory. An epic and unique adventure in a land devoid of meaning. A volcanic reptile leading an infinite race.
It's time to wake up and forget again.

items.name: Andespite
items.description: It is said that this volcanic rock comes from a faraway island in the Archipelago of Scales. Known to the Paztek as Shibaparta, and considered sacred, it is a valuable resource that can be used as a currency.

items.name: Tra Int Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit more intelligent.

items.name: Pa Tra Int Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much more intelligent.

items.name: Ra Tra Int Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much, much more intelligent.

items.name: Tra Str Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit stronger.

items.name: Pa Tra Str Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much stronger.

items.name: Ra Tra Str Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much, much stronger.

items.name: Tra Agi Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit more agile.

items.name: Pa Tra Agi Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much more agile.

items.name: Ra Tra Agi Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much, much more agile.

items.name: Tra Cha Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit luckier.

items.name: Pa Tra Cha Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much luckier.

items.name: Ra Tra Cha Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much, much luckier.

items.name: Tra Vit Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit more lively.

items.name: Pa Tra Vit Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much more lively.

items.name: Ra Tra Vit Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much, much more lively.

items.name: Tra Ini Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit more of an instigator.

items.name: Pa Tra Ini Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much more of an instigator.

items.name: Ra Tra Ini Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much, much more of an instigator.

items.name: Tra Pod Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit more grabby.

items.name: Pa Tra Pod Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much more grabby.

items.name: Ra Tra Pod Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much, much more grabby.

items.name: Tra Pow Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit more powerful.

items.name: Pa Tra Pow Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much more powerful.

items.name: Ra Tra Pow Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much, much more powerful.

items.name: Tra Psh Res Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit more stable.

items.name: Pa Tra Psh Res Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much more stable.

items.name: Tra Cri Res Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit more unflappable.

items.name: Pa Tra Cri Res Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much more unflappable.

items.name: Tra Psh Dam Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit more disruptive.

items.name: Pa Tra Psh Dam Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much more disruptive.

items.name: Tra Cri Dam Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit more opportunistic.

items.name: Pa Tra Cri Dam Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much more opportunistic.

items.name: Tra Earth Dam Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes your blows a bit more brutal.

items.name: Pa Tra Earth Dam Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes your blows much more brutal.

items.name: Ra Tra Earth Dam Rune
items.description: An eternal dream rune that makes your blows much, much more brutal.

items.name: Tra Fire Dam Rune

items.name: Pa Tra Cri Rune

items.name: Ra Tra Spe Rune

items.name: Legend of Brumaire
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of Brumaire's story.

items.name: Legend of Bram Worldbeard
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Bram Worldbeard.

items.name: Legend of Crocobur
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Crocobur.

items.name: Legend of Death-Defying
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Death-Defying.

items.name: Legend of Lady Jhessica
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Lady Jhessica.

items.name: Legend of a Thousand Leagues
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of the thousand league boots.

items.name: Legend of Dodge
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Dodge.

items.name: Legend of Fallanster
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Fallanster.

items.name: Legend of the Kicked Ass
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of the Order of the Kicked Ass.

items.name: Legend of Destiny
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the history of the world.

items.name: Legend of Rykke Errel
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Rykke Errel.

items.name: Legend of Buhorado
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Buhorado.

items.name: Legend of Jahash Jurgen
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Jahash Jurgen.

items.name: Legend of Ganymede
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Ganymede.

items.name: Golden Snowflake
items.description: Without this golden snowflake, no crafter could make any element of the Hairy set.

items.name: Hairy Pattern
items.description: This pattern can be used by craftsmen to make part of the Hairy set.

items.name: Improved Blibli Wax
items.description: This wax is much denser than typical wax. It is also more lasting. Thanks to these qualities, it makes an excellent base for candle production.

items.name: Eguntew Foot
items.description: It won't bring you good luck, or bad luck either for that matter. It's just a little foot...

items.name: Mawabouwaino Chip
items.description: A piece so intense that Waddicts claim it exceeds 200% cocoa. But can you ever really trust a Waddict?

items.name: Bionic Eye
items.description: This modified eye lets you detect any object or individual that contains chocolate.

items.name: Wunkie Tendon
items.description: A tendon so tender it tends to tendinitis but is loved by tendentious tenderfoots with a fondness for tendrils.

items.name: Suspicious Wrapper
items.description: Whatever was inside was fatty, melt-in-your-mouth, deliciousness.

items.name: Waddict Tooth
items.description: Just looking at this once-sweet tooth makes you wish you'd brushed your teeth not twice but thrice.

items.name: Brownish Pompom
items.description: Made from a Waddict tail, this pompom owes its brown colour to its original owner's chocolate-rich diet. At least that's the official story...

items.name: Waddict Bar
items.description: This bar is a basic component in the Mawabouwaino set.

items.name: Crunchy Bar
items.description: This bar is a basic component in the Crunchler set.

items.name: Chocomancer Bar
items.description: This bar is a basic component in the Chokao Priestess set.

items.name: Milipraline Hair
items.description: Even though it looks exactly like candy floss covered in angel-hair noodles, the Milipralines' hair is not edible, alas.

items.name: Torreflayer Skin
items.description: "Doctors in Bonta hate it, but you're going to love it! Discover this chocolate maker's secret to perfect skin!" This lurid advert that appeared recently in the Astrub Gazette wasn't a scam after all.

items.name: Temperaumaturge Cauldron
items.description: This cauldron is perfect for simmering delicious stews for hours, but it might give your meals the bitter taste of chocolate and victory through physical violence rather than through dialogue and sincere communication.

items.name: Podploder Hat
items.description: The Podploders' chef hats have always been the subject of the wildest rumours. Do they wear them to hide extra cocoa beans? Or unlikely cranial protuberances? Or worse yet, haircuts in very bad taste? Chokao alone knows.

items.name: Chocoligarch Diadem
items.description: The Chocoligarchs are the second-highest authority in the sect, just behind the Chokao Priestess. The Chocoligarchy also runs military operations, and acts as the Priestess's security detail.

items.name: Chokao Priestess's Embroidery
items.description: It would be a shame to damage embroidery of such high quality... but if ever you're invited to a chocolate orgy and you have nothing to protect your clothes or wipe your face with, this piece of fabric taken from the Chokao Priestess will make an excellent bib.

items.name: Broken Chokao Chip
items.description: This piece of chocolate is as dark as the dark magic that animated it before; it mustn't be allowed to fall into just anyone's hands, or mouth.

items.name: Waddict Foundry Key
items.description: Take a peek behind the scenes in the Fleaster chocolate factory with this key.

items.name: Crunchery Key
items.description: Tempting as it may be, don't eat this key. Use it to enter the Crunchery instead.

items.name: Chokao Temple Key
items.description: No Chocomancer will let you in to the Chokao Temple without this key.

items.name: Crunchler Heart
items.description: Despite its unappealing and inaccessible appearance, this mountain of chocolate hides a tender, tasty heart that will delight lovers of fine chocolate.

items.name: Yazkooalak Ear
items.description: The apparent softness of these ears has tricked many an adventurer before you. Tempting as it may be, we don't recommend using them as earmuffs. They lose all resistance to heat if not attached to their owner.

items.name: Nibbled Nugget
items.description: The Chocruncher from which you managed to take this piece still managed to bite it before dying. Animal instincts can be odd at times.

items.name: Chocopingwin Stomach
items.description: This stomach is renowned for its light, fresh mousse.

items.name: Chocolate Fur
items.description: For little and big kids aged 7 to 77, our chocolate Bearbarian furs please everyone. And if all the little Marshmallow Bearbarians held hands, they could stretch five times around the World of Twelve!

items.name: Chocosnailmet Coating
items.description:
Chocosnailmet recipe (Warning: the presence of a responsible adult is highly advisable.):

- Take one Snailmet
- Dip it in oil
- Dip it in water
- Cover with cocoa
- Now you have a Chocosnailmet ready to go!

items.name: Kwakao Beak
items.description: Tempestuous and anger-prone, Kwakaos are not the most easygoing birds in the World of Twelve. It's all due to their high cocoa content. Stories abound about hungry adventurers crunching down on a Chocruncher only to be crunched by a crunching Chocruncher.

items.name: Golden Leviatun Scale
items.description: Leviatun scales only start their slow transformation into gold after several centuries on their host. This, combined with the near extinction of Leviatuns explains why they are so difficult to find these days.

items.name: Aziz Feather
items.description: The wingspan of the Aziz is so wide that people claim that if it spread its wings it could hide the sun and plunge the World of Twelve into darkness.

items.name: Babyhemoth Relic
items.description: Some claim that the Babyhemoth's real name is "Uglyhemoth" after its appearance at birth. Since there's no reliable testimony from anyone who's seen this creature, the theory has never been proven.

items.name: Frozen Plasmogrine
items.description: The evolution of this plasmogrine was suspended when it got trapped in ice.

items.name: Kwaketch'd Animal Legend
items.description: Kwaketch'd was famous for showing up in the kitchen whenever it was featured on the menu of the day – and it never came empty-handed. This very peculiar characteristic was what lead to its extinction.

items.name: Pukachi Animal Legend
items.description: Pukachis had a special ability to get on the nerves of all the adults that heard its cry. They were exterminated to bring a bit of peace and quiet to the World of Twelve.

items.name: Magikrab Animal Legend
items.description: The Magikrab was so ridiculous that no god, large or small, has ever dared claim its creation. Even Silouate didn't bother to protect it during the great plague that wiped out so many pets.

items.name: Bakusharna Animal Legend
items.description: To understand the difference between a good and a bad dream, you need to know the difference between a good and a bad Chassullier. Only the Bakusharna could boast such an exploit.

items.name: Babyhemoth Reflection
items.description: Even though it contains only an infinitesimal speck of a Babyhemoth's power, this item will let your pet, petsmount, or mount reveal its hidden potential.

items.name: Time Crystal
items.description: The delicate fusion of the present physical materials and past and future abstract elements led to the formation of this crystal.

items.name: Timeless Crystal
items.description: The delicate fusion of the present physical materials and past and future abstract elements led to the deformation of this crystal.

items.name: Inert Egg
items.description: No one knows if this egg will ever hatch, or what might come out of it if it did.

items.name: Nanogrine
items.description: This plasmogrine has evolved into a tool to perfect living creatures. The side effects from its use are not yet known.

items.name: Prent's Nasal Fluid
items.description: This fluid has unexpected properties. Unlike yours. If yours did, you'd know by now given how much of it you've swallowed.

items.name: Time Loop
items.description: In theory, a loop only comes full circle when the end of the loop meets the start of the loop. But time is a reluctant matchmaker who refuses to make introductions.

items.name: Timeless Loop
items.description: This is what happens when time stands still while still flowing freely.

items.name: Great Timekeeper's Spectacles
items.description: These glasses seem ordinary, but they really are exceptional. They'll let you decipher the millions of volumes in Xelor's archives without spending millions of years at the job. Even for an immortal, the glasses are a wonderful time-saver... that adventurers will never properly appreciate because they never read all the text.

items.name: Albino Crocodyl's Eye
items.description: This eye is red, and not just because it was savagely ripped from its owner's head.

items.name: Turtelonia's Scale
items.description: Be careful with this scale. When the moon's rays shine on it, the reflection is so bright it could blind you.

items.name: Guilodyle Tongue
items.description: This tongue is absolutely delicious stewed with a few vegetables. Albino Crocodyls obviously prefer it raw.

items.name: Nosee Headband
items.description: This piece of cloth is as good as any other for covering blind eyes.

items.name: Caimaneedyl Doll
items.description: You're going to love playing with this doll. Think about your worst enemy, poke needles into this pile of rags, and savour the results.

items.name: Alassslash Loincloth
items.description: According to the legend, Alassslashes don't wear anything under their loincloths.

items.name: Cannicodyl Canine
items.description: You can use this sharp tooth to cut the meat you order to go with your drink next time you visit an inn.

items.name: Turtelonia's Sanctuary Key
items.description: You can visit Turtelonia's Sanctuary with this key. But there's no guarantee you'll live to tell the tale.

items.name: Turtelonia Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Key to Kharnotaurus's Lair
items.description: Despite what you might imagine, this key won't get you into the inn's storeroom. Not at all. Instead, it'll let you into the lair of a very peculiar innkeeper.

items.name: Alabaster Dreggon Claw
items.description: Specialists are still hotly debating what to call this item. Since it's found at the tip of an animal's paw, some say that it's a claw. Others claim it's a fingernail. Yet another divisive debate tearing the World of Twelve apart.

items.name: Alabaster Dreggon Skin
items.description: Even now that it's been removed from its owner, don't expose it to the sun for too long or it'll get a sunburn.

items.name: Draegnerys's Cloth
items.description: It took bravery (or foolishness) to rip off a piece of the Immature Dreggons' guardian's tunic. Many have been burnt alive for less than that.

items.name: Kharnotaurus Eye
items.description: Some claim that fortune tellers use this eye to communicate with spirits.

items.name: Kharnotaurus Tooth
items.description: A tooth of this size could almost be used as a sword.

items.name: Draegnerys's Hair
items.description: This hair is widely used to make items that protect against heat because they are very heat-resistant.

items.name: Pearl Onions
items.description: These perfectly prepared pearl onions will make all your dishes almost perfect.

items.name: Balanced Handle
items.description: Despite everything you've just done to it, this perfectly balanced handle is extremely well adjusted.

items.name: Foam Blade
items.description: At this stage of production, you can use this blade to trim your shrubs or scrub your dirty dishes.

items.name: Immaculate Met'Axe
items.description: This axe is still too pure to be used as is.

items.name: Met'Axe
items.description:
"This axe isn't particularly dangerous, and rightly so: the aim of such a tool isn't to injure. But don't rush to dismiss it as useless: it can spill a lot of ink." 

- Roger D, professional nerfer

items.name: Draegnerys Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Kharnotaurus Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Corruption Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: White Dofus
items.description: A Dofus without any personality.

items.name: Yellow Paint
items.description: I wrote a song for you and all the things you do...

items.name: Red Paint
items.description: What's wrong with seeing red?

items.name: Blue Paint
items.description: I'm blue, da ba dee da ba die.

items.name: Orange Paint
items.description: Orange you glad to see me?

items.name: Green Paint
items.description: Give it the green light.

items.name: Purple Paint
items.description: So lush and royal.

items.name: Black Paint
items.description: Perfect for representing night, coal, or sin.

items.name: Draconiros's Power
items.description: Draconiros has entrusted you with a small portion of his power to craft a nightmare catcher. You'd better not try using it for anything else, or you might irritate the Master of Dreams.

items.name: Minor Astral Rune
items.description: When Twelvians' dreams come together, dreamlike thoughts crystallise and form an astral rune. Small gestures may seem inconsequential, but they sometimes make an impression upon people's hearts. It's one of those small gestures that produced this rune.

items.name: Average Astral Rune
items.description: When Twelvians' dreams come together, dreamlike thoughts crystallise and form an astral rune. It's not unusual for more than one soul to dream of similar adventures on the same night. These coincidences are the source of astral runes such as this one that you have in your hand.

items.name: Major Astral Rune
items.description: When Twelvians' dreams come together, dreamlike thoughts crystallise and form an astral rune. Selfless acts don't always spread throughout the ages, but their impact greatly inspires a few souls. Their dreams crystallise into an astral rune such as this one.

items.name: Wonderful Astral Rune
items.description: When Twelvians' dreams come together, dreamlike thoughts crystallise and form an astral rune. Heroes often draw crowds, who in return dream of their exploits, thus creating wonderful astral runes.

items.name: Marvellous Astral Rune
items.description: When Twelvians' dreams come together, dreamlike thoughts crystallise and form an astral rune. Demonstrations of love are the source of many a dream, and one of them has created this marvellous rune.

items.name: Legendary Astral Rune
items.description: When Twelvians' dreams come together, dreamlike thoughts crystallise and form an astral rune. The incredible adventure that engendered this one is still told throughout the Krosmoz.

items.name: Amber Prysmaradite
items.description: As you look at this amber astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

items.name: Coral Prysmaradite
items.description: As you look at this coral astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

items.name: Crimson Prysmaradite
items.description: As you look at this crimson astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

items.name: Jade Prysmaradite
items.description: As you look at this jade astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

items.name: Emerald Prysmaradite
items.description: As you look at this emerald astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

items.name: Fir-Green Prysmaradite
items.description: As you look at this fir-green astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

items.name: Cyan Prysmaradite
items.description: As you look at this cyan astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

items.name: Azure Prysmaradite
items.description: As you look at this azure astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

items.name: Sapphire Prysmaradite
items.description: As you look at this sapphire astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

items.name: Mauve Prysmaradite
items.description: As you look at this mauve astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

items.name: Indigo Prysmaradite
items.description: As you look at this indigo astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

items.name: Zinzolin Prysmaradite
items.description: As you look at this zinzolin astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

items.name: Damaged Book
items.description: This book from the Amakna library has clearly seen better days. But the damage isn't irreversible, with the right materials and know-how, it could be restored to its former glory.

items.name: Shackles of Tyranny Key
items.description: You can use this key to confront Servitude, one of the Horsemen of the Eliocalypse. That way, you'll be freed from the burden of life.

items.name: Misery's Feather
items.description: When you're always wanting – and going after – more, you have to be careful someone doesn't pluck your feathers...

items.name: Junker Shoulder Pad
items.description: Junkers are particularly good at turning scrap metal and other rubbish into weapons and pieces of armour that are used to equip Misery's armies. The very basic look of this equipment stands in sharp contrast with its surprising robustness.

items.name: Starven Tongue
items.description: Starvens know how to use their tongues, to say the least.

items.name: Deboning Ribs
items.description: When correctly prepared, Deboning ribs could be mistaken for some good old Lousy Pig loins. Add a pinch of salt and pepper, and they're great! The meat's a little lean and it's technically cannibalism, but the flavour can't be beat.

items.name: Skentu Hood
items.description: "One Skentu can hide another." Actually, the Skentus – also known as "looters of the desert" – developed the technique known as "Kongalining". This technique consists of moving in single file, one after another, to hide their numbers and better surprise their opponents.

items.name: Dawaj Eye
items.description: What you thought were shining eyes are actually translucent stones Dawajes use to cover their eyes to protect them in the daylight and keep their night vision sharp.

items.name: Sterile Soil
items.description: This handful of sandy-textured soil might not make a very good fertiliser. It's as if all of the nutrients it once contained have been sucked out, down to the last one.

items.name: Dream Reflection
items.description: When you dream, you sometimes remember who you are... but when you wake, you forget, time and again. Gaze deeply into this reflection to remember what really matters.

items.name: Infinite Reflection
items.description: To understand the infinite nature of this reflection, just look for a few seconds into its astral patterns, so rich in age-old adventures.

items.name: Doitall Plank
items.description: The Miserites are outstanding handymen. Bartering means they can make everything they need themselves. This doitall plank is one of their pride and joys. It's as solid as they come.

items.name: War Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Misery Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Servitude Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Blood Throne Key
items.description: This key will let you challenge the most bloodthirsty Horsman of the Eliocalypse. Don't forget to equip your weapons and shine your armour – if you're going to be buried by War's hatchet, you might as well not look like a beggar.

items.name: Tree of Death Key
items.description: Decay, decrepitude and alienation – such are the charms of the Tree of Death. Do you want to go back to your roots and become one with nature? Corruption, the Horseman, will be delighted to turn you into compost.

items.name: Judgement of the Scales Key
items.description: It's almost impossible to talk to Misery unless she decides to talk to you. You may be able to force her hand with this key.

items.name: Corrupted Sprouts
items.description: A bouquet of these sprouts may attract good friends or bad company. It all comes down to how... open you are.

items.name: Corruption's Horn
items.description: It takes bravery to endure its sharp thorns, but if you're going to be corrupted, why not go all the way?

items.name: Pistilick Tongue
items.description: Adventurers are always on the lookout for unique treasures, but was it really necessary to collect a Pistilick tongue?

items.name: Rotten Dolid Skin
items.description: Whether you're looking for fun, or maybe just a bit mad, riding a Dolid is always a perilous exercise. As with any sporting activity, remember: practice makes perfect, and always stretch first to avoid injury. An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth... This shredded skin is a symbol of vengeance.

items.name: Elgrun Leg
items.description: Asking an Elgrun to shake hands is never a good idea. For one thing, it's a wild monster that's probably only thinking of tearing you to bits. Then there's the pouch of venom hidden in each of its appendages to ensure your slow and agonising death. Fun times all around!

items.name: Tentaclobber Tentacle
items.description: As their name suggests, Tentaclobbers are a pain to be around. This tentacle is the perfect weapon to make them understand the suffering they inflict on others by their mere presence.

items.name: Demongrel Petal
items.description: Make sure you've only plucked the Demongrel's petal. The spores that may be attached to it carry the worst diseases you can possibly imagine. Although, looking at your face, it may already be too late...

items.name: Worn Oar Wood
items.description: Wood so damaged that it must have been used by Galley slaves for years.

items.name: Armiscreant Hood
items.description: When you spend your life on a boat, you need to protect yourself from the weather.

items.name: Rhythmic Wand
items.description: This wand is useful at getting a galley working in rhythm, but can really hurt if it hits you in the eye.

items.name: Servitude's Lock
items.description: No one has ever been able to break this lock, all those who bore it served their master until their very last breath.

items.name: Slave Necklace
items.description: Anyone wearing this necklace is deprived of any will to rebel. It is the symbol of persecution in a world of obedience.

items.name: Ballasted Kanonball
items.description: This ball is extremely heavy and anyone dragging it must be extra vigilant if they don't want to lose a toe.

items.name: Whip Handle
items.description: This very ergonomic handle means you can whip harder to increase efficiency.

items.name: Damaged Fabric
items.description: Once this fabric has been patched, it will be sent to Misery's warehouses.

items.name: Patching Tool
items.description: The Miserites use this kit to patch up pieces of cloth found in the desert.

items.name: War's Cap
items.description: Some will put it on their heads, others will smash it with their heads. You immediately recognised that this object would make a perfect knee brace... because you're such an intellectual.

items.name: Bloody Fabric
items.description: This fabric comes from a cape that has been dragged through too much blood and dust.

items.name: Coagulated Blood
items.description: The blood comes from an old wound.

items.name: Slicing Canine
items.description: All the iron contained in the blood imbued in this tooth has made it as strong as a blade.

items.name: Armour Fragment
items.description: This fragment from some titanic armour appears to have been forged in blood.

items.name: Linothorax
items.description: This armour seems perfect for protecting the wearer's joints when they have to make movements that require flexibility.

items.name: Sharp Blade
items.description: The number of heads cut by this blade could turn yours.

items.name: Eliocalypse Storm Key
items.description: This key – imbued with advanced technomagic properties – will give you access to the Eliocalypse time storm. If you don't get lost in the twists and turns of time, the Horsemen will have to watch out!

items.name: The Legend of Misery
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of Misery's story.

items.name: The Legend of War
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of War's story.

items.name: The Legend of Servitude
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of Servitude's story.

items.name: The Legend of Corruption
items.description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of Corruption's story.

items.name: Het Dawa Blood Sample
items.description: A sample of Het Dawa's blood. You have a little piece of him in you – how sweet... well, not really.

items.name: Katana Alloy
items.description: This still-glowing alloy is the result of all your hard work hammering it into shape. But don't get cocky: hammering your own nose won't make it as straight as this katana alloy.

items.name: Katana Blade
items.description: Well, it's something, but you'll have a hard time fighting with just this bit as your weapon.

items.name: Katana Handle
items.description: Crafted with care by Anatakwa. Maybe she was afraid of how long it would have taken if she had let you do the work.

items.name: Wood Pandawushu Artefact
items.description: This magic artefact is used by the Pandawushu disciples to enchant their equipment.

items.name: Fujibakama Leaf
items.description: Used in a wide variety of miracle cures, this plant is also used to flavour bamboo milk cocktails like fujikoladas and fujitos.

items.name: Rice Oil
items.description: If you need a brief moment of calm after a lengthy dinner with the in-laws, use this oil as a massage oil.
