Renowned for its delicate scent, it will relax your muscles and release all the tension that accumulated during those difficult hours. Otherwise, it's also perfect for whipping up a quick vinaigrette.

items.name: Rock Dust
items.description: Don't go anywhere near this if you suffer from allergies.

items.name: Spirit Bamboo Branch
items.description: A branch from the last spirit bamboo of Plantala. An extinct plant species originally from the Astral Plane, fiercely guarded by a powerful Yokai called Shinotake.

items.name: Spirit Abode Key
items.description: If, in your youth, you were terrified of the haunted house at Trool Fair, there's still time to turn back because once you cross the threshold, it'll be too late to flee the Yokai haunting the Spirit Abode.

items.name: Selenite Stone
items.description: They say that only Tanuki ghosts can extract this stone from the rocks of Terrdala.

items.name: Pandala Rain
items.description: Most Pandawas would rather it rain beer than water on their island... but the rice would probably taste funny if it did.

items.name: Shogun Tofugawa's Tomb Key
items.description: This key will let you into the Shogun Tofugawa's Tomb.

items.name: Snapper Oil
items.description: Slather this oil all over yourself on your next trip to the shore. Not only will you end up perfectly tanned, but you'll ensure that those around you take proper social distancing measures thanks to the odour you'll give off.

items.name: Crushed Mist
items.description: Mist Army corpses were robbed to produce this substance.

items.name: Copy of the Cania Map 1/3
items.description:
This partial copy will let you reconstruct the full map of the Cania bandits' movements.
(The Cania Bandits quest must be in progress for you to study the map.)

items.name: Copy of the Cania Map 2/3
items.description:
This partial copy will let you reconstruct the full map of the Cania bandits' movements.
(The Cania Bandits quest must be in progress for you to study the map.)

items.name: Copy of the Cania Map 3/3
items.description:
This partial copy will let you reconstruct the full map of the Cania bandits' movements.
(The Cania Bandits quest must be in progress for you to study the map.)

items.name: Map of Cania
items.description:
This map will allow you to find and fight the three Cania bandits.
(The Cania Bandits quest must be in progress for you to study the map.)

items.name: Paper Tulip
items.description: Picture-perfect pristine white petals, a heady scent, this flower would look right at home in the most beautiful bouquets. Worth considering if you decide to marry someday.

items.name: Ink Snapper
items.description: This Snapper is just a drop of ink in the ocean of Wukin.

items.name: Paper Haiku: Qilin
items.description:
A lucky omen
For the Tanukis much more!
An inspiration

items.name: Paper Haiku: Froog
items.description:
Ever lucky charm,
These Pandalucian Froogs
Filling a tankard

items.name: Paper Haiku: Chtiger
items.description:
Of bone or paper,
A Chtiger is a Chtiger
Lurking in your shade

items.name: Paper Haiku: Pig
items.description:
A dragon or pig?
Amaknians never know
With his stuffy nose

items.name: Paper Haiku: Swane
items.description:
See one thousand Swanes
Fluttering so gracefully
A soaring prayer

items.name: Ink Haiku: Mystery
items.description:
The great mystery
That will be revealed to you,
Written in the dark

items.name: Ink Haiku: Tale
items.description:
The curtain rises
A simple tale of times past
Once upon two times...

items.name: Ink Haiku: Illusion
items.description:
All is chimera
Between truth and lie, know this:
The lie does it all

items.name: Ink Haiku: Shadow
items.description:
Blurry silhouettes
Standing tall against the light
Of ink theatre

items.name: Ink Haiku: Invisible
items.description:
Behind the curtain
There is no puppet master
Your hand follows his

items.name: Dragon Haiku: Resolution
items.description:
Wukin and Wukang
Twin reflections of one mind
A vow's witnesses

items.name: Dragon Haiku: Destruction
items.description:
Executioner,
The end of a dying world –
Return to the void

items.name: Dragon Haiku: Passion
items.description:
The source of our souls
In your garden here I've found
My once lost country

items.name: Dragon Haiku: Creation
items.description:
Oh, three wise sages
Two kingdoms, of black and white
A dream awoken

items.name: Dragon Haiku: Rebirth
items.description:
Inky Domakuro
Dorigami of paper –
Black-spotted Dofus

items.name: Two Kingdoms Haiku: Blossoming
items.description:
Under a bower
A Pandawa is sleeping
How her heart blossoms

items.name: Two Kingdoms Haiku: Harvest
items.description:
Along rice paddies
Who's proudest of his harvest?
The Moskito king

items.name: Two Kingdoms Haiku: Fermentation
items.description:
In the golden vat
The miracle here happens
The gods are tipsy

items.name: Two Kingdoms Haiku: Sleep
items.description:
Sweet master of dreams
Take me in your arms and sow
My one last winter

items.name: Two Kingdoms Haiku: Passage
items.description:
As the year is born,
All our promises take root
To sprout tomorrow

items.name: Wukin Haiku: Evening
items.description:
The Descendre evening
Deposits a burning kiss
On dead men's closed eyes

items.name: Wukin Haiku: Sakura
items.description:
Far gone already
The corollas caracole
A cherry tree sobs

items.name: Wukin Haiku: Black
items.description:
The crackling crickets
One Bow Meow, two witches –
Ashes of a hearth

items.name: Wukin Haiku: Scarecrow
items.description:
Surrounded by fields
A guardian ever mourns
The Kwaks' that have gone

items.name: Wukin Haiku: Cold
items.description:
On the mountain path
An errant guide is mirrored
Back by shards of ice

items.name: Wukang Haiku: Morning
items.description:
From her first morning
Jiva shone bright in the east
Oh, glorious sun

items.name: Wukang Haiku: Sakura
items.description:
Where do winds carry
Your ever fragrant blossoms?
To the horizon

items.name: Wukang Haiku: Heat
items.description:
Pulled from the oven,
It glimmers on our tables –
A banquet of crumbs

items.name: Wukang Haiku: Thunder
items.description:
A storm announced rain
On an island sound asleep –
Bright spirit lightning

items.name: Wukang Haiku: White
items.description:
Dear, do not shiver
Under a blanket of snow
A bowl of milk warms

items.name: Pandala Haiku: Forbidden Inn
items.description:
A peaceful garden
Where the pebbles make their rounds,
How Pandawa smiles

items.name: Pandala Haiku: Plantala
items.description:
I dreamt of a tree
Its branches were the antlers
Of a bleating stag

items.name: Pandala Haiku: Terrdala
items.description:
Iron born of stone,
Rock against pick and pickaxe –
A song for Tanu?

items.name: Pandala Haiku: Akwadala
items.description:
That once frothy cap
Hastily spilt bamboo milk
Tears of bitterness

items.name: Pandala Haiku: Feudala
items.description:
A lone fouxwork
Screams its own burning desire
To love a bright star

items.name: Pandala Haiku: Aerdala
items.description:
Can you hear the wind
Whispering the world's secrets?
Its voice is silent

items.name: Pandala Haiku: Nolifis
items.description:
Live while there's still time!
Nothing's ever carved in stone
But your epitaph

items.name: Samurai Haiku: Spring
items.description:
In a calm old pond
A fat Toaquad dives – SPLASH!
The sound of water

items.name: Samurai Haiku: Summer
items.description:
The summer army,
Under the Tofu's own watch,
We shall mow you down

items.name: Samurai Haiku: Autumn
items.description:
Words fly into air
Glimmers dance under the moon
Sparks crackle and sigh

items.name: Samurai Haiku: Winter
items.description:
Two arms, two sabres
The snow is a light mantle
One foot in the grave

items.name: Samurai Haiku: New Year
items.description:
The katana's edge
Oh, how the samurai weaves –
Friends and enemies

items.name: Liquid Crystal
items.description: Your wildest desires are within reach with this extremely malleable ore.

items.name: Bendable Crystal
items.description: Don't be fooled by its appearance! This ore bends but won't break.

items.name: Key to Orukam's Memory
items.description: This key will let you into Orukam's Memory.

items.name: Key to Imagiro's Memory
items.description: This key will let you into Imagiro's Memory.

items.name: Paper Petal
items.description: With organisation, rigour and conviction, what was once destroyed can be reborn.

items.name: Imushin Semi-Clouton
items.description: Properly folded and thrown with force, this piece of paper can be an effective throwing weapon, or an elegant messenger to deliver sweet nothings to your beloved's window.

items.name: Imorok Circumflex Carapace
items.description: If you fold 4 carapaces of this type together, you can have a blast telling your friends' fortunes. Start by writing simple words or symbols inside. Then, when they give you a number, all you have to do is open and close the 4 points that many times and then read the response out loud.

items.name: Imiyama Quote Marks
items.description: If you wore a pair of Imiyama quote marks around your head, you'd make a lovely hat stand but no one would take you seriously.

items.name: Imetsu Ellipses
items.description:
"I've got rheumatism
In my knee
And gout that just
Won't set me free...
Life's an ellipsis,
I'm sure you'll agree.
I was full of zip
When I sang to thee."

- Don O'Van, retired crooner

items.name: Imafugo Apostrophe
items.description: Fold this one way and you'll get a strophe, fold it the other way and you'll get an antistrophe. Oddly, if you need an apostrophe, you're out of luck.

items.name: King Imagami Diacritic
items.description: Often confused with the die-a-critical, diacritics won't let you roll 10 critical hits in a row. King Imagami's diacritic will, however, make you king-for-a-day in the Celestial Kingdoms of Wukin and Wukang. That's something at least.

items.name: Ink Petal
items.description: Let's let time take its course, so that the flower will bloom again in spring.

items.name: Shinlam Semi-Clouton
items.description: If you like reading and fighting but you always struggle to when defending your opinion of literary works, throw in a few semi-cloutons and a kick out a few footers to get your point across, full stop.

items.name: Rokoram Circumflex Carapace
items.description: Young Twelvians have taken up the habit of saying "LOL TL;DR, circumflex carapace circumflex carapace" whenever anyone sends a letter deemed too long and boring. Clearly, circumventing politeness by flexing the limits of language to get under boomers' skins has become an art form.

items.name: Mabram Quote Marks
items.description: If you're one of "those people" who "mime" quote marks with their "fingers" when repeating "rumours" about other people, these Mabram antlers are "perfect" for you.

items.name: Tsunam Ellipsis
items.description: You can't say ellipsis without lips. Think about it...

items.name: Fugokam Apostrophe
items.description: Putting your apostrophe's in the wrong place is a sure-fire way to draw a crowd – a crowd of riled-up language police, that is.

items.name: Queen Amirukam Diacritic
items.description: One might think that "diacritic" derives from the words "diatribe" and "critic", but in reality diacritics are merely marks or signs added to letters or phonemes to distinguish them from another similar form, give them a specific phonetic value, and so on. Among the Yokianzhi, this is symbolically akin to a crown that distinguishes the queen from the other Spwrites.

items.name: Habapandero
items.description: This fiery fruit is used in most Pandalan dishes and should be handled with care. You should only hold it by the stem. If your fingers should touch any of the flesh, you should wash your hands immediately because you risk losing your eyesight or sense of smell if you were to touch your eyes or nose.

items.name: Offering to Celestial Spirits
items.description: This scarlet silk bag contains a prayer to spiritual creatures. Place it on the altars of the Celestial Kingdoms as an offering and maybe certain spirits will pay some attention to you...

items.name: Shogun Tofugawa Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Koumiho Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: King Imagami Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Queen Amirukam Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Astral Substrate
items.description: No one is quite sure what this is, but it's highly unlikely to be edible.

items.name: Archoken
items.description: When you spend every minute of your life at a major casino, you have less time to travel. This token, however, will let you fight any archmonster you like.

items.name: Searchoken
items.description: No need to go searching. With this searchoken, you'll find them right away, whoever they are.

items.name: Kraradia Spaulder
items.description: If a Kraradia hits you with an arrow, you're either already dead or the flames or poison covering the arrow will take you out.

items.name: Bellilith Diadem
items.description:
"Think me crazy if you must, old friend, but I know these dreams. They are visions of the future. Hell is nigh, my brother. It is at our doors."

– Anonymous

items.name: Bwarioch Scalp
items.description:
"To learn about violence, ask a piwin. To learn about tenderness, ask a chtiger."

– Pandalan proverb

items.name: Pigzebub Snout
items.description:
"My snout is dirty. Dirty to my cheeks. I've dipped it in mud and blood. And so what? Did you really think governing wasn't dirty business?"

– Jean-Pork Astrre, commander of the Pigzebubs, speaking to a new recruit

items.name: Inferniripsa
items.description: An Inferniripsa's whispers are like the hissing of a snake: an entrancing chant that only ends when the audience has sighed its last sigh. Literally.

items.name: Kabaal's Broken Sceptre
items.description:
"Much is made of the violence of a river that washes away everything in its path, but no one ever speaks of the violence of the banks that hem it in."

– Kabaal, leader of the Possessed

items.name: Demonic Appendix
items.description:
"If your neighbours have these types of appendices growing on their bodies, be careful. They've probably got a very contagious disease: appendicitis. My aunt caught it last week. It wasn't pleasant. Luckily, you can boost your immunity to it by eating roots four times a day and wearing metal panties. At least, that's what my research shows."

– Webb Emdee, amateur doctor

items.name: Qilin Mane
items.description: A symbol of artistic perfection for the Tanukis, the Qilin is an inspiring spirit and a harbinger of good omens. That must be why hair from the mane – taken with the greatest respect – is used to craft certain Pandalan items.

items.name: Kabaal Ritual Key
items.description: "In this nightmare vision, like a ripple on water, demons and Twelvians, boowolves and gobballs, good and evil, dream and reality, and life and death went hand in hand." – Kabaal

items.name: Kabaal Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Shrynk Rat's Magic Skull
items.description: Just to be clear, this skull doesn't belong to Shrynk Rat, but to one of her beloved little Splat Rats.

items.name: Rat Phink's Rusty Pipe
items.description: In theory, congratulations are in order for getting your hands on Rat Phink's weapon, but just look at it... What are you going to do with this rusty old thing?

items.name: Rat Batster's Slingshot
items.description: Oh, so you think this is just an ordinary slingshot? Well, you're right!

items.name: Chika Rat's Lance
items.description: This lance was stolen from a Bontarian militia member who was stealing food from the pantry. It will be deducted from his pay. That'll teach him.

items.name: Rat Lly's Old Book
items.description: Jealous of the education received by some Bontarian rats, the Rat Lly began devouring the thickest volumes in the Brakmar library. After a few bouts of indigestion, he eventually realised that he only needed to read the pages to get an education, rather than gobbling them up like aged cheese.

items.name: Aloevie Rat's Magical Tome
items.description: This book is sacred and comes directly from the Bonta Library... and for some odd reason, Aloevie Rat has the power to use it. Unfortunately, the same cannot be said for her Brakmarian rival.

items.name: Flatt Rat's Ear
items.description: An ear? Unfortunately, that's all you'll get out of this Flatt Rat...

items.name: Chak Rat's Collar
items.description: Who would have thought that someday, someone would use their own necklace as a weapon? It's said that this item once belonged to a mysterious Bontarian that Chak Rat spied on for days in order to learn how to use it before ultimately stealing it.

items.name: Scrolloken
items.description: This small fragment of scrollmagic still smells faintly of destroyed magic, which a connoisseur might describe as a subtle blend of mysticism and dreams of adventure. For us common folk, it smells more like meat roulade with potatoes.

items.name: Ball of Gobkool Wool
items.description: The Koolich swears by this type of wool, and this type of wool only, when it comes to making clothing!

items.name: Brutasmodan's Jaw
items.description:
"First there is desire, then passion, then suspicion, jealousy, anger and betrayal. When love goes to the highest bidder, trust is impossible... and without trust, there can be no love. Jealousy... yes, jealousy will make a demon of you."

– Author unknown

items.name: Diabelial Tongue
items.description: A wise man once wrote that the tongue is a fire, an unrighteous world unto itself, setting on fire the cycle of nature and set on fire by hell. One look at this Diabelial Tongue and you can see where he was coming from.

items.name: Typhomet Horn
items.description: When thrown with a brisk sidearm movement, this horn won't come back to you, but it will do plenty of damage as it flies.

items.name: Demoloch Tentacle
items.description: In a long-ago era when demon invasions were commonplace, the Twelvians made offerings to the Demolochs to satisfy their infernal appetites and protect their own lives. The offerings consisted of sacrificing the first fruits of a harvest, the first-born lamb in the spring, or the first-born child in a family.

items.name: Malephisto Shoulder
items.description: When dipped in lava or boiling water, Malephisto shoulders crack open like lobster shells. You won't find any pearls or beautiful treasures inside, but a strange-tasting gooey material that actually goes surprisingly well with a nice shallot reduction.

items.name: Destroyer Spike
items.description:
"When you live among ghosts, you eventually become a ghost yourself, and the world of demons is no longer a stranger's world but our own, born not of the night but of our own entrails.

[...]

Then one day the revelations of the Eliocalypse come, and we understand that we're damned and miserable and blind, and then all that remains is to drift through the nightmares of this world with chattering teeth, like the grim and doleful phantoms we are."

— Wack Ookerjack, excerpt from the book "The Shustuft Crustians"

items.name: Eternal Conflict's Nightmarish Mask
items.description: While most nightmares only leave us with a vague sense of disquiet, others hit us with a raw, chilling realism. We find ourselves overwhelmed with a visceral fear, one that stays with us even when we're awake, because those nightmares deny us even the small touch of wonder that normally makes them bearable.

items.name: Battle of the Crimson Dawn Key
items.description:
"Two demons share our lives / And strive to rob them of all reason. / 'Tis their will that our every act drives / No matter the age or the season. / And were I to name the true faces thereof / Let one be named Ambition, the other one Love."

— Jean du Puits, "Tales of Dawn"

items.name: Eternal Conflict Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Virtue of Supreme Harmony
items.description: Before creating any major work, the Tanukis pray to the Qilins for these sacred spirits to inspire them and guide them on the path of harmony, the most fundamental of the five virtues. Anyone who wishes to progress along that path should probably speak with a Qilin.

items.name: Malter Petal
items.description: Terrakourial's magic prevents this petal from wilting as long as it stays within the Evil Forest, even if its original Malter is dead.

items.name: Malzerb Sprout
items.description: This young sprout hoped to become a flourishing Malter. But that was before you put him out to grass.

items.name: Maltrio Bola
items.description: You might be surprised at the incredible variety of weapons that can be crafted from the materials found in the Evil Forest. Then again, there are a lot of materials to choose from in this region, with its rich veins of rare and precious minerals and the ancient hardwood trees that grow here. Who was the first Malter to realise that tying an acorn to the end of a rope would make a simple but effective weapon?

items.name: Malterbarb Barb
items.description: Be careful when you venture into the Evil Forest. In addition to watching out for Malters hidden among the leaves, you should also watch where you put your feet – you could easily trip over a large root or, worse, step on a Malterbarb.

items.name: Malalfa Lucky Charm
items.description: Despite the fact that they look like brainless brutes, the Malalfa like to accessorise their outfits with things from nature worn as jewellery. They sometimes give these accessories to their peers, who usually see these gifts as kind offerings.

items.name: Malwood Horn
items.description:
The Malwoods are very attached to their horns. They spend a lot of time maintaining them by rubbing them on tree trunks, creating a constant and distinctive scraping sound.
Once in a while, a Malwood will lose one of their horns in a battle. When this happens, they lose all their will to live and end up crawling into a hollow tree where they'll stay for the rest of their days.

items.name: Key to Long Slumber's Barrow
items.description: The flames on this key came straight from Hell Mina's partisan. Any adventurer who can open the doors to Long Slumber's Barrow with their bare hands will be worthy of meeting its guardian, since they're obviously just as reckless as her.

items.name: Tsunami Engraving
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Tsunami, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Water element. The enchantment slightly reduces base damage.
Only health steal is modified by this engraving.

items.name: Quake Engraving
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Quake, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Earth element. The enchantment slightly reduces base damage.
Only health steal is modified by this engraving.

items.name: Blazing Engraving
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Blaze, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Fire element. The enchantment slightly reduces base damage.
Only health steal is modified by this engraving.

items.name: Hurricane Engraving
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Hurricane, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Air element. The enchantment slightly reduces base damage.
Only health steal is modified by this engraving.

items.name: Downpour Engraving
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Downpour, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Water element. The enchantment reduces base damage by a moderate amount.
Only health steal is modified by this engraving.

items.name: Landslide Engraving
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Rockslide, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Earth element. The enchantment reduces base damage by a moderate amount.
Only health steal is modified by this engraving.

items.name: Spark Engraving
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Spark, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Fire element. The enchantment sharply reduces base damage.
Only health steal is modified by this engraving.

items.name: Draught Engraving
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Draught, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Air element. The enchantment sharply reduces base damage.
Only health steal is modified by this engraving.

items.name: Spittle Engraving
items.description:
Thanks to the power of Spittle, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Water element. The enchantment sharply reduces base damage.
Only health steal is modified by this engraving.

items.name: Flame Engraving
items.description:
Thanks to the power of Flame, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Fire element. The enchantment reduces base damage by a moderate amount.
Only health steal is modified by this engraving.

items.name: Gust Engraving
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Gust, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Air element. The enchantment reduces base damage by a moderate amount.
Only health steal is modified by this engraving.

items.name: Tremor Engraving
items.description:
Thanks to the power of the Tremor, neutral damage inflicted by a weapon is definitively transformed into damage associated with the Earth element. The enchantment sharply reduces base damage.
Only health steal is modified by this engraving.

items.name: Oktapodas Ink
items.description: This ink comes from the undersea depths and seems to be a vestige of a distant era. Its scent surrounds you and seems almost suffocating – as if it contains great power. If you bring it up to your ear, you hear a faint crackling. There's no doubt about it: this ink is no ordinary ink.

items.name: Gob Akademy Key
items.description: With this key, you'll be able to get into the Akademy even when it's not an open house day organised by the management. Of course, that doesn't mean they'll be happy to see you.

items.name: Hell Mina Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Director Grunob Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Anomaly Fragment
items.description: These small mirror-like gems seem to reflect important events that took place in other eras. Hopefully, bringing them back to the Material Plane won't upset the balance of the Krosmoz.

items.name: Bwork-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Bworks. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Bwork Precision (level 200):
• At the start of each turn, the bearer gains 3% ranged damage for 1 turn if they are adjacent to an enemy; otherwise, they gain 3% close-combat damage for 1 turn.

items.name: Wabbit-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Wabbits. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Wabbit Impatience (level 200):
• At the start of combat, the bearer gains 1% final damage per enemy fighter, but loses 2% final damage until the end of the fight when one of them dies.

items.name: Boowolf-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Boowolves. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Boowolf Fury (level 200):
• The bearer gains 5% final damage until the end of the fight when an allied fighter dies (stackable 2 times).

items.name: Moskito-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Moskitos. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Moskito Thirst (level 200):
• The bearer sacrifices 5% of their final damage to heal themself by 10% of the damage they inflict on enemies during their turn.

items.name: Trool-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Trools. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Trool Brutality (level 200):
• At the start of combat, the bearer sacrifices 1% final damage per enemy fighter to gain 3% final damage until the end of the fight when one of them dies.

items.name: Kanig-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Kanigs. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Kanig Barbarism (level 200):
• When the bearer kills an entity with a weapon, they gain 4% final damage for 2 turns (stackable 2 times).

items.name: Gobbette-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Gobbettes. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Gobbette Sweetness (level 200):
• At the start of each turn, the bearer gives 3% close-combat damage to adjacent allies for 1 turn (stackable 1 time).

items.name: Greedoblop-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Greedoblops. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Greedoblop Gluttony (level 200):
• When an allied fighter that was present at the start of the fight dies, the bearer is healed for 20% of their health (max. 3 times).

items.name: Bwak-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Bwaks. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Bwak Generosity (level 200):
• When the bearer ends their turn adjacent to an enemy, the bearer sacrifices 2% ranged damage for their next turn to give 4% ranged damage to their allies for 1 turn (stackable 1 time).

items.name: Chafer-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Chafers. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Chafer Immortality (level 200):
• When an allied fighter that was present at the start of the fight dies, the bearer gains 400% of that ally's level as shield for the rest of the fight (max. 5 times).

items.name: Sauroshell-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Sauroshells. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Sauroshell Protection (level 200):
• At the start of combat, the bearer gains 75% of each ally's level in shield, but loses 5% resistance every time an allied fighter that was present at the start of the fight dies.

items.name: Crackler-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Cracklers. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Crackler Robustness (level 200):
• At the start of combat, the bearer sacrifices 2% resistance per ally to give 3% resistance to their allies. The resistance sacrificed for an ally is recovered when they die.

items.name: Treechnid-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Treechnids. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Treechnid Bark (level 200):
• When the bearer suffers an attempted MP loss, they gain 75% of their level as shield for 1 turn (stackable 1 time).

items.name: Domoizelle-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Domoizelles. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Domoizelle Devotion (level 200):
• At the end of each turn, the bearer transfers 5% of their health to adjacent allies and gains 5% Vitality for 2 turns if the transfer is made.

items.name: Piwi-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Piwis. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Piwi Velocity (level 200):
• When the bearer is locked, they gain 2 MP for 1 turn.

items.name: Strich-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Striches. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Hystritcheria (level 200):
• The bearer gains 7 Lock if pushed or 7 Dodge if attracted for 1 turn.

items.name: Arachnee-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Arachnees. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Arachnee Web: 
• At the end of each turn, the bearer gains 7 Lock for 1 turn for each enemy 2 cells away or closer.

items.name: Koalak-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Koalaks. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Koalak Savings (level 200):
• When the bearer is locked, they gain 1 AP for 1 turn.

items.name: Kitsou-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Kitsous. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Kitsou Evasion (level 200):
• At the start of each turn, the bearer gains 7 Dodge for 1 turn for each enemy 2 cells away or closer.

items.name: Kozaru-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of the Kozaru. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Kozaru Agitation (level 200):
• When the bearer pushes, attracts or transposes an entity, the bearer gains 7 Lock and Dodge for 1 turn.

items.name: Scurvion-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Scurvions. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Scurvion Toxicity (level 200):
• At the start of each turn, the bearer inflicts 6 to 8 damage on themself in their best attack element to inflict that damage on adjacent entities at the end of the bearer's turn.

items.name: Pandora-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Pandora. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Pandora's Call (level 200):
• At the end of each turn, the bearer sacrifices 1 MP for their next turn to give 2 MP to their non-static summons for 1 turn.

items.name: Neye-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Neyes. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Neye Acuity (level 200):
• At the start of each turn, the bearer gains 3 Range for the turn. This bonus is lost if they use at least 1 MP.

items.name: Spimush-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Spimushes. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Spimush Altruism (level 200):
• When the bearer ends their turn adjacent to an ally, they give 1 AP to adjacent allies for 1 turn (stackable 1 time).

items.name: Persaport-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Persaports. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Persaport Empathy (level 200):
• At the start of combat, the bearer gains 10% final healing. This bonus is lost if one of their allied fighters dies.

items.name: Tofoone-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Tofoones. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Tofoone Benevolence (level 200):
• When the bearer ends their turn adjacent to an ally, they give 1 MP to adjacent allies for 1 turn (stackable 1 time).

items.name: Dreggon-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Dreggons. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Dreggon Fetter (level 200):
• When the bearer locks an enemy, the bearer gains 150% of their level as shield for 1 turn.

items.name: Unlimited Rental Pass
items.description: This pass gives you unlimited access to all cosmetic items – just perfect for updating your wardrobe so you can be the most stylish of all beastologists in Osatopia.

items.name: Pine Cone
items.description: This pine cone must have fallen from a tree, not a monster. Why ever did you pick it up? You look a bit ridiculous with all that sap stuck to your fingers.

items.name: Timongoose Fur
items.description: This impermeable fur coat allows timongooses to glide effortlessly through the water. If you ever get the urge to shear one of them like a gobball, throw it in the water and you'll see for yourself.

items.name: Thoronduddleswell Feather
items.description: During mating season, male thoronduddleswells rip out the prettiest feathers on their rumps to give them to the object of their affections. Thus, they attempt to seduce their beloved with a mating display involving a bloody rump.

items.name: Bulkyfallo Horn
items.description: This impressive horn will weigh quite a lot in your bag! You'd better hope you can sell it for a tidy sum, otherwise you'll have ruined your back for nothing.

items.name: Loutbear Claw
items.description: Loutbears – those gawking giants that have taken up residence in the multitude of pine trees crowning the colony of Albuera – spend most of their time wandering in search of crumbs capable of satisfying their massive appetites. As a result, they spend hours upon hours scratching the bark of pine trees with their long, curved claws for juicy, sleepy larvae hiding under the bark.

items.name: Coolwolf Fang
items.description: Beware of coolwolf bites! Once their fangs clamp down on one of your limbs, you won't be able to get free.

items.name: Nicking for Ninnies
items.description: This antique book has been handed down from generation to generation within the Clanger-Banger clan. Many ancestral techniques are explained in detail, such as "flatulent obfuscation" (perfected by Master Dopp Le Ganger) and the (in)famous "blinding undie-outie" (perfected by the equally (in)famous Banger, Mash Banger).

items.name: Raccooper Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Sylvan Refuge Key
items.description: The Sylvan Refuge was created as a sanctuary for the many animals who have been forced to abandon their homes as a result of Twelvians' greed and indifference towards them. Raccooper, the ruler of these woods, also makes his home there.

items.name: Pine Wood
items.description: If it weren't for this wood, there wouldn't be any homes in Albuera.

items.name: Soldalia Vine
items.description: Ephedrya is known for its exuberant vegetation. Right when you step foot on the island, plants coil around your ankles and climb up your leg to welcome you. The Soldalia, meanwhile, prefers to show affection by squeezing you with its stinging vines to the point of death – either its own or yours. Were you hoping for a warmer welcome? Dream on.

items.name: Camelliaxe Moss
items.description: To get rid of excess body hair, there's nothing better than a sharp knife. But the Camelliaxe only has a dull blade for pruning moss. This makes it look like a poorly kept statue... Luckily, there's adventurers! Since they love cleaning up, they gladly remove it all, at no cost. How generous of them...

items.name: Arm-of-the-Valley Thorn
items.description: Arms-of-the-valley are a very cute flower featuring little bells, symbols of gaiety and renewal... At least, that's what visitors to Belladonna's Castle thought before they got run through.

items.name: Wallopoppy Fist
items.description: Behind the wallopoppy's strength lies a major weakness; needless to say, victims of the marble-like protector couldn't find it. They'll keep looking for it even as they fertilise the soil in a somewhat restless final sleep.

items.name: Statulip Helmet
items.description: A long time ago, the Ephedrya castle guards were famed across the realm. They watched over the queen and the throne. No one could see their faces, hidden as they were behind shiny metal helms. They had never been heard shouting or complaining – it seemed they could feel no pain. Were their bodies made of stone? Perhaps the statues in the Chamber of Evils aren't so different from the models they're based on.

items.name: Belladonna's Lipstick
items.description: Some wear make-up to attract a partner. But Belladonna has no desire to be beautiful; she simply wants to steal a kiss from the passage of time.

items.name: Protectors' Flower
items.description: Certain flowers are able to grow on the toughest surfaces. That's the case with this one, as it only needs a few drops of rain to take root in the smallest crack and then bloom, perched on the shoulders of stone statues. It's no wonder the Protectors of Ephedrya unanimously embraced it!

items.name: Chamber of Evils Key
items.description: Witches hate to be disturbed while performing curses, so they make sure to keep their doors hidden and secured with a double-toil-and-trouble lock. And Belladonna is no exception. But summoning spirits in order to subjugate them can come with unwelcome surprises... like hordes of adventurers showing up to turn your chamber upside down.

items.name: Belladonna Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Irony Water
items.description: Those who taste this water without knowing where it comes from think it tastes of blood. That's hardly surprising, given how it's produced from an enormous amount of dissolved iron.

items.name: Bitter-Hammer Beard Hair
items.description: Perfect for Stubbyob beard lovers. Although this fascination with other people's hair is more than a little strange, this is one undeniable way to prove your victory in combat against the Bitter-Hammers.

items.name: Hardarmur Armour
items.description: This armour is as strong as a rokrusher and as resistant as a tankanvil.

items.name: Bonehammer Slobber
items.description: Apparently, bonehammers spit on their enemies after whacking them on the head with a hammer. No one knows if this is a sign of domination, contempt or affection.

items.name: Bylhuk Hair
items.description: You don't need to fight a bylhuk to get some of its hair – just go into the Bitter-Hammers' dining room and steal a dirty dish. Don't see the connection? Try eating pebble soup with a huge wig on your head, and you'll end up tongue-tied.

items.name: Slingobb Sling
items.description: If you think you can compare this weapon to a gobyob's, you'd be right. It's almost the same model, but with a square shape. Counter-intuitive for a slingshot.

items.name: Boarok Beard Elastic Band
items.description: Boaroks never go anywhere without a pair of elastic bands; with these accessories, their mounts can see clearly. Also, their beards don't get nibbled away in a cavalcade.

items.name: Berylbell Copperbeard's Bell
items.description: This bell is really effective if you want to be heard rather quickly, but in return, it makes everyone around you deaf for a good hour at least... It's said that only Bitter-Hammers can stand the sound. Do they actually have exceptional hearing, or is it just that their ears are so dirty they're blocked, meaning they can't hear anything but this bell?

items.name: Bitter-Hammers' Stronghold Key
items.description: This key grants you access to the Bitter-Hammers' Stronghold so that you can take up Berylbell Copperbeard's challenge. Don't judge the Stubbyob guardian by her small stature – she's one formidable opponent! Her fists could quickly give you a surprise.

items.name: Berylbell Copperbeard Essence
items.description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

items.name: Masterly New Leaf Orb (linked)
items.description: This orb lets you reset an item's characteristics if you use it during a smithmagic session.

type.name: Reinitialise the effects of an item with a level equal to or less than

effects.formatted: Reinitialise the effects of an item with a level equal to or less than 0

items.name: Major New Leaf Orb (linked)
items.description: This orb lets you reset an item's characteristics if you use it during a smithmagic session.

type.name: Reinitialise the effects of an item with a level equal to or less than

effects.formatted: Reinitialise the effects of an item with a level equal to or less than 0

items.name: New Leaf Orb (linked)
items.description: This orb lets you reset an item's characteristics if you use it during a smithmagic session.

type.name: Reinitialise the effects of an item with a level equal to or less than

effects.formatted: Reinitialise the effects of an item with a level equal to or less than 0

items.name: Minor New Leaf Orb (linked)
items.description: This orb lets you reset an item's characteristics if you use it during a smithmagic session.

type.name: Reinitialise the effects of an item with a level equal to or less than

effects.formatted: Reinitialise the effects of an item with a level equal to or less than 0

items.name: Cire Momore's Wax
items.description: You were warned to stay away, that death awaited you there on the cursed island, deep in that dark cave. But you didn't listen. Despite attempts to sear more of these warnings into your mind, you threw caution to the wind.

items.name: Cire Momore's Heart
items.description: The armour grew more wicked as the heart within was twisted.

items.name: Ashenstone
items.description: Contrary to what many geologists think, this ore is not volcanic in origin; the fire it spawned from is anything but natural. Put a block of ashenstone against your ear, and you'll hear the distant sound of the Sea of Dust... "For dust you are, and to dust you shall return." Redfis's motto sounds like a judgement.

items.name: Inhibitor Crystal
items.description: This crystal reduces recycling's impact on the prism's durability by half for the next twelve hours.

items.name: Pacifier Crystal
items.description: This strange crystal can influence minds and erase any hostility directed at the prism, thereby protecting it from attacks for the next twelve hours. Note that when this crystal is used, the modules on the prism are deactivated.

items.name: Ashenstone Flower
items.description: This flower isn't born from the earth's bowels but from the Bitter-Hammers' expertise. It is the key to opening a path to the terrifying Cire Momore. Give it to a Protector of Ashenstone to receive a blessing that may enable you to take down the terrible suit of armour.

items.name: Ephedryan Bramble
items.description: These brambles usually form a barrier around the walls of Belladonna's Castle simply to discourage adventurers from venturing inside.

items.name: Perceptor Nails
items.description: Perceptors never move without nails in their shoes. Better traction, more effective attacks... they really do rely on these nails.

items.name: Perceptor Mesh
items.description: Perceptors' garments shouldn't make them too hot or leave them too cold. That's why their tunics are generally made with this mesh material.

items.name: Perceptor Pole
items.description: This magical pole displays the emblem of the alliance employing the Perceptor on its banner. That way anyone who dares attack will know what to expect.

items.name: Perceptor Blade
items.description: Just because Perceptors keep their weapons hidden doesn't mean they don't have any. Once properly honed, this blade will become one of their fearsome daggers.

items.name: Perceptor Plate
items.description: Perceptors' cuirasses are always equipped with this kind of plate. Solid yet lightweight, it blocks incoming attacks without slowing down the Perceptor's movements.

items.name: Perceptor Lock
items.description: Perceptors will only carry chests that are secured with this lock. They believe it's the only kind that can truly keep the items inside safe and secure.

items.name: Perceptor Strap
items.description: Perceptors often have to deal with unscrupulous adventurers who try to steal the loot they're guarding. These straps are perfect for keeping a firm hold on the bags they carry, even during intense activities like chases or fights.

items.name: Chimeric Egg
items.description: This is one egg that won't weigh down your digestion.

items.name: Contraband Flour
items.description: Cut with temporal powder to keep it fresh longer, this flour can sometimes be a bit hard to digest. That said, it used to contain sawdust and powdered scaraleaf chitin, so count your blessings.

items.name: Forgechest
items.description: Forged to last, this chest is a lot tougher than you, yet not nearly as heavy.

items.name: Lektor Kebab
items.description: The recipe for this spicy kebab is an homage to Lektor the Kanniball. Savour each juicy bite slowly... but be careful! It can also be quite prickly on the tongue, and not just because of the spices.

items.name: Fyredite
items.description: Developed by a famous dark miner, this alloy has excellent mechanical strength. Admittedly, it also has a bothersome tendency to explode. But this apparent design flaw may actually be an intentional feature, given that its inventor had a lot of Rogue friends.

items.name: Module Parts
items.description: Whether you're more into nuggets or getting around quickly, you'll need these parts to craft the module that's right for you.

items.name: Premium Key
items.description: This key opens up unexpected possibilities.

items.name: Menologium Piece
items.description: Assemble all twelve pieces of the Menologium, and you can proudly brandish this mythical shield until Silvosse smashes you to bits like so many puzzle pieces.

items.name: Clockwork Metronome
items.description: As regular and precise as Xelor's Clock itself, this accessory is essential to keeping time during the Clockwork Ball, or to staying on the beat in any situation.

items.name: Radiant Pebble
items.description: With its golden gleam, this pebble could make you rich, even if it doesn't quite bring a ray of sunshine into your life.

items.name: Ra Psh Res Rune
items.description: Cleats have appeared on the bottom of your shoes. Very handy to avoid injury on steep or slippery surfaces. Ridiculous at a fancy ball, so choose the right moment to use this rune.

items.name: Ra Psh Dam Rune
items.description: Unbelievable – this rune places a thin layer of ice under your shoes. Useful for winter sports or for playing dubious pranks.

items.name: Analysis Module
items.description: You didn't really understand everything the Ankamian was trying to explain, but he did assure you that this machine will be able to process information from your fights. However, it is missing a number of parts for it to work properly.

items.name: Print Module
items.description: This small machine can produce bits of paper.

items.name: Dream Ruby
items.description: Infused with the power of the Master of Dreams, this ruby will enable your analyser to capture the essence of any dreams you face in battle.

items.name: Optical Module
items.description: This box equipped with a lens seems to be able to capture high-resolution images, whatever that's supposed to mean.

items.name: Mauve Liquid
items.description: An essential ingredient for an effective gobmetic.

items.name: Scaraleaf-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Scaraleaves. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Scaraleaf's Carapace (level 200):
• When the bearer suffers an attempted AP removal, they gain 75% of their level as shield for 1 turn (stackable 1 time).

items.name: Thoronduddleswell-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Thoronduddleswells. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Thoronduddleswell's Patience (level 200):
• When the bearer uses no MP during their turn, they gain 2 MP for their next turn.

items.name: Leopena-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Leopenas. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Leopena's Perseverance (level 200):
• When the bearer uses no MP during their turn, they gain 1 AP for their next turn.

items.name: Bambooto-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Bambootos. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Bambooto's Serenity (level 200):
• When the bearer uses no MP during their turn, they gain 3 Range for their next turn.

items.name: Pingwinkle-Infused Croquette
items.description: This croquette has been infused with the all the hidden potential of Pingwinkles. Feeding it to your legendary pet will give your pet new powers.

effects.formatted:
Pingwinkle's Comfort (level 200):
• At the end of each turn, the bearer is healed for 2% of their health for each adjacent ally.

items.name: Stuffed Nomoon
items.description: It may be only virtual, but it's still a super-duper collector's stuffed toy!

items.name: Ra Earth Res Rune
items.description: This rune will absorb Earth elemental damage.

items.name: Ra Neutral Res Rune
items.description: This rune will absorb Neutral elemental damage.

items.name: Ra Fire Res Rune
items.description: This rune will absorb Fire elemental damage.

items.name: Ra Water Res Rune
items.description: This rune will absorb Water elemental damage.

items.name: Ra Cri Res Rune
items.description: Inexplicably, you believe this rune is lucky. It should help you avoid any unfortunate blows.

items.name: Ra Air Res Rune
items.description: This rune will absorb Air elemental damage.

items.name: Mama Ayuto Pie Crust
items.description: Children love Mama Ayuto's pies, especially when they're chucked in the face of anyone who threatens the Imps. What's the secret to her success? A long-lasting pastry, as crisp as a Crackler, that only Ayuto can break. It's hardly surprising that some crafters use it to improve the structural integrity of their creations and tempt their customers.

items.name: Captain Chafer's Bone
items.description: When you see the number of the Captain's bones in circulation, you realise that the illustrious Chafer must have had a thousand and one radii, as many tibias and an incalculable number of ribs.

items.name: Dark Vlad's Flaming Hair
items.description: Keep away from crates of fireworks and Rogue bombs, or your career as a crafter will be cut as short as that hair.

items.name: Ovatoken
items.description:
"I was not the best because I struck quickly. I was the best because the crowd loved me. Win the crowd, Maximor, and you will win your freedom."

— Proximor, veteran gladiator.

items.name: Pa Dam Ref Rune
